title: Junior Process Engineer Technician
description:
Our client is currently seeking a Junior Process Engineer Technician to join their team in Camarillo, CA. This position will support both process and product development initiatives through a combination of computer-based tasks and hands-on responsibilities. The ideal candidate will assist with developing, prototyping, and implementing new or enhanced manufacturing processes aimed at improving efficiency, quality, and output. This is an excellent opportunity to join an innovative team and grow within a dynamic manufacturing environment.
The Day-to-Day:

 Generate comprehensive process documentation, testing procedures, and manufacturing protocols.
 Conduct design of experiments (D.O.E) to improve process capability and repeatability.
 Prepare and present data reports, summarize findings, and recommend technical solutions.
 Understand and analyze product/process flows and equipment requirements.
 Identify and troubleshoot factors impacting process performance.
 Perform hands-on experiments and operate manufacturing equipment.
 Create process controls and train personnel in their use.
 Monitor and evaluate ongoing process performance.
 Generate technical reports and communicate findings to cross-functional teams.
 Collaborate with quality teams and assist with MRB disposition.
 Utilize 2D and 3D CAD tools for design work involving CNC, laser machining, circuit boards, and silk-screen artwork.
 Apply SolidWorks and AutoCAD Fusion in support of 3D printing and rapid prototyping projects.
 Use programming languages such as Python and GCODE for CNC machining applications.

Qualifications:

 High School diploma or equivalent is required.
 Associate’s Degree in Engineering Technology, Manufacturing Technology, or related field is required.
 Bachelor’s Degree in a science or engineering discipline (e.g., Ceramics, Materials, Chemical Engineering) is preferred.
 Bilingual in Spanish is preferred.
 At least 1 year of experience working in a manufacturing environment.
 Minimum of 2 years of experience with SolidWorks and AutoCAD.
 Familiarity with CNC programming and 3D printing (filament and resin).
 Proficiency with Microsoft Office 365 (Outlook, Excel, Word, Teams, Project, PowerPoint) and Adobe Acrobat.
 Strong aptitude for diagnosing, maintaining, and repairing mechanical systems.
 Demonstrated success supporting medium- to high-volume manufacturing and improving yield and quality through new product introduction and scale-up.

Pay Rate:

 $23.00 to $28.00 /hr

Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $23.00 - $28.00 per hour
Benefits:

 Health insurance

Work Location: In person

title: Applications Engineer - Industrial Automation
description:
We are seeking talented individuals to join our growing team!
 
 
  CONVERGIX Automation Solutions leverages the strengths, experience, and capabilities of our existing businesses, along with new talent, to transform and grow into the ultimate automation solutions trusted partner, capable of solving any industrial automation challenge.
 

 
  What would a typical day look like?
 
  Engage with the customer through the requirements definition, generating concepts, cost development, and presentation of the proposal.
  Develop a defined Proposal that clarifies all customer requirements.
  Interact with the sales and management teams to lead technical alignment.
  Present concepts to customers emphasizing competitive advantages.
  Assist the internal proposal design team and processes.
  Document technical requirements, project risks, oversee project plans and project change procedures.
  Participate in technical advisory roles, as required.
  Interact with Customers at all levels, as required.
 
 
  Ensure effective handoff to operations for ongoing maintenance and troubleshooting.
  Follow a standardized quoting process.
  Standardized presentations including capture-plans, executive reviews and customer reviews.
  Standardized tools used include varying levels of proposal templates, Cost worksheets, CAD tools for concept approach, Compliance Matrices depending on industry and customer and FAT/SAT Criteria
  Opportunities for enhancing proposals through the use of technical writers and Dedicated Simulation/CAD resources.
  Leveraging cross business expertise and experience via a knowledge-sharing platform, Capturing reference machines and SharePoint/MS Teams or other online software package
 

 
  What qualifies you for this opportunity?
 
  Bachelor’s degree in an engineering discipline or equivalent experience.
  2+ years of industry experience (preferably in the automation industry).
  Experience in Quoting, Sales and Customer Interaction is preferred.
  Ability to read and understand mechanical design drawings and Customer Part Prints.
  Understanding of Electrical & Pneumatic controls architecture.
  Successfully work with project teams and customers to design and estimate complete systems.
  Recognize and determine cost factors, such as timelines, materials, labor, tooling, etc.
  Reliable transportation and an ability to travel; although this position is focused on local clients and minimal travel is required, you should have the ability to travel within US and Canada
 
 Physical Demands:
 
  While performing the duties of this position, the employee is regularly required to stand, walk, sit, use hands to feel objects, reach with hands and arms, stoop, kneel, talk and hear.
  Specific vision abilities required for the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.
  Occasionally lifts or move up to 25 pounds – This will be role specific so ask Manager if they would like this to be included.
 

 
  What does CONVERGIX Offer You?
 Here at CONVERGIX, we offer a very generous compensation and benefits package including:
 
  Comprehensive benefits and 401K/RRSP packages (including health, dental, vision coverage and more!)
  Clear paths for career advancement and opportunities for professional development
  Hands on experience with the latest automation technologies and tools
  The chance to be part of a globally recognized workplace that consistently develops cutting-edge solutions that set industry standards
  A diverse and inclusive atmosphere that provides support for employees from all walks of life
 

 
  ABOUT CONVERGIX AUTOMATION SOLUTIONS
 Convergix Automation Solutions designs, engineers and integrates hardware and software to automate its customers' operations. Convergix specializes in creative, custom solutions and serves customers in a broad range of industries. With over 900 employees and 25+ locations worldwide, Convergix is a leading global diversified automation provider. Our vision is to become the ultimate trusted partner, capable of solving any industrial automation challenge with our passionate people, world-renowned processes and diverse experience.
  Learn more about us: https://convergixautomation.com/

 
  What does CONVERGIX value?
 Our values are our foundational concepts on which we build CONVERGIX; we adhere to these no matter what mountain we climb.
 
  Integrity - Respect, Transparency, Commitment
  Excellence - Continuous Improvement, Innovation, Collaboration, Communication
  Passion - Momentum, Sense of Urgency, Growth, Success, Velocity
 

 
  Why join the CONVERGIX team?
 As a growing company in the industrial technology industry and rooted with strong corporate values, CONVERGIX Automation Solutions can offer a unique value proposition to employees. We are expanding at a rapid pace as we continue the path to be a $1 Billion company. CONVERGIX brings a new, holistic approach to automation throughout the value chain. At CONVERGIX, products, technology, experience, support and expertise intersect to empower customers in every industry to reach their full potential.

 
  We thank all candidates for their interest, however only those considered for an interview will be contacted.

 
 CONVERGIX Automation Solutions has an accommodation program in place that provides reasonable accommodations for employees with disabilities. If you require a specific accommodation because of a disability or a medical need, please contact Human Resources.

 
 #PJ
 
 Equal Opportunity Employer
 This employer is required to notify all applicants of their rights pursuant to federal employment laws. For further information, please review the Know Your Rights notice from the Department of Labor.

title: Process Engineer
description:
Together for a cleaner, healthier world.
 
 
 
  Johnson Matthey, a FTSE 250 organisation, is a global leader in sustainable technologies specialising in catalysis, precious metal products, chemicals and process technology. With operations in over 30 countries, we employ more than 12,600 people. We have more 200 years of success behind us; be part of the next stage of our growth journey and help maintain our reputation as one of the most admired organisations in our field. Our unique culture and people give us competitive advantage and will ensure our success for years to come. You can be part of that success story.
 
 
  
 
 Catalyst Technologies (CT) is a market leader in the syngas value chain. It develops and supplies high-value, specialty process technology and catalysts for chemicals and fuels processing to enable our customers to operate efficiently, profitably, and sustainably. With CT at the forefront of the transition to sustainable chemicals and fuels, the transition to net zero is creating exciting new opportunities in this sector.
 
 
 
  The Process Engineer is responsible for providing technical support to the EHS, Production, Maintenance and Quality teams to improve safety, efficiencies, quality, and yield. The position will also support the development of new processes, lean initiatives, and continuous improvement efforts across the plants.
 
 
 
  Your Responsibilities:
 
 
  Provides daily technical and process engineering support to the Production, EHS, Quality and Maintenance teams
  Defines and implements improvements in existing process and opportunities for new or additional systems.
  Provides technical support and problem solving to the manufacturing teams to timely troubleshoot production issues
  Monitors process conditions daily by evaluating trends and communicates findings to production and maintenance teams
  Supports site sustainability initiatives to meet JM targets
  Leads and/or participates in audits of existing processes for safety, environmental, and quality on a regular basis.
  Assures that effective and efficient process measures are in place.
  Uses and supports the company’s Management of Change (MOC) procedures. Lead MOCs from start to finish as directed
  Leads and/or participates in formal, documented process reviews of all new projects.
  Collaborates with EHS and Quality staff to assure manufacturing processes are safely designed, audited, and operated in accordance with company policies and procedures, which includes all appropriate local, state, and federal regulations and codes.
  Leads process-related projects as appropriate.
  Assures process documentation is complete, including, but not limited to process flow diagrams (PFD’s) (with material and energy balances), Process and Instrument Drawings (P&ID’s) and process descriptions.
  Learns and / or applies Lean, Six Sigma and other Continuous Improvement tools and techniques as required in support of operations Lean efforts
  Assures process control systems, including interlocks are properly designed, implemented, and regularly verified as required.
  Develops training material and provides training sessions to operations and maintenance teams
  Performs other duties as required.
 
 
 
  Requirements for the role:
 
 
  Bachelor’s degree in chemical engineering from an accredited school
  2-5 Years experience in process Engineering or process engineering management
  Experience in Process Safety Management Environment
  Lean Six Sigma Experience, Green Belt certification preferred.
  Ability to understand processes and lead process improvement efforts
  Ability to understand process P&IDs
  Use of SAP or comparable CMMS
  Use of Wonderware historian or comparable process trend software
  Proficient in Microsoft Office applications.
  Good oral and written communications skills. Ability to work in a matrix environment
 
 
 
  How you will be rewarded:
 
 
  We offer a competitive compensation and JM Elements benefits package including bonus, excellent pension contributions and 20 days annual leave (varies for shift- based roles). Our JM Elements Benefits programme helps our employees understand and manage the JM benefits, as well as helping you focus on your overall wellbeing – for you and your family. We use our inspiring science and technology to enhance lives. For those who are passionate about sustainable solutions and shaping our markets, we offer stretch and a wealth of diverse opportunities. We’ll give you freedom to bring your whole self to work and be part of a team where difference matters and all voices are heard, that genuinely cares for you and where your contribution is appreciated. We’ll empower you to lean in and make things happen, to create solutions and value for our customers. United by our values and vision, we’re self-starters sharing the same values and accountability and always with a shared commitment to doing the right thing. We’re passionate about making a difference and delivering a better tomorrow for us and for you – a cleaner and healthier world, today and for future generations.
 
 
   Johnson Matthey is open for discussion on, job share and flexible working patterns.
 
 
  #JMUS
 
 
  #LI-DJK2
 
 
  To submit your application, please click the "Apply" button online.
 
 
  All applications are carefully considered and your details will be stored on our secure Application Management System. This is used throughout Johnson Matthey for the selection of suitable candidates for our vacancies as they arise. Johnson Matthey respects your privacy and is committed to protecting your personal information.
 
 
 
  For more information about how your personal data is used please view our privacy notice: 
  
   Johnson Matthey Privacy Notice
  . By applying for this role and creating an account you are agreeing to the notice.
 
 
 
  Johnson Matthey Plc is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, marriage or civil partnership, pregnancy or maternity, religion or belief.

title: PRODUCT ENGINEER
description:
LISI AEROSPACE is ranked 60th in the global aerospace value chain and specializes in the design and manufacture of high-tech metal components to enhance aircraft safety and performance. Active since 1950 in the fastener market (no. 3 worldwide), LISI AEROSPACE has been a recognized player in metal components for aircraft engines and airframes since 2011. With its dedication to industrial excellence, LISI AEROSPACE aims to become a leader in costs, quality, deadlines and workplace safety. This mindset is represented at every level of our company and by all of our team members. At LISI AEROSPACE, we focus above all on advancement and flexibility. Every employee is empowered and has the latitude they need to carry out their assignments and develop their skills. We provide this mobility and training through our Corporate University, the LISI Knowledge Institute (LKI). As a result, our company is growing fast and always welcoming new talents. 

 PRODUCT ENGINEER 
SUMMARY 

 Product Engineer individual is responsible for providing technical support to all manufacturing and support departments and to outside customers on the design of fasteners. 

 ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES 
Other duties may be assigned. Reasonable accommodation for disabilities may be made for one or more of the following: 



 Reviews customer drawings and specifications. Analyzes new and changing customer requirements. Ensures equivalent Hi-Shear parts meet customer drawing/specification requirements. Designs or modifies products for customers to utilize in new applications.
 Prepares and maintains sales and manufacturing drawings; may prepare tooling drawings, overlays, drawings for test fixtures and equipment. Prepares and updates Process Control Requirements; PCD’s.
 Interfaces with customers on technical issues.
 Provides technical support on assigned fastener products.
 Develops test plans and conducts qualification testing of new products and special testing of existing products. Produces test reports and product specifications.
 Confers with Manufacturing, Manufacturing Engineering, Quality Engineering, Test Lab, Suppliers and the customer to coordinate and communicate engineering requirements.
 Interfaces with Sales Department in creation and revision of company sales publications. Provides support in adding and updating Item Master codification / engineering ERP records.
 Investigates manufacturing problems and recommends solutions.
 Performs root cause analysis on defective products using engineering principles and knowledge of manufacturing processes
 Will continuously look for and review applicable emerging technologies related to existing and new product development and in parallel with core competencies and manufacturing techniques.
 Responsible for complying with the rules and regulations set forth by Federal, Local, and State government, LISI Aerospace, and HSE Procedures.
 Responsible for attending all training provided and for adhering to all HSE procedures, policies, and plans, conforming to reporting requirements, and safe operating procedures at all times.
 Required to bring any known or suspected nonconformance for all company procedures or legal requirements to management’s attention immediately.
 Continually seek opportunities to improve our HSE performance by establishing objectives and targets, measuring progress, and reporting our results.
 Other duties may be assigned
 Ways of working, Experience, and Behaviors 

 To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies: 



 Analytical – Ability to analyze and understand complex information, product specification, and critical technical information. Able to scrutinize information providing succinct information on risks and proposed actions
 Technical Skills – Understands and has working knowledge of ISO 9001, AS 9100, NADCAP, Mil-Specs, ITAR, General aircraft construction and aircraft industry trends, Aircraft fasteners industry and Aerospace specifications, machine tools, forging and metal processing. Able to use mechanical testing equipment. Able to clearly share expertise and transfer technical knowledge to others; Working in problem solving team environment; Communicates technical knowledge and expertise with customers to instill confidence regarding quality function.
 Oral Communication – Speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations; listens intently to others and seeks clarification; Provides clear and pleasant responses to inquiries regardless of the situation.
 Written Communication – Writes technical documents clearly and accurately; Transfers technical data into meaningful written documents that can be understood by all levels of the organization.
 Team Work – Balances team and individual responsibilities; Exhibits objectivity and openness to others' views; Gives and welcomes feedback; Contributes to building a positive team spirit; Puts success of team above own interests.
 Business Acumen – Understands business implications of decisions; Displays orientation to profitability; Demonstrates knowledge of market and competition; Aligns work with strategic goals.
 Cost Consciousness – Works within the direction of the department’s resources; Contributes to profits and revenue; Conserves organizational resources.
 Adaptability – Adapts to changes in the work environment; Manages competing demands; Changes approach or method to best fit the situation; Able to deal with frequent change, delays, or unexpected events.
 Planning/Organizing – Manages multiple projects, Prioritizes and plans work activities; Uses time efficiently; Plans for additional resources; Sets goals and objectives; Develops realistic action plans.
 Professionalism – Approaches others in a tactful manner; Reacts well under pressure; Treats others with respect and consideration regardless of their status or position; Accepts responsibility for own actions; Follows through on commitments.
 Supervisory Responsibilities 
No Supervisory responsibilities. 
May assist in the coaching and process teaching of interns or less experience personnel under the supervision of management. 
. 

 ESSENTIAL JOB REQUIREMENTS SKILLS AND ABILITIES 

 Education and/or Experience 


 Bachelor of Science degree in Engineering or a related technical field
 A minimum of two years of engineering experience
 Working experience of manufacturing environment procedures, methods, design and documentation
 Working knowledge of machine tools and forging preferred
 Working knowledge of relevant engineering applications, technical reading and writing; knowledge of manufacturing
 Or equivalent combination of experience and related education
 Language Skills 
Ability to read, analyze and interpret professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations. Ability to write reports, business correspondence and procedure manuals. The ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers and the general public. 

 Mathematical Skills 
Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, proportions, percentages, area, circumference and volume strengths (tensile, shear, etc.). Ability to apply concepts of basic algebra and geometry. 

 Computer Skills 
To perform this job successfully, an individual should have knowledge of 2D and 3D CAD software; Testing software;; Database software; Internet software; Inventory software; Spreadsheet software and Word Processing software. 

 Reasoning Ability 
Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral or diagram form. Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations. 

 Certificates, licenses, registrations 
Evidence of “US person” is required under ITAR 

 PHYSICAL DEMANDS, WORK ENVIRONMENT, HEALTH AND ,SAFETY 

 Physical Demands 
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. 

 While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit for extended periods of time, and to speak or listen. The employee is frequently required to sit and requires eye-hand coordination, repetitive hand movement and manual dexterity use hands to finger, handle, or feel. The employee is occasionally required to stand for extended periods of time and walk. The employee must occasionally bend, reach to shoulder level and lift, carrying, pushing and/or pulling up to 10 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, and ability to adjust focus. Hearing level within normal/average range. 

 Work Environment 
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. 

 Safety and Environmental 
The responsibilities of the position include compliance with company and governmental safety, environmental and hazardous materials regulations and procedures. Employee will be required to wear personal safety equipment such as safety glasses, hearing protection, or proper footwear PPE in specified areas. 



 Participate in the development and promotion of the HSE culture
 Be exemplary in terms of health, safety and the environment, in particular by :
 Respecting and ensuring respect for the instructions and rules established in the field of health, safety and the environment (in particular the LISI golden rules)
 Immediately correcting, whenever possible, or reporting to his or her superiors and/or the HSE department, any malfunction or risky situation in the fields of health, safety and environmental protection
 Implementing preventive actions to reduce the environmental footprint and control health and safety risks
 Participate, upon request, in analyses (of risks, incidents) and HSE working groups related to his/her professional scope
 Be familiar with the main health and safety risks and the main environmental impacts relating to the scope of his/her work
 Be familiar with the site's HSE policy and objectives
 To be able to make proposals for improving working conditions and limiting environmental impact
 Benefits Include 
Medical 
Dental 
Vision 
401K 
Paid Sick and Vacation Time 
Alternative Work Schedule 
Salary: $67,000 - $85,000 Annually 

 LISI is an equal opportunity at will employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of age, race, religion, color, disability, sex, sexual orientation or national origin.

title: Process Engineer
description:
Bullseye Industries Inc/Serpent Arms has an immediate opening for a Process engineer. We are a production CNC Machine Shop that has been serving its growing list of customers since 1995. Our team of 60 employees produce machined components and products for most major markets including, lawn and garden, agriculture, food and beverage, dairy, airgun, and firearms.
The Process Engineer is responsible for ongoing process and quality improvements throughout our facility. This individual in this position will be responsible for developing and implementing new production and quality processes and standards for new and existing projects by working with our production and quality teams. They will also be responsible for ensuring the processes are implemented and followed.
Preferred Qualification include:

 5+ years manufacturing experience
 Leadership experience
 Proficiency in CAD
 Good organizational skills
 Written and oral communication skills
 Problem solving skills
 Results driven

1st Shift Monday- Friday
Pay: based on experience
Full benefit package after 60-day probationary period for Full-Time employees. (Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K with a 4% match, Colonial Life, Flex Spending, PTO after one year.
Check us out! www.bullseyeind.comor Facebook @bullseyeindustriesinc
Bullseye Industries Inc is an Equal Opportunity Employer including disability and veterans.
If you are an individual with a disability and you need assistance or a reasonable accommodation during the application process, please contact our services team at 920-386-4625
Job Type: Full-time
Benefits:

 401(k)
 401(k) matching
 Dental insurance
 Health insurance
 Vision insurance

Schedule:

 Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Application Engineer
description:
Company: DL Thurrott 

 About Us 
D.L. Thurrott is a trusted pump solutions provider specializing in the design, supply, and service of industrial and municipal pumping systems. With deep expertise in fluid handling applications, we deliver reliable, energy-efficient pump solutions tailored to meet the demanding needs of our customers. From system design to preventative maintenance, our team ensures optimal performance and long-term value. 

 Website: https://dlthurrott.com/ 

 Summary/Objective:
 The Applications Engineer will be responsible for providing exceptional service to our valued clients. In this role, you will craft and recommend technical solutions to a varied industrial customer base, support outside sales, and generate complex proposals. Excellent opportunity for recent engineering graduate that went to a vocational program in high school. 

 Essential Functions:


 Maintain and cultivate positive customer relationships
 Develop and recommend value added process equipment solutions for customer applications which increase their operational efficiencies, improve their operational safety, and reduce their environmental impact.
 Prepare technical proposals with sales team.
 Process orders, via order entry system, and manage complex projects.
 Follow-up and expedite critical projects and orders.
 Resolve any order problems related to delivery or paperwork issues directly with, sales team, customer and suppliers.
 Handle all inquiries/contacts in a professional manner.
 Work in concert with our outside sales team; funnel leads/opportunities to the sales team
 Resolve product issues or determine product solutions over the phone or via e-mail
 Competencies:


 Strong customer-service focus with a passion to exceed customer expectations
 Ability to address concerns and communicate clearly and efficiently
 Problem-solving and critical thinking; handle and resolve challenging problems
 Strong organizational, communication, attention to detail, multi-tasking, and time management skills
 Establish priorities, work independently, and proceed with objectives with minimal supervision
 Mechanical, electrical, and/or instrument aptitude
 High energy, drive and sense of responsibility
 Work Environment:
 This job operates in a professional office and manufacturing floor environments. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as laptop computers, photocopiers and smartphones; and tools found in a manufacturing environment such as hand tools, hydraulic tools, and power tools. 

 Physical Demands 

 The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. 

 While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision and ability to adjust focus. This would require the ability to lift up to 15 lbs., open filing cabinets and bend or stand on a stool as necessary. 

 Position Type/Expected Hours of Work 

 This is a full-time position. Days and hours of work are Monday through Friday; 8 am to 5 pm. 

 Preferred Education and Experience 



 Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering preferred
 SolidWorks, MasterCam, Office 365
 Experience in customer service a plus
 #dlthurrott 
#FCG-L 
#LI-NP1 
#flowcontrolgroup #manycompaniesoneteam 

 D.L. Thurrott operates as a vital subsidiary within Flow Control Group (FCG), a prominent holdings company that is a leading solutions provider focused on technically oriented products and services for flow control, fluid handling and process, industrial automation, and life sciences with locations throughout North America. As a critical intermediary between over 3,000 suppliers and 15,000 customers, over 90 brand companies, and close to 1,700 employees, FCG’s distribution and technical expertise serve an essential function in the movement of mission-critical components to a diverse array of end markets and applications. 

 Why Build a Career with Us? 

 Everyone’s an Owner of the Company: Because every team member contributes to Flow Control Group’s success, everyone has the benefits of ownership! Flow Control Group has a broad-based employee ownership program extended to every employee within our portfolio companies. 

 Competitive Benefits: Enjoy an attractive benefits package that includes Medical, Dental and Vision insurance (among other plans), competitive 401(k) matching program, career growth opportunities, employee referral program, paid time off and holidays, as well as parental leave. 

 Training: FCG University learning and training platform available to all employees offering over 80k courses. 

 Career Growth Opportunities: At Flow Control Group, we are committed to your professional development. With a vast network of over 100 brands across North America, we provide unparalleled opportunities for growth and advancement. Whether you're just starting your career or looking to take it to the next level, we offer custom training programs, mentorship, and a supportive environment to help you achieve your goals. Join us and be part of a dynamic team where your contributions make a real impact. 

 Equal Opportunity Employer: Flow Control Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other legally protected characteristics.

title: Process Engineer
description:
ABOUT THE ORGANIZATION
 
 Sun Chemical, a member of the DIC Group, is a leading producer of packaging and graphic solutions, color and display technologies, functional products, electronic materials, and products for the automotive and healthcare industries. Together with DIC, Sun Chemical is continuously working to promote and develop sustainable solutions to exceed customer expectations and better the world around us. With combined annual sales of more than $8.5 billion and 22,000+ employees worldwide, the DIC Group companies support a diverse collection of global customers.
 
 Sun Chemical Corporation is a subsidiary of Sun Chemical Group Coöperatief U.A., the Netherlands, and is headquartered in Parsippany, New Jersey, U.S.A. For more information, please visit our website at www.sunchemical.com or connect with us on LinkedIn or Twitter
 
 Process Development Engineer
 
 
 Overview – Support site manufacturing operations by providing quality and process troubleshooting assistance, leading process optimization projects, providing engineering input into capital projects, performing process safety studies and calculations, and implementing improvement ideas to achieve site objectives in the most safe, economical and efficient manner.
 
 
 Responsibilities
 
  Support and adhere to the principles of the American Chemistry Council's Responsible Care® by protecting the environment, health, safety and security of our employees, contractors, carriers, distributors, visitors, customers and neighbors.
  Utilize lean manufacturing tools where appropriate. Design data collection plans, lead plant trials, analyze data, and implement improvements. Lead or participate in teams in support of optimizing plant processes for quality, cost, reliability, and productivity.
  Provide process design for engineering projects including P&ID development, equipment specification development, mechanical drawing evaluation and approval, and generation of process releases.
  Represent manufacturing, coordinating new product introductions, process optimization projects, and process and product changes using a cross-functional team approach that ensures all aspects of the product and process changes have been addressed. Identify, evaluate, and make recommendations regarding new process technologies.
  Be knowledgeable of and follow all Environmental, Health and Safety practices including but not limited to: manage waste movements according to satellite and/or 90-day accumulation requirements, inspect air contaminant sources and institute corrective action for out-of-spec conditions, prevent releases into the sewer and/or storm water systems by following BMPs (best management practices), activate BASF emergency response procedures in case of spills or other emergencies.
 
 
 
 Education
 
  Degree in Chemical Engineering required
  Working knowledge of chemical processes both batch and continuous operations required
  Functional computer skills (Microsoft office) required
   
    Programming skills for advanced Excel use preferred
   
  Working knowledge of technical computer skills for process modeling calculations – ability to be trained
  Working knowledge of statistical analysis of process data
 
 
 
 Experience
 
  Minimum 3 years of technical experience in the Chemical industry required
  Working knowledge of OSHA Process Safety Management (PSM) Requirements preferred
  Familiarity developing Standard Operating Procedures required
  Understanding of advanced process automation systems preferred
  Must be able to work independently, possess excellent written and verbal communication skills and serve as a member of or interface with multi-disciplinary teams.
 
 
 
 Skills
 
  Strong analytical skills and demonstrated success in implementing Operational Excellence improvement tools such as Six Sigma, SPC, etc. in a manufacturing environment
  Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to interact effectively with all levels of personnel in a matrix organization
  Root cause analysis and problem solving
  Planning and prioritizing effectively to meet deadlines
  Taking initiatives; being open to new ideas
 
  BENEFITS
 
 We offer a range of market-competitive total rewards that include merit increases, paid holidays, Paid Time Off, medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability benefits, 401(k)+match and life insurance. Eligibility of benefit timing may vary.
 
 
 EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY
 
 It is Sun’s policy that applicants for employment are recruited, selected, and hired on the basis of individual merit and ability with respect to the position being filled. Sun prohibits discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, national origin, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other status protected by applicable law.
 
 Employment agencies are an important component of our talent acquisition strategy, and we value the partnerships we have built with our preferred vendors. We will not accept unsolicited resumes from employment agencies for any employment opportunity. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Sun Chemical or directly to hiring managers in any form without a signed contract on file, and search engagement for that position, will be deemed unsolicited in nature, and no fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired as a result of the referral or through other means. Additionally, any resume submitted without a contract in place will be considered property of Sun Chemical and no fees will be paid to the agency if the candidate is hired.
  #ID23

title: Applications Engineer
description:
About VSP Technologies 
VSP Technologies is the largest dedicated fluid-sealing products distributor in the United States, with an approach focused on managing every part of the gasket-use process to make improvements that save customers time and money. The company offers products from more than 20 premium manufacturers, as well as several of its own patented products and designs.
Essential Functions
Support technical expertise, product development, and customer relations for VSP. Provide engineering solutions, conduct data analysis, lead research, and foster internal and external collaboration.

 Technical Support: Assist with torque calculations, material compatibility, and flange integrity. Provide customer solutions and write technical reports.
 Data & Analysis: Analyze project data, document cost savings, and improve processes for efficiency.
 Research & Development: Conduct product testing and contribute to new product development.
 Training: Lead training sessions for customers and internal teams.
 Collaboration: Work with specialists, engineers, and management to meet customer needs and improve operations.
 Public Representation: Promote VSP’s products and services externally.

Education and Experience

 Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical, Chemical, Nuclear, Industrial, or Material Science Engineering
 Experience in technical/applications support at industrial, transportation, or power generation facilities (Preferred)

title: Process Engineer
description:
Job Summary
We are seeking a hands-on, results-driven Process Engineer to support our aluminum extrusion, anodizing, paint and converting operations. This person will drive process improvements, reduce waste, enhance product quality, and support environmental, health, and safety (EHS) initiatives. The ideal candidate will work cross-functionally with production, maintenance, quality, and EHS teams to identify opportunities, implement solutions, and support a culture of continuous improvement.
Key Responsibilities

 Analyze production processes and performance data to identify improvement opportunities in extrusion, anodizing, and paint lines.
 Lead and execute Continuous Improvement (CI) projects to reduce waste, increase yield, and optimize throughput.
 Investigate process deviations, quality issues, and equipment inefficiencies; develop and implement corrective actions.
 Standardize best practices by developing and updating process documentation and SOPs.
 Collaborate with operators and supervisors to implement lean manufacturing practices and process controls.
 Partner with EHS personnel to promote a safe working environment, assist in safety audits, and support compliance with environmental regulations.
 Monitor key process indicators and drive proactive adjustments to maintain optimal performance.
 Support new equipment installations, process trials, and scale-up of new products or changes.
 Train production staff on process changes and support development of training materials.
 Contribute to cross-functional problem-solving teams focused on quality, efficiency, and safety.

Qualifications

 Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering (Mechanical, Industrial, Chemical, or related field).
 1-2 years of experience in a manufacturing or industrial environment; metals, extrusion, or surface finishing preferred.
 Experience with Lean, Six Sigma, or other CI methodologies.
 Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills; data-driven decision-making.
 Familiarity with EHS principles.
 Excellent communication and team collaboration skills.
 Knowledge of aluminum extrusion, anodizing, or painting processes a strong plus.

title: Entry Level Engineer - RF / Test Tech.
description:
JSG is seeking an immediate temporary to full time RF Test Technician / Entry level Engineer for our client in the South Bay - CA.
 
 Reporting to the Operations Manager and partnering closely with engineering teams, the RF Test Technician develops and performs test solutions for RF products from concept through manufacturing release. He/she supports product development evaluations and final product characterization testing and works with the development team.
 Primary Duties
 
  Work closely with product design engineering and operations to support product development.
  Specify and recommend test resources, processes, capabilities, and technology.
  Set-up test circuits to measure the electrical parameters of products.
  Test, update and repair printed circuit board using test stations, soldering equipment and/or tools.
  Participate in the assembly and testing of RF components within manufacturing.
  Use basic statistical tools, compare to charts, histograms, cause-and-effect diagrams, to evaluate electrical data for test variability and aid in problem solving.
  Associate Degree in Electrical Engineering, trade school education, electronic certification, or equivalent professional training with 3 years of experience in RF testing and basic manufacturing assembly skills.
  Capable of setting and adjusting each electrical test instrument and measuring the magnitude and accuracy of the parameters called out by the specification.
  Able to make complex test set-ups including inputs, outputs, and metering requirements.
  Basic RF knowledge needed, along with tuning/troubleshooting experience from 6GHz and below.
  Ability to debug circuits and systems.
  Hands-on experience with RF testing equipment including Spectrum and Network Analyzers, Oscilloscope, Power Meter, Signal Generator, and Power Supply.
  Awareness of ISO 9001 standards and procedures.
  Comfortable working both independently and in team environments.
  Excellent communications skills; computer proficiency; good analytical and problem-solving skills.
  Must be able to walk, sit or stand throughout an 8-10 hour day, and lift 40 lbs. using proper technique.
 Salary $25-$35/hr. DOE
 
 #D800
 
 JSG offers medical, dental, vision, life insurance options, short-term disability, 401(k), weekly pay, and more. Johnson Service Group (JSG) is an Equal Opportunity Employer. JSG provides equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, marital status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: New Product Engineer
description:
Our client, a leader in the industrial sector, is seeking a NPI Engineer to join their team. As a NPI Engineer, you will be part of the manufacturing department supporting product introduction initiatives. The ideal candidate will have strong communication skills, excellent problem-solving abilities, and a collaborative spirit which will align successfully in the organization.
 Job Title: NPI Engineer
 Location: Suwanee, GA
 Pay Range: $75-$85k
 What's the Job?
 
  Evaluate customer drawings and data for labor quotation and documentation creation.
  Perform design for assembly (DFA) and design for fabrication (DFF) analysis of product designs.
  Support Lean culture and effectively use Lean Sigma concepts to identify and eliminate waste.
  Lead the development of design documentation and materials for manufacturability.
  Monitor SMT processes and establish robust process parameters and controls.
 
 What's Needed?
 
  6+ years of demonstrated experience in SMT process engineering.
  Ability to read and understand PCA assembly drawings and technical notes.
  Strong knowledge of DFM, NPI, and Lean Manufacturing methods.
  Experience with MFG ERP software or similar manufacturing software.
  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
 
 What's in it for me?
 
  Opportunity to work in a dynamic and innovative environment.
  Engage in continuous learning and technical development.
  Be part of a team that values collaboration and quality.
  Contribute to impactful projects that shape the future of manufacturing.
  Work in a supportive culture that encourages growth and improvement.
 
 Upon completion of waiting period associates are eligible for:
 
  Medical and Prescription Drug Plans
  Dental Plan
  Supplemental Life Insurance
  Short Term Disability Insurance
  401(k)
 
 If this is a role that interests you and you'd like to learn more, click apply now and a recruiter will be in touch with you to discuss this great opportunity. We look forward to speaking with you!
 About ManpowerGroup, Parent Company of: Manpower, Experis, Talent Solutions, and Jefferson Wells
 ManpowerGroup® (NYSE: MAN), the leading global workforce solutions company, helps organizations transform in a fast-changing world of work by sourcing, assessing, developing, and managing the talent that enables them to win. We develop innovative solutions for hundreds of thousands of organizations every year, providing them with skilled talent while finding meaningful, sustainable employment for millions of people across a wide range of industries and skills. Our expert family of brands – Manpower, Experis, Talent Solutions, and Jefferson Wells – creates substantial value for candidates and clients across more than 75 countries and territories and has done so for over 70 years. We are recognized consistently for our diversity - as a best place to work for Women, Inclusion, Equality and Disability and in 2023 ManpowerGroup was named one of the World's Most Ethical Companies for the 14th year - all confirming our position as the brand of choice for in-demand talent.

title: Controls Engineer
description:
Role
 As a Controls Engineer (also known as Automation Engineer, Electrical Controls Engineer), you will provide technical support to manufacturing operations, drive continuous improvement through the design and installation of new equipment and systems, and maintain current documentation of equipment and systems. You will also be responsible for troubleshooting, rebuilding, and repairing electrical equipment and automated systems. Benefits
 
  Competitive Compensation
  Employee Ownership (Company Shares)
  Lucrative Incentive Bonus Opportunity
 Qualifications
 
  BS in electrical engineering or equivalent professional qualifications.
  Minimum of 2 years' experience commissioning and troubleshooting machine/process controls.
  Proficient in editing and developing PLC programs and able to deliver complete and accurate electrical system drawing packages.

title: Technical Support Engineer Trainee
description:
The Engineer Trainee will engage in learning and supporting various engineering functions, with a focus on the assembly, troubleshooting, and repair of mining trucks. This role offers hands-on experience in the engineering and technical aspects of the heavy machinery sector. The Engineer Trainee will collaborate with experienced engineers to assist in the construction and maintenance of mining trucks and contribute to solving mechanical and electrical challenges.
  
   Responsibilities
  
   
    Assist senior engineers in the assembly and development of mining trucks, ensuring adherence to quality and safety standards.
    Participate in the assembly and construction of mining trucks, aiding in the installation of mechanical, electrical, and hydraulic components.
    Diagnose and troubleshoot mechanical, electrical, and hydraulic issues in mining trucks, providing effective solutions for repairs and improvements.
    Support the repair and maintenance of mining trucks, ensuring optimal functionality and compliance with industry standards.
    Collaborate with engineering teams to identify recurring issues and propose enhancements to improve performance and reliability.
    Collect, analyze, and interpret performance data from mining trucks, offering insights into operational efficiency and recommending corrective actions.
    Contribute to engineering projects related to mining truck design, testing, and modification, tracking milestones and ensuring timely completion.
    Participate in the testing of newly built or modified mining trucks to ensure they meet operational and safety requirements.
    Assist in creating and updating technical documentation, including repair manuals, design specifications, and maintenance logs.
    Stay informed on the latest technologies and best practices in mining truck engineering and maintenance through training and development programs.
    Work with cross-functional teams, including manufacturing, quality control, and maintenance, to ensure the successful delivery and upkeep of mining trucks.
    Document technical incidents and quality issues, contributing to continuous improvement efforts.
    Engage in training and cross-functional development programs to enhance skills and knowledge.
   
  
   Competencies
  
   
     Education and Experience: Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
    Strong interest in heavy machinery, specifically mining trucks, and a willingness to learn.
    Basic understanding of mechanical and electrical systems in large-scale vehicles or machinery.
    Excellent problem-solving skills, with the ability to troubleshoot and repair mechanical, electrical, and hydraulic issues.
    Ability to work with engineering software and tools used for diagnostics, analysis, and repair.
    Strong communication and teamwork skills, with the ability to work collaboratively across departments.
    Good organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to follow technical specifications.
    Knowledge of Outlook software, Excel Spreadsheet software and Word Processing software.
    Travel to customer and supplier sites domestically and internationally for 2-7 weeks in duration.
    Ability to obtain and maintain Local Mine induction and access.
    Ability to obtain and maintain Local Mine HSE certification.
    Ability to obtain and maintain a valid passport and driver’s license.
   
  
   Our Offer
  
   An interesting and ambitious role in a successful international company. We offer a secure work environment with a comprehensive benefits package that includes major medical, dental and vision insurance, 401K plan with company match, paid vacation and personal days and competitive salary.
   Referral Bonus: Tier II
  
  
   Have we awoken your interest? Then we look forward to receiving your online application. If you have any questions, please contact Nicole Alden.
   Liebherr-America, Inc. and its US affiliates are Equal Opportunity Employers. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic factors, military/veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.
 If you are a California resident, please visit Liebherr USA, Co. Privacy Statement for more information regarding how Liebherr-America, Inc. and its US affiliates collect and process your personal information.
    One Passion. Many Opportunities.
  
 
  The company
 In line with its international growth, Liebherr’s venture into the United States began in 1970. Within a couple of years, the company expanded and completed its production facilities in Newport News, Virginia, for its product line of hydraulic excavators. It was later converted into Liebherr’s manufacturing facility for mining trucks and remains home to Liebherr Mining Equipment Newport News, Co. In addition to its production facility, Liebherr markets a wide variety of products and technologies its companies located across the United States. The companies are Liebherr-Aerospace Saline, Inc., Liebherr Gear Technology, Inc., Liebherr Automation Systems, Co., and Liebherr USA, Co., the umbrella company for eight divisions that are positioned across the United States.
 Location
 
  Liebherr Mining Equipment Newport News Co.
  4100 Chestnut Avenue
  23607 Newport News, VA
  United States (US)
 
  Contact
 
  Nicole Alden
  nicole.alden@liebherr.com

title: Project Engineer (PEMB) Entry Level
description:
Red Dot Buildings has an opening for an entry-level project engineer. This position acts as a technical liaison between Red Dot and architects, general contractors and foundation engineers.
This position is responsible for reviewing architectural drawings, structural drawings, Red Dot’s approval drawings and making technical business decisions on how Red Dot proceeds on an individual project.
The ideal candidate will be able to convey technical information clearly and concisely both written and verbally. This position includes approximately 10% customer-facing verbal communication with conference calls and approval meetings.
The ideal candidate will have the ability to manage multiple responsibilities while meeting deadlines and without impacting quality of work in a fast-paced team environment. The candidate must be comfortable making decisions and possess good communication skills.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s of Engineering in Civil, Architectural or Mechanical Engineering OR years of technical experience in the PEMB industry.
Candidates must be close enough to Athens Texas to drive in for an interview.
Positive and professional attitude.
Ability to self-motivate without the need for constant guidance.

title: Process Engineer
description:
ABOUT THE ORGANIZATION
 
 Sun Chemical, a member of the DIC Group, is a leading producer of packaging and graphic solutions, color and display technologies, functional products, electronic materials, and products for the automotive and healthcare industries. Together with DIC, Sun Chemical is continuously working to promote and develop sustainable solutions to exceed customer expectations and better the world around us. With combined annual sales of more than $8.5 billion and 22,000+ employees worldwide, the DIC Group companies support a diverse collection of global customers.
 
 Sun Chemical Corporation is a subsidiary of Sun Chemical Group Coöperatief U.A., the Netherlands, and is headquartered in Parsippany, New Jersey, U.S.A. For more information, please visit our website at www.sunchemical.com or connect with us on LinkedIn or Twitter
 
 Process Development Engineer
 
 
 Overview – Support site manufacturing operations by providing quality and process troubleshooting assistance, leading process optimization projects, providing engineering input into capital projects, performing process safety studies and calculations, and implementing improvement ideas to achieve site objectives in the most safe, economical and efficient manner.
 
 
 Responsibilities
 
  Support and adhere to the principles of the American Chemistry Council's Responsible Care® by protecting the environment, health, safety and security of our employees, contractors, carriers, distributors, visitors, customers and neighbors.
  Utilize lean manufacturing tools where appropriate. Design data collection plans, lead plant trials, analyze data, and implement improvements. Lead or participate in teams in support of optimizing plant processes for quality, cost, reliability, and productivity.
  Provide process design for engineering projects including P&ID development, equipment specification development, mechanical drawing evaluation and approval, and generation of process releases.
  Represent manufacturing, coordinating new product introductions, process optimization projects, and process and product changes using a cross-functional team approach that ensures all aspects of the product and process changes have been addressed. Identify, evaluate, and make recommendations regarding new process technologies.
  Be knowledgeable of and follow all Environmental, Health and Safety practices including but not limited to: manage waste movements according to satellite and/or 90-day accumulation requirements, inspect air contaminant sources and institute corrective action for out-of-spec conditions, prevent releases into the sewer and/or storm water systems by following BMPs (best management practices), activate BASF emergency response procedures in case of spills or other emergencies.
 
 
 
 Education
 
  Degree in Chemical Engineering required
  Working knowledge of chemical processes both batch and continuous operations required
  Functional computer skills (Microsoft office) required
   
    Programming skills for advanced Excel use preferred
   
  Working knowledge of technical computer skills for process modeling calculations – ability to be trained
  Working knowledge of statistical analysis of process data
 
 
 
 Experience
 
  Minimum 3 years of technical experience in the Chemical industry required
  Working knowledge of OSHA Process Safety Management (PSM) Requirements preferred
  Familiarity developing Standard Operating Procedures required
  Understanding of advanced process automation systems preferred
  Must be able to work independently, possess excellent written and verbal communication skills and serve as a member of or interface with multi-disciplinary teams.
 
 
 
 Skills
 
  Strong analytical skills and demonstrated success in implementing Operational Excellence improvement tools such as Six Sigma, SPC, etc. in a manufacturing environment
  Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to interact effectively with all levels of personnel in a matrix organization
  Root cause analysis and problem solving
  Planning and prioritizing effectively to meet deadlines
  Taking initiatives; being open to new ideas
 
  BENEFITS
 
 We offer a range of market-competitive total rewards that include merit increases, paid holidays, Paid Time Off, medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability benefits, 401(k)+match and life insurance. Eligibility of benefit timing may vary.
 
 
 EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY
 
 It is Sun’s policy that applicants for employment are recruited, selected, and hired on the basis of individual merit and ability with respect to the position being filled. Sun prohibits discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, national origin, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other status protected by applicable law.
 
 Employment agencies are an important component of our talent acquisition strategy, and we value the partnerships we have built with our preferred vendors. We will not accept unsolicited resumes from employment agencies for any employment opportunity. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Sun Chemical or directly to hiring managers in any form without a signed contract on file, and search engagement for that position, will be deemed unsolicited in nature, and no fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired as a result of the referral or through other means. Additionally, any resume submitted without a contract in place will be considered property of Sun Chemical and no fees will be paid to the agency if the candidate is hired.
  #ID23

title: Engineer Technician
description:
About Attollo Engineering
Attollo Engineering is a designer and manufacturer of cutting-edge infrared cameras and instruments for defense and industrial applications. Attollo provides competitive salary compensation, a generous benefits package, and 401K matching.
Job Description 
Attollo is seeking to hire an experienced Engineering Technician to work closely with and support our rapid paced production manufacturing efforts. In this position you will be heavily involved in the R&D development tasks such as building, testing, debugging, and documenting electronic and optoelectronic systems. Tasks might vary from day-to-day and intense attention to detail is required.
Role and Responsibilities
Follow ESD-safe and FOD-aware handling procedures
Build up circuit boards and custom cables in prototype test quantities

 Lead free and standard soldering of components
 Surface mount components (some limited BGA) with 0402 components size, up to 200 components per board
 Place solder with stencils with place components by hand

Communicate results and observations with Engineers
Present results clearly verbally and with written emails and small written documents
Read and follow mechanical drawings for assembly specifications
Cleaning optical elements

 Working in a cleanroom environment as needed (full gown, boots, mask, etc.)
 Clean room equipment and tools
 Ultrasonic cleaning tools

Aid in fabricating, painting, and installing mechanical components

 Mixing and applying heat and UV cure epoxies using dispensers
 Using calibrated tools to inspect components and assemblies
 Using microscopes for visual inspections
 Installing 0-80 Fasteners with Loctite

Qualifications and Education Requirements

 3+ years of experience in a similar environment with extensive hands-on laboratory and/or manufacturing support experience.
 Mathematical skills with ability to perform unit conversions, manipulate decimals and fractions, calculate setpoints
 Superb soldering skills of 0402 components

Preferred Skills

 Strong Windows based PC experience with Excel and Word operation
 Ability to navigate to schematics and layouts in Altium
 Can work with defined requirements to complete tasks with minimal supervision
 Attention to detail, organized and methodical

Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $25.00 - $40.00 per hour
Benefits:

 401(k)
 Dental insurance
 Health insurance
 Paid time off
 Referral program
 Vision insurance

Experience:

 Soldering: 1 year (Required)

title: Manufacturing Launch Engineer
description:
Description: 
 At Innotec, we're passionate about designing innovative and durable products that enhance safety. As industry experts in industrial LED lighting, headrest stays & metal forming, and counterweights, we take pride in our ability to provide cutting-edge solutions that meet the unique needs of our customers.
 As a leading LED lighting manufacturer, we're also dedicated to promoting sustainability in everything we do. By minimizing our environmental impact, we're not only contributing to a healthier planet, but we're also providing our customers with more sustainable and cost-effective solutions.
  Innovation is our passion. People are our culture.
 We are selectively seeking a Manufacturing Launch Engineer to join our team. Successful candidates will have a desire to work in a fast-paced environment based on trust and integrity and have an interest in a hands-on approach to business. Interested applicants should have a passion for manufacturing and innovation as well as a desire for a broad scope of daily responsibilities. In addition to these qualities, we are looking for someone with the following characteristics and qualifications: Requirements:

  3+ years of engineering experience launching product
  Lighting experience is a plus

  Proven results towards continuous improvements
  Experience with product or process innovations and a perpetual drive toward learning
  Familiarity with many different aspects of the manufacturing process, i.e. product/machine design and build, launch, quoting, price negotiation, customer interaction
  Proven leadership ability and desire to work in a team based atmosphere
 
  Additionally, we're looking for the following qualifications:
 
  A Bachelor's degree in engineering
  3+ years of experience in related field
  Must be a U.S. citizen or green card holder
  Manufacturing experience is a plus!
  Industry specific experience is a plus, but not a requirement
 
 Innotec offers competitive compensation and benefits including profit sharing, ESOP, 401k investment, generous paid leave, tuition reimbursement, robust training and development, and lots of cool technology.

title: Application Engineer
description:
Xylem is a Fortune 500 global water solutions company dedicated to advancing sustainable impact and empowering the people who make water work every day. As a leading water technology company with 23,000 employees operating in over 150 countries, Xylem is at the forefront of addressing the world's most critical water challenges. We invite passionate individuals to join our team, dedicated to exceeding customer expectations through innovative and sustainable solutions.
 
 THE ROLE: The Applications Engineer will be responsible for providing cordial, timely, and accurate Vertical Turbine Pump product and order support. This role will collaborate with other technical and engineering groups, production, and sales to understand the needs and desires of the customers and provide them with service levels that meet or exceed customer expectations.
 
 CORE RESPONSIBILITIES: To perform the job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.
 
 

 
  Provide Applications Engineering support to channel partners, distributors and end users
  Provide optimal design selections based on customer requirements.
  Estimate project costing and negotiate lead times.
  Collaborate with purchasing team and other stakeholders to obtain costing for components as required
  Support maintenance of CRM funnel to ensure opportunity visibility by field sales team.
  Develop technical depth and understanding of Xylem products and applications.
  Conduct Project Engineering activities during submittal development and order fulfillment
  Collaborate with other technical and engineering groups to provide the required customer solution.
  Proactively anticipate and mitigate risk
  Provide timely responses to inquiries.
  Meet or exceed established SLA and required metrics.
  Be easy to do business with
  Support timely order entry, deliverables and order status.
 
 
 
 QUALIFICATIONS:
 
 

 
  Bachelor's degree in engineering required.
  One to Five years+ related experience with rotating equipment preferred. Candidates who possess < 2 years of relevant experience will be considered Associate Application Engineers
  Knowledge of pump hydraulics, mechanics and construction

title: Process Engineer
description:
Full-Time 
York, Pennsylvania 
07/05/2025 
Compensation: 55000.-60000. / Annually 
Benefit Offered: YES 

 Our client, a precision metals manufacturer, has an immediate need for an experienced Process Engineer, to join their winning team in York. 

 Our candidate of choice will support plant projects and activities, driving improvement to processes within the entire plant and serve as a subject expert on local and corporate databases and ERP systems along with supporting LEAN initiatives for entire facility, including Continuous Improvement. 

 KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
 Coordinates with Operations Manager, Production Manager, and Quality Administrators for Continuous Improvement Activities. Engineer, Requisition and /or manufacture materials, parts, or supplies to support new or improvements to operational processes, equipment, or tooling. 
Maintain accurate plant layout in Auto CAD 
Maintain accurate documentation control in local and corporate databases, including QMS documentation control, related to manufacturing processes and instructions. 
Act as the project manager for all new part number creation, development and production release (including new tool builds and tool transfers) by leading the APQP process entirely. 
Maintain customer prints, specifications and cross reference database. 
Support industry surveys and controls (ref RoHS, MSPCA, Conflict Minerals). 
Driving LEAN initiatives in the plant through all departments (6 Sigma, LEAN, etc…). 
Lead data accuracy requirements in corporate ERP system (currently EPICOR). Including driving improved / increased modules activity usage (Min / Max, rates/ efficiencies, etc…). 
Develop and maintain system costing standards. 
Support customer initiatives on productivity improvements and cost reduction activities, including cost review initiatives. 
Act as backup for manufacturing cost quotes and proposals. 
Leads the Continuous Improvement, RFQ and other committees and teams. 

 KEY REQUIREMENTS:
 Must be able to perform all duties and meet requirements with or without accommodation. 
Associate’s degree; or two years combination of related education. Preferably in Industrial Engineering. Other acceptable areas of study include Mechanical and Manufacturing Engineering. 
Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations. 
Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals. 
Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public. 
Ability to work with mathematical concepts such as probability and statistical inference, and fundamentals of plane and solid geometry and trigonometry. Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations. 
Able to work independently with minimal direct supervision on assigned tasks, projects and activities. 
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables. 
Strong working knowledge of personal computers and software (Windows, Access, Word, and Excel). 
Must be able to successfully complete all training requirements as listed on training matrix for this position. 

 WE OFFER:
 100% premium coverage for medical, dental and vision coverage including family 
Generous blue cross coverage with low deductible ($400 individual, $800 family) 
2 weeks PTO after 90 days on boarding 
401K w Company match 

 Please apply today to be immediately considered for the role!

With a deep understanding of today’s hiring trends and technologies we have the ability to leverage the most effective recruiting methods to find the best candidates across numerous markets and industries and place them into the appropriate position successfully. Please allow us to help you find your dream job today! 

 Apply Now

title: Data Engineer
description:
Overview: 
 
   HaloMD
 
 
 
  
 Who We Are:
 
 
  HaloMD specializes in Independent Dispute Resolution (IDR) through The No Surprises Act and state regulations for out-of-network healthcare providers, leveraging advanced technology and deep industry expertise to secure optimized reimbursements.

  Build ETL/ELT pipelines to ingest and load data

  Gain strong knowledge of underlying data and business rules, and assist other teams

  Demonstrated ability in meeting deadlines and communicating progress across projects

title: Application Engineer
description:
Position Overview:
We are seeking a highly skilled Application Engineer to lead high-engineering projects related to air compressors and compressed air systems, including our compressed air enclosure designed to enable year-round operation in any weather condition. This role requires deep technical expertise, strong project management skills, and the ability to liaise with customers, engineering firms, and internal teams. The engineer will be responsible for designing, reviewing, and approving technical solutions while ensuring successful project execution.
Key Responsibilities:
Engineering & Technical Expertise:

 Lead the development and improvement of the AWA, ensuring it meets performance, durability, and regulatory standards.
 Review and interpret complex engineering drawings, P&IDs, and technical specifications.
 Ensure compliance with industry standards, regulations, and customer requirements.
 Support project with interaction with the customer on general assembly drawings, piping flow diagrams and
 Provide technical guidance and support for installation, commissioning, and troubleshooting of AWA enclosures.
 Analyze and optimize air compressor systems and industrial compressed air solutions for end users to include site layout.

Project Management & Customer Interaction:

 Act as the primary engineering contact for high-level projects with distribution, end users, and EPC’s.
 Work closely with customers, engineering firms, and contractors to define project requirements, understand their needs, and help create solutions.
 Lead project meetings, provide technical insights, and ensure alignment with customer expectations.
 Develop project schedules, and coordinate with outside engineering firms on design specifications for seismic, wind, and snow loads.
 Coordinate with internal teams at the AWA factory to ensure timely project execution and support of AWA projects.
 Ability to understand how to take compressed air systems, design structure for placement outside, and application of the product to industries we support.

Collaboration & Innovation:

 Support R&D initiatives related to new products, efficiency improvements, and system integrations.

Qualifications & Skills:

 Education:
 Bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering or a related field.
 Experience:
 5+ years of experience in engineering, preferably in air compressors, metal structures or enclosures, or related structures. Understanding how a project with equipment build goes from design, and construction to placement onsite.
 Technical Skills:
 Strong understanding of compressed air systems, piping, pressure vessels, and industrial ventilation.
 Experience designing weather-resistant enclosures for outdoor industrial equipment is a plus.
 Proficiency in CAD software (AutoCAD, SolidWorks) and engineering calculations.
 Knowledge of electrical and control systems related to air compressors is a plus.
 Project Management:
 Ability to manage multiple projects, work with stakeholders, and meet deadlines.
 Communication:
 Strong verbal and written communication skills for customer interactions and technical documentation.
