title: Test Engineer 1
description:
P-DPD-001
 
 Position Summary 
 
 The Test Engineer I position is an entry-level hands-on position that performs high level testing and provides engineering input for current and new products and customer/application specific projects. This position is approximately 60% hands-on. It offers a unique blend of engineering work as well as hands-on learning with the company products. The position provides a learning curve to hydraulics and builds a strong foundation for engineering work.
 
 Duties and Responsibilities 
 
  Performs various laboratory assignments primarily involving hydraulic test stands but also including electrical applications, electronics, instrumentation, and calibrations.
  Develops testing procedures to replicate real world applications within the Fluid Care Center.
  Maintains a strong understanding of product testing and product performance specifications, this individual provides value-added input such as observations and feedback during new and existing product testing, working closely with Engineering.
  May assist in the development of new products for commercial launch, from concept through design, testing, and introduction. Supports new products after commercial introduction. Evaluates, improves, and certifies for production any new products. Such efforts would include, but are not limited to, the creation and/or design review of the following documents; SOP (Standard Operating Procedures), assembly drawings, element construction drawings, detail machining drawings, BOM's (Bill of Material), assembly drawings, technical manuals, etc.
  Provides engineering support for the design of new products or the modification of established products in response to company or customer requirements within the guidelines of the Company policy, cost effectiveness, manufacturability, product safety and liability, accepted engineering practices, applicable standards or regulations, and within the time constraints established by the FCC Supervisor.
  Assists in the design of new tooling, fixtures, test equipment and prototype components as necessary.
  Conducts and runs various tests associated with fluid analysis, including particle counting, viscosity measurement, Karl Fischer Titration, patch testing & microscopic analysis.
  Understands, and is able to conduct multi-pass testing per ISO 16889.
  Performs or assists in client tours/training/troubleshooting within the lab or at a client's facility.
  Performs other duties as assigned.
 
 Qualifications 
 
 To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. 
 
 Qualifications: 
 
  Minimum of Bachelor's Degree in Engineering is required; BSME, BSIE, BSc or BSEE is required.
  Knowledge of AutoCAD and/or Solid Works or equivalent computer aided drafting system is required.
  Experience in fluid power industry and/or manufacturing environment is preferred.
 
 Skills and Abilities: 
 
  Knowledge of product design, project management, and hydraulic/electrical schematics as applied to fluid power is preferred .
  To perform this job successfully, an individual should have excellent knowledge of ERP software, spreadsheet software and word processing software; SAP experience is a plus.
  Has an understanding of, or willingness to learn data acquisition software and systems (LabView or similar) and is able to use the software with existing test equipment.
 
 Certificates and Licenses: 
 
  Fluid Power Specialist Certification is required within eighteen months of employment.
 
 Other Requirements: Travel, including driving, is required, including occasional travel to domestic and international locations.

 
 
 Working Environment 
 
 Manufacturing facility. The noise level can be loud, at times requiring hearing protection. 
 
 Physical Requirements 
 
 Physical Abilities Lift / Carry 
 Stand F 10 lbs or less O 
 Walk F 11-20 lbs O 
 Sit F 21-50 lbs O 
 Handling / Fingering C 51-100 lbs O 
 Reach Outward C Over 100 lbs N 
 Reach Above Shoulder F Push / Pull 
 Climb O 12 lbs or less O 
 Crawl O 13-25 lbs O 
 Squat or Kneel O 26-40 lbs O 
 Bend O 41-100 lbs O 
 N (Not Applicable) Activity is not applicable to this occupation. 
 O (Occasionally) Occupation requires this activity up to 33% of the time (0 - 2.5+ hrs/day) 
 F (Frequently) Occupation requires this activity from 33% - 66% of the time (2.5 - 5.5+ hrs/day) 
 C (Constantly) Occupation requires this activity more than 66% of the time (5.5+ hrs/day) 
 
 Safety and Personal Protective Equipment 
 
 Must adhere to all safety rules in force for the location you are in while performing your job responsibilities. This includes at a customer or supplier location. Must meet requirements for PPE in specific manufacturing areas when you are in those areas including safety shoes and safety glasses . 
 
 Direct Reports 
 
 Not applicable.
 
 Benefits
 PEAK's benefit offerings available for our associates include medical, dental, vision, Flexible Spending Account (FSA), Dependent Care Savings Account (DCA), and 401K plan.
 
 PEAK believes that taking care of our team is essential for success and we are proud to provide benefits that enhance both your well-being and your future.
  
 Additionally, our associates may be eligible for Paid Sick Leave as required by Federal, State, or local laws. 
 
 Equal Opportunity Employer (EEO)
 PEAK Technical Staffing is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. PEAK does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. All employment decisions are made based on qualifications, merit, and business need. We encourage all individuals to apply. 
 
 Candidate Privacy
 To read our Candidate Privacy Information Statement, which explains how we will use your information, please navigate to https://peaktechnical.com/privacy-policy/ and https://peaktechnical.com/ca-residents-privacy-rights/

 THE ROLE: The Applications Engineer will be responsible for providing cordial, timely, and accurate Vertical Turbine Pump product and order support. This role will collaborate with other technical and engineering groups, production, and sales to understand the needs and desires of the customers and provide them with service levels that meet or exceed customer expectations.

  Support maintenance of CRM funnel to ensure opportunity visibility by field sales team.
  Develop technical depth and understanding of Xylem products and applications.
  Conduct Project Engineering activities during submittal development and order fulfillment
  Collaborate with other technical and engineering groups to provide the required customer solution.
  Proactively anticipate and mitigate risk

 QUALIFICATIONS:
 
 

 
  Bachelor's degree in engineering required.

title: Application Engineer
description:
Application Engineer
Caron Engineering is a small but growing company working in the global CNC machine industry. We develop and produce accessories that allow CNC machines to work smarter and more efficiently for some of the largest and most advanced companies in the world.
We are seeking a detailed-oriented full-time application engineer who would be responsible for all duties related to converting customers’ requirements into installed software. Any required training on these products and related services would be supplied by the company. You’ll primarily support our MiConnect platform—our powerful graphical programming environment for smart automation integration—with the opportunity to expand into other Caron Engineering technologies like AutoComp. This role combines hands-on problem-solving, system configuration, customer interaction, and documentation to deliver high-performance, real-world applications.
ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES The responsibility of this role will include, but may not be limited to the following:

 The job will mainly focus on the support of our MiConnect product but will expand to other CEI products.
 This includes learning and understanding all system components, system options and the programming environment to set up and configure systems for all our customer’s needs.
 It will require the ability to produce a flow chart for each process, documentation of all features and programming of the application in our graphical programming environment.
 It is also intended that you will eventually learn and support our AutoComp software and be able to assist in the support that our integrators require.
 Communication – keep the Office Admin and/or purchase agent informed of all pertinent activities; Must also be able to communicate accurately and pleasantly with on-site customer contacts to support any Q&A or troubleshooting (on-site or phone/email); solid verbal and written skills are necessary
 Assist with product testing and documentation
 Maintain your online calendar work schedule (jobs, travel, etc.)
 Comfortable with handling all travel arrangements including hotels, your personal automobile, and commercial flights
 Comfortable with accurately tracking and reporting all time and expenses for customer visits and shop work
 A pleasant personality is necessary as you spend a lot of time at customer locations
 Have strong interpersonal and communication skills, be self-motivated and self-directed, plus have the ability to work closely with senior management and corporation officers
 All employees with disabilities should be able to perform the essential job descriptions with or without reasonable accommodation

QUALIFICATIONS (IF REQUIRED)

 Internal – qualification initiated from CEI – experience at other position(s), training, etc.

o A solid background / education in the electrical engineering or mechanical engineering
o Extensive knowledge in computer programming is major bonus
o Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
o Proficient with flow chart design software (Visio or equivalent)
o Exceptional customer service and interpersonal skills
o Great organization and time management skills External – degrees, certifications, and experience –
o Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or Computer Science preferred. o Basic understanding of flowchart design preferred.
o Familiarity with core programming concepts such as variables, control flow, and logic structures preferred.
o Maintain an active driver’s license, usable automobile (presentable, registered, insured, secure) for remote work assignments
o Active passport and immunization for international trave
Salary & Benefits
· Starting salary of $55,000 to $70,000 dependent on experience and education
· Medical and Dental Insurance
· Health Reimbursement Arrangement (HRA)
· 401(k)
· Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP) in which each year of service allows you to share in company growth
· Paid disability & life insurance
· Paid time-off starting: vacation days (10), sick days (5), personal days (3), and holidays (11-12 days)
· Vacation days increase to 15 days per year after 1 full year of service, and 20 days per year after 2 full years of service
For more information, please visit our website at: https://www.caroneng.com/

title: Application Engineer
description:
Job Title: Application Engineer
 
 Job Description
 The Application Engineer provides technical and modification parts support to sales, PPC, shop, and NP teams to facilitate order management and completion, thereby achieving departmental goals. The role also involves conducting research projects to enhance departmental efficiencies and capabilities.
 
  Responsibilities
 
  Review requests from sales to provide quick information for processing motor modification quotes and orders through emails and phone calls.
  Develop and improve shop procedures to document current practices and methods, allowing for continuous improvement and uniform implementation, including conducting time studies for accurate capacity calculations.
  Provide technical assistance to PPC, shop, and NP teams as needed.
  Mentor and train sales teams on technical information related to motor modifications.
  Collaborate with product engineers and QA personnel to evaluate potential factory issues.
  Maintain and update all motor modification technical tools to ensure accuracy and reliability for users.
  Conduct training sessions for sales groups and field sales teams on motor modification processes and procedures.
  Support stock inventory conversions via modification processes.
  Source and develop new parts for addition to inventory or special projects.
 
  Essential Skills
 
  Bachelor’s degree from a four-year college or university, or equivalent combination of education and experience.
  Understanding of electric motor mechanical assembly to the component level.
  Ability to comprehend basic to medium complexity level specifications.
  Familiarity with basic industry standards such as NEMA, IEC, IEEE, UL.
  Proficiency in technical writing.
  Capability to read and interpret electrical drawings and nomenclature.
  Proficiency with Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Word, and Outlook.
  Attention to detail, organization, and time management.
  Strong problem-solving, analytical, negotiation, leadership, and communication skills.
  Customer focus and the ability to work well with others.
 
  Additional Skills & Qualifications
 
  Experience with SAP and ability to work with ERP systems.
  Experience with design, mechanical engineering, motors, BOM, drawings, and PLM.
  Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
 
  Work Environment
 The role is 100% onsite in Duluth, providing a personal desk and computer in an office and shop setting. The mod shop is equipped with 7 cranes and a team of 10 people. While there is no frequent travel required, occasional travel to other modification shops may occur with considerable advance notice. The current team includes 6 engineers, 2 operations personnel for the mod shop, gearing, and panels, 1 manufacturing specialist, 1 process engineer, and 1 training specialist.
 
  Pay and Benefits
 The pay range for this position is $80000.00 - $85000.00/yr.
 
  Workplace Type
 This is a fully onsite position in Duluth,GA.
 
  About Actalent
 Actalent is a global leader in engineering and sciences services and talent solutions. We help visionary companies advance their engineering and science initiatives through access to specialized experts who drive scale, innovation and speed to market. With a network of almost 30,000 consultants and more than 4,500 clients across the U.S., Canada, Asia and Europe, Actalent serves many of the Fortune 500.
 The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regard to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.
 If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation, such as the modification or adjustment of the job application process or interviewing due to a disability, please email actalentaccommodation@actalentservices.com for other accommodation options.

title: Project Engineer
description:
PROJECT ENGINEER
 Jonesboro, AR
 
 Camfil Air Pollution Control is an industry leader in providing dust, fume and mist collection equipment. Camfil APC products provide clean air in manufacturing settings making the workplace safer and more productive.
 
 SUMMARY:
 We are seeking a detail-oriented and technically proficient Project Manager to join our team. This role involves supporting our sales representatives, processing in-house projects, project related customer communications, assisting production engineering team, and pricing new equipment. Experience with SolidWorks is highly preferred.
 
 Why Join Us?
 
  Be part of a leading company in the dust collection and ventilation industry.
  Competitive salary and benefits package.
  Opportunities for professional growth and development.
  A supportive and collaborative team environment.
 
 
 ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:
 Sales Support:
 
  Collaborate with sales representatives to understand customer needs and project requirements.
  Review and process customer orders accurately and efficiently.
  Coordinate with internal departments to ensure smooth project execution.
 
  Order Processing:
 
  Manage the flow of in-house projects from initial inquiry through to completion.
  Ensure all orders are processed in a timely manner and meet customer specifications.
  Oversee the documentation and administrative aspects of order processing.
 
  Customer Communication:
 
  Respond to customer inquiries via phone and email, providing timely and accurate information.
  Address any issues or concerns raised by customers, ensuring their satisfaction.
  Maintain strong relationships with customers, acting as the main point of contact for project-related queries.
 
  Production Engineering Assistance:
 
  Collaborate with production engineers to ensure projects are designed and manufactured to meet customer expectations.
  Assist in the creation and review of technical drawings, ensuring all designs are feasible and efficient.
  Provide technical support in troubleshooting and resolving any challenges that arise during production.
 
  Equipment Pricing:
 
  Develop accurate pricing models for new equipment, considering material costs, labor, and overhead.
  Work with the procurement team to ensure competitive pricing while maintaining profitability.
  Provide pricing information to the sales team in a timely manner.
 
  Technical Knowledge:
 
  Utilize your understanding of ventilation systems, particularly dust collection, to inform project decisions.
  Stay current with industry trends and advancements in dust collection and ventilation technologies.
  Ensure all projects meet relevant safety and performance standards.
 
 
 EDUCATION & WORK EXPERIENCE: 
 
  Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, or a related field.
 
 
 QUALIFICATIONS:
 
  3+ years of experience in project management, preferably in a technical or manufacturing environment.
  Experience with dust collection systems, ventilation, or a related industry is highly desirable.
 
 
 SKILLS:
 
  Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
  Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.
  Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.
  SolidWorks experience is preferred.
  Technical knowledge in ventilation systems and dust collection.
  Fluency in Spanish is preferred
 
 
 WORK ENVIRONMENT: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is exposed to office, warehouse, and plant environments. The work environment will require the use of personal protective equipment (PPE) in certain areas. Must be able to access and navigate each department at the organization's facilities.
 
 EEO STATEMENT: We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Jr. Mechanical Engineer
location: 5679 Harrisburg Ind Pk Dr, Harrisburg, NC 28075
description:
ASSA ABLOY Global Solutions is part of the ASSA ABLOY Group, who are the global leader in access solutions. Every day, we reimagine how people move through a safer, more open world with ease. If you’ve ever walked through an automatic door, stayed in a hotel, or gone through passport control, you’ve probably used one of our products or services. We have operations in over 70 countries, with over 52,000 colleagues around the world.
Our expertise in customer journey mapping, innovation, and service design leads to the invention of new solutions that create value for our clients and exceptional experiences for their end users. And we have the fantastic opportunity available in Key and Asset Management for a Junior Mechanical Engineer.
Part of Global Solutions, Key and Asset Management provide intelligent management solutions for keys and equipment.Our key cabinets & locker solutions help all types of organisation’s better control their important assets, improving productivity & accountability, and reducing risk in critical processes.
Your Role in Keeping the Future in Safe Hands…
As the Junior Mechanical Engineer for the Global solutions division of ASSA ABLOY, you will have the opportunity to significantly impact the evolution of our next-generation products, services, and processes and work with a wide range of technologies to drive innovation. You will get to work on a team that keeps growing, innovating, and giving you room to be proactive, creative, and develop unique perspectives on how various services interact with each other.
Reporting to the Electromechanical Engineer, you will be responsible for supporting the mechanical needs of the business by working on mechanical design, mechanical support needs, and mechanical projects.
What you will do…

 Generate detailed engineering drawings and modify existing drawings using a 3D CAD program (Autodesk Inventor).
 Work with a team on the design and development of new products, ensuring they meet customer needs, safety standards, and manufacturing capabilities.
 Maintain and generate build instructions and documentation, including using a 3D CAD program (Autodesk Inventor).
 Facilitate life cycle testing of new products, including design of test fixtures/test jigs, and provide detailed reports of results.
 Assist with maintaining and providing triage for Engineering Change Requests.
 Collaborate with suppliers and vendors to source materials and components for product prototypes and production.
 Provide support to the Quality team with investigations and testing related to design issues.
 Provide support and rapid response for mechanical engineering issues escalated to the team. This will include ‘hands-on’ support, telephone & email support to multiple areas of the business.
 Assist with prototype builds of pre-production products, including production engineering review of new products and major product changes.

What we expect of you…

 Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering/Engineering Technology, Industrial Engineering/Engineering Technology, Electrical Engineering/Engineering Technology, or a related field.
 1-3+ years of experience in product development or engineering.
 Proficient in 3D CAD, preferably Autodesk Inventor.
 Experience with CAD revision control systems, preferably Autodesk Vault Professional.
 Solid understanding of materials, product assembly, and manufacturing processes (sheet metal fabrication, extrusions, casting, molding, machining).
 Excellent problem-solving skills with a detail-oriented mindset.
 Strong communication and collaboration skills, with experience working in cross-functional teams.
 Experience working using Agile methodologies.
 Ability to work both autonomously and as part of a team
 Fluent in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc.)
 Experience with Autodesk Inventor and Vault
 Experience with Atlassian Confluence / Jira
 Ability to read and interpret complex electro/mechanical technical drawings.

Helpful Additional Skills…

 Experience with FEA (Finite Element Analysis), DFM (Design for Manufacturing), and FMEA (Failure Mode and Effects Analysis) is highly desirable.

What you can expect from us…
· 11 paid holidays + 15 paid vacation days
· Company 401k match program (4.5%)
· Annual Bonus Plan
· Health, Dental, Vision, Life, & ADD Insurance
· Access to online benefits portal & ASSA ABLOY brand discounts
· High performance laptop
· Smart/Casual dress code
Application
You can submit your application by clicking ‘Apply Now’. We will not consider application received via e-mail or through other channels. We will review applications continuously, so please apply as soon as possible.
About Us
Featuring four times in Forbes’ most innovative companies worldwide, we deliver innovative, safe, and convenient security solutions that provide real added value to our customers. As a group, our goal is to everyday help billions of people experience a more open world. We’re proud to boast leading positions across the majority of Europe, North and South America, Asia, and Oceania, offering products and services to our customers seeking solutions to their entrance and opening requirements, such as locks, doors and entrance automation.

title: Engineer-in-Training - Full Time (Entry Level)
description:
Engineer-in-Training – Full Time (Entry Level)
Milano & Grunloh Engineers, LLC is a fast-paced, growing engineering firm located in Effingham, Illinois. We have been in business since 1979 and currently have 25+ employees. Our clientele tends to be within a 90-mile radius of Effingham, allowing you to work close to home every day and giving you the opportunity to make an impact on local communities.
This position has the following responsibilities:

 Plan, design, and manage a variety of civil engineering projects


 Organize and perform projects from inception to completion


 Preparation of plans using Civil 3D software including streets, sewers, and utilities


 Preparation of details, specifications, and bidding documents


 Preparation of regulatory permits for projects


 Complete project administration for municipal projects including attending client meetings


 Attend council/board meetings


 Strong communication skills for working with clients regarding current and future projects

A successful candidate will have:

 Graduated from an accredited college or university with a BS in Civil Engineering


 Passed F.E exam and is planning to take the P.E. exam within 3-5 years


 Prefer prior experience in site/civil land development industry including permitting, design, and construction of land development projects


 Working knowledge of Civil 3D/AutoCAD software


 Knowledge of Illinois Department of Transportation specifications, policies, and procedures


 Ability to effectively manage clients


 Strong team player that can manage and contribute to several projects simultaneously

Compensation:

 Commensurate on experience


 Employer paid health insurance coverage for eligible full time employees


 Employer paid dental/vision insurance coverage for eligible full time employees


 Employer paid basic life insurance coverage for eligible full time employees


 Seven paid holidays after 90-day probationary period; including 3 hours paid time the afternoon before a holiday


 Paid personal leave hours beginning with four hours per month after 90-day probationary period, and increasing at one full year of employment and increasing again after ten full years of employment


 SIMPLE Retirement Plan for eligible full time employees upon meeting two year salary requirements, company match up to 3%


 Use of company vehicle for employees with Profession licensure after 90-day probationary period. Includes personal use during off-work hours

title: Process Engineer
description:
Full-Time 
York, Pennsylvania 
07/05/2025 
Compensation: 55000.-60000. / Annually 
Benefit Offered: YES 

 Our client, a precision metals manufacturer, has an immediate need for an experienced Process Engineer, to join their winning team in York. 

 Our candidate of choice will support plant projects and activities, driving improvement to processes within the entire plant and serve as a subject expert on local and corporate databases and ERP systems along with supporting LEAN initiatives for entire facility, including Continuous Improvement. 

 KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
 Coordinates with Operations Manager, Production Manager, and Quality Administrators for Continuous Improvement Activities. Engineer, Requisition and /or manufacture materials, parts, or supplies to support new or improvements to operational processes, equipment, or tooling. 
Maintain accurate plant layout in Auto CAD 
Maintain accurate documentation control in local and corporate databases, including QMS documentation control, related to manufacturing processes and instructions. 
Act as the project manager for all new part number creation, development and production release (including new tool builds and tool transfers) by leading the APQP process entirely. 
Maintain customer prints, specifications and cross reference database. 
Support industry surveys and controls (ref RoHS, MSPCA, Conflict Minerals). 
Driving LEAN initiatives in the plant through all departments (6 Sigma, LEAN, etc…). 
Lead data accuracy requirements in corporate ERP system (currently EPICOR). Including driving improved / increased modules activity usage (Min / Max, rates/ efficiencies, etc…). 
Develop and maintain system costing standards. 
Support customer initiatives on productivity improvements and cost reduction activities, including cost review initiatives. 
Act as backup for manufacturing cost quotes and proposals. 
Leads the Continuous Improvement, RFQ and other committees and teams. 

 KEY REQUIREMENTS:
 Must be able to perform all duties and meet requirements with or without accommodation. 
Associate’s degree; or two years combination of related education. Preferably in Industrial Engineering. Other acceptable areas of study include Mechanical and Manufacturing Engineering. 
Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations. 
Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals. 
Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public. 
Ability to work with mathematical concepts such as probability and statistical inference, and fundamentals of plane and solid geometry and trigonometry. Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations. 
Able to work independently with minimal direct supervision on assigned tasks, projects and activities. 
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables. 
Strong working knowledge of personal computers and software (Windows, Access, Word, and Excel). 
Must be able to successfully complete all training requirements as listed on training matrix for this position. 

 WE OFFER:
 100% premium coverage for medical, dental and vision coverage including family 
Generous blue cross coverage with low deductible ($400 individual, $800 family) 
2 weeks PTO after 90 days on boarding 
401K w Company match 

 Please apply today to be immediately considered for the role!

With a deep understanding of today’s hiring trends and technologies we have the ability to leverage the most effective recruiting methods to find the best candidates across numerous markets and industries and place them into the appropriate position successfully. Please allow us to help you find your dream job today! 

 Apply Now

title: Mechanical Engineer
description:
The position of the Operations Engineering will be a member of the Engineering Team and responsible for acting as the liaison for the engineering team and collaborating with internal and offshore teams, managing and owning bill of material and record management, and troubleshooting issues related to quality, warranty, aftermarket, and field support. This position will also have forklift testing, troubleshooting, and repair responsibilities at the headquarters and engineering R&D site in Deforest WI.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the following satisfactorily; other duties may be assigned.
· Partner with sales and manufacturing teams to configure new lift truck orders and ensure proper communication with cross-functional teams to successfully complete customer orders
· Ensure truck model configurations are set up and reviewed for accuracy and in a timely manner
· Partner with procurement and supply chain departments to complete part substitutions and deviation projects
· Manage truck BOMs (Bill of Material), engineering change notes, and records management with limited guidance
· Independently troubleshoot manufacturing issues, not limited to quality, warranty, aftermarket, and field-support
· Support new R&D site and equipment setup and organization
· Act as department liaison with onsite and offshore team members
Experience or Education: 
· Bachelor’s Degree in Industrial Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Engineering Mechanics, Engineering Physics, or other technical fields
· 1+ years of hands-on mechanical or electrical experience, ideally in a manufacturing setting
· 1+ Li-ion battery and charger experience
· 1+ years with lift trucks or off-highway equipment preferred
· Foundational awareness of ANSI B56.1 standards
· Experiencing using ERP systems (Plex preferred)
· CAD/3D modeling & drawings (SOLIDWORKS)

 8 hour shift

title: Process Engineer
description:

As a Process Engineer , you will be part of the production department supporting innovative product development. The ideal candidate will have strong mechanical aptitude, excellent problem-solving skills, and a desire to excel in a team-based environment, which will align successfully with the organization.

title: Reliability Engineer
description:
Now hiring! Reliability Engineer
  
  
  
   
 Seneca, SC (Onsite)
   
   
 We are looking for a Reliability Engineer to join our team in Seneca, SC.
   
   
 Come create chemistry with us!
   
   
 BASF’s Catalysts division is the global market leader in catalyst technologies. The division develops and produces mobile emissions catalysts as well as process catalysts and offers precious metals trading, recycling and related products and services.
   
   
 As a Reliability Engineer you will lead the Reliability Centered Maintenance (RCM) program for the Seneca site. You will apply the appropriate reliability tools and techniques (e.g., Bad Actor Program, FMEA, RCFA, RBI, RCA, etc.) to drive improvements, optimize costs, and improve asset effectiveness.
  
 
 
  
    As a Reliability Engineer, you create chemistry by...
  
  
  
   

   
    Work with Maintenance & Reliability (M&R) Experts to maintain and drive progress along the site M&R Roadmap.
    Develop and maintain Preventive Maintenance (PM), Predictive Maintenance (PdM), Asset Integrity (AI), Structural Integrity, and Corrosion Assessment programs; coordinate Risk-Based Inspections (RBI) and replacement of relief valves and flexible hoses.
    Develop and maintain the Critical Equipment List and Critical Spares Inventory; collaborate with site Engineers on Equipment Care Strategies (ECS).
    Lead the Bad Actor Program by reviewing work orders, analyzing Asset Effectiveness (AE) data, and implementing action plans to improve equipment reliability.
    Lead Root Cause Failure Analyses (RCFA) for complex or recurring equipment issues.
    Lead the Precision and Preventative Maintenance Program, including vibration analysis, laser alignment, balancing, thermal imaging, and ultrasonic inspections; improve existing programs and implement new ones.
    Participate in site Hazard Assessments (BHA) as the reliability expert and coordinate with off-site experts to resolve material of construction and chemical compatibility issues.
   
  
 
 
  
    If you...
  
  
  
   

   
    Have a Bachelor of Science degree in Mechanical, Chemical, or Industrial Engineering with over five years of experience as a Maintenance or Reliability Engineer in a chemical manufacturing environment.
    Demonstrate experience with formal reliability programs such as RCM, including developing, reviewing, and implementing strategic preventive and predictive maintenance procedures.
    Have thorough knowledge of mechanical equipment design and a strong understanding of maintenance and reliability practices for process equipment such as pumps, piping, pressure vessels, storage tanks, relief devices, compressors, and boilers.
    Be familiar with technical engineering standards, including pipe specifications, and be able to read and interpret P&IDs, engineering drawings, and vendor documentation.
    Possess excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, and demonstrate proficiency in SAP and Microsoft Office applications.
    Be capable of performing physical tasks, including repeated lifting and transferring of 50 lb sacks.
   
  
 
 
  
    Create your own chemistry with you@BASF
  
  
  
   
 At BASF, you will have the chance to do meaningful work towards building a more sustainable future. In addition to competitive compensation and benefits, BASF provides you with access to a wide range of elements to help you be your best. It’s what we call you@BASF. We are committed to providing benefits, programs, and opportunities that support our employees’ overall well-being, personal growth, and a safe, collaborative, and inclusive work environment.
   Just some of the many benefits we offer include:
   
    Flexible work arrangements whenever possible
    Highly competitive retirement savings plan with company match and investment options
    Well-being programs that include comprehensive mental health support for you and your household family members
    Family forming benefits (fertility, adoption and surrogacy reimbursement, maternity/parental leave, and more)
    Back-up child and elder care with discount programs for families of all ages and stages
    Mentoring and career development opportunities that allow you to share, learn, and thrive
    Matching gifts program that allows you to deepen the impact of your contributions to qualified charities.
    Employee crisis support for when the unexpected happens
    Access to our BASF wine cellar, employee discounts, and much more!
   
  
 
 
  
    About us
  
  
  
   
 As one of the largest chemical companies in North America we have been finding solutions for your everyday needs and addressing the most complex economic, environmental, and sustainability challenges for more than 150 years!
   At BASF we empower our employees with the tools, guidance and opportunities they need to advance and succeed in work and life. Giving you the support you need to be your best and fulfill your personal ambitions is what helps us create chemistry. After all, our success is linked to yours. Whatever path you envision, BASF is a great place to build a rewarding, successful career.
   Belong to Something Bigger. #belongatBASF
  
 
 
  
    Privacy statement
  
  
  
   
 BASF takes security & data privacy very seriously. We will never request financial information of any kind via email, private text message or direct message on any social medial platform or job board. Furthermore, we will never send a candidate a check for equipment or request any type of payment during the job application process. If you have experienced any of the above, please contact myhr@basf.com to report fraud.
  
 
 
  
    Equal employment opportunities
  
  
  
   
 We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, citizenship, color, religion, sex, marital status, national origin, disability status, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
   Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis.

title: Junior Process Engineer Technician
description:
Our client is currently seeking a Junior Process Engineer Technician to join their team in Camarillo, CA. This position will support both process and product development initiatives through a combination of computer-based tasks and hands-on responsibilities. The ideal candidate will assist with developing, prototyping, and implementing new or enhanced manufacturing processes aimed at improving efficiency, quality, and output. This is an excellent opportunity to join an innovative team and grow within a dynamic manufacturing environment.
The Day-to-Day:

 Generate comprehensive process documentation, testing procedures, and manufacturing protocols.
 Conduct design of experiments (D.O.E) to improve process capability and repeatability.
 Prepare and present data reports, summarize findings, and recommend technical solutions.
 Understand and analyze product/process flows and equipment requirements.
 Identify and troubleshoot factors impacting process performance.
 Perform hands-on experiments and operate manufacturing equipment.
 Create process controls and train personnel in their use.
 Monitor and evaluate ongoing process performance.
 Generate technical reports and communicate findings to cross-functional teams.
 Collaborate with quality teams and assist with MRB disposition.
 Utilize 2D and 3D CAD tools for design work involving CNC, laser machining, circuit boards, and silk-screen artwork.
 Apply SolidWorks and AutoCAD Fusion in support of 3D printing and rapid prototyping projects.
 Use programming languages such as Python and GCODE for CNC machining applications.

Qualifications:

 High School diploma or equivalent is required.
 Associate’s Degree in Engineering Technology, Manufacturing Technology, or related field is required.
 Bachelor’s Degree in a science or engineering discipline (e.g., Ceramics, Materials, Chemical Engineering) is preferred.
 Bilingual in Spanish is preferred.
 At least 1 year of experience working in a manufacturing environment.
 Minimum of 2 years of experience with SolidWorks and AutoCAD.
 Familiarity with CNC programming and 3D printing (filament and resin).
 Proficiency with Microsoft Office 365 (Outlook, Excel, Word, Teams, Project, PowerPoint) and Adobe Acrobat.
 Strong aptitude for diagnosing, maintaining, and repairing mechanical systems.
 Demonstrated success supporting medium- to high-volume manufacturing and improving yield and quality through new product introduction and scale-up.

Pay Rate:

 $23.00 to $28.00 /hr

Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $23.00 - $28.00 per hour
Benefits:

 Health insurance

Work Location: In person

title: Application Engineer I
description:
***Consideration given to applicants residing within a commutable distance from York, PA or must be willing to relocate***
 
 Build your best future with the Johnson Controls team! 
 
 Who We Are: 
 
 As a global leader in smart, healthy and sustainable buildings, our mission is to reimagine the performance of buildings to serve people, places and the planet. Join a winning team that enables you to build your best future! Our teams are uniquely positioned to support a multitude of industries across the globe. You will have the opportunity to develop yourself through significant work projects and learning opportunities. We strive to provide our employees with an experience, focused on supporting their physical, financial, and emotional wellbeing. Become a member of the Johnson Controls family and thrive in an empowering company culture where your voice and ideas will be heard - your next great opportunity is just a few clicks away! 
 
 What We Offer: 

 
  Competitive salary
  Paid vacation/holidays/sick time
  Comprehensive benefits package including 401K, medical, dental, and vision care - available day one!
  On the job/cross training opportunities
  Encouraging and collaborative team environment
  Dedication to safety through our Zero Harm policy
 
 
 
 What You Will Do: 
 
 The Air Handling Unit Application Engineer performs a full range of field commercial and technical support functions including assignments requiring special qualifications/attainments. This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship. 
 
 How You Will Do It! 

 
  Provide commercial, competitive and technical application support to the field sales organization on all aspects of Custom and Standard Air Handling Units with minimal direction.
  Works with a small team of technical employees to provide articulate resolutions to the field selling organization requests for AHU project support with a strong emphasis on Basis if Design.
  Provide application training and project management, as required, on Air Handling Systems for the field sales organization.
  Support Customer Visits (factory tours) as necessary.
  Participate in testing of AHU selection and pricing software.
  Work with the Field Sales organization, manufacturing, engineering, and Customer Service to resolve Air Handling Unit order issues.
  Work with engineering to develop cost effective resolutions to unique Air Handling Unit applications.
  Assist Airside Technical Service with field application issues as necessary.
  Develop technical documents to support field sales on various areas of air handling application as necessary.
  Work with marketing to develop selection and pricing software requirements as necessary.
  Determine best techniques/procedures/theories and apply them to analysis, design and/or research of air handling products.
  Use complex problem-solving techniques requiring regular use of ingenuity and creativity.
  Recommend cost savings and value engineering alternatives for Air Handling Units and systems.
  Provide technical direction for other engineers, drafters or technicians on specific work assignments.
  Be proficient at preparing, checking, and coordinating the release of documentation to support Custom and Standard Air Handling products.
  Be proficient and extrapolating ideas into product requirements and apply the philosophy of concurrent engineering with manufacturing process.
  Conduct feasibility studies and systems analysis for new applications as necessary.
  Strive for continuous improvement and teamwork in product development and processes.
 
 
 
 What We Look For: 
 
 Required

 
  BS degree in Engineering (ABET accredited) or related science.
  Minimum of 2 year of experience in HVAC, construction or related field (i.e plumbing).
  Customer Service experience.
  Well versed in Microsoft Suite Applications (Word, Excel, Access, and PowerPoint) as well as Internet software and E-mail.
  Understanding of business principles for the business unit.
  
 Preferred

 
  Experience with providing technical sales support.
 
 
 #EarlyCareers
 
 #TechnicalSupport
 
 #CustomerService

title: Data Center Technical Operations Engineer I
description:

 The Data Center Technical Operations Engineer Facility will be responsible for Data Center Engineering Operations within an Amazon Data Center including risk management and mitigation corrective and preventative maintenance of critical infrastructure vendor management and metric reporting.

title: Entry Level Manufacturing Engineer
description:
Job Title: Manufacturing Engineer
 
 Job Description
 We are seeking a dedicated Manufacturing Engineer to join our Aluminum Machining Department. This role involves leading, creating, and implementing innovative technical solutions in mass production, business planning, and new model development to meet or exceed targets in safety, environment, quality, delivery, and cost.
 
  Responsibilities
 
  Effectively communicate with all levels of the organization to ensure common understanding and direction.
  Review and analyze daily reports to identify safety, quality, and delivery gaps, and develop potential countermeasures or root cause analysis opportunities for continuous improvement.
  Utilize data analysis and the PDCA cycle to lead, support, develop, and justify solutions with related groups and departments to solve complex problems.
  Monitor and manage equipment and processes to ensure optimal manufacturing performance and function while minimizing operating expenses.
  Develop self, colleagues, and team capabilities through training, mentoring, and sharing technical expertise and understanding.
  Establish priorities and make decisions based on data analytics to effectively accomplish business objectives.
  Manage project implementation, including schedule, budget, and resource allocations, to ensure successful completion and target achievement.
  Test, evaluate, and implement new and innovative technologies to improve overall equipment and process efficiency.
  Develop and manage investment and expense budgets to achieve overall cost targets.
 
  Essential Skills
 
  Bachelor's Degree in Engineering or equivalent experience in Engineering Manufacturing or Automation.
  2-5 years of experience in Manufacturing Engineering.
  Proficiency in PLC automation, process improvement, continuous improvement, and project management.
  Familiarity with manufacturing engineering, process engineering, lean manufacturing, and CNC programming.
 
  Additional Skills & Qualifications
 
  Bachelor's or Associate's degree in Engineering or Engineering Technology with a focus on Mechanical, Manufacturing, Industrial, or Electrical disciplines.
  If no degree, at least 6 years of relevant experience is required.
  Computer literacy to support industry-standard software applications.
  Positive attitude, open-mindedness, and team-player mentality.
  Strong self-motivation and desire to work in a manufacturing environment.
  Demonstrates leadership capabilities and strong communication skills (verbal and written).
 
  Work Environment
 The role is situated within a steel manufacturing environment, requiring 50% desk work and 50% presence on the plant floor, focusing on heavy equipment. The position offers a contract-to-hire opportunity with benefits such as 5 PTO days upfront, holiday pay, and shutdown pay if the team is not working.
 
  Pay and Benefits
 The pay range for this position is $34.00 - $36.00/hr.
 Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job
 classification and length of employment. Benefits are subject to change and may be
 subject to specific elections, plan, or program terms. If eligible, the benefits
 available for this temporary role may include the following:
 
  Medical, dental & vision
  Critical Illness, Accident, and Hospital
  401(k) Retirement Plan – Pre-tax and Roth post-tax contributions available
  Life Insurance (Voluntary Life & AD&D for the employee and dependents)
  Short and long-term disability
  Health Spending Account (HSA)
  Transportation benefits
  Employee Assistance Program
  Time Off/Leave (PTO, Vacation or Sick Leave)
 
 
  Workplace Type
 This is a fully onsite position in Anna,OH.
 
  Application Deadline
 This position is anticipated to close on Jul 29, 2025.
 
  About Actalent
 Actalent is a global leader in engineering and sciences services and talent solutions. We help visionary companies advance their engineering and science initiatives through access to specialized experts who drive scale, innovation and speed to market. With a network of almost 30,000 consultants and more than 4,500 clients across the U.S., Canada, Asia and Europe, Actalent serves many of the Fortune 500.
 The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regard to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.
 If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation, such as the modification or adjustment of the job application process or interviewing due to a disability, please email actalentaccommodation@actalentservices.com for other accommodation options.

title: Entry level - Controls Engineer
description:
#RTASATNY
Title : Entry Level Controls Engineer
Locations : Schaumburg, IL
Duration : Fulltime – Direct hire
Pay Range : $70,000 to $80,000/yearly + benefits
Notes:

 Required skills: Controls, PLC experience, and AutoCAD.
 Extensive work experience isn't necessary; recent engineering graduates often have relevant project experience from school.
 Siemens experience is a plus.
 Candidate must live within a commutable distance to Schaumburg, IL. Travel will increase as workload grows.
 Target compensation is $75–80K. For highly qualified candidates with more experience, up to $85K is acceptable.
 This is a backfill for a position filled in January 2024. A previously successful profile can be used as a template.

Job Overview
Day-to-Day Tasks:

 Communicate and report to Project Managers.
 Controls Engineering responsibilities may include:
 Designing concepts, drawing/design packages, implementation lists, control strategies, functional specifications, sequence of operations, HMI/PLC programs, and related tasks.
 Debugging HMI/PLC programs and database systems.
 On-site audits, field surveys, system implementation, commissioning, and startup support.
 Collaborate with engineering teams.
 Participate in training on current and emerging technical applications.
 Research advanced control technologies for new or existing projects.

Requirements:

 Bachelor's Degree in Engineering or a technical field (preferred).
 Experience in Controls Engineering.
 Knowledge of electrical principles, control systems, P&IDs, electrical/pneumatic drawings, and related documents.
 Proficient with PLCs (especially Allen-Bradley); familiarity with others is beneficial.
 Proficient in HMI tools like Wonderware and RS View.
 Strong leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
 Willingness and ability to travel as needed.

Career Path:

 Promotion to Senior Controls Engineer is the next step.
 Advancement criteria:
 a. Strong performance in the current role.
 b. Ability to conceptualize, design, and implement full control systems.
 c. Technical consulting with team members and clients.
 d. Leadership in managing and directing project teams.

title: Flight Test Instrumentation Specialist
description:
Are you passionate about data, precision, and aviation innovation? Do strain gauges, telemetry systems, and high-stakes testing get your heart racing? We’re on the hunt for a Flight Test Instrumentation (FTI) Specialist who thrives in hands-on environments and is excited to work on cutting-edge, experimental aircraft.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Install, calibrate, maintain, and troubleshoot custom instrumentation systems for experimental aircraft with meticulous attention to detail.
Collaborate closely with FTI engineers to develop advanced data acquisition setups, from sensor selection to integration, supporting key certification efforts.
Conduct rigorous pre- and post-test system checks and calibrations to ensure flawless data capture.
Assist with post-flight data processing and help drive proactive risk assessment and mitigation.
What You Bring:
Bachelor’s in Engineering + 8 years of experience, or Master’s + 6 years.
Minimum 5 years of hands-on flight test instrumentation experience in the aerospace sector.
Deep technical expertise in complex aircraft systems and configuration management.
Proven skills in installing and calibrating various flight test sensors, including strain gauges, accelerometers, thermocouples, and VDTs.
Strong proficiency in building connector assemblies, wiring harnesses, and managing airborne telemetry systems.
Experience instrumenting full aircraft systems from the ground up, including involvement in certification processes.
Bonus: Familiarity with battery-powered aircraft, unmanned systems, or autonomy technologies.
Extra Bonus: Experience with Safran XMA tools and working with regulatory bodies (FAA, TCCA, EASA).
You Are Someone Who:
Excels in fast-paced, high-pressure environments.
Enjoys solving tough challenges through innovative hardware and data-driven solutions.
If you're ready to push the boundaries of what's possible in the sky, we'd love to have you onboard. Let's build the future — together.
Job Type: Contract
Experience:

 flight test instrumentation: 8 years (Preferred)
 aerospace: 8 years (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Field Engineer I - Minneapolis, MN
description:
The Opportunity
 
 
 QuidelOrtho unites the strengths of Quidel Corporation and Ortho Clinical Diagnostics, creating a world-leading in vitro diagnostics company with award-winning expertise in immunoassay and molecular testing, clinical chemistry and transfusion medicine. We are more than 6,000 strong and do business in over 130 countries, providing answers with fast, accurate and consistent testing where and when they are needed most – home to hospital, lab to clinic.
 
 Our culture puts our team members first and prioritizes actions that support happiness, inspiration and engagement. We strive to build meaningful connections with each other as we believe that employee happiness and business success are linked. Join us in our mission to transform the power of diagnostics into a healthier future for all.
 
 The Role 
 As we continue to grow as QuidelOrtho, we are seeking a Field Engineer I in Minneapolis, MN. This is a field based position that offers a company car, gas card, cell phone and laptop, and all vehicle maintenance will be covered by QuidelOrtho. This field based position covers customers throughout Minneapolis, MN.
 
 
  
   
    
     
      The Responsibilities 
      
       We are seeking a qualified individual who has experience installing, operating, maintaining, repairing, and modifying electromechanical equipment, preferably in the field. Troubleshoot technical problems and systems issues.
       Determine technical solution in accordance with product and customer specifications and recommends actions to company or customer representatives for coordinative product solution.
       Conducts technical analysis of product implementations, modifications, and enhancements to product in accordance with specific customer specifications and implementations.
       This position will also require the individual to assess Customer needs and recommends solutions in accordance with product specifications and Customer Specifications.
       Conducts technical training and product briefing with customers, vendors and company representatives as needed. Act as local on-site representative to customer's organization. Manage all territory responsibilities including Preventive Maintenance & upgrades including software & hardware. This position requires the individual to provide service support in the hospital/clinic laboratory environment.
       Responsible for individual parts management, online training, and administrative expense reporting.
       Perform other work-related duties as assigned.
      
      
      The Individual 
      Candidates should be aware that the Company currently requires customer-facing workers to meet Customer Credentialing requirements which may include but are not limited to, up to date immunizations. The Company is an equal opportunity employer and will provide reasonable accommodation to those unable to be vaccinated where it is not an undue hardship to the company to do so as provided under federal, state, and local law. 
      
      Required: 
      
       Education : Minimum of an Associate's degree in Electronics or Electrical/Mechanical Engineering, or equivalent 4 years of military or field service experience required.
       Experience : Minimum 4 years e xperience installing, operating, maintaining, repairing, and modifying electromechanical equipment, preferably in the field, required.
       A team player that is self-motivated & interacts appropriately with peers, sales counterparts, and customers is required.
       The ability to organize and express ideas clearly, verbal and written, in individual or group situations.
       Possess appropriate technical knowledge and have the ability to utilize that knowledge to effectively perform required job functions with an effective level of competence demonstrating a high degree of knowledge in electro-mechanical, chemistry, computer and/or other related disciplines.
       Ability to effectively manage assigned workload within allotted time constraints.
       Must have the ability to lift 75 lbs.
       A valid driver's license is always required.
       Extended hours may be required
       Travel : Ability to travel overnight 50-75% to Rochester, NY, in the first few months of training. Post-training must be able to travel up to 75% around territory, with occasional overnight travel (1-2 nights per week).
       This position is not currently eligible for visa sponsorship.
      
      
      Preferred: 
      
       Experience within Healthcare or Medical Device industry
      
      
      The Key Working Relationships 
      Internal Partners: 
      
       Field Service: Field Engineer, Senior Field Engineers, Area Service Engineers, Regional Service Managers, Area Service Directors
       Sales: Area Sales Directors, Account Managers, Strategic Account Executives, Business Development Managers, Channel Sales Managers
       Technical Specialists, Field Application Specialists, Area Technical Specialists, Technical Support Specialists
       Interacts with other aspects of the organization as required (e.g., Finance, HR, IT, Customer Service, etc.)
      
      
      External Partners: 
      
       Customers including but not limited to Laboratory Managers, Supervisors.
      
      
      The Work Environment 
      T yp ical work hours with overtime required in a ou tside field engineer env i ronm ent. Mu st m a in tain a v al i d dr iv er’s licen s e a n d mus t o wn and m ai n tain an a u t omob ile su i tab l e fo r tr av el to c u s tome r sit e s, air por t, e tc.       The Physical Demands 
      Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus. While performing the duties of this job, regularly required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel and talk or hear. Frequently required to stand, walk, bend, twist, reach and sit. Occasionally required to reach, kneel, squat, or balance. Mu st b e p hy sica ll y ab l e t o t rav e l up to 75 %. Tr av el in cl ud es ai rp la n e, t r ai n , a u t omob il e , and ov ern igh ts. Must be able to lift up to 75 pounds.
      
      Salary Transparency 
      The salary range for this position takes into account a wide range of factors including education, experience, knowledge, skills, geography, and abilities of the candidate, in addition to internal equity and alignment with market data. At QuidelOrtho, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on that facts and circumstances of each case. The salary range for this position is $65,000 to $85,000 and is bonus eligible. QuidelOrtho offers a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance, along with a 401(k) plan, employee assistance program, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, paid time off (including sick time) and paid Holidays. All benefits are non-contractual, and QuidelOrtho may amend, terminate, or enhance the benefits provided, as it deems appropriate.
      
      Equal Opportunity 
      QuidelOrtho believes in Equal Opportunity for all and is committed to ensuring all individuals, including individuals with disabilities, have an opportunity to apply for those positions that they are interested in and qualify for without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, veteran status, disability, genetic information, or any other protected characteristic. QuidelOrtho is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals so that an individual can perform the duties. If you are interested in applying for an employment opportunity and require special assistance or an accommodation to apply due to a disability, please contact us at recruiting@quidelortho.com

title: Lab Assistant
description:

Job Summary: 
We are seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented Lab Assistant to join our team in an indoor grow operation. The successful candidate will be responsible for maintaining the fertigation rooms, gathering plant metrics, and assisting the lab director with various duties. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of plant science, chemistry, and biology, as well as experience in a laboratory setting.
Essential Job Functions: 

 Maintain fertigation for indoor grow operation
 Gather plant metrics to monitor optimal growth
 Mix nutrients for plant watering and fulfill nutrient mix orders
 Conduct plant tissue culture
 Assist lab director with lab duties
 Conduct grow room walk-throughs to collect plant metrics, identify growth issues, and troubleshoot equipment failures
 Utilize scientific literature to prepare and improve SOPs
 Maintain inventory and organize warehouse stock of raw materials
 Take daily and weekly readings; data entry of daily and weekly readings
 Organize and store all chemical substances, fluids, and compressed gases according to safety instructions
 Handle potentially dangerous substances, pesticides, bleach, and chemical reagents
 Organize and be responsible for garage salt inventory
 Maintain supplies and chemical inventory; create purchase orders as needed
 Operate various types of equipment such as pH meters, balances
 Independently follow SOPs, verbal and written instructions, and established protocols
 Work indoors in a state-of-the-art, climate-controlled, clean indoor cultivation environment
 Play a crucial role in all stages of plant cultivation
 Engage in data collection to continually improve product
 Maintain quality control measures to keep plants healthy and happy
 Conduct farm hygiene management to keep plants healthy and happy
 Troubleshoot equipment issues

 Basic understanding of plant science/horticulture or biology

 At least 1 year of lab experience
 Experience in plant tissue culture is a plus

 Integrity and respect toward others
 Ability to preserve the confidentiality of information

 Ability to work weekends/holidays on an occasional basis
 Ability to work extended days on an occasional basis

 Ability to work within strict time frames and resolute deadlines

 Buffer preparation experience

 Department runs all hours and holidays; may be asked to work holidays and some weekends as needed; may need to stay late to cover emergencies on site

We Offer:

 Professional development and growth opportunities
 Collaborative and supportive work environment

title: Donor Data Specialist
description:
[{"description":"Food Bank of the Southern Tier Seeks a Donor Data Specialist!
Make Every Gift Count!
Food Bank of the Southern Tier Elmira, NY | On-site | $21.00–$24.00/hour Full-time | Non-exempt
Are you passionate about making a difference and skilled at keeping data accurate and organized?
Join the Food Bank of the Southern Tier as a Donor Data Specialist and help us create hunger-free communities! Based in Elmira, NY, you’ll support our $6M+ annual fundraising efforts by ensuring donor records are accurate, gift transactions are processed efficiently, and data-driven processes run smoothly.
As the Donor Data Specialist, you will serve as the primary data steward for the fundraising team, maintaining the accuracy, integrity, and completeness of donor records, gift transactions, and development-related data, contributing to an exceptional donor experience.
If you’re passionate about data, excel at detail-oriented tasks, bring proactive problem-solving to a collaborative team, and are eager to contribute to a cause that matters, we want to hear from you!
What You’ll Do
· Process 50–300 daily gift transactions (checks, credit cards, pledges, and more) with precision, keeping our fundraising engine humming, especially during the busy Q4 season.
· Maintain and update donor records in Raiser’s Edge NXT, ensuring clean data to support donor stewardship and fundraising success.
· Coordinate with internal teams to reconcile financial reports and maintain organized records for audits, keeping everything transparent and efficient.
· Support donor engagement by ensuring timely gift acknowledgments and providing regular updates to our Annual Fund Manager.
· Train staff on database best practices and pitch in with administrative tasks to keep our Development & Community Engagement Department thriving.
Who You Are
· You have a high school diploma (specialized training in donor databases like Raiser’s Edge NXT preferred) and 3–5 years of experience in data entry, nonprofit fundraising, or administrative roles.
· You’re detail-oriented, with strong Excel skills and a knack for managing multiple priorities, even during high-volume periods.
· You’re a team player with great communication skills, comfortable handling sensitive donor information with confidentiality.
· Experience in nonprofits or food banking is a plus, as is familiarity with direct mail or major gifts.
What You’ll Receive
At FBST, we prioritize work-life balance and foster a supportive, mission-driven culture. We offer a robust benefits package, including:
· Meaningful Impact: Help end hunger across the Southern Tier with a mission-driven organization.
· Competitive Pay: $21.00 - $24.00 per hour, based on experience.
· Stable schedule: Monday–Thursday, 8:00 AM–4:00 PM; Friday, 8:00 AM–1:00 PM.
· Time Off: 10 days of PTO to start, increasing to 15 days after the first year, plus 13-15 paid holidays.
· Insurance: Medical, dental, and vision coverage, life, short-term & long-term disability.
· Retirement Savings: 403(b) plan with pension contribution.
· Additional Benefits: Flexible Spending Account, Health Savings Account, Supplemental Insurances, Legal & Identity Shield Programs, Employee Assistance Program, and discounts through "My Better Benefits."
Job Summary
The Donor Data Specialist is responsible for maintaining the accuracy, integrity, and completeness of donor records, gift transactions, and development-related data within the organization’s constituent management system. Serving as the primary data steward for the fundraising team, this role ensures consistent and timely entry, coding, and documentation of contributions in support of an annual fundraising goal exceeding $6 million.
The Specialist collaborates with the Development & Community Engagement, Business Services, and Catholic Charities Finance Departments to ensure fundraising transactions are accurately recorded, reconciled, and aligned across donor databases and reporting systems. While standard operating procedures (SOPs) guide much of the workflow, the Specialist regularly applies independent judgment to resolve data discrepancies, research incomplete or unclear information, and uphold compliance with internal standards and external reporting requirements.
This position plays a key role in managing data integrity during peak periods such as fourth quarter, campaigns, matching gift drives, and peer-to-peer fundraising events when accuracy, adaptability, and attention to detail are critical. The Specialist also supports appeal tracking, acknowledgment processes, and cross-departmental reconciliation to advance the organization’s donor stewardship and fundraising success.
In this role, you will focus on the following key areas:
· Gift Processing & Data Entry
· Database Management & Integrity
· Financial Reconciliation & Reporting
· Donor Stewardship & Engagement
· Training & Administrative Support
Qualifications
· High school diploma or equivalent required; Associate’s or Bachelor’s degree preferred.
· 3+ years of experience in donor data entry, fundraising operations, finance, or related administrative/data management roles.
· Proficiency with Raiser’s Edge NXT (or similar donor CRM systems); experience with third-party fundraising platforms is a plus.
· Strong skills in Microsoft Excel, including formulas and reporting functions.
· Excellent attention to detail and commitment to data accuracy and integrity.
· Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment, especially during peak fundraising seasons.
· Strong organizational and problem-solving abilities.
· Effective communication and collaboration skills with cross-functional teams.
· Commitment to maintaining donor confidentiality and data privacy standards.
· Familiarity with basic accounting practices is a plus.
· Experience in a nonprofit or food banking environment is a plus.
Ready to Make an Impact? · Visit www.foodbankst.org to learn more about our work. · The full job description is available on our Careers page at foodbankst.org/careers. Apply today with your resume and cover letter and help us build a stronger, hunger-free Southern Tier!
Our Hiring Process
· Applications will be reviewed regularly until the position is filled.
· Qualified candidates will be invited for a phone screening followed by in-person interviews (2-5 interviewers).
· Start date is approximately two weeks after acceptance and background check completion.
#NonprofitJobs #DataJobs #FundraisingJobs #HungerRelief #ElmiraJobs #Hiring
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $21.00 - $24.00 per hour
Expected hours: 35 per week
Benefits:

 Health insurance
 Paid time off

Schedule:

 8 hour shift
 Day shift
 Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person"}]

title: Program Data Assistant
location: 3545 North Long Beach Boulevard, Long Beach, CA 90807
description:
[{"description":"ChildNet Youth and Family Services is currently recruiting for a Program Data Assistant for our Behavioral Health Services program located in Long Beach, CA.
Behavioral Health Services (BHS) provides comprehensive services including individual/group therapy for at-risk children and their families. The ChildNet Program Data Department is responsible for the management of data systems, as well as monitoring, analysis, and reporting for ChildNet programs. The Program Data Assistant will be responsible for providing support and training to ChildNet staff on company data systems. In addition, the Program Data Assistant will assist in developing and maintaining systematic processes for collecting, tracking, and monitoring various data for all staff.

 Provide support and training to ChildNet staff on data systems.
 Communicate with Billing, Intake, Quality Assurance, and staff from other departments to address data needs and processes.
 Enter program, survey, and outcome data as needed.
 Track and monitor compliance with data and implementation projects.

 Participate in special data projects, as needed or requested.

Qualifications:

 Bachelor’s degree, preferably in the behavioral sciences or public health field, AND
 One (1) year of experience with data collection and data entry.
 In lieu of degree, consideration will be given to candidates who possess at least two (2) years of relevant working experience in data collection or data systems.
 Strong organization and interpersonal communication skills and the ability to work both within a team and/or independently.
 Attention to detail and the ability to maintain sensitive information with the strictest confidentiality.
 Ability to communicate clearly and effectively in English, both verbally and in writing.
 Intermediate to advanced knowledge/skills with Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Excel.

 Bilingual proficiency in speaking, reading, writing, and understanding Spanish is a plus, but not required.

All offers of employment with ChildNet Youth and Family Services, Inc. are contingent upon a post-offer, pre-hire medical clearance with an occupational physical, tuberculosis screening, and a negative drug test. A criminal background clearance which consists of fingerprinting through the Dept. of Justice/FBI/Child Abuse Index Search is required.

ChildNet offers a hybrid work policy; eligibility is determined by business and program needs.

title: Proofreader / Administrative Assistant
description:
[{"description":"About us

Job Summary
Homeyer Consulting Services, Inc., the nation’s largest independent industrial water consulting firm, has an opening for an Administrative Associate team member in our Tewksbury, Massachusetts headquarters.
This individual would act as an editorial assistant and complete a large amount of proofreading. Daily tasks would include proofreading and minor editing to technical documents, such as proposals, scientific reports, request for proposals, etc. Most work originates in Microsoft Word and is then converted to PDF and published to the client in final form. More administrative duties include receiving faxes, printing/filing, phone calls, data entry, updating and managing records, etc.
The individual should be dynamic, well spoken, have excellent writing skills, require little supervision, be able to multitask, and have good planning skills. This individual should be a personable and friendly professional who is organized, computer literate, and detail oriented. This individual should be a self-starter who takes initiative in projects and is interested in moving into a leadership role. This is a non-exempt hourly position.

title: Laboratory Technician
description:
[{"description":"Job Title: Laboratory Technician 
Location: Warrensville, OH 
Pay Rate: $26.05 /hr. 
Start Date: Right Away 
Contract : 12 months 
Keywords: #LabTechnician; #AuroraJobs; 

 Job Summary:
 We are seeking a detail-oriented and technically skilled Laboratory Technician to support our materials testing and analysis operations. The ideal candidate will be responsible for preparing and analyzing metallurgical samples, performing physical property tests, and documenting results to support engineering and process qualification efforts. 

 Key Responsibilities:Sample Preparation:
 Section (cut) sample parts using a manual abrasive saw. 
Mount, sand, and polish specimens for metallurgical analysis. 

 Testing & Analysis:
 Perform Archimedes density measurements. 
Conduct metallurgical micrograph analysis, including grain size and microstructure evaluation. 
Perform hardness testing using appropriate equipment and standards. 

 Documentation & Reporting:
 Accurately document test results in laboratory reports. 
Compile and organize data into spreadsheets or other formats as requested by engineering staff. 

 Qualifications:


 Associate degree or technical certification in Materials Science, Metallurgy, or a related field preferred.
 1-3 years of experience in a laboratory or manufacturing environment.
 Familiarity with metallographic preparation techniques and testing methods.
 Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and basic data entry.
 Strong attention to detail and ability to follow standard operating procedures.
 Good communication and organizational skills.
 Work Environment:


 Laboratory and manufacturing floor settings.
 Use of personal protective equipment (PPE) required.
 May involve standing for extended periods and handling of small tools and equipment.
 If you are interested in this role, please apply via the apply now link provided.
