title: Data Entry Specialist
description:
[{"description":"Data Entry Specialist
  
  
   #AM
  
  
   
    Who We Are
   
   
    Our employees consistently rate Grant Associates as a great place to work, and often recommend open positions to friends. We are a culturally diverse company with competitive benefits, frequent opportunities for growth and change, training, and fun activities! We provide: Competitive wages for high performance • 11 Paid Holidays • PTO • Tuition reimbursement • Guided Professional Development Plans • Summer Fridays • Weekly Wellness Sessions • Medical/Vision/ Dental • Employer Paid Life Insurance • Employer 401k Contributions • Employee Referral Bonus • Employee Assistance Programs •Company Picnics • Volunteer Experiences • Access to Free Financial Counseling
   
   
   
    Innovation and a culture of continuous improvement are built into the fabric of our company. Staff have an opportunity to improve themselves and our company by joining our Fit Forward, Culture, Innovation, and Green teams.
   
   
   
    Description
   
   
    The PA EARN Program, operated by Grant Associates, is seeking a Data Entry Specialist to support program operations through accurate data management and documentation. This role includes compiling and quality-checking monthly invoicing documents, processing transportation stipends using MS Dynamics, and maintaining both manual and electronic filing systems. The Data Entry Specialist will ensure confidentiality, support reporting needs, and contribute to the overall efficiency of the program through detailed organization and administrative support.
   
   
   
    Responsibilities
   
   
    Compiles, quality check and sorts monthly invoicing documentation for program compensation and reimbursement.
    Assist with regular reports and tracking sheets of invoiced compensation/reimbursement payments.
    Assist with writing and recording a high volume of checks for customer transportation stipends on a weekly basis using MS Dynamics software.
    Maintains employer confidence and protects operations by keeping all information confidential
    Ensure that all items are properly numbered, tagged and stored in designated locations
    Maintains data entry requirements by following data techniques and procedures; reporting needed changes
    Responsible for organizing a volume of files both manually and electronically
    Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed
    Respond to requests for information and access relevant files
    Operate high volume scanners and copy machines
    Other duties as assigned
   
   
   
    Qualifications
   
   
    Associates degree or equivalent experience preferred
    1 to 3 years of equivalent work experience
    Ideal candidate will have a background in accounting procedures and systems
    Proficient in computer applications such as MS Office specifically MS Excel, experience with MS Dynamics a plus
    Must have a high level of accuracy with numbers and data entry - Accurate keyboard skills and proven ability to enter data at the required speed – 40 WPM
    Ability to analyze numerical and written information, as well as, work well in a collaborative setting.
    Excellent verbal and written communication skills
    Knowledge of correct spelling, grammar and punctuation
    Knowledge of clerical and administrative procedures
    Ability to thrive in a performance-driven business setting and consistently meet deadlines
    Successful candidate will have a demonstrated ability to work well under pressure, handle multiple projects simultaneously, and manage work under tight deadlines
   

   
   
    About Us
   
   
    Grant Associates is a national workforce development company that is passionate about raising the economic security for the people, businesses, and communities we serve. Since opening our doors in 1997, we have operated programs in cities large and small, partnering with communities to build the human side of economic development. As one of the largest workforce development organizations in North America, we have provided workforce development services to more than 50,000 companies and helped more than 1.2 million people achieve their career goals. Grant Associates is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Advanced Personnel Management (APM) Group, a leading international provider of Human Services with offices in ten countries.
   
   
   
    Grant Associates is an Equal Opportunity Employer"}]

title: Payroll Clerk/Data entry
description:
[{"description":"Job Overview
We are seeking a detail-oriented and organized Payroll Clerk to join our finance team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing payroll processes, ensuring accurate and timely compensation for employees. This role requires a strong understanding of payroll management, benefits administration, and accounting principles. The Payroll Clerk will work closely with HR and finance departments to maintain accurate records and support overall corporate accounting functions.
Duties

 Process payroll on a weekly basis, ensuring accuracy in employee compensation.
 Ensure data is uploaded and entered correctly for accuracy.
 Administer employee benefits and deductions, maintaining compliance with company policies.
 Perform data entry tasks related to payroll and benefits into the HRIS and accounting software.
 Utilize systems for payroll management and timekeeping.
 Conduct double entry bookkeeping to ensure accuracy in financial records.
 Assist in resolving payroll discrepancies by collecting and analyzing information.
 Maintain confidentiality of sensitive employee information while adhering to data protection regulations.
 Collaborate with HR to update employee records and manage changes in employment status.

Skills

 Proficient in payroll management and benefits administration.
 Experience with accounting software and HRIS systems.
 Strong data entry skills with attention to detail.
 Familiarity with double entry bookkeeping principles.
 Knowledge of corporate accounting practices is a plus.
 Ability to work effectively in a team environment while managing multiple tasks.
 Excellent organizational skills with a focus on accuracy and deadlines.
 Strong communication skills to interact effectively with employees and management.

Join our team as a Payroll Clerk where your expertise will contribute to the smooth operation of our payroll processes, ensuring that our employees are compensated accurately and on time.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $18.82 - $21.00 per hour
Benefits:

 401(k)
 Dental insurance
 Health insurance

Work Location: In person"}]

title: Histology Technician - Trainee / Data Entry Operator
description:
[{"description":"Monday - Friday Shift 7:30 AM - 4:00 PM (Every other Saturday 9:30 AM- 1:30 PM)
Are you a recent Graduate with a Bachelor of Science? This is an incredible opportunity to get on the job training with an amazing company!
Job Summary
Histotech- Trainee - Grossing, Embedding and Special Stains
Obtain and process pathology specimens, maintaining positive specimen identification. Perform routine, special stain and Immunohistochemistry for histopathological and cytopathological tests, entry and recording functions in accordance with department policies and procedures.
Knowledge and Critical Skills/Expertise
Language Ability – Ability to read and interpret documents such as patient requisitions, safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence.
Math Ability – Ability to add, subtract, multiply and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals.
Reasoning Ability – Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished either verbally or written. Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.
Position Requirements (Education, Experience, Licensure/Certifications)
A. A., A. S., B. A. or B. S. degree. Degrees must include 6 credits in Biology, 6 credits in Chemistry and 12 credits in any Medical Laboratory related course. (Math and Physics credits are not included.)
3 year experience in a Histology laboratory within the last five years Demonstrates knowledge of and can perform IHC testing. Demonstrates knowledge of computer skills in word processing, Excel and database entry
Histotechnologist I: HT/HTL (ASCP) eligible and must take the ASCP certification exam within one year of hire
Tasks, Duties and Responsibilities
1. Interacts with physicians, employees and clients in a positive manner consistent with the mission and values of Bako Diagnostics.
2. Performs routine and non-routine activities involved in the preparation of slides for microscopic evaluation by pathologist(s), according to policies and procedures.
3. Ensure proper accessioning and labeling of all tissue samples.
4. Process paperwork associated with accessioning and reporting.
5. Ensure proper tissue processing.
6. Embed processed tissue in paraffin.
7. Perform microtomy of embedded tissue.
8. Prepare slides for routine Hematoxylin & Eosin, Periodic Acid Schiff’s, Grocott’s Methenamine Silver and Fontana Masson staining.
9. Perform cover slipping of stained slides either manually or via automation.
10. Ability to prepare solutions and reagents for special stain procedures.
11. May be required to obtain and validate control tissue used in special stains.
12. Maybe required to perform special stain procedures.
13. Perform gross tissue examination (high complexity testing) set forth by the 1988 CLIA CFR 493. 1489.
14. Prepare solutions and reagents for IHC procedures.
15. Obtain and validate control material used in IHC procedures.
16. Perform IHC testing.
17. Perform filing of finished blocks and slides.
18. Perform routine maintenance and cleaning of equipment.\
19. Follow the laboratory's standard operating procedures for job-related responsibilities.
20. Differentiate acceptable and unacceptable processing, embedding, cutting and staining of tissue specimens.
21. May be required to develop, execute, or validate new procedures.
22. Capable of identifying problems that may affect test performance or reporting of test results and resolve or immediately report to Histology Supervisor or Technical Supervisor.
23. Ensure all safety, quality control and quality assurance standards are met.
24. Ensure compliance with all local, federal, CLIA and CAP regulations along with GLP and GCP practices.
25. Maintain a clean and well-organized work area.
Working Conditions
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly exposed to fumes or airborne particles, hazardous chemicals and hazardous waste The employee is frequently exposed to human tissue. Personal protective equipment to lower the risk of exposure is provided by Bako Diagnostics
Physical Demands
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit, use hands, reach with hands and arms, and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk and stoop, kneel, or crouch. The employee may occasionally lift and/or move up to 30 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: From $18.00 per hour
Benefits:

 401(k)
 Dental insurance
 Flexible spending account
 Health insurance
 Life insurance
 Paid time off
 Vision insurance

Medical Specialty:

 Pathology

Schedule:

 Day shift

Work Location: In person"}]

title: Scheduler/Data Entry
description:
[{"description":"Are you an experienced scheduler known for your lightning-fast pace, exceptional communication prowess,and unwavering attention to detail? We're seeking a dynamic individual like you to join our team and make an impact in our fast-paced environment. If you thrive on delivering top-notch customer service and have demonstrated longevity in scheduling for over three years with one company, we want to hear from you!
About Us: 
Precision Plumbing & Heating Systems has been an industry leader in Northern Michigan since 2000 and we are looking for top-notch individuals to join our growing team! We pride ourselves on operating with honesty, integrity and appreciation for every employee and customer. We offer a 100% customer satisfaction guarantee, and we appreciate our many customers whose 5-star reviews show us that we are meeting our goal of exceeding our clients expectations every day! We regularly give back to our community through our Precision Cares program and our annual Precision Make-over. We are strong proponents of continuing education and support each individual to be the very best that they can be!
Job Overview:
We are seeking a detail-oriented, customer liason to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for inputting, updating, and maintaining accurate data within our systems, strategically scheduling appointments and overseeing our membership programs.
Job Responsibilities:

 Scheduling Mastery: Utilize your extensive scheduling experience to coordinate appointments, meetings, and deadlines with precision and efficiency.
 Customer Service Excellence: Interact with clients and co-workers professionally and courteously, ensuring their scheduling needs are met promptly and accurately.
 Attention to Detail: Maintain meticulous records, data entry and documentation, ensuring all scheduling information is accurate and up to date.
 Communication Expertise: Communicate clearly and effectively with team members and clients, providing updates and managing expectations.

Requirements:

 Experience: Minimum of 3 years of experience in scheduling or dispatching roles with a single employer, demonstrating stability and commitment.

Benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision, and AD&D Insurance is provided for employee with additional options available for employee and family, 401K retirement plan with up to 4% Match, Paid PTO and Holidays, Paid Continuing education and professional development opportunities.

description:
[{"description":"Position Summary: PCF is seeking a detail-oriented and organized Data Entry Specialist to handle donation entry and record-keeping, ensuring accurate donor data. title: Scheduler & Data Entry Specialist
description:
[{"description":"Position Overview
We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Scheduler and Data Entry Specialist to join our team. This role is responsible for scheduling jobs directly with customers, coordinating calendars with internal teams, and ensuring data accuracy across all systems. The Scheduler will play a vital role in keeping operations and sales teams in the loop on all customer activities, schedules, and status updates. This position will also work closely with the Equipment Division to coordinate repair schedules, field truck availability, and maintenance documentation—making it an essential support function across departments.
Key Responsibilities Scheduling with Customers

 Coordinate and schedule service appointments, job site visits, or project tasks directly with customers via phone, email, or scheduling software.
 Serve as customers' primary point of contact regarding scheduling logistics, confirmations, and rescheduling.
 Collaborate with field staff, service teams, and operations leaders to align job schedules with team availability and resource needs.
 Monitor scheduling conflicts and proactively resolve issues to minimize delays or disruptions.
 Maintain clear and timely communication with customers to ensure satisfaction and reliability.

Cross-Team Coordination

 Communicate scheduled job updates, changes, and customer feedback to both operations and sales teams in real time.
 Ensure that sales representatives are aware of scheduled jobs, pending appointments, and follow-ups related to their accounts.
 Keep operations informed of daily job loads, reschedules, cancellations, and any special customer requirements.
 Facilitate alignment between sales promises and operational capacity through accurate scheduling and feedback loops.
 Coordinate closely with the Equipment Division to schedule repairs, track vehicle readiness for field deployment, and document all repair and maintenance activities.
 Balance service scheduling with the availability of trucks and equipment needed in the field, avoiding conflicts between operational needs and repair timelines.

Data Entry Duties

 Accurately enter customer data, job details, appointment statuses, and relevant notes into internal systems or CRMs.
 Maintain organized and up-to-date records of all customer interactions and scheduling activity.
 Document equipment repairs, service requests, and downtime logs in coordination with the Equipment Division.
 Generate job schedules, repair timelines, and coordination reports for use by team leads and managers.
 Audit records regularly for completeness, consistency, and compliance with company standards.
 Support digital file maintenance and archiving for documentation and reporting purposes.

QualificationsEducation & Experience

 High school diploma or equivalent required; associate degree or related certification preferred.
 Minimum 1–2 years of experience in scheduling, customer coordination, or administrative roles.
 Familiarity with CRM platforms and scheduling tools (e.g., Jobber, ServiceTitan, Housecall Pro, GPS Insight, Salesforce).

Skills

 Excellent communication and interpersonal skills across both customer and team interactions.
 Strong organizational skills with a high level of accuracy and attention to detail.
 Ability to multitask, prioritize, and adapt in a fast-paced, customer-centric environment.
 Technologically proficient in office productivity tools and cloud-based systems.
 Professional, solution-oriented, and collaborative mindset.

Work Environment

 This is an on-site position.
 Standard business hours; occasional extended hours may be required to meet scheduling demands or customer needs.

Preferred Qualifications (Optional)

 Experience in a service-based, logistics, or field operations industry (e.g., construction, equipment services, repair operations).
 Familiarity with fleet coordination or equipment maintenance workflows.
 Understanding how scheduling impacts downstream operations, resource availability, and service timelines.

Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $23.27 - $28.02 per hour
Expected hours: 40 – 50 per week
Benefits:

 401(k)
 401(k) matching
 Dental insurance
 Health insurance
 Life insurance
 Paid time off
 Referral program
 Retirement plan
 Vision insurance

Ability to Commute:

 Mc Callsburg, IA 50154 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

 Mc Callsburg, IA 50154: Relocate before starting work (Preferred)

Work Location: In person"}]

Education and/or Work Experience Requirements:

 At least 1 year experience in call center experience preferred.

 Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including ability to effectively communicate with internal and external customers.
 Excellent computer proficiency (MS Office – Word, Excel and Outlook).

Physical Requirements: 

 Ability to safely and successfully perform the essential job functions consistent with the ADA, FMLA and other federal, state and local standards, including meeting qualitative and/or quantitative productivity standards.
 Ability to maintain regular, punctual attendance consistent with the ADA, FMLA and other federal, state and local standards.
 Must be able to stand and walk for up to 8 hours a day.
 Must be able to lift and carry up to 25 lbs.
 Must be able to talk, listen and speak clearly on telephone.

title: Data Entry
description:
[{"description":"Our client is seeking a detail-oriented and dependable Bilingual Data Entry Clerk to support our team by accurately entering, updating, and maintaining information in our systems. The ideal candidate will be fluent in both English and Spanish (spoken and written) and capable of handling sensitive or confidential data with discretion and accuracy.
  Responsibilities:
 
  Enter and update data in internal databases and software systems accurately and efficiently.
  Translate and input information in both English and Spanish has required.
  Verify and cross-check data to ensure accuracy and completeness.
  Maintain electronic and paper records in accordance with company policies.
  Communicate with internal departments and external clients or vendors as needed.
  Identify and correct data entry errors or report them to appropriate parties.
  Meet daily and weekly productivity and quality targets.
  Perform general administrative tasks as assigned.
 
 
 
 Requirements:
 
  High school diploma or equivalent; associate degree preferred.
  Proven experience in data entry or administrative roles.
  Fluent in both English and Spanish with strong reading and writing skills.
  Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills.
  Strong typing speed and proficiency with data entry software (e.g., Microsoft Excel, databases, CRM systems).
  Ability to handle confidential information with integrity.
  Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
 
  Preferred Qualifications:
 
  Experience in a bilingual customer service, administrative, or office support environment.
 
 
  IND-EL"}]

title: Clinical Research Assistant/Medical Assistant
description:
[{"description":"Clinical Research Assistant/Medical Assistant (Growth Opportunity to Coordinator Role – Aesthetics Focus)
Brian Biesman, M.D 
What we are about:
MedSpa Partners (MSP) is North America’s largest platform of top-tier medical aesthetics clinics (including plastic surgery, cosmetic dermatology, and med spas) and is one of Deloitte’s Top 25 Best Managed Companies in Canada. Our goal is to allow our industry-leading teams to achieve their professional aspirations by creating world-class patient experiences through sustainable support, collaboration, and community.  
Why Work at Brian Biesman, M.D?
Our clinic is renowned for its dynamic and supportive culture, where teamwork is more than a value—it's our foundation. Led by the esteemed Dr. Brian Biesman, recognized nationally for excellence in clinical expertise, groundbreaking research, and unparalleled patient satisfaction, we are at the forefront of innovation in medical aesthetics and technology-driven care.
Are you passionate about aesthetics and ready to build a long-term career in clinical research? We are seeking a driven, detail-oriented Clinical Research Assistant who is eager to grow into a Clinical Research Coordinator role within our aesthetic research department.
This position is more than just a job - it is a career-building opportunity for someone excited about advancing in the field of aesthetic medicine. You’ll begin by supporting ongoing clinical trials, learning the ins and outs of research protocols, patient interactions, and regulatory processes. With time, mentorship, and hands-on experience, you’ll transition into leading studies as a Clinical Research Coordinator.
What we are looking for:
· A strong desire to grow in the research field
· Someone committed to a long-term role and career growth
· Passion for aesthetics and patient-centered research
· Highly organized with excellent communication skills
· Prior research, healthcare, or aesthetics experience is a plus, but not required
We are not just looking to fill a position – we are looking to invest in someone who is excited to grow with us for the long haul. If you’re ready to build a meaningful career in aesthetic research, we want to hear from you.
What you can expect from us:
· Mentorship and training tailored to growth into a coordinator role
· Competitive salary commensurate to your experience  
· Industry Incentives  
· Dedication to our team member’s career development, advancement, and satisfaction  
· Internal career progression and advancement opportunities  
· Employee referral program  
· A family-focused environment based on equality and respect  
Responsibilities and Duties
· Obtain Good Clinical Practice (GCP) certification within the first 30 days of hire
· Under the direction of the Lead CRC and the Principal Investigator, assists the CRC and other site staff in their responsibilities by conducting the following according to study protocol:
· Completes pre-study activities
· Reviews and knows requirements of study protocol thoroughly
· May attend investigator meetings and site initiation visits
· Complete pre-study visit preparation of source documents and/or other necessary study supplies
· Implements the procedures of the protocol
· Assists investigator and/or other staff with patient visits
· Completes or assists with all study visit procedures
· May assist with Study Drug compliance and/or administration as properly trained or licensed including study drug receipt, dispensation, preparation, and maintenance of drug accountability records
· Accurately records pertinent information in source documentation
· Assists in communicating with patient for study-related issues
· Schedules subjects for study visits, conducts appointment reminders, and reschedules visits if needed
· Assists in reporting and completing required documentation (according to sponsor, regulatory, and company policies) for all serious adverse events (SAE's) immediately to investigator and within 24 hours to sponsor
· Assist with transcribing accurate information in the case report forms (CRF's) data entry, data verification, query resolution, and quality control
· Assist in maintaining current patient logs for clinical trials
· Assist in managing study supplies and inventory
· Monitors and submits request for reorder of all study/office supplies as needed during study
· May assist with clinical monitoring visits
· Obtain vital signs, Obtain EKGs, and perform blood draws
· Keeps Lead CRC and PI apprised and informed of all situations and daily operations
· Perform a variety of self-motivated clinical research support with strong written and verbal communication skills.
· Perform basic lab procedures per protocol, such as: blood specimen collection, centrifuge operation, storing and shipping of lab specimens, accountability of specimens and notification of courier for specimen pick-up
· Request and track medical record requests
· Ensures study related reports and patient results are reviewed by the CRC and/or investigator in a timely manner
· Temperature-controlled drug and supply monitoring and documentation
· Complete administrative tasks, such as patient document filing, management of study correspondence, and maintenance of Regulatory documents and study binders
· Act as a member of an interdisciplinary team to plan, organize, conduct, and maintain the activities of research trials in an efficient and accurate manner
· Understand good documentation in accordance with ALCOA-C principles when collecting, transferring data to sponsor/CRO data capture systems and resolving queries under the direction of the Clinical Research Coordinator
· Understand the informed consent process with emphasis on ensuring initial and ongoing consent of study subjects
· Understand basic elements of regulatory documentation required to initiate, maintain and close a clinical research trial
· Maintain confidentiality of patient protected health information, sponsor confidential information, and the clinic at all times
· Perform all other duties as requested or assigned
Preferred Background/Experience:
· Medical Assistant
· Clinical Research
· Healthcare
Qualifications
· Prior research, healthcare, or aesthetics experience
· High school diploma or GED
To apply:
Interested applicants should submit a resume and cover letter sharing their interest in aesthetics and clinical research. Applications that do not include both a cover letter and resume will not be reviewed.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $50,000.00 - $75,000.00 per year
Physical Setting:

 Clinic

Schedule:

 Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

 Please tell us why you want to work in aesthetics clinical research.
 Please note that interested applicants should submit a cover letter and resume. Applications that do not include both a cover letter and resume will not be reviewed. If you acknowledge this requirement, please write "yes".
 Do you live in or around the Nashville area? (REQUIRED)

Work Location: In person"}]

title: Customs Administrative Assistant / Customs Clerk (Entry-Level)
description:
[{"description":"Pacific Customs Brokers has been in business for over 65 years, and we are always looking for our next generation of brokers. Looking for a new career in a stable industry with plenty of growth opportunities? Consider starting your new journey as a Customs Administrative Assistant / Customs Clerk, where you will play an important role in the import clearance process.
What We Do
We are an integral player in the supply chain and are best known for our brokerage services. We assist importers by ensuring their shipment paperwork is complete and meets US requirements. We then make an electronic declaration on their behalf to the government to allow their goods to enter the country.
But that’s not all we do! We are passionate about international trade and also offer advisory services to the business community. We help companies navigate trade agreements, determine the value of their goods, and pass any other hurdles they may encounter bringing goods into this country.
Why Work With Us
Our success is due to the dedicated and knowledgeable staff who work here. We offer stable employment in a growing industry, competitive wages, excellent benefits, and room for growth. Many of our trade advisors and compliance specialists started as Customs Administrative Assistants, and we promote (and pay for) additional education that supports your career growth.
Because international trade is a 24/7/365 business, this role is on a shift-based schedule, with time assignments which will vary and will include days, afternoons, and at times overnights. This is not a Monday to Friday daytime job, and the shift will also usually include a Saturday and/or Sunday. Shift schedules will be assigned at least a month in advance and employees will always be full-time.
Requirements:

 Available for days/afternoons/evenings, including at least one weekend day
 Typing speed of 35 WPM or better
 Professional telephone etiquette (previous reception and/or CSR experience is an asset)
 Administrative experience (i.e. filing, scanning, data entry) is beneficial
 Ability to complete physical tasks such as sitting, bending, and crouching
 Must be able to speak, read, and write English at a professional level
 Must be in the US and have the right to work at the time of application. Applications from outside the US will not be considered. Out-of-state applicants should indicate their planned date of arrival to the Blaine area
 Foreign placement agencies need not contact.

We Offer:

 Starting wage of $19.40 plus shift premiums (i.e. additional $1.50 per hour for any hours worked between 6 pm and 11 pm and additional $2.50 for any hours worked between 11 pm and 5 am)
 Full-time employment (40 hours/week)
 Employees (and their families) are covered by Medical, Dental, and Vision Benefits
 Employees are covered by Life Insurance, can enroll in our company's 401K plan, and can participate in profit-sharing.
 Employees are eligible for 10 paid vacation days (following the first year of employment) and 11 paid holidays (following 30 days of employment)
 Education Support
 Growth and Development Opportunities
 and more!

Candidates with previous administrative or customer service experience are encouraged to apply. Submit your resume and cover letter via Indeed or directly on our website.
Principals only. No agents or recruiters need contact.
#everyonewelcome
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $19.40 - $20.90 per hour

 Vision insurance

title: Intake Data Entry Specialist
description:
[{"description":"PRIMARY JOB DUTIES
 
 Enters referrals as they are called or arrive in the office. Collaborates with intake RNs / LPNs for disposition of referrals.
 
 Appropriately communicates information according to department policies and procedures. Answers phones as necessary to maintain customer service standards.
 
 Organizes and performs work effectively and efficiently.
 
 Maintains and adjusts schedule to enhance department performance.
 
 Maintains and promotes customer loyalty.
 
 Effectively demonstrates the mission, vision, and values of the agency on a daily basis.
 
  1.0 40% QUALITY OF WORK:
 
 1.1 20% Processes referrals as they are called or arrive in the office. Collaborates with intake RNs for disposition of referrals as evidenced by:
 
  Reviews incoming referrals and accurately creates electronic file in HCHB within established time frames.
  Coordinates with liaisons, intake staff and referral sources when missing or incomplete information is received.
  Keys large volume of highly complex statistical data into the computer with speed and accuracy.
  Monitors all pending weekend and holiday admission/readmission referrals to determine if packet is complete and episode is started.
 
 
 1.2 20% Appropriately communicates information according to agency policies and procedures as evidenced by:
 
  Takes phone calls from the referral source or patient/family when the primary nurse is not available.
  Communicates information about anticipated discharges to the appropriate agency personnel in a timely manner, including the anticipated date of discharge and services needed post discharge.
  Facilitates clarification of information from physicians and/or referral sources.
  Communicates ideas for improving the referral process to the Intake Manager and follows up as appropriate. Reports unresolved problems in a timely manner.
 
 
  2.0 40% PRODUCTIVITY/USE OF TIME:
 
 2.1 30% Organizes and performs work effectively and efficiently as evidenced by:
 
  Daily maintenance of Forcura documenting on all pending referrals.
  Referrals are processed into an EMR system.
  Maintains zero complaints from the community on timeliness of answering phones for the intake team.
 
 
 2.2 10% Maintains and adjusts schedule to enhance team performance as evidenced by:
 
  Reporting to work on time and returning promptly from errands, breaks, and meals.
  Managing personal work schedule and time off to promote smooth agency operations.
  Assisting other team members to ensure completion of all work assignments.
  Demonstrating flexibility with changing workload/assignments.
  Does not exceed accrued PTO or qualified leave of absence(s).
 
 
  3.0 20% TEAM WORK, MISSION, VISION, VALUES:
 
 3.1 20% Demonstrates positive interpersonal relations in dealing with all members of the team (i.e. co-workers, supervisors, physicians, etc.) as evidenced by:
 
  Responding to all customers in a courteous, sensitive and respectful manner.
  Maintains confidentiality in all professional areas and considers the needs of clients and their families, other employees, physicians, visitors, and all members of the community in an informative, courteous, and compassionate manner. Complies with the Well Care HIPAA Policies and Procedures.
  Managing stress and personal feelings without a negative impact on the team.
  Completing the review period without any formal disciplinary action.
  Presenting a clean and neat appearance in personal attire and one’s work area.
 
 
  JOB SPECIFICATIONS
 
 Education: High School Diploma or equivalent. Secondary education preferred.
 
 Licensure / Certification: Not required.
 
 Experience: At least two years computer experience, preferably in the field of healthcare. Prior experience in customer service/physician relations preferred. Experience with medical insurance verification required.
 
 Essential Technical Skills: Must be able to write, use the telephone, read and speak clearly. Computer literate and demonstrated experience with Microsoft Office.
 
 Interpersonal Skills: Must possess excellent communications skills. Ability to develop and maintain working relationships with patients, staff and public. Effective listening skills.
 
 Essential Physical Requirements: Ability to sit/stand for extended periods of time. Must be able to stoop, bend, sit, and ability to operate office equipment.
 
 Essential Mental Requirements: Ability to deal effectively in stressful situations. Ability to organize and prioritize, learn new skills and techniques. Able to learn and use supportive services.
 
 Essential sensory requirements: Visual acuity, touch, hearing and speaking.
 
 Other – Hours of Work: Weekends Thurs-Sunday. Full-Time. Office hours are 8:00 – 6:00 pm. Schedule and hours may vary due to the assigned schedule at the time of hire. Occasional need for flexible hours to accommodate department needs."}]

title: Call Center Associate I - Lottery (Home/Remote, RI
description:
[{"description":"Location: RI Statewide, RI, US
    
   
  
 
 
  
   
    
     Requisition ID: 17712
    
   
  
 

 


 
  Brightstar is an innovative, forward-thinking global leader in lottery that builds on our renowned expertise in delivering secure technology and producing reliable, comprehensive solutions for our customers. As a premier pure play global lottery company, our best-in-class lottery operations, retail and digital solutions, and award-winning lottery games enable our customers to achieve their goals, fulfill player needs and distribute meaningful benefits to communities. Brightstar has a well-established local presence and is a trusted partner to governments and regulators around the world, creating value by adhering to the highest standards of service, integrity, and responsibility. Brightstar has approximately 6,000 employees. For more information, please visit www.brightstarlottery.com.
 
 
  
   
    
     Responsibilities
    
   
   
    
     Brightstar is seeking a Call Center Associate in our Rhode Island team. This position is a home-based or remote role, but candidates must reside within the state of Rhode Island. The first week of training will be at Brightstar’s West Greenwich office location. Brightstar’s Call Center receives incoming calls from lottery retailers from across the U.S. Call Center Associates assist and provide basic troubleshooting support for Brightstar equipment and systems. This is NOT a sales position. Brightstar’s Home / Remote employees must have a high-speed internet connection with a hard-wired connection to your router in a safe and quiet place to work. Brightstar will provide you with a desktop or laptop, monitor(s), and accessories. This Brightstar Call Center operates 24/7 and offers two shifts (1st, 2nd) with paid shift differentials for hours that qualify. Working on Saturday and/or Sunday is also required.
    
    
     Answer inbound phone calls from lottery retailers across multiple jurisdictions regarding lottery equipment issues, supply requests, and game information
 Connect with internal departments to resolve customers’ issues by conferencing or transferring calls as appropriate
 Accurately diagnose and troubleshoot terminal equipment issues and take appropriate action
 Demonstrate an ability to defuse situations and escalate issues appropriately
 Utilize the knowledge base to provide accurate information and troubleshooting steps
 Ensure each retailer contact is detailed in Customer Relationship Management (CRM) tool with a suitable call reason, issue, and notes
 Demonstrate a strong dedication to providing continuously outstanding customer service
    
   
  
  
   
    
     Building Bright Future's
    
   
   
    
     Brightstar employees in this role receive the following (all benefits mentioned are subject to policy and eligibility requirements):
 Hourly pay of $22.50 per hour (Rhode Island residents only)

title: Cash Posting Representative - Remote
description:
[{"description":"JOB SUMMARY
 The Cash Posting Representative will be responsible for posting non-automated payments in the patient accounting systems for Conifer Clients to ensure bank deposits are posted on a daily basis. The primary goal is to ensure maximum revenue & service for our clients. This function is responsible for accurate and timely application of payments to patient accounts as well as researching and posting unidentified transactions.
 ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
  Include the following. Others may be assigned.
 
  Post payments electronically or manually in the patient accounting system
  Research and resolve Unidentified Accounts using established Identification function/process. Ability to interpret remit language and understand payer behavior, forwarding balances/ overpayment recoveries.
  Reconciles bank and special accounts, which may include: research, payment transfer or payment refund. Run queries to pull account details and monitor postings / transfers as applicable
  Review/Research all payment related issues via email or work desk
  Post payment corrections, payment transfers, inter-facility transfers, capitation payments, payroll deductions. Communicate with Reconciliation reps as required.
  Call insurance companies for required remittance advice and/or missing information to post payments. Open tickets with business partners as deemed necessary using established Identification function/process for timely resolution of worked accounts
  Identify and reconcile owner to owner refunds; track and log refund transactions between owners
  Work Special Projects to completion
 
 KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES
  To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
 
  Intermediate in Microsoft Office tools; knowledge of patient accounting systems a plus
  Data entry and 10-key by touch
  Critical thinking and analytical skills
  Must be able to work concurrently on a variety of projects and work in a fast paced environment with a sense of urgency
  Adaptable to Change and work in an evolving healthcare setting
  Ability to communicate effectively, work independently as well as in a team
 
 Conifer requires its candidates, as applicable and as permitted by law, to obtain and provide confirmation of all required vaccinations and screenings prior to the start of employment. This may include, but is not limited to, the COVID-19 vaccination, influenza vaccination, and/or any future required vaccines and screenings.
  EDUCATION / EXPERIENCE
  Include minimum education, technical training, and/or experience preferred to perform the job.
 
  High school diploma or equivalent
  2-3 years of related experience; payment posting/ hospital patient accounting systems a plus
 
 PHYSICAL DEMANDS 
 The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. 
 
  Must be able to work in sitting position, use computer and answer telephone
  Ability to travel
  Includes ability to walk through hospital-based departments across broad campus settings, including Emergency Department environments
 
 WORK ENVIRONMENT 
 The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. 
 
  Office Work Environment
  Hospital Work Environment
  Virtual Work Environment
 
 As a part of the Tenet and Catholic Health Initiatives family, Conifer Health brings 30 years of healthcare industry expertise to clients in more than 135 local regions nationwide. We help our clients strengthen their financial and clinical performance, serve their communities, and succeed at the business of healthcare. Conifer Health helps organizations transition from volume to value-based care, enhance the consumer and patient healthcare experience and improve quality, cost, and access to healthcare. Are you ready to be part of our solutions? Welcome to the company that gives you the resources and incentives to redefine healthcare services, with a competitive benefits package and leadership to take your career to the next step!
 
 Compensation and Benefit Information
 Compensation
 
  Pay: $15.80 - $23.70 per hour. Compensation depends on location, qualifications, and experience.
  Position may be eligible for a signing bonus for qualified new hires, subject to employment status.
  Conifer observed holidays receive time and a half.
 
 Benefits
 Conifer offers the following benefits, subject to employment status:
 
  Medical, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance
  Paid time off (vacation & sick leave) – min of 12 days per year, accrue at a rate of approximately 1.84 hours per 40 hours worked.
  401k with up to 6% employer match
  10 paid holidays per year
  Health savings accounts, healthcare & dependent flexible spending accounts
  Employee Assistance program, Employee discount program
  Voluntary benefits include pet insurance, legal insurance, accident and critical illness insurance, long term care, elder & childcare, AD&D, auto & home insurance.
  For Colorado employees, Conifer offers paid leave in accordance with Colorado’s Healthy Families and Workplaces Act.
 2503020153 Employment practices will not be influenced or affected by an applicant’s or employee’s race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, age, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status or any other legally protected status. Tenet will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities unless doing so would result in an undue hardship"}]

title: Payroll Data Entry Analyst - Contract
description:
[{"description":"Our client a mid-sized manufacturing organization in NH is seeking a contract Payroll Data Entry Analyst to join their team! This is a 5 day in person role located in Rochester, NH moving to Portsmouth NH in August. Must be able to commute! Attention to detail, accuracy & ability to work in a fast-paced environment are priorities.
The Payroll Data Entry Analyst will be responsible for the accurate and timely data entry related to payroll. This role will review, validate and execute the data entry process in our HRIS Systems. Duties include, but are not limited to:

 Perform data entry of all new hires, promotions, transfers, and terminations in ADP and SAP across all divisions.
 Process USHR Payroll onboarding notices for all US new hires, promotions, and transfers via Resource Management (RM) system.
 Enter HRCT SAP data updates including promotions, cost center changes, pay rate adjustments, manager changes, and terminations for Corporate/MC.
 Manage late submission data that does not pass through system bridges in ADP, including Leaves, Terms, and Group Changes.
 Process ADP Garnishment and Wisely invoices: code, scan, and submit to Accounts Payable.
 Respond to garnishment verification requests: scan and upload court orders with employee details; process checks and submit.
 Complete Child Support verification requests: complete questionnaires and verifications, scan and upload required documentation.
 Handle Medical Support Orders: scan, save to garnishment folder, and coordinate with Benefits team for enrollment actions.

Preferred Experience/Characteristics/ Competencies & Education
Required Qualifications:

 1–3 years of experience in HRIS data entry, payroll administration, or related field.
 Familiarity with ADP, SAP, or similar HR/payroll systems.
 Strong attention to detail and data accuracy.
 The ability to key data accurately and quickly
 Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with discretion.
 Excellent organizational and time management skills.

Preferred Qualifications:

 Prior experience with HRCT processes and systems.
 Knowledge of garnishment and child support processing.
 Experience in a multi-division or multi-location organization.
 Proficiency with Excel functions to analyze data, reporting, using pivot tables and VLOOKUP’s

Job Types: Full-time, Temp-to-hire, Contract
Pay: $24.00 per hour
Expected hours: 40 per week
Schedule:

 Day shift
 Monday to Friday

Education:

 Bachelor's (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

 Rochester, NH 03839 (Required)

Work Location: In person"}]

description:

Duration: 10+ Months
Location: Sunnyvale, CA (Hybrid)
Description:
Primary Function of Position:

 Efficiently handle customers’ inquiries such as purchase orders, product complaints, product returns or exchanges.
 Professionally responds to emails, understand the customers’ needs and their environment to improve satisfaction at sales and service support levels.
 Accurately and timely process orders and requests in ERP and CRM databases.
 Understand processes and make recommendations to improve overall team efficiency.

 Enter sales orders into SAP/Neptune, verify that terms and conditions of purchase orders are processed accordingly.

 Log customers’ complaints timely and accurately, report to Regulatory as appropriate.

 Quickly become knowledgeable on policies, processes, and procedures; as well as knowledge of products and pricing models.

title: Customer Service Representative
description:
Customer Service Representative
Job Summary:
We are seeking a dedicated and detail-oriented Customer Service Representative (CSR) to join our logistics service support team. The ideal candidate will play a crucial role in ensuring seamless communication between customers, drivers, and internal teams. This position requires excellent communication skills, problem-solving abilities, and strong multitasking skills to efficiently manage customer inquiries, order processing, and administrative tasks.
Key Responsibilities:

 Answer and Make Calls: Handle inbound and outbound calls to assist customers, prospective customers, drivers, and internal teams.
 Order Processing: Accurately enter and update orders in our transportation management system to ensure timely and efficient deliveries.
 Customer Support: Provide professional and courteous assistance to customers regarding order status, scheduling, and issue resolution.
 Driver Assistance: Communicate with drivers to provide instructions, updates, and support throughout the delivery process.
 Appointment Scheduling: Make outbound calls to respond to service inquiries, schedule delivery appointments and update customers and end-users.
 Issue Resolution: Identify and resolve problems proactively, escalating issues to the appropriate departments when necessary.
 Data Entry & Documentation: Maintain accurate records of customer interactions, order updates, and dispatch logs.
 Administrative Support: Perform general office duties, including email correspondence, filing, and document management.
 Technology Utilization: Use the company’s software systems and customer portals to manage orders, track shipments, and update delivery statuses.
 Team Collaboration: Work closely with dispatchers, warehouse staff, and drivers to ensure smooth operations and exceptional customer service.

Required Qualifications & Skills:

 Experience: 1-3 years of customer service experience, preferably in logistics, trucking, warehousing, courier services, or final-mile delivery.
 Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills with a friendly, customer-focused approach.
 Computer Proficiency: Strong computer skills, including experience with office productivity software systems (such as MS-Office or Google Workspace).
 Multitasking & Problem-Solving: Ability to manage multiple tasks efficiently while responding quickly to changing priorities.
 Attention to Detail: Strong accuracy and organizational skills to ensure order and data integrity.
 Team Player: Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment with a positive attitude.
 Adaptability: Willingness to learn new systems and processes to enhance customer service efficiency.

Preferred Qualifications:

 Experience in the logistics or transportation industry.
 Knowledge of transportation management software and customer management systems.

Work Environment & Schedule:

 Office-based position with standard business hours (Monday–Friday) and occasional overtime as needed.
 Fast-paced, team-oriented work environment requiring quick decision-making and effective communication.

Benefits:

 Competitive salary based on experience.
 Comprehensive benefits package that includes health, dental, vision, voluntary life and disability.
 Paid time off and holidays.
 Opportunities for career growth within the company.

What We Offer:

 Competitive salary based on experience.
 Bonus opportunities based on attainment of KPIs and operational goals
 Benefits package, including comprehensive benefits package and paid time off.
 Opportunities for growth and advancement in a growing company.
 A collaborative and supportive team environment.

Submit your resume and cover letter detailing your experience and why you are the ideal candidate for this role. Applications can be sent to XXX@zippdelivers.com or submitted via .

Benefits:

 Dental insurance
 Health insurance
 Paid time off
 Vision insurance

Schedule:

 Monday to Friday

 Earth City, MO 63045 (Required)

title: Entry Level Client Support Associate
description:
Our firm is dedicated to delivering exceptional service and innovative solutions to our clients. Our team is passionate about building lasting relationships and driving success through personalized support. We are currently seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Entry Level Client Support Associate to join our expanding team.
Job Description:
As an Entry Level Client Support Associate, you will play a crucial role in managing and nurturing client relationships. You will be the primary point of contact for clients, ensuring their needs are met, and providing exceptional service. Your role will involve a mix of administrative tasks, client interactions, and problem-solving to support our clients effectively.
Key Responsibilities Of An Entry Level Client Support Associate:

 Serve as the main point of contact for assigned client accounts, addressing inquiries, and resolving issues promptly.
 Build and maintain strong, long-term client relationships through regular communication and personalized support.
 Collaborate with internal teams to ensure client needs are met and projects are executed smoothly.
 Manage and track client account details, including contracts, billing, and service agreements.
 Assist clients with onboarding, account setup, and training on our products/services.
 Monitor account performance and provide regular updates to clients, highlighting key metrics and success stories.
 Identify opportunities for account growth and upselling additional services or products.
 Handle any client complaints or concerns with professionalism and a focus on resolution.
 Maintain accurate and detailed records of client interactions and transactions.

Qualifications Of An Entry Level Client Support Associate:

 Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field (preferred).
 Proven experience in a client-facing role or customer service position.
 Strong communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to build rapport with clients.
 Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
 Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and CRM software.
 High level of attention to detail and organizational skills.
 Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.

 401(k)
 401(k) matching

 Day shift
 Monday to Friday

title: Service Operations Coordinator
description:
Position: Service Operations Coordinator
 
 We’re seeking a dependable and detail-driven professional to support day-to-day service operations for a growing team. This full-time opportunity involves managing service orders, coordinating the flow of spare parts, and entering critical data into the company’s ERP platform. The right candidate will bring at least two years of experience in a similar administrative or service-based role, along with a demonstrated ability to work accurately and efficiently under tight timelines.
 
 Primary Responsibilities:
 

 
  Handle incoming service orders, including repair and product exchange requests
  Enter and maintain order and inventory records within an ERP environment
  Assist with tracking parts availability and coordinating replenishment
  Communicate clearly with internal departments to support smooth service workflows
  Contribute to resolving shipping, inventory, or order issues as needed
  Support documentation, reporting, and general administrative tasks related to logistics and service
  
 Qualifications:
 

 
  2+ years of experience in service coordination, order processing, or related office-based work
  Familiarity with ERP platforms (experience with MAS 500/Sage a plus, but not required)
  Strong computer and typing skills, with the ability to quickly learn new systems
  High attention to detail and excellent organizational skills
  Comfortable in a fast-changing, team-oriented setting
  High school diploma required; further education is beneficial
  
 Preferred:
 

 
  Exposure to shipping, inventory management, repair tracking, or warranty workflows
  Experience with MASS or related ERP systems
 
 
 
 
 Equal Opportunity Employer / Disabled / Protected Veterans

description:
Build your Career with an Industry Leader
 As the global leader of premium labels, MCC helps brands stand out in competitive markets and inspire positive consumer experiences. Backed by over a century of printing experience, MCC is focused on the future by developing consumer-driven innovations and sustainable packaging solutions. Working for our team, you can truly make a difference.

Comply with quality assurance specifications of the customer and MCC including but not limited to handling procedures, paperwork requirements, etc. Compliance with all data integrity, product safety, and GMP standards required.

title: Blood Collection Staff - Customer Service
description:
We provide Paid-Training – no prior medical experience required!
Joining The American Red Cross is like nothing else – it’s as much something you feel as something you do. You become a vital part of the world’s largest humanitarian network. Joining a team of welcoming individuals who are exceptional, yet unassuming. Diverse, yet uncompromising in unity. You grow your career within a movement that matters, where success is measured in people helped, communities made whole, and individuals equipped to never stop changing lives and situations for the better.
When you choose to be a force for good, you’ll have mentors who empower your growth along a purposeful career path. You align your life’s work with an ongoing mission that’s bigger than all of us. As you care for others, you’re cared for with competitive compensation and benefits. You join a community that respects who you are away from work as much as what you do while at work.
Where Your Career is a Force for Good!
WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW (Job Overview):
When you join our team you will be utilizing your healthcare and/or customer service skills to assist with every step of the blood collection process. This includes collaborating with your team to transport and setup equipment at the collection sites in local communities, creating a welcoming and comfortable environment for volunteer donors, and following all safety procedures while collecting lifesaving blood donations that are delivered to hospitals. 
The Red Cross offers paid phlebotomy training with the ability to grow your healthcare skills and career within the nation’s top humanitarian organization. To learn more about being a phlebotomist and the impact you can make in this position, watch this short video: rdcrss.org/lifesavingrole
WHERE YOUR CAREER IS A FORCE FOR GOOD (Key Responsibilities):

 Take the time to personally connect with donors – listen to their stories and help them understand how impactful their donation is.
 Collaborate with your teammates to create a welcoming and friendly environment so our volunteer donors feel comfortable coming back again and again.
 Be detailed oriented all day, every day. This ensures that the blood you collect meets goals, regulatory requirements and can be safely transfused
 May drive Red Cross vehicles and you will work with the team to setup and tear down equipment at the donation sites. Position may require a minimum height of 60 inches to ensure the ability to safely operate Red Cross vehicles.

Standard Schedule (Madison, Wisconsin): 

 Variable schedule Monday-Friday with occasional Saturdays
 Two Consecutive Days Off
 To best meet the needs of our donors and community, staff work a variable schedule which may include early mornings, late nights, weekends and holidays. Overnight travel may be required in some locations.
 Schedule is provided two to three weeks in advance

Pay Information: 

 Starting rate $20.72/hour (Entry-Level), $25.06/hour (LPN License), $30.09/hour (RN License)

WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED (Minimum Qualifications):

 High school diploma or equivalent required
 Customer service experience and effective verbal communication skills are required
 A current, valid driver's license with good driving record is required.
 Physical requirements may include the ability to lift, push or pull heavy weights up and down ramps and stairs, good manual dexterity, the ability to sit or stand for long periods of time and adapt to long, irregular hours and frequent schedule changes is required. Position may require minimum height of 60 inches to ensure the ability to safely operate Red Cross vehicles.
 At the American Red Cross, we conduct many mobile blood drives at businesses, schools and many other locations. All staff work as a team to setup and tear down the equipment required to conduct a mobile blood drive.
 Basic computer skills are required. Must be proficient with Microsoft office applications.

WHAT WILL GIVE YOU THE COMPETITIVE EDGE (Preferred Qualifications):

 Prior healthcare or phlebotomy experience (CNA, MA, EMT etc.)
 Prior leadership experience

BENEFITS FOR YOU:
As a mission-based organization, we believe our team needs great support to do great work. Our comprehensive package includes:

 Medical, Dental, and Vision plans
 Health Spending Accounts & Flexible Spending Accounts
 PTO: Starting 15 days a year; based on type of job and tenure
 Holidays: 11 paid holidays comprised of six core holidays and five floating holidays
 401K with up to 6% company match
 Paid Family Leave
 Employee Assistance
 Disability and Insurance: Short + Long Term
 Service Awards and recognition

The American Red Cross is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $20.72 - $30.09 per hour
Benefits:

 401(k)
 401(k) matching
 Dental insurance
 Disability insurance

title: Customer Service Representative
description:
We are looking for an Customer Service Representative to join our business development and acquisitions firm. We are known for the reliable and superior customer service our team provides. The Customer Service Representative is someone who will push boundaries and make a profound impact with our clients. We are seeking an Customer Service Representative who enjoys meeting new challenges and surpassing customer service, support, and sales expectations within an industry.
The Customer Service Representative's primary focus is to foster professional relationships to generate repeat business and increase company revenue. They will focus on acquiring new customer acquisitions and additional revenue streams to increase profit margins and expand our market. Our business provides customers with the best services that meet their desired individual needs. If you are interested in stepping into a long-term career with the opportunity to learn various skills within the business industry, then this Customer Service Representative position is for you!
Overview of the Customer Service Representative Responsibilities: 

 Initiate with customers by working alongside our customer service and sales team members to expand the customer base and generate company revenue
 Engage with customers face to face and offer tailored services that exceed their expectations of provided by our client
 Provide support to each customer answer any inquiries, troubleshooting services, and ensuring each delivery is met on time to complete the customers experience
 Process all sales orders for customers on service they are interested in
 Obtain a comprehensive and extensive knowledge of products and promotions by attending weekly team meetings
 Ensure all operations are under company compliance guidelines
 Acquire new and existing customers information in a professional manner that builds customer trust and loyalty
 Work closely with other team members and departments to drive sales and consumer acquisitions while maintaining superior customer service

Customer Service Representative Requirements:

 Experience in a customer service, customer support or similar role is preferred
 Ability to handle customer information and data in a responsible manner
 Active listening to be the primary point of contact for each customer and provide essential customer support
 Proven ability to problem-solve on the spot, multitask to manage multiple accounts
 Practical communication skills when working with customers in an immediate setting
 Attention to detail

title: Customer Service Representative
description:
About Atrium: 
 What you do matters. As a people-centric organization, we foster an environment of collaboration, high performance, and innovation where your talents are valued and your achievements are celebrated. Join us and become part of an inclusive team. 
 
 Client Overview: 
 Our client is a privately-owned manufacturing company that specializes in the food and beverage industry. They are the leading provider in the industry, have state-of-the-art facilities, and customer application centers throughout the USA. Their team is now looking for a Vendor Management Specialist! 
 
 Salary/Hourly Rate: 
 $23/hr - $26/hr 
 
 Position Overview: 
 The Vendor Management Specialist will work with account managers, sales, supply chain, and accounting on fulfilling orders, pricing, assessing inventory, and tracking shipments for current vendors and new customers. 
 
 Responsibilities of the Vendor Management Specialist:
 
  Review pricing, lead times, product availability, and shipping status to ensure accurate and timely order processing.
  Establish and maintain positive relationships with customers to enhance satisfaction and loyalty.
  Update and manage customer information in the company's CRM system.
  Respond promptly and professionally to emails, inquiries, and complaints, following up as necessary to ensure complete customer satisfaction.
  Review the open order report daily, notifying customers of any changes and addressing concerns proactively.
  Initiate Return Authorizations or Credit Memos as necessary and follow up until resolution.
  Record customer interactions, including inquiries, complaints, and actions taken.
  Collaborate with Sales Account Managers on pricing and specific requirements to ensure customer satisfaction and retention.
 Required Experience/Skills for the Vendor Management Specialist:
 
  3 to 5 years minimum Customer Service experience is a must.
  Prior experience in a manufacturing environment.
  Experience with ERP systems and proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite.
 Preferred Experience/Skills for the Vendor Management Specialist:
 
  3 to 5 years of office administrative experience.
  High volume order entry experience within a procurement department.
  Excellent oral and written communication skills.
 Education Requirements:
 
  Associate degree preferred and/or equivalent work experience.
 Benefits:
 
  Atrium Care Package available, upon eligibility (including healthcare plans, discount programs, and paid time off).
 By applying to this job, you agree to receive calls, AI-generated calls, text messages, and/or emails from Atrium and its affiliates, and contracted partners. Frequency varies for text messages. Message and data rates may apply. Carriers are not liable for delayed or undelivered messages. You can reply STOP to opt out on any message you receive. For more details, please review our Terms of Use and Privacy Policy . 
 
 As a woman-owned firm, we value diversity. We are an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer and will consider all applications without regard to race, sex (including gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation and gender identity), age, color, religion or creed, national origin or ancestry, veteran status, disability (physical or mental), genetic information, citizenship or any other characteristic protected by law. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Candidates who apply for roles through the Atrium website will be added to our candidate pool and may be considered for additional roles of a similar title. title: Customer Success Specialist
description:
Customer Support Specialist, Job, Customer Service, Full-Time, Nashville, TN
               ***DAY SHIFT THIS ROLE IS ONSITE M-F
              Our Company is experiencing tremendous growth and exciting career opportunities. Because of our growth, we are looking to add an additional team member to our Customer Service Team with our Sales department. Our company has been in business for more than 50 years manufacturing, installing and servicing air filtration products for commercial and industrial applications. We are based in Nashville, TN, but serve a nationally recognized customer base in 48 states.
              This position is responsible for assisting with all aspects of client relationships to the overall delivery of on-point customer account satisfaction and effective use of products and services. Work directly with clients to provide day to day account support, problem resolution, research, and analysis. Responsible for the overall management of a book of assigned accounts. Spend a lot of time with the client and also interfacing with the client as needed. The ideal candidate is a professional and organized self-starter with exceptional communication skills who can manage multiple projects, work well under pressure, solve problems, and conduct themselves professionally with co-workers and vendors alike.
              
              
 Job Responsibilities:
              
               Set-up and implement new customer accounts to ensure a smooth start to the customer’s program.
               Compiling information and data from multiple internal and external sources and data bases to create accurate and timely reports.
               Collaborating with customer using defined processes, expertise and judgment to ensure customer satisfaction.
               Establishing rapport with the customer in a professional, polite, positive and courteous manner
               Projecting professionalism and sincerity through verbal and written communication.
               Handle multiple vendor accounts.
               Fast pace environment. Timely follow up expected.
               Take incoming calls from Customers and our Service Technicians in the field that may need immediate attention.
               Superior customer service skills are required, with the ability to react quickly and decisively to resolve customer issues in a professional manner.
               Ability to work calmly in a fast-paced team environment; manage special projects without compromising other responsibilities.
               Liaising with internal departments using good communication skills to ensure the assigned client’s needs are satisfied by raising and resolving areas of concern and ensuring all are aware of changes within clients.
              
               Job Requirements:
              
               1-3 plus years of customer account/customer service experience.
               Possess strong proficiency in use of Microsoft Office software, especially Excel (must be skilled in developing spreadsheets, and charts, utilizing pivot tables and V Look-up)
               Associates Degree in business or related field preferred. B.S. Degree desirable
               Experience with Microsoft Dynamics and Microsoft CRM or similar Client Relationship Management system is a plus
               Experience with work order platforms such as Service Channel, fmPilot2, Corrigo, or other comparable systems.
               Excellent oral and written communication skills
               Proven record of managing multiple accounts and projects simultaneously
               Excellent planning and organizational skills
              
              
              
 As an employee, you can feel confident that your health and well-being are among our highest priorities. We offer a competitive salary and benefits plan that includes; Medical, Dental, Vision, Prescription Drug, Life Insurance, 401K Savings Plan, and Paid Time Off (PTO).
               Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Customer Service Representative
description:
Staff Management Group is seeking a Customer Service Representative for our client in Elizabeth, NJ. Please read the ENTIRE job description and ALL of the job requirements BEFORE applying for this position.
 
 
 Schedule:
 
  1st Shift: 8:30AM - 5PM
  Monday - Friday
  Plus Overtime

  $24 / hour
 
 
 
 Job Summary:
 We are seeking a Customer Service Representative to join our order management team. This full-time, on-site role is responsible for entering customer orders, resolving inquiries, and providing professional, proactive service to clients, sales reps, and third-party vendors. Ideal candidates will bring strong communication, problem-solving, and organizational skills in a sales-driven or customer-focused environment.
 
 
 Job Responsibilities:
 
  Accurately enter customer orders in compliance with company policies and procedures
  Handle incoming calls and emails in a professional, friendly, and timely manner
  Confirm customer-specific pricing to ensure accuracy and transparency
  Communicate proactively with customers to address inquiries and resolve issues
  Collaborate closely with sales representatives and brokers to exceed service expectations
  Provide timely feedback to management and sales teams regarding service issues or customer concerns
  Coordinate order releases with third-party warehouses and maintain daily communication
  Work with internal departments to resolve pricing discrepancies and customer requests
  Maintain a positive, customer-first attitude while managing multiple tasks independently
  Support overall team efforts to ensure a high level of customer satisfaction
 
 
 
 Job Requirements:
 
  MUST be bilingual - English AND Spanish
  Associate degree or equivalent work experience in customer service (sales-driven setting preferred)
  Proficient in Microsoft Office; willing to learn additional software programs
  Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to handle challenging situations professionally
  Exceptional verbal and written communication, organizational, and interpersonal skills
  Solid math, typing, and data entry skills; ability to perform basic arithmetic operations
 
 
 
 Additional Information
 Staff Management Group is an equal employment opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without unlawful discrimination based on race, color, creed, national origin, sex, age, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, or citizenship status.
 
 
 About Staff Management Group: Staff Management Group has over 30 years of experience placing staffing candidates in distribution, manufacturing, production, assembly, and clerical positions. Staff Management Group is one of New Jersey’s leading staffing and recruiting agencies specializing in light industrial and clerical staffing. Come join the team!

title: Customer Service Representative
description:
Description:
The Customer Service Representative is a key liaison between the sales team, production, customers and technical support staff.
Resolves general customer enquiries by clarifying issues on part numbers, price, delivery dates and general product enquiries. Follows up to ensure resolution and customer satisfaction. Works with manufacturing and shipping to fast track orders to meet customer demand.
Confident in assessing the customer needs and canvassing relevant department for information as needed, Solid work ethic in successfully completing tasks by being dependable, responsible contributor committed to excellence and success
Duties and Responsibilities 
Essential Job Functions:

 Handle incoming/outgoing calls:

- Process orders via phone, fax, or email

- Expedite customer purchase orders
- Deal with customer's requests for:
* Ship & Delivery status

* Freight Tracking

- Quality on processing/tracking non-conformances returns to vendors

- Open orders
- Lead times

- As needed

- Answer phones when receptionist is not available

Note: This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by this employee. He or she will be required to follow any other instructions and to perform any other duties requested by his or her supervisor.

 Informed understanding of Global Shop Software relating to

- Order Entry
- Invoicing

 Strong customer service skills
 Empathy, patience and consistency

Working Conditions

 This is largely a sedentary role; however, some filing is required. This would require the ability to lift files, open filing cabinets and bend or stand as necessary.

Physical and Ergonomic Requirements
