title: Executive Assistant
description:
Executive Assistant– Women’s Care Center Bismarck
Women's Care Center is the nation's largest pregnancy resource center. Founded by a Catholic theologian in 1984, this organization now serves 40,000 women annually from 37 centers in 12 states. Our mission is to help pregnant women choose life for their babies, have healthier pregnancies, become better parents, and take first steps to self-sufficiency.
To help advance our mission, we are seeking an Executive Assistant. This key staff position will ensure smooth daily operations while supporting the Executive Director. This position requires a high level of organization, adaptability, and discretion, as well as the ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Executive Support: Provide administrative support to the Executive Director.

 Use Microsoft Office, Google Workspace, Zoom, and other appropriate technology to develop documents, presentations, and reports.
 Complete a broad variety of administrative tasks that allow the Executive Director to effectively lead the center, including special projects, designing and producing documents, collecting and preparing information for meetings with staff and external stakeholders.
 Serve as primary point of contact for external stakeholders (donors, vendors, community leaders), including those of a highly confidential or critical nature. Prioritize and determine appropriate course of action, referral, or response.
 Schedule, attend, and document meetings with the Executive Director.
 Prepare and coordinate executive correspondence and mailings.
 Preserve, foster, and model a collaborative, positive work environment and external reputation.

Office and Project Management:

 Coordinate office maintenance work with vendors and drive issues to resolution.
 Purchase and replenish office materials and maintain office equipment
 Manage individual projects providing support to staff. Assist team members during times of heavy workload, as needed.
 Participate as needed in special projects and events.
 Provide support during the interviewing and onboarding process, including managing benefits enrollments.

Donor and Community Relations Support:

 Work with Executive Director to plan and execute Luxury Bingo, Giving Hearts Day, and additional outreach events as needed.
 Provide support in sharing the organization’s mission with local churches and community impact groups to generate additional awareness and support.
 Perform basic accounting duties, including simple bookkeeping and banking tasks.
 Become resident expert in our donor databases (Donor Perfect and GiveSmart) ensuring donor and gift information is accurate and input in a timely manner. Demonstrate high level of confidentiality with donor information.
 Assist with managing volunteers who provide support for outreach initiatives.
 Correspond with donors and other stakeholders to share success, express gratitude and invite into mission.

Education: Bachelor’s degree
Experience: Three years’ office management experience preferred, including experience working with executive staff.
Required Skills:

 Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including English usage, grammar, and spelling. Ability to compose general business correspondence and proofread the work of others.
 Expert proficiency with Microsoft Office, Google Workspace, Zoom and related computer technology and office equipment.
 Exceptional organizational skills with attention to detail and the ability to prioritize, manage multiple projects, and meet deadlines.
 High degree of professionalism and strong relationship-building skills in communicating with diverse groups of people: senior executives, staff, donors, community leaders.
 Able to maintain a high level of integrity and discretion in handling confidential information.
 Strong diplomacy skills, with the willingness to give and receive constructive feedback in a respectful and effective manner.
 Problem-solving skills, particularly in reacting to appropriate level of urgency to situations or events that require a quick response or turnaround.
 Self-motivated, proactive, and capable of taking initiative when working independently and as part of a team.
 Embody the five core values critical to the pro-life mission of the Women’s Care Center: commitment to mission, radical hospitality, get it done spirit, servant leadership, and growth minded.

title: Orthodontic Assistant (Madison)
description:
Description: 
  About us:
 Orthodontic Experts is dedicated to quality care and orthodontic excellence, we are a community committed to making a difference in the lives of our patients. We are looking for the best of the best to join our team as a Orthodontic Assistant. We currently have 29 offices in the greater Chicagoland area, Wisconsin, and Indiana. This year we are on track to open additional offices! Our core Values consist of the following:
 
  Accountability
  Continuous Improvement
  Inclusion
  Integrity
  Respect
  Teamwork
  Transparency
 
  We also offer competitive pay!
  Pay Range: $20.00-$28.00 per hour plus monthly bonuses
  Job Description:
 As an Orthodontic Assistant, you will be an integral part of creating beautiful smiles for our patients. You will be part of a dynamic team of orthodontic professionals who are passionate about providing excellent care. You will be responsible for providing support to our Orthodontist and assisting in the chair-side procedures. Your duties will include preparing patients for their treatment, sterilizing instruments, taking digital radiographs, and assisting with laboratory procedures.
  Duties include, but are not limited to:
 
  Prepare patients for orthodontic treatments, such as cleaning teeth, taking X-Rays, and making impressions.
  Examine patient's mouths and take notes of irregularities.
  Assist the orthodontist during procedures, such as adjusting braces and placing orthodontic appliances.
  Manage patient records and update charts.
  Educate patients on proper oral hygiene and orthodontic care.
  Sterilize instruments before and after use.
  Follow safety and infection control protocols.
  Complete Aligner procedures: attachments and adjustments, and scans
  Complete Full Arch Bonding top and bottom, as well as bonding fixed retainers
  Debonding
  Rebonding Brackets
  Using various digital scanners
  Making clear retainers
  Delivering expanders, space maintainers and forsus.
  In the event you are traveling to another clinic, you are required to perform all duties and responsibilities of your role including administrative tasks.
  Participate in Marketing events
  Other tasks as assigned.
  Requirements: 
 
  Orthodontic assisting (1 year required)
  Availability on Saturdays
  High School Diploma of GED
  Certificate of completion for Orthodontic Assistant Courses (preferred)
  Ability to learn quickly and efficiently
  Can multitask
  Be professional, organized, and have strong attention to detail
  Have excellent communication skills.
 
  Working Hours/ Location:
 
  Monday – Wednesday 8:45am – 5:00pm
  Thursday & Friday 6:45am – 3:00pm
  2 Saturdays per month
   1710 Eagan Rd , Madison, WI 53704
 
 
 
 Benefits (for our part-time employees):
 
  Employee Assistance Program
  Free and discounted Orthodontic Treatment
  Monthly bonuses
  Vacation Rental (After 1 year of employment)
  Two paid Holidays off per year (Thanksgiving & Christmas)

  Uline, a family-owned company, is North America’s leading distributor of shipping, industrial, and packaging materials with over 9,000 employees across 14 locations.

title: Treasury Management Assistant I or II
description:
ANB Bank has financial strength embodied in $3 billion in assets and is a true community bank with an unwavering commitment to excellence. The bank helps each of its communities prosper through investment, sponsorship, philanthropy, and employee volunteerism. It is a passion ANB has for banking that makes a difference.

 
 ANB Bank hires individuals who provide excellent customer service and build meaningful relationships with our customers and within our communities. ANB is committed to rewarding our team members who strengthen our company and culture. ANB offers competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package for this position.

 
  Hiring Pay Ranges: $20.25 - $26.25 per hour (Includes $1.00 per hour Cost of Living Adjustment)
 
  Treasury Management Assistant I - $20.25 - $23.63 per hour
  Treasury Management Assistant II - $21.50 - $26.25 per hour 
   
    This position may be eligible to receive an additional $1.00 per hour is approved for the Spanish Communication Assistant Program
    The hiring pay range for this position is commensurate with the level of relevant experience and education.
   
 

 
  Health & Wellness Benefits (Subject to Eligibility Requirements)
 
  Minimum 4 Weeks of Paid Time Off (PTO)
  11 Paid Holidays
  Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance
  Health Savings (HSA), Flexible Spending (FSA), and dependent care spending accounts
  Company provided Live, AD&D, and Disability Insurance with supplementation options
  401(k) plan with discretionary company match and profit sharing
  Discretionary annual bonus and employee referral incentives
  Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
  Tuition Reimbursement Program
  Spanish Communication Assistant Program Incentive
  Employee Banking Products
 

 
  Summary
 
  Responsible for supporting and developing Treasury Management customers to include the following: opens accounts, sells/cross-sells Treasury Management products/services along with other bank products/services, and resolves complex customer service issues. Supports the sales and service goals for the assigned region. Proactively seeks new customers through referrals and prospecting. In addition, a Treasury Management Assistant may assist in the following: general customer service; supporting the Treasury Management Department by preparing documents for opening new accounts or making changes to existing Treasury Management agreements and updating the various departments (EBU, Lockbox, Positive Pay, eDeposit) accordingly. Maintains a thorough understanding of Treasury Management products. Some on-site customer interaction and product implementation may also be required.
 

 
  Essential Duties and Responsibilities
 
  Produces agreements or other documentation necessary for all Treasury Management Products/Services and updates the various departments (EBU, Lockbox, Positive Pay, eDeposit) accordingly.
  Performs necessary computer system maintenance and set up for new accounts and changes to existing accounts.
  Responds to customer inquiries and requests including, but not limited to, telephone transfers, wire transfers, Cashier’s checks, ordering banking product/supplies, stop payments, closing accounts, account maintenance, and providing interim statements.
  Provides administrative support for Treasury Management Officers.
  Services large complex depository relationships. Assists customers with general questions regarding all facets of Treasury Management products and services including positive pay, e-deposit, lockbox, repurchase accounts, and account analysis.
  Responsible for relationship management and business development through cross-selling of Treasury Management products and services.
  Captures and ensures proper set-up of Treasury Management product revenue.
  Maintains a thorough understanding of Treasury Management products.
  Identifies cross-selling and referral opportunities to broaden customer banking relationships.
  Identifies, mitigates, and prevents fraud risk.
  Supports the sales and service goals for the assigned region.
  Proactively seeks new customers through referrals and prospecting.
  May be required to help with on-site customer installations of treasury products.
  Maintains current knowledge and consistent compliance with Bank Secrecy Act (BSA) requirements, as well as knowledge and consistent compliance with other banking regulations and Bank policies and procedures related to the position.
  Delivers quality of service as defined by department and company standards.
  Maintains confidentiality as defined by department and company standards.
  Supports the company’s Mission, Vision, and Values.
  Other duties as assigned.
 

 
  Education and/or Experience
  Treasury Management Assistant I
 
  Minimum 1 year related banking experience; or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  Excellent attention to detail and accuracy.
  Proficiency in Microsoft Office products.
  Knowledge of banking products, treasury operations and banking regulations.
  To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
 
  Treasury Management Assistant II
 
  Minimum 3 years related banking experience; or an equivalent combination of education and experience for external
  Minimum 2 years related banking experience; or an equivalent combination of education and experience for internal
  Minimum 2 years experience in treasury management or related financial roles.
  Excellent knowledge of banking products, treasury operations, and banking regulations.
  Demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
  Knowledge of treasury management systems, preferred.
  Analytical mindset with a focus on problem-solving and process improvement.
  To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
 

 
  Work Schedule: Monday - Friday, 8:00am - 5:00pm

 
  Equal Opportunity Employer / Affirmative Action / Minorities / Female / Disability / Veteran
 ANB Bank is committed to providing Equal Opportunity in Employment. The Bank is continually trying to improve recruitment, employment, development, and promotional opportunities for its employees. Our selection decisions are based on job-related factors and not on the basis of age, race, sex, color, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, pregnancy, marital status, genetic information, gender identity, or any other status protected by federal, state, or local law.
 ANB Bank complies with the Equal Pay for Equal Work Act. ANB Bank requests that Applicant not disclose its wage history to ANB Bank. If ANB Bank for any reason comes into possession of Applicant's wage rate history, ANB Bank will not rely on it in determining a wage rate. ANB Bank requests that Applicant not provide information on age, date of birth, or graduation date from any academic institution, including on resumes.
  Anticipated Date of Application Window Closure: 06/05/2025 (or until filled)

title: Data Entry Associate / Administrative Assistant
description:
DATA ENTRY ASSOCIATE / ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANT
Since 1989, Defense Technology Equipment Inc. has been highly specialized in logistic military procurement in the fields of military aerospace and aviation logistic support. With offices strategically located only fifteen minutes from Washington D.C. and a distribution center and warehouse five minutes from Washington-Dulles International Airport, we have the capability to provide our customers with technical support and aircraft on the ground (AOG) needs in a short period of time. And our proximity to the airports, U.S. Government agencies, the U.S. Department of Defense, and worldwide Embassies Military Attaches' Procurement Offices enables us to work closely, personally and efficiently with our clients.
As the Data Entry Associate, you will utilize your skills and talents to successfully perform the following responsibilities, which will include but not be limited to:

 Enter requests for quotes into ERP system.
 Work closely with sales team to ensure that information received from client for price request is complete.
 Submit requests for parts to vendors and maintain follow up until quotes are received.
 Enter final quote information into database and present to sales representative for review.

 Strong written/verbal communication skills.
 Strong organizational skills and attention to detail are key in this role.
 Ability to prioritize and multitask.

 At least one year of experience as a Data Entry Clerk.
 High School Diploma or GED.
 Bilingual in Spanish, French or Portuguese is a plus.
 Aviation Industry knowledge highly desirable.
 Salary level dependent upon qualifications.

Our commitment to your success is enhanced by our competitive compensation and an extensive benefits package including paid time off, medical, dental and vision benefits and future growth opportunities within the company. Plus, we work to maintain the best possible environment for our employees, where people can learn and grow with the company. We strive to provide a collaborative, creative environment where each person feels encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning and culture.

title: Data Entry Specialist
description:
Data Entry Specialist
  
  
   #AM
  
  
   
    Who We Are
   
   
    Our employees consistently rate Grant Associates as a great place to work, and often recommend open positions to friends. We are a culturally diverse company with competitive benefits, frequent opportunities for growth and change, training, and fun activities! We provide: Competitive wages for high performance • 11 Paid Holidays • PTO • Tuition reimbursement • Guided Professional Development Plans • Summer Fridays • Weekly Wellness Sessions • Medical/Vision/ Dental • Employer Paid Life Insurance • Employer 401k Contributions • Employee Referral Bonus • Employee Assistance Programs •Company Picnics • Volunteer Experiences • Access to Free Financial Counseling
   
   
   
    Innovation and a culture of continuous improvement are built into the fabric of our company. Staff have an opportunity to improve themselves and our company by joining our Fit Forward, Culture, Innovation, and Green teams.
   
   
   
    Description
   
   
    The PA EARN Program, operated by Grant Associates, is seeking a Data Entry Specialist to support program operations through accurate data management and documentation. This role includes compiling and quality-checking monthly invoicing documents, processing transportation stipends using MS Dynamics, and maintaining both manual and electronic filing systems. The Data Entry Specialist will ensure confidentiality, support reporting needs, and contribute to the overall efficiency of the program through detailed organization and administrative support.
   
   
   
    Responsibilities
   
   
    Compiles, quality check and sorts monthly invoicing documentation for program compensation and reimbursement.
    Assist with regular reports and tracking sheets of invoiced compensation/reimbursement payments.
    Assist with writing and recording a high volume of checks for customer transportation stipends on a weekly basis using MS Dynamics software.
    Maintains employer confidence and protects operations by keeping all information confidential
    Ensure that all items are properly numbered, tagged and stored in designated locations
    Maintains data entry requirements by following data techniques and procedures; reporting needed changes
    Responsible for organizing a volume of files both manually and electronically
    Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed
    Respond to requests for information and access relevant files
    Operate high volume scanners and copy machines

title: Customs Administrative Assistant / Customs Clerk (Entry-Level)
description:
Pacific Customs Brokers has been in business for over 65 years, and we are always looking for our next generation of brokers. Looking for a new career in a stable industry with plenty of growth opportunities? Consider starting your new journey as a Customs Administrative Assistant / Customs Clerk, where you will play an important role in the import clearance process.
What We Do
We are an integral player in the supply chain and are best known for our brokerage services. We assist importers by ensuring their shipment paperwork is complete and meets US requirements. We then make an electronic declaration on their behalf to the government to allow their goods to enter the country.
But that’s not all we do! We are passionate about international trade and also offer advisory services to the business community. We help companies navigate trade agreements, determine the value of their goods, and pass any other hurdles they may encounter bringing goods into this country.
Why Work With Us
Our success is due to the dedicated and knowledgeable staff who work here. We offer stable employment in a growing industry, competitive wages, excellent benefits, and room for growth. Many of our trade advisors and compliance specialists started as Customs Administrative Assistants, and we promote (and pay for) additional education that supports your career growth.
Because international trade is a 24/7/365 business, this role is on a shift-based schedule, with time assignments which will vary and will include days, afternoons, and at times overnights. This is not a Monday to Friday daytime job, and the shift will also usually include a Saturday and/or Sunday. Shift schedules will be assigned at least a month in advance and employees will always be full-time.
Requirements:

 Available for days/afternoons/evenings, including at least one weekend day
 Typing speed of 35 WPM or better
 Professional telephone etiquette (previous reception and/or CSR experience is an asset)
 Administrative experience (i.e. filing, scanning, data entry) is beneficial
 Ability to complete physical tasks such as sitting, bending, and crouching
 Must be able to speak, read, and write English at a professional level
 Must be in the US and have the right to work at the time of application. Applications from outside the US will not be considered. Out-of-state applicants should indicate their planned date of arrival to the Blaine area
 Foreign placement agencies need not contact.

We Offer:

 Starting wage of $19.40 plus shift premiums (i.e. additional $1.50 per hour for any hours worked between 6 pm and 11 pm and additional $2.50 for any hours worked between 11 pm and 5 am)
 Full-time employment (40 hours/week)
 Employees (and their families) are covered by Medical, Dental, and Vision Benefits
 Employees are covered by Life Insurance, can enroll in our company's 401K plan, and can participate in profit-sharing.
 Employees are eligible for 10 paid vacation days (following the first year of employment) and 11 paid holidays (following 30 days of employment)
 Education Support
 Growth and Development Opportunities
 and more!

Candidates with previous administrative or customer service experience are encouraged to apply. Submit your resume and cover letter via Indeed or directly on our website.
Principals only. No agents or recruiters need contact.

title: Executive Administrative Assistant – Mission Division
description:
Description 
 The Executive Administrative Assistant – Mission Division will Provide administrative and operational support for a Vice President of the College; perform complex support staff duties which require a high degree of decision-making and independence of action. Confidentiality is held in highest regard.
 The Executive Administrative Assistant – Mission Division will manage schedules and correspondence to organizing meetings and maintaining confidentiality, taking minutes , preparing materials for presentation to the Board of Trustees, and maintaining an accurate calendar of the Vice President’s time. This position will serve as initial contact for wedding inquiries , prioritize correspondence requiring action by the Vice President, and is responsible for representing the Vice President to the general public, which includes welcoming and screening visitors and handling all phone calls appropriately and accurately with a high degree of patience and courtesy.
 The Executive Administrative Assistant – Mission Division will ready files and other relevant documents prior to meetings / appointments, act as the senior support staff member of the divisional staff, and initiates all appropriate paperwork such as travel requests, check requests, purchase orders, key requests, etc. This position will keep accurate and current filing system and schedules meeting space for committee meetings, and k eeps abreast of relevant campus events and news.
 The Executive Administrative Assistant – Mission Division will understand travel needs and makes appropriate travel arrangements for the Vice President, provide review of and assistance with division budgets including all operating, endowed and restricted accounts, and provide support for the Division for Mission, assists with special projects of the Center for Faith, Action, and Ministry and the Center for the Study of Spirituality. This position will creatively des ign posters for campus-wide events and works with College Marketing and Communications departments to develop other material for publication, Create and maintain the division's web pages and internal portal pages, and coordinate various programs and events.
 The above is intended to describe the general content of and requirements for the performance of this job. It is not to be construed as an exhaustive statement of duties, responsibilities and requirements .
 Minimum Qualifications 
 
  Education and/or experience equivalent to a high school diploma.
  At l east six years of increasingly responsible secretarial experience of a qualifying nature.
  The ability to accurately and efficiently operate a personal computer for word processing, spreadsheet and desktop publishing, as well as familiarity with e-mail and the Internet. Budget management.
  Extensive knowledge of MS Office and Google Platforms
  Exemplary planning and time management skills
  High-level verbal and written communications skills
  The ability to maintain positive interpersonal relationships with students, faculty, staff and the public.
 
 Preferred Qualifications 
 
  The demonstrated sensitivity to college concerns, issues and operations, especially as they related to the issues of college students and other areas within the jurisdiction of the Vice President.
  The demonstrated capacity to deal with confidential and sensitive data and exercise good judgment in handling information of this type.
  The demonstrated ability to supervise administrative functions in an independent and effective manner.
  The ability to act as an administrative aid in areas of research, correspondence and planning.
  The ability to exercise judgment to determine issues that may be emergencies or high priority issues that need immediate solutions or attention versus things of lesser importance
 
 Schedule 
 40 Hours/ 12 Months/ Monday – Friday

title: Administrative Assistant 1
description:
JOB 
Are you an enthusiastic individual with strong organizational abilities? The Department of Environmental Protection is eager to find a candidate who fits this description! We are in search of a meticulous Administrative Assistant 1 to become a vital part of our team. This position demands a person who can efficiently manage a variety of administrative responsibilities while maintaining a high level of effectiveness. If you are excited about the prospect of embracing this rewarding opportunity and playing a key role in our team's achievements, we encourage you to submit your application today! 

 EXAMPLE OF DUTIES 
In this position, you will be responsible for the review and issuance of mine operator license applications and their renewals, ensuring compliance with both technical and non-technical requirements. This involves engaging with applicants through phone calls and emails to address any deficiencies, discrepancies, or inquiries related to their applications. Additionally, you will assess insurance certificates, verifying that they meet the necessary legal standards regarding coverage types, documentation accuracy, and required coverage amounts. Your role is crucial in maintaining the integrity of the licensing process and ensuring that all operators adhere to regulatory standards.Interested in learning more? Additional details regarding this position can be found in the position description.Work Schedule and Additional Information: Full-time employmentWork hours are 8:00 AM to 4:30 PM, Monday - Friday, with a 60-minute lunch.Telework: You may have the opportunity to work from home (telework) part-time, up to 3 days per week. In order to telework, you must have a securely configured high-speed internet connection and work from an approved location inside Pennsylvania. If you are unable to telework, you will have the option to report to the headquarters office in Harrisburg.Salary: In some cases, the starting salary may be non-negotiable.You will receive further communication regarding this position via email. Check your email, including spam/junk folders, for these notices. 

 SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION 
Completing the application, including all supplemental questions, serves as your exam for this position. No additional exam is required at a test center (also referred to as a written exam).Your score is based on the detailed information you provide on your application and in response to the supplemental questions. Your score is valid for this specific posting only.You must provide complete and accurate information or: your score may be lower than deserved.you may be disqualified.You may only apply/test once for this posting.Your results will be provided via email.

title: Technical Service Specialist
description:
Full Time Equipment Installation & Troubleshoots/Repairs instruments and control circuits
   
   
 Salary Range: $25.00 To $32.00 Hourly
   
   
 Up to 90% Travel, any where in USA
   
   
 About Us
   Meurer Research (MRI) is a brand within Parkson Corporation. MRI engineers and manufactures advanced water and wastewater treatment equipment to solve complex issues facing treatment facilities worldwide. Our products include Inclined Plate Settlers, Hoseless Cable-Vac™ and Ultra-Scraper Sludge Collectors, flocculation systems, mixers, baffles, pilot systems, and package systems. MRI holds over 50 patents and has worked on over 5,000 installations cleaning more than 5 billion gallons of water each day.
   
   
 Position Description:
   Services products and equipment as assigned. Starts up, identifies, analyzes, and repairs instruments and products at customer’s location. Performs preventative maintenance, site surveys, installations and modifications as needed or requested by customers. Performs training at customer site. Troubleshoots basic control circuits. Determines parts to order for repairs and timeliness of need.
   
   
 Essential Functions:
   
     Equipment Installation & Maintenance: Install, commission, and maintain water/wastewater treatment systems, pumps, valves, PLCs, HMIs, Controls, and related components.
     Troubleshooting & Repairs: Diagnose and resolve operational and process issues with mechanical, electrical, and chemical treatment systems.
     Field Support: Liaise with customer to provide on-site technical support, site surveys, inspections, maintenance of our equipment for water/wastewater treatment facilities, and provide feedback to Business Units for continuous improvement.
     Customer Training: Educate clients on proper equipment use, routine maintenance, and troubleshooting techniques.
     Regulatory Compliance: Ensure all work complies with local, state, and federal environmental regulations and safety standards.
     Documentation & Reporting: Maintain accurate service records, complete work orders, and provide detailed reports on equipment performance and issues.
   
   Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.
   
   
 Education:
   
    
     Associate or Bachelor degree in Environmental Science, Engineering, Mechanical/Electrical Technology, or a 5+ years related field preferred
    
   
    Experience:
   
    2 years technical training in Controls/Programming
    5+ years operation/troubleshooting experience in Water and/or Wastewater industry
    3 – 5 years of Field Service experience
    Experience with ISO9001 requirements is desirable
   
   
   
 Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:
   
    Strong understanding of Water/Wastewater treatment processes, pumps, motors, SCADA systems, PLC/HMI products and associated programming
    Thorough electrical knowledge of Control Panels and VFDs
    Ability to read and understand mechanical and technical drawings
    Excellent written and verbal skill
    Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to multi-task
    Computer skills in Microsoft Office Suite
   
   
   
 Licenses and/or Certifications:
   
    
     None Required
    
   
   
   
 Travel:
   
    
     Ability to travel up to 90%
    
   
   
   
 Benefits include health care (medical, dental, vision) with coverage starting on the first day of employment as well as 401(k) with company match and holiday pay.
   
   
 Parkson Corporation is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Parkson Corporation is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

title: Controls Technician
description:
Competencies:
 
  Communication
  Quality
  Results Driven
  Safety
  Technical Skills
 
 
 
 Supervisory Responsibilities:
 This position does not have any supervisory responsibilities.
 
 
 Position Summary
 The Specialist -Control Technician will manage and assist with PLC and automated systems troubleshooting and maintenance. The technician will also assist with installation, implementation, and troubleshooting of newly designed systems. They are responsible for managing work orders and projects. They may be responsible for delegating some workload as needed and ensure work orders are completely fully and timely.
 
 
 Key Responsibilities
 
  Work with the order system to manage assigned work orders
  Ensure assigned work orders are completed in a timely fashion
  Troubleshoot problems in electrical control panels, sensors, and other automation hardware
  Delegate work as appropriate to assistant technicians to ensure proper completion of work
  Manage and execute projects to ensure completion by desired deadlines
  Responsible for cross-departmental communication to ensure jobs are completed
  Respond to all necessary communications such as via email and phone calls for support across the greenhouse
  Maintain the operation of PLC/Argus systems, making programming changes as required
  Monitor PLC/Argus systems for alarms and correct issues expediently as they arise
  Other duties as assigned by management
 
 
 
 Minimum Qualifications
 
  Proficient in Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel).
  Basic knowledge of hand and power tools.
  Understanding of electrical control circuits and hardware (relays, contactors, overloads, switches, etc.)
  Experience using multimeters (voltmeter, amp meter, Megger, etc.)
  Ability to make minor and/or major modifications to PLC/Argus programs as requested.
  1 to 3 years of experience in a similar role.
 
 
 
 Preferred Qualifications
 
  Proficient in working with PLC/Argus system software (GE, Horner, Omron, etc).
  Experience creating and modifying PLC/Argus programs.
  Ability to create HMI/SCADA system screens.
  Proficient in creating schematics and wiring diagrams using Microsoft Visio.
  Experience building control panels based off schematics and wiring diagrams.
  Associate’s degree in electrical engineering, Automation Technology, or a related field preferred.
  Relevant certifications or training in PLC programming, automation systems, or electrical control systems is a plus.
 
 
 
 Job Setting & Physical Demands
 This position is primarily outdoors but may be required to work between locations and within an indoor office environment for administrative duties, which may require the use of computers and standard office equipment. Fluency to read, write, and understand the English language is required. Must be able to work in all outdoor elements, including dust and allergens. Position requires long-term ability for standing, sitting, squatting, bending, reaching, and twisting on a regular basis to fulfill essential duties. Candidate must have the ability to operate all machinery necessary within the department and across the facility, including but not limited to operating the table lifter and get certified and operate on internal vehicles. Candidate will also be regularly required to work at heights above 6 feet.
 
 
 Employee must have the ability to life 35 pounds unaided, and regularly lift up to 80 pounds with assistance.
 
 
 Disclaimer
 This job description indicates in general the nature and levels of work, knowledge, skills, abilities and other essential functions (as covered under the Americans with Disabilities Act) expected of people assigned to this position. It is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities required of the incumbent. All employees may be required to perform activities outside of their normal job responsibilities from time to time as needed.
 
 
 Title VII of the Civil Rights Act protects individuals from employment discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, or gender identity), national origin, age (40 or older), disability, and genetic information.

title: Lab Technician
location: 100 Paper Mill Hill Road, Port Townsend, WA 98368
description:
The Position
The Lab Technician is responsible for taking and preparing samples, testing, analyzing, recording and reporting results of their tests to support mill operations
About Port Townsend Paper Company (PTPC)
The Port Townsend Paper (“PTPC”) mill is proud to have been in continuous operation for more than 90 years. We use a blend of virgin and recycled fibers (Kraft and OCC pulp) to produce Kraft pulp, paper, containerboard, medium and market pulp. We have built a strong and loyal customer base by developing and nurturing strategic partnership-style relationships.
At PTPC we believe that a healthy and safe work environment is fundamental to the success of all employees. We put that belief into practice every day by managing risk and building safety reliability into our processes and procedures. Engaging and empowering our workforce to maintain world-class safety performance is the pathway to achieving operational excellence. We also strive to preserve the environment, be good neighbors, and remain a valued member of the local community. Many of our employees have enjoyed working at PTPC for the greater part of their careers; we have employees with 20, 25, 30, even 35 years of service. PTPC is proud to provide good, prevailing wage jobs on the Olympic Peninsula.
Job Responsibilities

 Perform laboratory tests, experiments and analyses in accordance with established protocol and procedures
 Prepare and maintain laboratory equipment, instruments and materials for experiments and testing
 Certify laboratory testing equipment and instruments are calibrated, ensuring accuracy and reliability of results
 Collect and process samples and data for analysis, recording observations and findings accurately
 Maintain laboratory records, logs, and documentation, ensuring completeness, accuracy, and compliance with regulatory requirements.
 Assist with the development and validation of laboratory methods, procedures, and protocols.
 Conduct quality control checks and assurance procedures to ensure accuracy and reliability of test results.
 Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues and problems related to laboratory equipment, procedures, and processes.
 Follow safety protocols and procedures to ensure a safe and secure working environment
 Comply with regulatory requirements, quality standards, and laboratory policies and procedures.
 Collaborate and provide technical support with technical staff and other departments
 Contribute to the maintenance and cleanliness of the laboratory facilities and workspaces.
 Demonstrate professionalism, integrity, and a commitment to excellence in all aspects of work.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

 Proficient in Microsoft Office applications, including Excel, Outlook, and Word
 Strong mathematical and analytical skills
 Effective verbal and written communication skills
 Familiarity with Six Sigma principles and quality tools is a plus

Required Education and Experience

 High school diploma or equivalent required; associate degree preferred
 1–2 years of laboratory or technical experience, preferably in a manufacturing or industrial setting

Employment Terms

 Full-time, Non-Exempt position
 Salary range: $50,000 to $70,000
 Excellent benefits package including medical, dental, life, and long-term disability insurance.
 Competitive paid vacation plan.
 9 paid holidays and one paid personal holiday per calendar year.


 Retirement plan.
 In compliance with the Immigration and Naturalization Act, proof of authorization to work in the United States will be required at the time of hire.
 Prior to a new hire, a background check including criminal record history will be conducted. Information from the background check will not necessarily preclude employment but will be considered in determining the applicant’s suitability and competence to perform in the position

Port Townsend Paper Company is an equal opportunity employer. We are a drug-free workplace.

title: Junior / Level 1 Helpdesk Technician
description:
The Junior Helpdesk Technician handles the first-level support requests that come in from our Clients. They are the first to touch a helpdesk ticket and make sure that the issue is handled quickly and the Client is informed of what to expect every step of the way. When help is needed the Junior Helpdesk Technician can get help from or escalate issues to other members of the Service Delivery Team.
RESPONSIBILITIES & TASKS
CUSTOMER SERVICE
✓ Providing a first point of contact for customers through our helpdesk, be that via phone,
email, or ticket
✓ Delight our Clients with a Friendly, Quick, and Helpful Experience
✓ Provide the Client with basic remote troubleshooting
USE OF OUR TICKETING SYSTEM
✓ Use our Ticketing System to work on and resolve Helpdesk Tickets & Service Requests
✓ Managing and recording all work through our Ticketing System
✓ Make sure that Client Documentation is well maintained
✓ Split tickets that have several issues into separate tickets.
✓ Make sure that tickets aren’t “stale” throughout the process
USE OF OUR MONITORING & MANAGEMENT TOOL
✓ Review the RMM dashboard and apply remediation actions as indicated by our Processes
✓ Review regularly scheduled/automated actions as indicated by our Processes

title: Electronic Technician
description:
Goleta Aerospace company seeks 3 Electronic Engineering Technicians. Must have 6+ years of solid experience. Must meet ITAR Requirements and pass background and drug test.

 
  Provide input for work instructions and procedures for electronics soldering, assembly and testing.
  Review and interpret complex technical schematics, ensuring accuracy during the build, assembly and testing phases.
  Perform complex soldering and rework, including surface mount assembly for components as small as 0402, with proficiency in handling a wide variety of package types (e.g., QFN, QFP, TSOP, through hole connectors, etc.) under a microscope. J-STD or NASA soldering with space addendum certification preferred.
  Build and test multi-wire cable harnesses, including developing Interface Control Documents (ICDs) and conducting thorough verification testing. IPC or NASA harnessing certification is preferred.
  Participate in the assembly and testing of RF electronics hardware.
  Perform troubleshooting using Test Measurement and Diagnostic Equipment (TMDE), such as vector network analyzers, spectrum analyzers, signal generators, logic analyzers, oscilloscopes, and digital multi-meters.
  Familiarity with reading electrical and RF schematics.
  Perform integration of electronic components in support of rapid prototyping requirements.
  Bachelor's degree in a related field is preferred; relevant experience may be substituted for education.
  8+ years of direct technical experience with electronic systems, including analog, digital, and RF subsystems.
  Strong hands-on experience with RF circuits and systems.
  Experience with soldering & de-soldering using rework tools, such as hot tweezers, hot plates, hot air rework stations and reflow ovens.
  Understanding of, and experience working with, high reliability products within a quality management system.
  Excellent manual dexterity with the ability to handle small parts and fasteners, including sizes as small as #0-80.
  High standard of quality workmanship with attention to detail in assembly, testing, and documentation.
  One of the following certifications: J-001 for soldering, or IPC-6018 or IPC-6010

title: Junior Process Engineer Technician
description:
Our client is currently seeking a Junior Process Engineer Technician to join their team in Camarillo, CA. This position will support both process and product development initiatives through a combination of computer-based tasks and hands-on responsibilities. The ideal candidate will assist with developing, prototyping, and implementing new or enhanced manufacturing processes aimed at improving efficiency, quality, and output. This is an excellent opportunity to join an innovative team and grow within a dynamic manufacturing environment.
The Day-to-Day:

 Generate comprehensive process documentation, testing procedures, and manufacturing protocols.
 Conduct design of experiments (D.O.E) to improve process capability and repeatability.
 Prepare and present data reports, summarize findings, and recommend technical solutions.
 Understand and analyze product/process flows and equipment requirements.
 Identify and troubleshoot factors impacting process performance.
 Perform hands-on experiments and operate manufacturing equipment.
 Create process controls and train personnel in their use.
 Monitor and evaluate ongoing process performance.
 Generate technical reports and communicate findings to cross-functional teams.
 Collaborate with quality teams and assist with MRB disposition.
 Utilize 2D and 3D CAD tools for design work involving CNC, laser machining, circuit boards, and silk-screen artwork.
 Apply SolidWorks and AutoCAD Fusion in support of 3D printing and rapid prototyping projects.
 Use programming languages such as Python and GCODE for CNC machining applications.

Qualifications:

 High School diploma or equivalent is required.
 Associate’s Degree in Engineering Technology, Manufacturing Technology, or related field is required.
 Bachelor’s Degree in a science or engineering discipline (e.g., Ceramics, Materials, Chemical Engineering) is preferred.
 Bilingual in Spanish is preferred.
 At least 1 year of experience working in a manufacturing environment.
 Minimum of 2 years of experience with SolidWorks and AutoCAD.
 Familiarity with CNC programming and 3D printing (filament and resin).
 Proficiency with Microsoft Office 365 (Outlook, Excel, Word, Teams, Project, PowerPoint) and Adobe Acrobat.
 Strong aptitude for diagnosing, maintaining, and repairing mechanical systems.
 Demonstrated success supporting medium- to high-volume manufacturing and improving yield and quality through new product introduction and scale-up.

 $23.00 to $28.00 /hr

title: Engineering Technician
description:
Job Description
 We are seeking a dedicated Engineering Technician responsible for ensuring the smooth operation of all machinery and equipment within our facility. The ideal candidate will possess strong mechanical aptitude and the ability to troubleshoot machinery effectively.
 
  Responsibilities
 
  Ensure all machinery and equipment are running smoothly.
  Read and interpret new equipment/product diagrams.
  Troubleshoot machinery in plant operations.
  Monitor production and document processes in compliance with GMP standards.
 
  Essential Skills
 
  Mechanical aptitude
  Troubleshooting
  Knowledge of electronics
  Experience in chemical production or pharmaceutical manufacturing
 
  Additional Skills & Qualifications
 
  Associates Degree.
  2-3 years of experience in chemical or pharmaceutical manufacturing (preferred industry)
  Exposure to APIs is a plus
 
  Work Environment
 The work environment involves working with teams of four supervisors and a team of technicians. The role requires working four 12-hour shifts in a 2, 3, 2 pattern, with alternating day and night shifts every five weeks. Training will initially occur on the day shift for the first few months. The company offers significant opportunities for growth, including bonuses, stock options, company-paid benefits, and a 6% 401k match.
  Pay and Benefits
 The pay range for this position is $65000.00 - $75000.00/hr.
 Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job

  Transportation benefits
  Employee Assistance Program
  Time Off/Leave (PTO, Vacation or Sick Leave)
 
 
  Workplace Type
 This is a fully onsite position in Richmond,VA.
 
  Application Deadline
 This position is anticipated to close on Jul 29, 2025.

 Actalent is a global leader in engineering and sciences services and talent solutions. We help visionary companies advance their engineering and science initiatives through access to specialized experts who drive scale, innovation and speed to market. With a network of almost 30,000 consultants and more than 4,500 clients across the U.S., Canada, Asia and Europe, Actalent serves many of the Fortune 500.

title: Laboratory Technician
description:
Laboratory Technician
 Indianapolis, IN
 $25/HR
 
 The Laboratory Technician role supports the development and registration of innovative agricultural products through hands-on laboratory, greenhouse, and field-based research. This position plays a key part in generating data used to evaluate new products and improve existing solutions.
 
 Laboratory Technician Responsibilities:
 
  Assist in the planning, execution, and reporting of Fate & Metabolism studies to support product development and regulatory registration.
  Support laboratory testing and data collection according to study protocols and Good Laboratory Practices (GLP).
  Train and mentor technicians, contractors, and student assistants in laboratory procedures and data collection methods.
  Operate and maintain a variety of laboratory instruments including GC, HPLC, LC-MS, balances, centrifuges, and liquid scintillation counters.
  Ensure compliance with all relevant safety standards and regulatory requirements, including EPA GLP standards and NRC protocols for handling radioactive materials.
  Maintain accurate and complete records of experiments and activities.
  Collaborate effectively with internal teams across Regulatory Science and the Fate & Metabolism group.
  
 Laboratory Technician Qualifications:
 
  Bachelor’s degree in Chemistry, Biology, Environmental Science, or a related field, or equivalent relevant experience.
  Basic understanding of chemistry and laboratory techniques; prior experience in a GLP-compliant environment is a plus.
  Familiarity with laboratory instrumentation and data systems.
  Strong organizational and documentation skills.
  Ability to work effectively both independently and in a collaborative team environment.
  Commitment to lab safety and regulatory compliance.

Job Title: Electronic Technician I 
Contract: 6 Months 
Pay Rate: $21.50 /hr. 
Shift Start and End Time : 7am-330pm (Flexible/8 hour shift) 

 Belcan is a leading provider of professional IT, Engineering, Workforce Solutions and staffing in the United States, Canada, UK, Europe, and India. 

 A Electronic Technician I job in Carson, CA is currently available through Belcan. In this role you will be responsible for the design, development and fabrication / procurement of electronic test equipment required during research and development of new product development programs, and the sustaining engineering of test equipment on the production floor. If you are interested in this role, Apply Today! 

 Job Description:
 The Lead Engineering Technician is responsible for the design, development and fabrication / procurement of electronic test equipment required during research and development of new product development programs, and the sustaining engineering of test equipment on the production floor. This role works with the Engineering and Industrialization teams to ensure electronic test equipment is appropriately designed and built according to program requirements and ensuring the maintenance of these equipment and its functionality to support ATP testing. Directly supports the production floor in the sustaining and safe operations of the electronic test equipment. Works with suppliers and vendors for procurement, maintenance services to the test equipment, and supports maintenance and storage protocols of all electronic equipment. 

 Summary of Duties:
 1. Work with the Engineering and Industrialization teams to ensure electronic test equipment, tooling, jigs, fixtures, and special gauges for specific product types are designed and implemented to meet program requirements. 
2. Supports the specification, design, fabrication / procurement and commissioning of new equipment to support program objectives of delivery, cost, quality and safety. 
3. Directly supports the production lines in troubleshooting and resolving electronic testing equipment issues and maintenance needs, such as test box repair, wire harness fabrication and repair, coordinating outside services for equipment review and repair. 
4. Ensures tooling maintenance and storage protocols and verify plans for all equipment in accordance with Cabin tooling standards. 
5. Collaborate with other engineering disciplines and supply chain to procure equipment to support program requirements, or to procure necessary components for in-house fabrication of the test equipment. 
6. Coordinate with Facilities and Industrialization teams to ensure that necessary production floor space and support are available for the commissioning of new test equipment. 
7. Leads smaller projects in the maintenance and spare parts inventory of electronic testing equipment and its components to support production sustaining engineering. 
8. Maintenance and upkeep of the Industrialization Tooling and Testing room. 
9. Fundamental application of design, development, procurement, maintenance and storage procedures. 
10. Perform all other duties as assigned. 

 Qualifications:
 Education: Minimum of High School education. 

 Experience: Up to 15 years related experience in highly regulated engineering design or production environment, with electronics focus. Experience in functions such as Quality, Operations, Manufacturing Engineering, and Engineering are desired. 

 Computer Skills:


 Understanding of ERP systems
 Working knowledge of applications in design and development of circuit diagrams and tooling / jigs / test equipment
 Working knowledge of equipment maintenance applications (e.g. eMaintenance)
 Working knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
 Other Skills:


 Experience working at electronics, automobile, aerospace, space OEMs
 Significant knowledge and hands-on experience in electronics and electrical circuitry
 Working knowledge of primary processes like soldering, wire harness fabrication, test box fabrication.
 Prior experience in other Operations related functions such as Quality, Manufacturing Engineering
 Proven ability to read and interpret complex engineering drawings and models
 Use of LEAN tools like VSM and 5S
 Proven organization and communication skills
 Ability to work well independently and cross-functionally with minimal oversight.
 Strong communication, time-management, and problem-solving skills.
 Prior supervisory experience is a plus
 IPC certifications are desired
 Certification in soldering work (IPC specifications) is desired
 Working Conditions:
 1. Does require fluent communication in English language. 
2. Employment Status may be part-time, full-time, or temporary. 
3. Protracted or irregular hours may be required.

title: Engineering Technician
description:
2 Openings

 2nd shift (7:00 PM–7:00 AM)

 3rd (11:00 PM–7:00 AM)

Seeking a skilled and motivated Engineering Technician to join our team in Burlington, NC. The Engineering Technician will be responsible for supporting the engineering team in the maintenance, troubleshooting, and optimization of manufacturing equipment and processes. This role requires a critical thinking approach to ensure that all machinery and systems operate at peak efficiency, contributing to the overall productivity, quality of our production lines, and a continuous improvement mindset to drive value added changes.
Key Responsibilities:

 Equipment Maintenance & Repair:
 Diagnose and resolve mechanical, electrical, and pneumatic issues on production machinery.
 Conduct preventative maintenance on all equipment according to schedules and manufacturer recommendations.
 Communicate with OEMs to troubleshoot, diagnose and modify equipment to ensure proper functionality
 Read engineering drawings to identify, procure, and trouble shoot components/sub-assemblies ensuring required parts are available
 Process Optimization:
 Collaborate with engineers to identify opportunities for improving manufacturing processes and equipment performance.
 Implement modifications and upgrades to machinery to enhance productivity and efficiency.
 Assist in the installation and commissioning of new equipment and machinery.
 Spearhead engineering projects, installations and modifications ensuring proper application, and documentation, and training is conducted for all stakeholders involved.
 Documentation & Reporting:
 Maintain accurate records of maintenance activities, equipment performance, and downtime on a daily basis.
 Prepare detailed reports on troubleshooting efforts, repairs, and equipment modifications.
 Ensure all maintenance and repair activities comply with safety standards and regulations.
 Team Collaboration:
 Work closely with production teams to ensure equipment readiness and resolve any technical issues that may arise during production.
 Provide technical support and training to operators on equipment use and troubleshooting.
 Participate in continuous improvement initiatives to enhance overall production efficiency.

Qualifications:

 Education & Experience:
 Associate's degree or equivalent technical training in Engineering Technology, Industrial Maintenance, or a related field.
 Minimum of 3 years of experience as an Engineering Technician or similar role in a manufacturing environment, preferably in the food and beverage industry.
 Technical Skills:
 Strong knowledge of mechanical, electrical, and pneumatic systems.
 Proficiency in reading and interpreting technical drawings, schematics, and manuals.
 Experience with PLCs, HMIs, and other automation systems is a plus.
 Familiarity with preventive maintenance programs and CMMS software.
 Proficiency with technology, and Microsoft Office Suite applications.
 Other Skills:
 Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work under pressure.
 Strong attention to detail and commitment to quality.
 Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
 Effective communication and interpersonal skills.

Working Conditions:

 Ability to work in a fast-paced manufacturing environment.
 Must be able to stand, walk, and perform physical tasks for extended periods.
 Willingness to work flexible hours, including shifts and weekends, as required.

Benefits:

 Competitive salary based on experience.
 Health, dental, and vision insurance.
 Paid time off and holidays.
 Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.

 Wickliffe, OH

title: Entry Level Engineering Tech
description:
The Assembly Geometry Engineer Technician is responsible for evaluating existing processes and configuring manufacturing systems. Timely and appropriate adjustments of clamping points at assembly machines. Assembly Geometry Engineer Technician is a key position between Project management, Engineering Management, Assembly Department, Assembly Maintenance, Tooling, Quality Department and customer needs.
** FIRST AND THIRD SHIFT TECHNICIANS NEEDED **
Essential Functions
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
1.Adjusting tooling clamping/net points on all machines.
2.Analyze CMM reports / measurement reports / protocols of components and assembly, evaluate, manufacturing inaccuracies (e.g., geometric deviations)
3.Adjusting clamping points accordingly by selecting suitable shims (intermediate layers), components shimming to get them in the tolerance range (green status).
4.Documentation of all measurements and adjustments including shim logs.
5.Advise and support production and maintenance staff on all geometrical issues related to part quality.
6.Supporting Assembly Department or related departments (tool / die / laser), during the process of planning new Assembly or optimizing existing Assembly machines.
7.Supporting the production during the process of manufacturing of new assembly components.
8.Attending customer meetings/escalations if required.
9.Participation of FMEA
10.Maintains a safe and clean work area.
11.Other duties may be assigned based on skills and overall company needs.
12.Analyze fixtures for optimization.
13.Lead with preventative maintenance on all tooling if necessary and assist with sourcing spare parts.
14.Lead production changeovers on all machines.
15.Provide production support on welding issues related to machine / electrode for operations.
16.Teach robot positions for optimization and or quality related issues.
voestalpine Automotive Components Cartersville LLC
Competencies
1. Experience with the following joining processes:

 a. Ability to use CAD to find parts and or measurement data.
 b. Experience in CMM / geometrical clamping points on assembly fixtures and tools. (GD&T)
 c. Knowledge of components and assemblies
 d. Mechanical Engineering technical knowledge (MET)
 e. Knowledge of MS office packages
 f. Ability to read mechanical drawings and prints.
 g. Find spare parts per equipment documentation.
 h. Systematic problem solving

Supervisory Responsibility
This position has no supervisory responsibility.
Work Environment
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly exposed to moving mechanical parts. The employee is occasionally exposed to fumes or airborne particles. The noise level in the work environment is usually loud.
Physical Demands
Physical Demands the physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to stand and use hands to finger, handle, or feel. The employee is frequently required to walk and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee is occasionally required to climb or balance and talk or hear. The employee must regularly lift and /or move up to 10 pounds, frequently lift and/or move up to 25 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds.
Position Type/Expected Hours of Work
This is a full-time position, and hours of work and days are generally Monday through Friday, 1st 2nd or 3rd shift depending on position needed on a 3 shift 8-hour schedule. In order to meet our customer’s demands this role may be required to perform work outside of business hours including weekends and or additional coverage.
Travel
Generally, travel is expected for this role only driven by training. Travel can be local or international. Travel is expected to be less than 15%.
Required Education and Experience
a. Training in a 3.5-year technical profession (e.g. industrial mechanic) or comparable training
b. Mechanical engineering knowledge
c. Knowledge of mechanical components / assemblies / pneumatics
d. Fanuc Robot knowledge
e. Knowledge of MS office packages
f. Root cause analysis
Preferred Education and Experience
Work Authorization/Security Clearance
This role is not supported for work authorization.
AAP/EEO Statement
voestalpine Automotive Components Cartersville, LLC. provides equal employment opportunity to all individuals regardless of their race, color, creed, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law.
Other Duties

title: Lab Technician
description:
JOB TITLE: Laboratory Technician - Coatings
SUMMARY: Prepares and implements pigment lab test programs to ensure compliance with company’s quality requirements as compared to standards
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

 Prioritizes and manages multiple samples tests daily from varying sources. Approximately 30-50 tests per week.
 Executes test plans for each product in different mediums (based on the product and intended usage) to demonstrate that it meets all significant product specifications/requirements as compared to standards.
 Documents progress throughout process as well as final test results.
 Works with Technical Director to obtain approval of final test results.
 Communicates with Samples, Supply Chain and Customer Service departments regarding status of testing and outcomes.
 Plans for materials inventory in lab to support testing.
 Prepares and cleans laboratory equipment.
 In bulk, prepares materials/containers necessary in advance of testing to expedite testing time.
 Keeps lab and workspace clean.
 Performs other related duties as assigned by management.

· Two to four years related experience or equivalent.
· Commitment to excellence and high standards
· Acute attention to detail
· Ability to manage priorities and workflow and meet deadlines
· Good judgement with the ability to make timely decisions
· Versatility, flexibility, and a willingness to work within constantly changing
priorities with enthusiasm
· Strong analytical skills
· Demonstrated ability to plan and organize projects
· Proficient on Spectrophotometer and other lab equipment necessary to perform testing
· Working knowledge and understanding of the basic principles and practices of lab testing - preferably in chemical colorants
PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORK ENVIRONMENT: 

 Frequently required to stand
 Occasionally required to lift items up to 50 pounds
 Continually work around powdered pigments

title: Entry Level Help Desk Technician
description:
Reynolds and Reynolds is an industry leader in developing software and business forms for the automotive industry. These products enable car dealerships to operate more efficiently and effectively in a competitive marketplace.
Responsibilities:
The Entry Level Help Desk Technician responds to and diagnoses service issues through discussions with dealership customers and is responsible for leveraging resources across all levels of the organization. You will serve as single point of ownership for customer issues. You will follow call center procedures, document customer issues, include troubleshooting steps and resolution in the call-tracking tool. You will diagnose customer issues and assign appropriate support. You will ensure resolution of issues.
Requirements:

 Associate degree or equivalent in related field
 Strong customer service skills
 Analytical thinker
 Troubleshooting and problem solving skills
 Oral and written communication skills

Training: 
Mentoring with an experienced Frontline consultant that includes active listening and hands on training. Formal classroom instructional training in various Hardware solutions.
Benefits: 
Our associates receive medical, dental, vision, and life insurance. We also offer company contributions to your HSA, 6% match on 401(k), and a work/life balance with paid time off. At our Dayton office, you can take advantage of our great training programs and facility amenities, including an onsite dining facility offering complimentary breakfast and lunch, a fitness center, and an onsite medical center. We also offer a wide variety of sports and social leagues to participate in after work, along with volunteering initiatives through our Associate Foundation.
Reynolds and Reynolds promotes a healthy lifestyle by providing a non-smoking environment.Reynolds and Reynolds encourages applicants of all ages and experience to apply, as we do not discriminate on the basis of age.
Job Type: Full-time
Benefits:

 401(k)
 Dental insurance
 Health insurance
 Life insurance
 Paid time off
 Vision insurance

Location:

 Dayton, OH 45430 (Required)

Work Location: In person
