title: Entry Level Sales/Project Manager
description:
Job description
Join Estate Claim Services, LLC as an Entry Level Sales/Project Manager and kick-start your career in Minnesota. If you have excellent communication skills, a knack for customer service, and a passion for helping others, this role is perfect for you.
As an Entry Level Sales/Project Manager, you'll play a crucial role in generating customer leads, meeting sales targets, and providing exceptional service to homeowners. You'll learn to inspect properties, assess scope, and effectively manage projects under the guidance of our experienced team.
What We Offer You
Unlimited Earning Potential: Start strong with $2,000 a month guarantied pay as you build your pipeline, plus commissions and monthly bonuses! With our comprehensive commission structure and performance-based bonuses, you can expect to earn between $60,000 and $100,000 annually—or more!
Comprehensive Training: Receive extensive sales and product training to set you up for success. 1 week in office with provided lunch and 2 weeks on the field with your manager!
Welcoming and Fun Work Environment: Join a team that values collaboration, dedication, and mutual respect.
Growth & Advancement: Opportunity to grow within the company, with chances to expand your skills and responsibilities. You can advance with our company to earn all the way up to 50% of the profits in commissions!
Responsibilities:

 Lead Generation: Utilize your communication skills and creativity to identify and pursue potential leads. This may involve cold calling, networking, and utilizing online resources to expand the customer base.
 Sales Goal Achievement: Work diligently to meet and exceed sales targets set by the company. Develop strategies to maximize sales opportunities and capitalize on market trends.
 Customer Relationship Management: Build and maintain strong relationships with customers by providing exemplary service and addressing their needs and concerns promptly. Act as a trusted advisor throughout the restoration process, guiding homeowners with empathy and expertise.
 Property Inspections: Learn to conduct thorough inspections of properties to assess storm damage and determine the scope of restoration work required. Develop an eye for detail and the ability to accurately evaluate property conditions.
 Project Management Support: Assist in organizing and managing restoration projects from initiation to completion. Coordinate with contractors, suppliers, and other relevant parties to ensure timely and efficient project delivery.

Benefits:

 Comprehensive Training: Receive extensive training and mentorship to develop your skills in sales, customer service, and project management. Learn from experienced professionals who are committed to your success.
 Career Advancement Opportunities: Benefit from opportunities for career growth and advancement within our organization. We invest in our employees' development and provide pathways for progression based on merit and performance.
 Competitive Compensation Package: Enjoy a competitive compensation package that includes commission-based pay, and performance incentives. Your hard work and dedication will be rewarded with tangible financial benefits.
 Positive Impact: Make a meaningful difference in the lives of homeowners affected by storms. Join a team that is dedicated to restoring homes and communities with integrity, compassion, and excellence.

Qualifications:

 Strong Communication Skills: Possess excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to articulate ideas clearly and persuasively.
 Customer Focus: Demonstrate a genuine commitment to understanding and addressing the needs of customers. Strive to deliver exceptional service and exceed customer expectations.
 Adaptability: Be adaptable and flexible in response to changing circumstances and priorities. Embrace new challenges and opportunities for learning and growth.
 Organizational Skills: Exhibit strong organizational skills and attention to detail in managing sales activities, customer interactions, and project logistics. Prioritize tasks effectively and meet deadlines consistently.

If you're ready to launch your career and make a difference in storm-affected communities, we want to hear from you. Apply now to join our team and start your journey with Estate Claim Services, LLC. We look forward to welcoming you aboard!

description:
THIS IS NOT A REMOTE POSITION
JOB OVERVIEW
The Junior Sales Manager to support our growing sales team. They will assist in driving revenue growth, supporting existing customer relationships and developing new ones, building market forecasts, and expanding market share within the aviation industry.
To apply come by the front office or click the link below:[https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/932QFZF]
POSITION DUTIES
Support the sales team in managing key accounts and building client relationships.
Act as the key focal point for assigned customer accounts, bringing in experts from other departments where necessary.
Assist in preparing and delivering sales presentations, proposals, and quotes.
Track sales metrics, generate reports, and provide insights to support strategy.
Maintain accurate records of customer interactions and transactions in the CRM system.
Coordinate with technical services and product development teams to align sales strategies.
Participate in industry trade shows and client visits as required.
Identify potential leads and opportunities in domestic and international markets.
Monitor market trends, competitor activities, and customer feedback to recommend improvements.
POSITION REQUIRMENTS
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Aviation Management, or related field.
1–3 years of sales or business development experience (preferably in manufacturing or aviation).
Strong communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
Proficiency with Microsoft Office and CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce).
Detail-oriented with the ability to manage multiple priorities.
Willingness to travel as needed (up to 20%).
Preferred Qualifications:
Knowledge of the aviation industry or aviation tire products.
Technical understanding of manufacturing processes or tire specifications.
Fluency in a second language is a plus (for international sales growth).

While performing the duties of this job, the teammate is frequently required to sit
Reach with hands and arms, climb stairs as needed
Talk, hear and communicate effectively
The teammate must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds
The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate; at times the teammate may be required to be in manufacturing or warehouse environments that are usually not moderate
OTHER DUTIES

Its products are sold in over 150 nations and territories around the world.

title: Entry Level Manager
description:
Our company has continued to be a top provider of market insight and consumer sales in the Orlando region. We gather market perspectives and determine consumer preferences on client products, services, and promotional sales through direct introduction and communication. Our clients aim to provide the most advanced technology services available, and our Entry Level Managers are their partners in reaching qualified leads. By having a free flow of information between the clients and our teams, we develop a deep understanding of where our clients want to be in the near future and how we can get them there through our sales and marketing strategies.
Before working directly with client services, Entry Level Managers will have access to entry-level training that prepares them to answer potential questions, troubleshoot topics, and suggest alternative service options. We are looking for an Entry Level Manager who is engaged in creating business opportunities and determined to keep up with client innovations. If you want to help expand business outreach, build your critical thinking skills, communicate and collaborate with teams daily, and assist in sales and marketing strategy, our Entry Level Manager position fits you.
What we look for in an Entry Level Manager:

 Use direct communication to secure new customers, achieve outreach goals, and complete sales metrics
 Build a positive image and representation of the client brand by providing informative customer service before, during, and after the sales process
 Develop an understanding of the local market region to generate more relevant marketing and sales strategies for client products
 Work with the sales team and other Entry Level Managers to determine how client qualifications and protocols can be adequately conveyed to the local community
 Utilize entry-level training on sales, customer service, client expectations, and business metrics to generate new opportunities for the client successfully
 Analyze sales results to identify patterns, track market preferences, and better assist customer service and marketing strategies

Qualifications for a Successful Entry Level Manager:

 A high school diploma or equivalency is required
 An Associate's degree or two-year program certification is encouraged
 Previous knowledge of customer service, sales, business, management, or leadership is encouraged
 Ability to properly communicate the benefits and elements of client services during sales, given the proper entry-level training for Entry Level Managers
 Reliability in time management to follow training schedules and achieve planned goals for marketing, product visibility, sales, and customer service
 Friendly and professional demeanor when working with customers, management, and other Entry Level Managers

title: Entry Level Account Manager
description:
Eminent Management Group is making waves in the telecommunications and technology industries, and we’re excited to have a new Entry Level Account Manager join us in doing so! We are proud to represent some of the top household names in the nation, most notably AT&T. The results we produce for our clients speak for themselves; our cutting-edge sales and customer engagement tactics set us apart from the competition and place us at the top of the industry. As we embark on AT&T’s newest expansion project in the Portland area, we need an Entry Level Account Manager to join our winning team.
As our new Entry Level Account Manager, you’ll have the opportunity to advance your career by helping oversee the implementation of AT&T’s newest promotional campaign. We’re looking for our next generation of leaders, so an ideal Entry Level Account Manager will have a drive to meet and exceed goals, exceptional organizational skills, and a willingness to develop new skills both personally and professionally. Holding a background in sports, clubs, campus organizations, and other team-oriented activities is a huge plus. If this sounds like you, we encourage you to APPLY TODAY!

 Engage directly with businesses and clients to understand their unique wants and needs, and recommend tailored solutions when closing sales

 Oversee the training and development of new Entry Level Account Managers to ensure a thorough understanding of company policies, operations, and sales goals

title: Account Manager
description:
The Role
Reporting to the Account Manager Lead, your role will be responsible for the day-to-day management and service of existing customer accounts, including quoting, purchasing, and inventory coordination to ensure accurate fulfillment and high levels of customer satisfaction. You will work closely with customers to support ongoing projects and respond to evolving inventory requirements. Ultimately, you will collaborate with internal teams to deliver products and services that align with client needs, contribute to sales targets, and drive continuous improvement in service delivery through proactive communication, problem-solving, and relationship management
Key Tasks
· Liaise with internal teams and clients to ensure production schedules align with customer demand and delivery targets.
· Review and process weekly orders and customer forecasts, investigating and resolving discrepancies proactively.
· Coordinate with the Purchasing team to ensure timely procurement of materials to meet production and inventory requirements.
· Monitor inventory levels and implement strategies to optimize stock holding and minimize discrepancies.
· Investigate and address anomalies in customer demand, order fulfilment, and forecast accuracy.
· Generate and maintain accurate documentation for order processing, forecasting, and customer-specific programs.
· Maintain accurate and up-to-date trackers for customer-specific parts, EOPS programs, and forecast documentation.
· Ensure all new product and new account setup documentation is submitted, tracked, and finalized according to company process.
· Support Finance by investigating and resolving short payments and customer account queries.
· Coordinate cross-functional issue resolution, escalating internally when required to ensure customer satisfaction and service continuity.
· Maintain up-to-date reporting documents related to margin performance, OTIF, and customer KPIs.
· Contribute to customer satisfaction through proactive issue management, timely communication, and continuous service improvement
The Candidate
You will have a solid understanding of account management practices, including sales support, inventory coordination, and customer relationship management. Experience working within a manufacturing or supply chain environment would be advantageous, along with familiarity in handling customer forecasts, material planning, and procurement coordination. Proficiency in Microsoft Office and ERP/EDI systems is essential.
The successful candidate must possess excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to interpret customer data, identify trends, and resolve discrepancies quickly and effectively. Strong communication and interpersonal skills are critical, as you will be required to build and maintain relationships across both internal teams and external clients. You will also need to demonstrate strong organizational and time management abilities, particularly when managing multiple accounts and meeting strict deadlines.
A proactive attitude is a must, along with a strong sense of ownership and accountability. You should be comfortable working both independently and as part of a cross-functional team. The ideal candidate will thrive in a fast-paced environment, be highly adaptable, and able to prioritize effectively in order to maintain service excellence. A focus on accuracy, attention to detail, and a commitment to continuous improvement are key to success in this role

description:

The Sales Account Manager will be involved in many aspects of our development, obtaining market knowledge of products, sourcing and distribution process. Working closely with the client and Product Development team, the Sales Account Manager’s main objective is customer development, customer relations, soliciting orders, and communication with clients and retailers.

 Work directly with retail customer to manage and create new products based on customer’s request.

 Obtain industry knowledge and awareness through product research and store visits in order to identify market trends and movements
 Process and track purchase orders. Coordinate with the Product Development team and buyers to monitor delivery dates, resolve discrepancies, ensure industry regulations are met, develop packaging designs, and oversee quality assurance.

title: Junior Sales Account Manager
description:
THIS IS NOT A REMOTE POSITION
JOB OVERVIEW
The Junior Sales Manager to support our growing sales team. They will assist in driving revenue growth, supporting existing customer relationships and developing new ones, building market forecasts, and expanding market share within the aviation industry.
To apply come by the front office or click the link below:[https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/932QFZF]
POSITION DUTIES
Support the sales team in managing key accounts and building client relationships.
Act as the key focal point for assigned customer accounts, bringing in experts from other departments where necessary.
Assist in preparing and delivering sales presentations, proposals, and quotes.
Track sales metrics, generate reports, and provide insights to support strategy.
Maintain accurate records of customer interactions and transactions in the CRM system.
Coordinate with technical services and product development teams to align sales strategies.
Participate in industry trade shows and client visits as required.
Identify potential leads and opportunities in domestic and international markets.
Monitor market trends, competitor activities, and customer feedback to recommend improvements.
POSITION REQUIRMENTS
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Aviation Management, or related field.
1–3 years of sales or business development experience (preferably in manufacturing or aviation).
Strong communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
Proficiency with Microsoft Office and CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce).
Detail-oriented with the ability to manage multiple priorities.
Willingness to travel as needed (up to 20%).
Preferred Qualifications:
Knowledge of the aviation industry or aviation tire products.
Technical understanding of manufacturing processes or tire specifications.
Fluency in a second language is a plus (for international sales growth).
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by a teammate to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
While performing the duties of this job, the teammate is frequently required to sit
Reach with hands and arms, climb stairs as needed
Talk, hear and communicate effectively
The teammate must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds
The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate; at times the teammate may be required to be in manufacturing or warehouse environments that are usually not moderate
OTHER DUTIES
Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the teammate for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.
Bridgestone Corporation, headquartered in Tokyo, is the world's largest tire and rubber company. In addition to tires for use in wide variety of applications, it manufactures a broad range of diversified products, which include industrial rubber and chemical products and sporting goods. Its products are sold in over 150 nations and territories around the world.

Manage and develop client accounts to initiate and maintain favorable relationship with clients. title: General Sales Manager
description:
General Sales Manager
  Location: Butte, MT
 Compensation: $100,000+ annually DOE
 Schedule: Saturdays Required. Sunday & one weekday off
 
 At Bretz RV & Marine, we don’t just sell RVs and boats - we help families go camping and boating, enjoy the outdoor lifestyle, and get back out quickly when something unexpected happens. Our culture is built on passion, teamwork, growth, family, and profitability. We’re more than coworkers; we’re a community driven to deliver exceptional service and uphold our values every single day.
 If you’re a problem-solver who thrives in a fast-paced environment and loves to lead by example, we’d love to meet you. Join a team dedicated to setting the standard for outdoor adventure retail in Montana and beyond.
 
  The Role: General Sales Manager
 As our General Sales Manager (GSM), you’ll lead the Butte dealership’s sales operations. You’ll oversee new and pre-owned sales, guide the Finance & Insurance (F&I) team, and ensure customers receive an exceptional, seamless buying experience.
 Today’s customers arrive informed and ready to explore. Your mission? Help them find the perfect RV, boat, watercraft, or snowmobile through a thoughtful, needs-based sales process. Your expertise, leadership, and ability to inspire your team will set Bretz apart from the competition.
 
  What You’ll Do
  Lead Sales Operations
 
  Build a culture of accountability and excellence in the sales department.
  Drive results to meet dealership goals for gross profit, unit volume, and finance penetration.
 
  Oversee Inventory & Financials
 
  Manage inventory levels, pricing, reconditioning, and lot/showroom presentation.
  Review deals, resolve “dead deals,” and support deal structuring.
  Oversee expense management and ensure pay plans, spiffs, and commissions align with company guidelines.
 
  Develop and Mentor Teams
 
  Coach and grow Sales and F&I teams.
  Collaborate with leadership to maintain a pipeline of talent for future leadership roles.
 
  Deliver Customer Excellence
 
  Resolve high-level customer concerns and complex trade or deal issues.
  Ensure consistent follow-up and a personalized customer experience.
 
  Drive Marketing & Events
 
  Coordinate promotions and ensure pricing and specials are effectively communicated.
  Plan and execute off-site shows and on-site events with proper staffing and logistics.
 
  Cross-Department Collaboration
 
  Work closely with Operations, F&I, Parts, and Service teams to deliver seamless customer experiences.
 
 
  Who You’ll Work With
 
   Operations Manager – Ensure unified operations and customer satisfaction.
   Business/F&I Managers – Secure financing and maximize profitability.
   Salespeople – Mentor and develop the sales team.
  Receptionists, Lot Crew, Forklift Drivers – Ensure smooth day-to-day dealership operations and customer engagement.
 
 
  What We’re Looking For
 
  Proven experience leading sales teams in the RV, marine, automotive, or similar industries.
  Strong knowledge of sales systems, CRM tools, product details, and market trends.
  Ability to motivate and develop a high-performing team.
  Excellent problem-solving skills and a customer-first mindset.
  Willingness to roll up your sleeves and pitch in wherever needed.
 
  Benefits
 
  Excellent earning potential and advancement opportunities.
  Comprehensive medical benefits package with multiple plan options, including vision and dental.
  401(k) retirement plan with employer match.
  Employee discounts and borrowing program.
  Profit-sharing.
 

   Bretz RV’s Commitment to You
 
  Opportunity to work in a family-oriented environment where work-life balance is valued.
  Growth and advancement opportunities.
  Team-building activities and events throughout the year.
  Engaging in a booming industry to provide the best customer experience.
 

 
 About Our Dealership:
  Bretz RV & Marine is a family-owned dealership group with a deep-rooted history in the outdoor adventure industry. Founded in 1967 in Missoula, Montana, we started with a single location. Over the years, we’ve grown into one of the largest RV and marine dealerships in the region, with multiple locations across Montana, Idaho, and Washington. Despite our growth, we’ve remained true to our mission of helping families go camping and boating, enjoy the outdoor lifestyle and get back out quickly when the unexpected happens. We continue to make decisions based on our core values—passion, teamwork, growth, family, and profitability—ensuring that every customer receives a world-class purchasing and ownership experience.
  Our success is built on our people. We invest in training, career development, and fostering a culture where every team member feels valued. Whether you’re on the sales floor, in the service bay, or behind the scenes, you play a crucial role in helping our customers create lifelong memories. At Bretz RV & Marine, we don’t just sell boats and RVs—we help families embark on their next great adventure. If you’re looking for a workplace that values teamwork, customer service, and a shared love for the outdoors, you’ve found it.
  Relocation: Many of our employees relocate from other areas looking for a better place to raise a family. Locations others have moved from: Idaho Falls, Pocatello, Seattle, Sacramento, Fresno, Los Angeles, San Diego, Portland, Albany, Salem, Bozeman, Helena, Great Falls, Butte, Anaconda, Kalispell, Denver, Sheridan, Powell, Red Lodge, Houston, Dallas, Fort Collins, Spokane, New York, Philadelphia, New Jersey, Phoenix, Mesa, Rapid City, Lincoln, Bismarck, California, Chicago, Illinois, Minneapolis, Detroit
 
 EEOC Statement:
  Bretz RV & Marine is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity for all associates. We hire, train, promote, and compensate associates based on personal and professional competence without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, disability, or citizenship, as well as other classifications protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. This commitment extends to all aspects of our employment practices in compliance with Washington State's non-discrimination policies.
  Products and Brands:
  RV Manufacturers: Airstream, Coachmen, Dutchmen, Entegra Coach, Forest River, Grand Design, Heartland, Keystone RV, KZ RV, NuCamp, Thor, Tiffin, Ember RV, Brinkley RV, Oliver Trailers.
  Boat Manufacturers: Barletta, Sea-Doo, Bayliner, Chaparral, Crownline, Smokercraft, Lowe, Starcraft, MB Sport, Sun Chaser, Yamaha Outboards, Honda Outboards, Mercury/Mercruiser, Volvo Marine, Thunderjet, Sylvan Boats.

title: Wholesale Account Manager
description:
Cuddledown Wholesale delivers expertly crafted, high-quality bedding and bath products to business customers nationwide. Building on Cuddledown's legacy as a trusted consumer brand for over five decades, we partner with interior designers, hospitality groups, and retailers to bring visions to life. At Cuddledown, we look for unique talent and skills, and above all else, passion. Our employees are enthusiastic team members who love what they do, and come to work every day ready to jump in and roll up their sleeves.
Position Overview:
Cuddledown is looking for a dynamic and competent Wholesale Account Manager who will be responsible for effectively developing and managing customer relationships, prospecting new customers, ensuring a strong service experience and expanding sales for the Wholesale division.
Responsibilities:

 Collect, analyze, and report on data related to consumer behavior, competitors, and trends to understand changing needs.
 Execute effective and timely communication with customers by phone, through email and face-to-face to ensure their needs are understood and addressed.

 Excellent verbal and written communication skills

title: Sales Account Manager – Branch Sales and Service
description:
Miller Environmental Group (MEG) is a leader in environmental services, providing innovative and compliant solutions for waste management, remediation, and industrial cleaning. Our TSDF and Branch network in New York offers customers a reliable, cost-effective way to manage all their environmental needs while ensuring regulatory compliance.
Position Overview:
We are seeking a results-driven Sales Account Manager to expand our Branch and TSDF services across our network. This role focuses on developing new business, managing existing accounts, and ensuring customers receive the highest level of service. The ideal candidate has a strong sales background, knowledge of environmental regulations, and experience selling industrial cleaning, emergency response, non-hazardous waste disposal, treatment, and recycling solutions.
Key Responsibilities:
Identify and develop new business opportunities within the industrial, manufacturing, utility, fuel terminal, and commercial sectors.
Build and maintain strong relationships with existing clients to ensure long-term partnerships.
Provide consultative sales support, helping customers navigate waste disposal regulations and compliance requirements.
Collaborate with operations teams to ensure seamless service execution.
Prepare proposals, contracts, and pricing structures tailored to customer needs.
Stay up to date on industry trends, regulatory changes, and competitive offerings.
Meet or exceed sales targets and TSDF revenue and profitability goals.
Qualifications:
Mush have 5+ years of B2B sales experience in environmental services, waste management, or related industries.
Strong understanding of TSDF operations, RCRA, DOT, and state environmental regulations in NY
Proven track record of developing and closing sales opportunities.
Ability to work independently while collaborating with internal teams.
Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
Willingness to travel within the tri-state territory as needed.
Why Join Us?
Competitive base salary + commission structure.
Company mileage reimbursement.
Comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, and 401(k).
Opportunity to grow within an expanding environmental services company.
If you’re a motivated sales professional with a passion for environmental solutions, we’d love to hear from you!
Miller Environmental Group is a leading environmental response, remediation and restoration services company, providing industry, government, commercial and residential customers with outstanding service. We provide training, pay for any necessary certifications and licensing, and offer opportunities for growth. Be a part of saying YES!
To be considered for a position please click APPLY and complete your application. Salary is commensurate with licenses and experience.
Come Join an Amazing Team where a long-term opportunity for growth and success awaits you. Please visit us at www.millerenv.com to learn more about us.

title: F&I and Sales Manager
description:
Weelborg's family of dealerships has a long history of serving their communities with exceptional vehicle and trustworthy service. We live, work, and play in the communities we serve and therefore we strive to serve each and every customer with the same respect we would expect to receive.
Weelborg Chevrolet of New Ulm is seeking a dependable, motivated self-starter and detail oriented Sales and F&I Manager.
Position Summary:
The Sales and F&I Manager is responsible for helping customers obtain the financing they need to purchase the vehicle of choice while completing the required documentation for each financing transaction.
Essential Responsibilities:
This list of duties and responsibilities is not all inclusive and may be expanded to include other duties and responsibilities as management may deem necessary from time to time:
1. Offer vehicle financing and insurance to customers and provide them with a thorough explanation of aftermarket products and extended warranties and a complete explanation of manufacturer and dealership service procedures and policies.
2. Contract new business, sell and close deals.

 Turns 100 percent of closed deals to finance, along with properly completed paperwork (insurance information, trade title etc.).
 Converts cash deals to finance.

5. Collect, receipt, and deposit cash, checks, and credit card transactions.
6. Acquire approval from lenders.
7. Create and maintain quality business relationship with lenders.
8. Verify paperwork involved with cash, finance or loan transactions.
9. Seek new lending institutions and maintain good working relationships to secure competitive interest rates and financing programs.
10. Process financing and leasing deals accurately and secure approval through financial sources.
11. Understand and comply with federal, state and local regulations that affect the new and used-vehicle and finance departments.
12. Create and maintain a program with the sales department that will ensure all sales are referred to the F&I department.
13. Train and provide the sales team with information on finance and lease programs and the benefits of the dealership’s financing and extended service programs.
14. Maintain profitability while controlling expenses and maintaining customer satisfaction.
15. Promote gap and aftermarket products.
16. Update reports daily with the status of pending deals or contracts in transit.
17. Review and communicate with lenders, managers and customers daily to make sure deals are processed within the same day to minimize delays in funding.
18. Understand all programs and rate options offered by our lenders.
19. Understand all factory incentives, rebates and sub-vented rates & qualification as well as collect all supporting documentation.
20. Solicit extended warranty sales (aftermarket).
21. Handle all cancellations for extended warranties and gap.
22. Remit and register policies with factory (i.e. ESP, Maintenance, etc.).
23. Collect and verify all documents required by dealer, factory and lender.

 Complies information and prepares reports as requested by management and/or Dealer Principal.
 Maintains CSI scores that meet and strive to exceed goals. Implement action plan to improve customer satisfaction. Keep employees informed of customer satisfaction goals and their impact on overall scores.
 Protects gross profit by arranging financing so outside sources do not have in impact on selling margins.
 Responsible for all paperwork involved with the sale of the vehicle, including obtaining customer signatures and securing payoff and insurance information.
 Assisting in process troubleshooting as needed, including being a technical resource as needed.
 Adhere to all Safety policies and procedures, reporting any nonconformity.
 Maintains technical knowledge in areas of responsibility by attending educational workshops, attends manager meetings, reviews publications, researches topics, establishes personal networks, maintains certifications, and participates in dealership training.
 Maintain training and certifications as required by manufacturer.
 Other duties as assigned.

An individual in this position must be able to successfully perform the essential duties and responsibilities listed above. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this position. The above list reflects the general details necessary to describe the principle and essential functions of the position and shall not be construed as the only duties that may be assigned for the position.
Required Competencies:
The following are required competencies of the position that must be met by the employee to successfully perform the essential functions of the job:

 Demonstrated proficiency in Windows, MS Office Suite including; Word, Excel, Power Point, and Outlook, internet/intranet and other organizational specific software.
 Demonstrates appropriate understanding/working knowledge of accounting principles and internal controls, and applies them.
 Attention to detail, strong organizational and time management skills.
 Professional communication skills for both internal and external customers, and coworkers.
 Must be able to demonstrate an ability and willingness to communicate effectively in order to maintain high levels of Safety, Quality and Efficiency.
 Strong customer service skills.
 Conducts business in an ethical and professional manner.
 Insightful use of analysis techniques, tools and concepts, to provide practical counsel to business area partners and management to drive business results.
 Independent worker and analytical thinker with ability to conduct research, data analysis and resolve complex problems.
 The Manager should be a person with solid understanding and respect for the differences of roles between management, supervisory and line personnel.
 Ability to plan, initiate, direct and carry out short and long-term programs.
 Demonstrated ability to influence others without direct, hierarchical control.
 Ability to define problems, collect and document data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.
 Ability to interpret an extensive variety of situations and events and respond accordingly.
 Working knowledge of budgets and financial statements.
 Ability to define problems, collect and document data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.
 Experience with developing and monitoring production strategies and performance metrics.
 Remain current on economic, industrial, and other trends that affect market and prices.
 Possess traits of honesty, integrity, creativity and flexibility.
 Must have high level of discretion and ability to handle sensitive and confidential information appropriately.
 Demonstrate an understanding of the products sold and the processes involved.
 Ability to read and comprehend standard operating procedures and company guidelines in order to maintain regulatory compliance.
 Ability to understand daily production needs.
 Ability to work independently, multi-task, and prioritize.
 Ability to perform at a high level in a fast-paced environment with the ability to adapt to a continually changing environment.
 Detail oriented, be quality minded.
 Maintain a valid drivers’ license and an acceptable Motor Vehicle Record (MVR).
 Punctual and regular attendance.

Education and Experience:

 Bachelor’s degree preferred or a combination of education and relevant work experience.
 5+ years automotive experience in sales and finance preferred.
 Industry specific software experience preferred.
 Basic understanding of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP).
 Obtain manufacturer certification within 90 days of employment and maintain required certification(s) as required by the manufacturer.

Physical and Mental Demands
The physical and mental demands described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions
Office – Work is performed in a general office environment with low to moderate noise exposure. May on occasion be exposed to loud sounds and distracting noise levels, such as from office equipment. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects; reach with hands and arms; climb stairs; balance; stoop, kneel, crouch; talk or hear; taste or smell. The majority of the time is spent seated at a workstation with access to telephone, computer, printer, files, and reference materials. Requires frequent verbal communication either in person, by telephone or by use of online interactive communication, to interact with vendors, suppliers, and consultants. Requires frequent written communication by requiring frequent typing and writing. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.
Working Environment
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Office - This job operates in a professional office environment. Employees will work face-to-face with others on a daily basis. Some may share office space. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is rarely exposed to outside weather conditions and risk of electrical shock. The noise level in the work environment is usually low. May on occasion be exposed to loud sounds and distracting noise levels, such as from office equipment. The employee may be exposed to very low levels of ammonia.

title: Area Sales Manager
description:
Logan Homes 
Southeastern Area Sales Manager – JOB SUMMARY and DUTIES
JOB SUMMARY
Responsible for leading and managing Logan Homes sales professionals within the Southeastern region to drive sales growth and meet sales goals by implementing company strategies. Develop and lead a sales team to maximize sales volume and profitability.
“Top 3” Responsibilities

 SELL: Inspire, manage, and lead a dynamic sales team to meet the company sales goals.
 COMMUNITY AUDITS: Provide leadership and accountability for presentation, comp analysis, sales process, and general community management.
 CONTRACT COMPLIANCE: Ensure deals are signed on time and processes are followed.

Primary Responsibilities

 Typical week - 2 days in office and 3 days +1 Saturday per month at Logan models. Perform field assessments of competitive communities to gather market insights, local housing trends, pricing strategies and competitor activity. Must have a presence at a minimum biweekly, at each Logan Home community. (Logan Home Models being described as “In the Field”)


 Guarantee prompt entry of all inventory homes into Hyphen in alignment with the production start schedule. Verify that OSC accurately list spec homes in MLS with correct formatting, photos, descriptions and showing instructions.


 MLS listings for each community must be audited during weekly community visits.


 Conduct a monthly audit for each community and submit completed report to the Sales and Marketing Director by the first Wednesday of the following month.


 Recruit, hire, train and oversee a team of 10-15 Community Sales Managers and Assistant Sales Managers.


 Administer, develop, and implement sales strategies, by balancing key performance measures, to maintain and improve the Company's sales results


 Track and analyze the sales pipeline, key metrics (e.g., traffic, conversion, cancellations, and closings. Key business ratios, and individual sales agents’ activities to ensure sales plan stays on target, taking corrective action in real time.


 Monitor backlog status and loan tracking process, collaborating with the Closing Coordinator and Mortgage Representative to support and update projected closing dates.


 Manage customer conflicts and customer service-related issues related to backlog and interactions with external Brokers.


 Ensure the Community Sales Manager and Superintendent hold weekly meetings, complete the required documentation for Sales-Production Meetings and submit each Monday during Sales Meetings.


 Maintain real estate license and BIC status by staying current with license and CE requirements.


 Oversee the contract process to ensure the front – line sales team submits accurate and timely contracts, along with any required payments.


 Ensures adequate staffing levels to meet department requirements and manages the Model Home staffing schedule.


 Evaluates employee performance and plans for compensation, accordingly, taking immediate corrective action when necessary.


 Delivers continuous coaching on functional competencies and leadership standards, including technical skills and behaviors. Warrant consistent, high quality buying experience from visit to close.


 Track and report sales and marketing initiatives to ensure the direct sales percentage is strategically appropriate.


 Attend sales appointments as needed, with a focus on supporting underperforming communities and agents.


 Role Clarifications

a. Sales Manager is responsible for contract negotiations and customer conflicts within established parameters; marketing and sales director steps in to manage exceptions or variances.
b. Partner with Sales and Marketing teams on lead generation campaigns, advertising, and signage strategies.
c. The Sales Administrator executes CD’s and Contracts under the direct supervision of the Sales and Marketing Director.

 Manage Key Performance Metrics - Company tracking spreadsheets, including, but not limited to:

a. Comparable Communities Matrix – While agents are responsible for maintaining data on their assigned communities, the Sales Manager, as well as the Sales and Marketing Director may require compiling this information periodically to support acquisition efforts.
b. Community Pricing Guide Tool -Maintain and apply the community pricing guidance tool as directed by the Sales and Marketing Manager.
c. Inventory and Product Management- Oversee the balance between spec homes and presales to support optimal inventory levels, ensuring steady sales pace while maximizing margins by coordinating with construction, design, and operations teams on community inventory levels, and spec homes.
d. Prepare and Manage Multiple Reports - Logan Homes Communities within your assigned area. - (Available Homes, Sales Pace, and Community Goals).
QUALIFICATIONS

 Proven leadership skills with the ability to motivate and guide a diverse team toward achieving business goals and objectives.
 Resilient, resourceful, and driven, influential, adapt to change and inspire high performance.
 Minimum of 3 years’ experience in the home building or new home sales industry preferred.
 Active North Carolina Real Estate Broker License.
 Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, including Outlook, Word, and Excel. We are an excel heavy company.
 Exhibit a polished and professional appearance.
 Ability to navigate job sites, and terrain. Presentable vehicle. (Mileage reimbursement provided)
 Exemplary customer service skills with the ability to engage professionally with customers, employees, and subcontractors.
 Exceptional time management skills with the ability to meet deadlines, multitask, and perform efficiently in a fast-paced environment.
 Completion of a pre-employment personality assessment is required.
 Ability to work full-time with a mix of office and Fieldwork (Traveling to Logan Home Models), 40% in the office, 60% in the field
 Willingness to work extended hours, including evenings and weekends, as necessary to support division goals and meet business objectives.

title: Inside Sales Account Manager

 Acquired by Staples in 1998, Quill delivers the essential services, solutions, and award-winning customer support to help our customers – and our people – thrive. When you partner with Quill, as a customer or as an associate, every workday is more rewarding.
 From paper, ink & toner, to technology and custom print, we deliver the right products at the right value, plus an unmatched assortment of over 900 instant rewards available with every order.

 We Offer:

title: Technical Account Manager
description:
We are seeking individuals with boundless energy, unwavering persistence, and an appetite for learning. We value individuals who approach challenges with enthusiasm and creativity. If you're ready to embark on a journey of continuous growth and contribute to meaningful solutions, we want you on our team.
 As a Technical Account Manager with AWC, you will work directly with our technology partners and develop a deep understanding of their products. You will interact with our sales team, engineering team and our customers to understand their applications and discuss how technology can be implemented for improvement. You will strive to leverage agile design and development methods to create greater value faster, and to help our project teams execute to deliver as promised, on time and within budget. The successful candidate must be innovative, passionate, and resourceful while demonstrating technical skills.
  How you’ll make an impact:
 
  Serve as the primary point of contact for assigned client accounts, building strong relationships, and understanding their technical requirements and business objectives
  Collaborate with internal teams to ensure timely delivery of products, services, and solutions that meet or exceed client expectations
  Identify opportunities for upselling and cross-selling additional products and services to existing clients, contributing to revenue growth and market expansion
 
 
  Build profitable sales in an assigned territory through sales with current customers and demonstrate a commitment to prospecting and new business development
  Conduct regular client meetings, presentations, and technical training sessions to deepen client engagement and promote product awareness
  Stay updated on industry trends, market developments, and emerging technologies to anticipate client needs and provide strategic recommendations
  Effectively manage account activities, including sales forecasts, pipeline management, and reporting, to achieve sales targets and objectives
  Manage the entire sales process, from order placement to delivery and installation. Coordinate with internal departments, including engineering, procurement, and logistics, to ensure orders are fulfilled on time and according to customer expectations
 
 
  Provide technical support and assistance to clients, addressing questions, resolving issues, and offering troubleshooting guidance as needed
 
 
  Hunger to build by being a trusted “go to” expert
  Teach concepts from the basics of electricity and motor control to complex SCADA database management and networking
 
 
  Provide technical support for the following products/technologies: PLC, I/O, HMI, SCADA, Drives, Synchronized Motion Control, Networking, WiFi, Radios, Motor Controls, Control Panel Design, and Power Distribution
 
  Skills you’ll need:
 
  Minimum of 2 years of experience in technical sales, account management, or related roles within the industrial controls and automation industry
  Strong technical background with process automation technologies and methodologies
  Proven track record of successfully managing key client accounts and driving business growth through effective relationship management and solution selling
  Excellent communication, presentation, and negotiation skills, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
  Strategic thinker with a customer-centric mindset and a proactive approach to problem solving
  Proficient in CRM software and Microsoft Office suite
  Willingness to travel as needed
 
 Here’s what will set you apart:
 
  4-year bachelor’s degree in Engineering / 2-year technical degree (preferred in an Engineering)
  Solid level knowledge of Electrical and Automation products, including but not limited to PLC’s, IO’s, Safety Devices, Enclosures, Motor Starters, Variable Frequency Drives, Pneumatics, Sensors, Panelboards, etc.
  Basic understanding of electricity, panel design/wiring, manufacturing/OEM experience
 
 The Rewards:
 
  Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP)
  401(K) Match
  Competitive Pay
  Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance Package
  Employer Paid Life Insurance
  Paid Time Off and Holiday Pay
  Career Development Opportunities
 
 About AWC
 As employee-owners, we strive to do more than just complete tasks; we seek to develop fulfilling careers by pushing ourselves and questioning the status quo. We embrace innovative and creative methods to expand our expertise while providing genuine value to our customers and technology partners. We strategically partner with the world’s most-recognized brands to help engineering, reliability, and maintenance teams solve problems effectively. As experts in our partners’ technologies, we are well-equipped to properly size, select, configure, and support each. It is our goal to serve you with the best combination of caring experts and innovative solutions from our partners.
  How We Win Together
 We are committed to solving customer problems and are looking for team members that want to be a trusted resource to those looking for a partner who out-knows, out-cares, and out-serves everyone else. Every day, we strive to deliver on our mission to empower people to make the greatest positive impact for the communities and families we serve together. Our Winning Together culture starts with a shared commitment to building an environment of inclusiveness, trust, and mutual respect. We know that when people like you are safe to pursue your passions, to learn, to serve, and to share in the rewards from our combined efforts, then we are winning together.
 
 
 Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities
 This employer is required to notify all applicants of their rights pursuant to federal employment laws. For further information, please review the Know Your Rights notice from the Department of Labor.

title: Sales Manager - Vermont
description:
Renewal by Andersen, America’s premier replacement window and door company, is seeking a highly skilled Sales Manager. If you are a customer service minded, highly driven individual with outstanding sales management experience, we would like to speak with you.
 
 
 
  
 Job Summary:
 
 
 
  
 Renewal by Andersen of Vermont is hiring a Sales Manager that will provide leadership, structure, and success to a sales force of 10 Design Specialists. Working directly under the General Manager the Sales Manager will develop, track, and maintain regular sales goals and KPI’s. Overseeing the development and performance of the entire sales force, the Sales Manager will be responsible for reporting all sales metrics, sales strategy, team development, and customer relations on a weekly, monthly, and quarterly basis.
 
 
 
  
 Primary Responsibilities:
 
 
  Manage Design Specialists and supporting staff.
  Achieve annual sales and customer satisfaction goals for specific locations.
  Coach and develop a sales team to meet pre-determined goals and benchmarks.
  Cooperates on team basis and learns from individual successes. Including sales ride-along visits with Design Specialists.
  Review all sales contracts.
  Track sales metrics, monitor daily results, and analyze for corrective action.
  Work closely with GM to develop annual sales goals over region.
  Conduct sales meetings that include strategy, quarterly sales plan, and training.
  Conduct one on one meeting with Design Specialists to review sales activity results and establish corrective plans as needed.
  Teach the RbA sales process by modeling the core behaviors.
  Provide communication and clarity around the sales process system.
  Establish an environment where all customers and employees are treated with dignity and respect.
  On-going and up-to-date training.
  Conduct formal performance reviews for sales force at least quarterly or as needed.
  Develop the sales force; build talent pipeline for succession planning.
  Participate, as a team member, with other managers providing best operational results.
  Work with Marketing Manager to maximize market penetration
  Establish and maintain sales budget.
  Participate as a team member with the leadership team to insure alignment to organizational goals and direction.
 
 
 
  
 Qualifications:
 
 
  Four-year degree or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
  Valid driver’s license with acceptable accident and moving violation motor vehicle record.
  Minimum 8 years of proven sales management experience with creditable references.
  Highly experienced with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
  Experience with reports, contracts, and data entry.
  Proven record with customer service and sales strategy.
  Experience using various measuring tools.
  Outstanding communication skills.
  Strategic planning and business development experience.
  Experience with contract development and review.
  Ability to develop teams and implement training systems.
 
 
 
  
 Location:
 
 
   Although this position will require extensive travel it will also be mandatory to work from headquarters at times.
 
 
 
  
 Renewal by Andersen of Vermont
 
 
  262B Mechanic St
 
 
  Lebanon, NH 03766
 
 
 
  
 Salary and Benefits:
 
 
  Health Insurance
  Paid Vacation
  Retirement Program
  Company Vehicle
  Base salary
  Bonus structure
  Annual earning potential of over $200K
 
 
 
  
 Job Type: Full-time
 
 
   Pay: $65,000.00 - $200,000.00 per year
 
 
 
  
 Benefits:
 
 
  401(k)
  401(k) matching
  Dental insurance
  Disability insurance
  Employee discount
  Flexible schedule
  Health insurance
  Life insurance
  Paid time off
 
 
 
  
 Schedule:
 
 
  10 hour shift
  8 hour shift
 
 
 
  
 Supplemental Pay:
 
 
  Bonus pay
  Commission pay
 
 
 
  
 Education:
 
 
  Bachelor's (Preferred)
 
 
 
  
 Experience:
 
 
  Sales Experience: 8 years (Required)
  Sales management: 8 years (Required)
 
 
 
  
 License/Certification:
 
 
  Driver's License (Required)
 
 
 
  
 Willingness to travel:
 
 
  100% (Preferred)
 
 
 
  
 Work Location: In person
 
 
 
  
 By applying to this job, I agree that I may be contacted at the number submitted, including by autodialed calls and texts, for informational and all other purposes by Renewal by Andersen, and its affiliated companies (collectively, “RbA”).

title: Senior Benefits Account Manager
description:
Summary
The Sr. Benefits Account Manager helps the Benefits Team to deliver high-quality and efficient service to both internal and external customers. You will take charge of the renewal and marketing process from inception to completion, working in tandem with the benefits account managers and client services administrators providing superior levels of customer satisfaction that drive long-term relationships, referral business and the attainment of profit goals.
Responsibilities and Duties
· Works proactively to maintain relationships with carrier and client contacts. Takes a significant role in meetings and on calls. Communicates directly with clients and vendors.
· The Senior Account Manager will have responsibility for managing the renewal and marketing process from start to finish for their book of business and assist the Benefits Account Managers as needed .
· Reviews, benefit plan summaries, and carrier source documents for accuracy. Understands more difficult and complex regulatory language and rules.
· Develops and maintains ongoing relationships with clients and their employees. Communicates directly with them and relies on a growing knowledge of the details of various insurance coverages.
· Acts as the subject matter expert on benefits and vendor/carrier products and services. Gets assistance on complex situations or products from more senior team members
· Begin to anticipate client needs and works with VP of HR to set up processes and procedures to drive efficiency.
· Drafts client presentations; takes an active role in client meetings
· Update benefit guides, and ensure client resources and communications are up to date following open enrollment or coverage change
· Prepare document and data for annual client compliance audits to be presented by the Account Executive, may take active role in presentation
· Address client requests including product or vendor service or performance challenges
· May provide updates to clients regarding appropriate industry trends and events, including all state and federal regulatory issues
· Proactive client service support in conjunction with the account management team
· Oversees client projects such as implementation of new business, open enrollment process, non-discrimination testing, etc.
· Interprets plan rules to ensure compliance with Plan Documents and Summary Plan Descriptions
· Provides leadership and training to more junior team members
· Functions include but are not limited to reconciliation of claim issues, benefit inquiries, enrollment issues, and carrier premium billing discrepancies
· Intake and audit control of enrollment information
· Track inquiries and complaints regarding carrier claims resolution
· Function as liaison to intervene with delays in claim processing
· Correspond with carriers, members, and providers to educate, clarify benefits, resolve claims, verify eligibility, and resolve disputes
· Investigate, research, and provide timely responses to all service issues
· Routinely educate on current or pending Federal and State legislation about HIPAA, COBRA laws, FMLA, and any other legal issues as they pertain to Employee Benefits
· Pursue a program of personal and professional development
Qualifications and Skills Required 

 Minimum of 5 years’ experience as a Benefits Account Manager
 Associate degree or higher preferred

· Excellent oral and written communication skills
· Strong human relations and professional skills
· Strong presentation skills to communicate effectively over the telephone and in person to individuals and large groups of employees
· Ability to listen for extended periods while maintaining assimilation
· Capable of making independent decisions using reasonable judgment
· Strong orientation to customer service
· Must have basic computer knowledge in Windows environment, create spreadsheets with appropriate computer programs
· NYS Life, Accident & Health License required
· Proficiency in Microsoft Office 365

 Experience with benefits Management system AMS360 Benefit Point experience a plus.

If you are passionate about enhancing employee experiences through effective benefits management, we invite you to apply today and become a vital part of The Reis Group's success!
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Pay: From $75,000.00 per year
Application Question(s):

 Do you have experience in marketing health benefits and client renewals?

Language:

 Spanish (Preferred)

License/Certification:

 Life and Health License (Required)

Ability to Commute:

 Goshen, NY 10924 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Sales & Logistics Manager
description:
Company Overview:
Founded in 2004, Rocky Mountain Biologicals (RMBIO) is an international biotechnology company located in Missoula, Montana. RMBIO manufactures liquid cell culture media, sera, transport media, and protein fractions for the global research, biopharma, medical, and clinical diagnostic industries.
Rocky Mountain Biologicals is a small, yet growing organization that works closely with our sister company in South Korea. We’re looking for the right person to join our team of 13 employees as a Sales & Logistics Manager.
About the Position:
RMBIO is a small company; our ideal candidate is comfortable wearing many hats. The Sales and Logistics Manager is responsible for leading the sales team to achieve company sales goals and objectives. This role involves developing strategic sales plans, building and maintaining client relationships, and overseeing daily sales department operations. Additionally, the Sales and Logistics Manager manages the planning, implementation, and oversight of logistics operations for key raw materials and customer shipments. This includes identifying suppliers, coordinating the flow of raw materials to RMBIO, and managing the distribution of finished products to customers. The Sales and Logistics Manager will also ensure optimal inventory levels of critical raw materials for the production of biologically derived products. Maintaining relationships with key suppliers and customers is crucial. The role also involves managing a sales associate to support the company’s sales goals. Further responsibilities include managing the production schedule and overseeing customer requested projects.
Key Responsibilities:

 Maintain relationships with customers and suppliers of key raw materials.
 Monitor market trends and competitor activities to identify growth opportunities and ensure RMBIO remains competitive.
 Utilize digital marketing (for example, email campaigns, and online advertising) to reach potential customers.
 Attend industry events, webinars, and conferences to develop business with potential customers and partners.
 Plan production schedule based on sales orders and forecasts, coordinate and align objectives with head of manufacturing.
 Coordinate the flow of goods from suppliers to RMBIO manufacturing and customers.
 Manage finished product inventory levels to ensure optimal stock availability.
 Develop and implement coordination strategies to support sales goals.
 Monitor and optimize transportation and distribution processes.
 Liaise with suppliers, manufacturers, and customers to ensure smooth operations.
 Maintain accurate records of shipments, inventory, and deliveries.
 Resolve any issues related to organization and supply chain management.
 Align logistics operations with sales objectives.
 Manage international shipments and corresponding regulatory requirements.

Qualifications:

 Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Logistics, Supply Chain Management, or a related field.
 Proven experience in sales, with a strong track record of meeting or exceeding targets.
 Proven experience in logistics and supply chain management.
 Strategic planning and execution capabilities
 Strong organizational and multitasking skills.
 Excellent communication and negotiation abilities.
 Ability to work independently and handle multiple projects.

Skills:

 Strategic planning and problem-solving.
 Leadership and team management.
 Analytical and data-driven decision-making.
 Attention to detail and accuracy.

Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $50,000.00 - $60,000.00 per year
Benefits:

 Dental insurance
 Health insurance
 Paid time off
 Vision insurance

Schedule:

 8 hour shift
 Monday to Friday

Ability to Relocate:

 Missoula, MT 59808: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Residential Sales Manager
description:
ImOn Communications has been the LOCAL choice for business telecommunications services in the Siouxland area since 1997. Over the last two years, we have expanded our network to offer fiber-to-the-home Internet services to Siouxland residents. As we grow our network, we are looking for a Residential Sales Manager to join our team.
At ImOn, you will be part of a workplace that values relationships with colleagues, customers, and our community. Our culture is focused on fostering a fun and rewarding work environment where you’ll help our team create connections, one person at a time.
We are seeking a dynamic and results-oriented Residential Sales Manager to lead and drive performance across our residential telecommunications division in the Sioux City area. This role is responsible for managing the end-to-end lifecycle of our residential sales, ensuring optimal customer satisfaction, workforce efficiency, and revenue growth. The ideal candidate will possess strong leadership skills, extensive experience in the telecom industry, and a proven track record of managing sales initiatives.
Compensation: Base pay + commission.
Sales Leadership & Strategy

 Develop and execute sales strategies to drive customer growth and market penetration in the residential market.
 Collaborate with Marketing to analyze market trends, customer feedback, and competitor activity to refine offerings and improve sales performance.

Cross-Functional Collaboration

 Coordinate with Marketing, Customer Service, Product Development, and Engineering to ensure alignment in campaigns, product rollouts, and customer experience enhancements.
 Act as the point of contact to coordinate residential sales and marketing events, which may include some evenings and weekends.

Performance Management

 Lead, coach, and mentor Residential Sales team to achieve and exceed Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) including customer acquisition, churn rate reduction, and upselling targets.
 Set clear goals, monitor performance metrics, and implement continuous improvement initiatives.
 Utilize data-driven tools and Customer Relationship Management (CRM) platforms to track sales progress, installation timelines, and customer satisfaction.

Budgeting & Resource Allocation

 Manage departmental budgets, forecast revenue projections, and ensure cost-effective resource allocation.

We are looking for people with:

 Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience in a related field.
 3+ years or management experience motivating others to reach specific sales goals.
 5+ years proven sales experience.
 Excellent interpersonal communication and presentation skills with the ability to work independently as well as part of a team.
 Excellent time management and organizational skills with the ability to handle multiple projects, meet established deadlines and change as business needs require.
 Valid driver’s license with a driving record that allows the employee to be insured by ImOn’s insurance carrier.

It would be nice if you had (preferred qualifications):

 Door-to-door sales experience.
 Marketing experience.
 Telecommunications industry experience.

At ImOn, we'll hook you up. We offer our employees a full benefit package to include:

 A 401k plan with up to a 4% company match.
 Insurance benefits that include multiple health insurance plans to choose from, Dental insurance, free Vision insurance and Life/Disability insurance.
 A robust wellness program that offers annual health screenings as well as fitness incentives.
 Work/Life balance that includes several different types of paid time off such as paid holidays, vacation time, personal time, volunteer time off as well as parental leave and bereavement leave.

Job Type: Full-time
Pay: From $70,000.00 per year
Benefits:

 401(k)
 401(k) matching
 Dental insurance
 Employee assistance program
 Employee discount
 Flexible spending account
 Health insurance
 Health savings account
 Life insurance
 Paid time off
 Parental leave
 Referral program
 Vision insurance

Schedule:

 8 hour shift
 Day shift

Work Location: In person

title: Regional Sales Manager
description:
The Peak Group of Companies is a leader in home improvement, supplying a vast array of innovative products throughout Canada, the United States, Australia, and New Zealand. Peak is a highly valued, strategic partner of Home Depot. Our unique business platform perfectly aligns with Home Depot’s do-it-yourself and professional customer, and our best-in-class products are offered throughout Home Depot’s massive retail network.
The Peak Group of Companies – proud recipient of the 2023 and 2024 HRD Best Place to Work Award. Our greatest strength is our people, a team of remarkably talented, supportive and passionate people. We are a place where innovation is encouraged, talent and teamwork are celebrated and results and success are rewarded.
We are experiencing continuous growth and have an immediate opening for the USA Regional Sales Manager position.
Job Summary 
Located in Atlanta, this role is focused on expanding Peak's market share in partnership with Home Depot within the Atlanta region. Reporting directly to the Vice President of U.S. Sales, this position will proactively identify and develop new business opportunities, driving growth in the market. If you are a motivated self-starter with a passion for travel, and possess exceptional sales, communication, and interpersonal skills, this could be the perfect opportunity for you!
Responsibilities: 

 Achieve/exceed sales targets.
 Grow Peak and Home Depot market share.
 Adhere to budget constraints.
 Analyze sales reports and create action plans.
 Maintain professionalism as a Peak representative.
 Foster strong relationships with Home Depot associates at all levels.
 Schedule time to meet with Home Depot's Regional, District and Store Managers, as well as members of Home Depot's head office team.
 Conduct "Train the Trainer" programs and product demonstrations with MET, MET regional managers and store associates.
 Identify and develop new business opportunities within Home Depot.
 Support and execute new product launches; co-ordinate and monitor the successful implementation of store resets and/or remodels; plan and attend special store events
 Plan and share a monthly schedule of your store walks in advance.
 Perform any other tasks and duties as requested by management from time to time

Qualifications: 

 Minimum of 5 years of retail sales experience
 Experience in retail, manufacturing, or account management, particularly in the home improvement industry
 Superior work ethic and self-starter
 Ability and willingness to travel 60% by car and 40% plane
 Communicate clearly and professionally in person, by phone and via email
 Excellent organization skills and the ability to execute and manage competing demands
 Strong interpersonal skills
 Basic computer skills including Microsoft Excel, Outlook, Word, and PowerPoint
 Post-secondary education is preferred, but not required.

Compensation: $100,000-$120,000/yr depending on experience plus commission.
The Peak Group of Companies is an equal opportunity employer. We respect the dignity and worth of every individual in the workplace and value the importance of diversity, fairness, and trust. Our goal is to attract, develop, and engage employees with exceptional ability and diverse backgrounds.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

 Performance bonus
