title: Technical Account Manager, Refining and Petrochemical
description:
Position: Technical Account Manager, Refining and Petrochemical 
Location: Preferably Houston Area 
Territory: Texas 
Status: Full-time, Permanent (1) 

 We’re not looking for just another chemicals Account Manager. We are looking for a technical, refinery-savvy, in-person closer who thrives in a fast-paced, boots-on-the-ground sales environment, who enjoys meeting new potential customers. 

 If you know your way around a refinery, enjoy walking units with engineers, and have the grit to chase down new business while building long-term trust with commercial and technical stakeholders, we want to hear from you. 

 At Quadra, we’re expanding, and looking for a Technical Account Manager to take charge of a key territory in Texas. 

 This isn’t a desk job or a slow-burn sales cycle. You’ll be face-to-face with decision makers across refining, LNG and petrochemical plants, owning your territory as an entrepreneur and representing one of the most respected chemical distributors in North America. 

 You’ll report directly to the Sales Manager, who will expect you to lead with initiative, building relationships, identifying pain points, and capturing value at each customer location, from engineers and operators to procurement teams. This role is perfect for someone who understands refining processes, thrives on competition, and has the confidence and credibility to sell technical solutions in a complex environment. 

 We want:


 A true sales hunter: someone who chases growth proactively, networks and doesn’t wait for leads to come in.
 An individual who can seamlessly take over existing business and leverage those relationships to grow Quadra’s footprint with strategic customers.
 A technical engineer with a firm grasp of refining operations.
 A visible, in-person presence, on the road, in plants, face-to-face with customers. After a year, your customers should know your name, Quadra and champion the value you bring.
 A team player who values transparency and collaboration, leveraging Salesforce to track Accounts, share Insights, manage Opportunity and contribute to a culture of accountability and territory growth.
 Someone who fits our people-first, entrepreneurial culture and is in it for the long haul.
 If you’ve sold into the downstream space, worked in operations or technical support, or have a network in refining you’re ready to activate, this is your opportunity to make a real impact. 

 Let’s talk. 

 Who are we? 
Founded over 48 years ago, Quadra is dedicated to its 550+ employees located in Canada and the United States. You will join a North American team that supports clients across the country and across the border. We are one of the largest distributors of chemicals and ingredients in North America and have facilities in strategic locations throughout the US. 

 At Quadra, we offer not only an engaging culture, a collaborative, family-oriented and supportive environment, but also a lot of autonomy and flexibility. Quadra has the perks of a large company and the accessibility of a small company. We also offer you the opportunity to be part of a professional, fun, innovative and engaged team in a growing, people-oriented organization that is Great Place to Work® certified in the US. You will work with dynamic colleagues who are eager to share their knowledge with you. 

 As a Technical Account Manager, your key responsibilities will include: 


 Building and expanding strong relationships with key refinery and petrochemical customers in alignment with Quadra’s values, strategic goals, and business direction.
 Meeting and exceeding annual sales and gross margin targets through disciplined execution and proactive territory management.
 Leveraging internal resources and supplier partnerships to deliver best-in-class technical and commercial support to clients.
 Reviewing customer technical details and host quarterly, in-person technical reviews on core products, such as Amines, Glycols, Activated Carbon, Molecular Sieve and other products as needed.
 Representing Quadra's product portfolio, including technical and commodity products, through regular in-person visits, joint calls, and active participation in industry conferences and trade events.
 Engaging in strategic networking, organizing, attending, and hosting events to raise brand visibility and connect with new prospects.
 Supporting customer troubleshooting 24/7 and identifying process optimization opportunities on site.
 Traveling frequently across the territory to stay connected to your accounts and uncover new business opportunities
 Demonstrating strong communication and presentation skills, both written and verbal.
 Managing urgent client needs and tight deadlines with professionalism and urgency.
 Identifying and qualifying key decision-makers and understanding their specific operational and purchasing needs.
 Leading the full sales cycle: from prospecting and relationship-building to contract negotiation and deal closure.
 Maintaining long-term relationships with influencers and decision-makers to secure recurring and new business.
 Navigating a dynamic, fast-changing environment with adaptability and a problem-solving mindset.
 Proactively cold calling and prospecting to fill the pipeline and grow market share.
 Maintaining detailed, up-to-date reporting and activity tracking using Salesforce.
 Forecasting territory progress and annual territory growth year/year.
 Key Skills and Attributes:


 Outgoing, approachable, and highly skilled at building trust-based relationships across all levels of a refinery or petrochemical site
 Willingness to be on-site regularly, travel frequently, and maintain a strong physical presence in the field
 Exceptional communication and presentation skills, with the ability to distill complex technical concepts into customer value
 Self-motivated and highly organized, with a track record of driving results and managing a territory like a business
 Tenacious and driven, persistent in the face of obstacles, with the resilience to win new business in a competitive environment
 Commercially astute, with the ability to balance technical selling with strategic account development
 Naturally curious, with a genuine interest in refinery operations, problem-solving, and process improvement
 Empathetic and emotionally intelligent: able to read a room, navigate internal politics, and adjust approach accordingly
 Able to actively listen to customers, extracting information and determining their needs through industry expertise
 Able to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic, and unstructured environment where priorities can shift quickly
 Proficient in CRM tools (Salesforce preferred) and disciplined in tracking activities, pipeline development, and opportunity management
 The ideal candidate will have the following qualifications:


 (Required) Bachelor’s degree in Chemical, Mechanical, Petroleum Engineering, or a related technical discipline
 Minimum 5 years of experience in technical sales or business development, specifically selling products or services to the refining or petrochemical industries
 Operations or technical background in a refinery, petrochemical, or chemical facility (minimum 5 years) is a significant asset
 Strong familiarity with the oil & gas sector and/or chemical distribution industry is considered a valuable advantage
 Hands-on experience with gas treating products such as amines, glycols, molecular sieve, heat transfer fluids, activated carbon, and other key commodities
 Proven track record of prospecting, qualifying, presenting, and closing new business opportunities
 Consistently meets or exceeds sales targets and KPIs through disciplined planning and execution
 Demonstrated ability to develop and grow long-term customer relationships, particularly with engineering and operations stakeholders
 Willing and able to travel up to 40% of the time, including international and overnight travel across the U.S. and Canada
 Must possess a valid driver’s license and passport and live within close proximity to a major airport
 Proficient with CRM platforms (Salesforce preferred), and mastery of the full Microsoft Office suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Word)
 At Quadra, we offer not only an engaging culture, a collaborative, family-oriented and supportive environment, but also plenty of autonomy and flexibility. We also offer you the opportunity to be part of a professional, fun, innovative and committed team in a growing, people-oriented, Great Place to Work® certified organization. 

 The advantages of choosing this position at Quadra:


 Flexible Remote Work & Autonomy: Enjoy the flexibility to work from home and autonomy to manager your key territory!
 Tailored training: We provide personalized training to support you and your growth
 Permanent, full-time position: Join us for a stable, long-term career
 Competitive salary & Performance Incentives: Your hard work is rewarded with attractive compensation and bonuses
 Excellent Benefits Package: Medical, Dental, and more to keep you covered including our Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
 Generous Time Off: Flexible personal days, sick days and vacation to recharge
 Wellness Programs: Enhance your quality of life with wellness initiatives, including health and mental wellness programs from healthcare leader
 401K with match: Plan your future with our matched retirement program
 Car & Tech Perks: We cover your car allowance, mileage, cellphone and internet costs.
 Family-owned and support environment: Be part of a private, family-owned company with a strong infrastructure and core values
 Award-Winning Workplace: Work in a certified Great Place to Work®, WEConnect Women Owned, and Best Managed Company!
 Inclusive Culture: We celebrate diversity and caring for each other and having fun are part of our core values!
 Career Growth: Unlock opportunities for development in a fast pace growing company
 Fun Social Activities: Get involved in company events, Volunteering programs, etc.
 Referral & Recognition Programs: Earn monetary rewards through our referral and employee recognition programs (years of service, merit awards, etc.)
 If you're ready to unleash your potential, make a difference, and embark on a fulfilling career in professional sales, we invite you to submit your resume detailing your experience and passion for sales. Together, let's redefine customer service and sales excellence and shape a brighter future for Quadra and our valued customers. 
Compensation Information: The annual base pay range for this position is reasonably expected to be $95,400 and $161,100 USD. Please note that the base pay shown is a guideline, and individual total compensation will vary based on factors such as job-related knowledge, skills, education, and experience. 
Base salary is only a part of the total rewards package - this role will also be eligible for a generous incentive program and benefits. Quadra’s salary ranges are benchmarked and are determined by role and level. Please note that the base pay shown qualifications, skill level, competencies, and work location. 
#LI-Remote 
#quadra1 

 Quadra supports and values diversity and offer equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status and gender identity. Quadra also welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. We recognize that some people do not identify themselves as either male or female. Therefore, whenever possible, we have opted for a gender-neutral wording in a non-discriminatory spirit.

title: Key Account Manager - Idaho/Utah
description:
We are currently looking for a Key Account Manager to join our team covering the Idaho and Utah areas. In this role, you will be responsible for maintaining and increasing sales volume with established key accounts while proactively seeking new business opportunities. You will act as the primary liaison between clients, internal teams, and management, ensuring profitable growth and exceptional service delivery. This is an exciting opportunity for someone who excels in strategic account management, relationship building, and driving sales success.
   What You Will Do:
  
   Achieve or exceed monthly and yearly revenue targets through strategic account management and sales efforts.
   Build and maintain strong relationships with key decision-makers within accounts.
   Align Semex’s genetic solutions with client needs through consultations, presentations, and personalized sales strategies.
   Identify upselling opportunities and develop strategic plans to maximize revenue.
   Negotiate pricing, terms, and services within corporate guidelines.
   Proactively resolve client issues and leverage internal resources for optimal solutions.
   Collaborate with sales representatives to enhance client relationships and generate leads.
   Manage client accounts receivable, ensuring prompt resolution of overdue accounts.
   Maintain accurate sales activity records and reports.
   Represent the company professionally at meetings and training programs.
  
   What You Need to be Successful:
  
   Proven 5+ years outside sales and/or business development experience in the Agriculture, A.I. or Dairy industry.
   Strong ability to build and maintain client relationships.
   Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
   Strategic mindset with a results-driven approach.
   Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a team.
   Proficiency in CRM systems, dairy herd management software (e.g., Dairy Comp, BoviSync, Animal, PC Dart) and sales reporting tools.
    Weekly local/ regional travel within Idaho and Utah is required. This could flex but will be roughly 80% of the time.
  
  
  
 What We Offer:
  At Semex, we demand the best of ourselves, our company, and what we do for our customers. Surrounding ourselves with the best, the brightest, and the most driven professionals ensures we attain this goal. We offer a challenging yet flexible work environment along with a competitive compensation and benefits package. At Semex, you will have the opportunity to make a difference in a world that increasingly requires innovative approaches to sustainable agriculture.
  We truly believe people are the cornerstone of our success—passion fuels our results, leadership creates growth and opportunities, and transparency builds clarity, encourages ideas, and challenges the status quo. If you are passionate about strategic account management and driving customer success, we encourage you to apply!
  Semex encourages people with disabilities to apply for open positions. Accommodations will be available upon request, depending on need, for candidates participating in the various stages of the recruitment process. Please contact: talentmanagement@semex.com.
   We thank all applicants for applying for this position, but only those considered for an interview will be contacted.

title: Sales Account Manager - Retail
description:
Introduction
Our client, a leader in the meat industry is currently seeking a Sales Account Manager - Retail to join their dynamic team. In this role, you'll be instrumental in driving growth and success in the Western USA market. Collaborating closely with regional leadership and marketing counterparts, you'll develop and execute strategic sales plans to meet and exceed objectives. With your expertise in customer relationship management, logistics coordination, and business development, you'll ensure exceptional service to our valued retail clients. If you're passionate about sales, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and have a proven track record in the food service industry, we invite you to explore this exciting opportunity.
Responsibilities
Sales Strategy:

 Collaborate with the Regional Sales Director and North American marketing team to develop annual and long-term strategies.
 Identify opportunities to serve existing retail and food service customers while attracting new ones in the region.

Sales and Marketing:

 Research and develop annual sales plans aligned with established strategies.
 Create customer-specific business plans and budgets, ensuring alignment with organizational objectives.
 Assist in the development and delivery of promotional materials for the region.

Procurement Plan:

 Review and confirm monthly inventory orders in line with sales plans and customer demand.
 Coordinate with the procurement team regarding product needs for planned activities.

Customer & Distribution Relationship Management:

 Maintain and strengthen customer relationships to secure supply contracts.
 Identify and develop relationships with prospective customers and distribution channels.
 Stay informed about market trends and competitor activities.

Logistics and Transportation:

 Coordinate distribution channels to ensure timely deliveries.
 Monitor inventory levels and product rotation in storage centers.

Supplier Relations:

 Maintain regular communication with major suppliers to stay informed about market trends.

Performance Effectiveness:

 Meet financial, customer, and business goals in the Eastern USA market.
 Monitor accounts receivables and report on market activity.
 Undertake professional development activities as needed.

Business Development:

 Identify opportunities for business growth.
 Collaborate with the team to explore new retail product opportunities.
 Maintain a network of influencers to support business development efforts.

Success Measures

 Achieve retail and food service sales objectives on a monthly and annual basis.
 Ensure successful product delivery while meeting inventory targets.

Requirements

 10+ years of experience in retail sales dealing with meat products.
 Prior experience with major retailers is preferred.
 Strong communication, negotiation, and sales planning skills.
 Fluency in English and proficiency in Excel and ERP software.
 Willingness to travel for business 25%-30% of the time

What We Offer
Why apply through Brunel? Finding the next step in your career can be a fulltime job in itself. We manage the process for you: from submitting your resume to coordinating interviews to extending offers and assisting with on-boarding. We’ll get you going while you get on with the job.
#BRUCAD
About Us
Brunel has a reputation for working with some of the best in the business. That’s what we continually strive for. Over 45 years, we’ve created a global network of interesting clients and talented individuals working together through a vast array of services.

 401(k) matching
 Dental insurance
 Health insurance
 Paid time off
 Vision insurance

 8 hour shift
 Monday to Friday

 Bonus opportunities

title: Account Manager
description:
Our culture is made up of highly motivated professionals striving for excellence in every office, board room and job site. Our professionals are collaborative individuals who pursue career growth with distinction and are willing to work for it. They understand the pivotal role they play in keeping every professional safe, forge trust by listening to one another, learn from every action large and small, and engage fully in their work to support every aspect of the organization.
 Reporting to the Sales Manager, the Account Manager will develop new sales opportunities throughout the Permian Basin and will continue to build on STEP’s Coiled Tubing and Hydraulic Fracturing reputation as an industry leader in this market segment. Building and sustaining strong relationships with external stakeholders based on credibility, integrity, and open dialogue is a critical success factor.

 
  RESPONSIBILITIES:
 
  Support execution of sales strategy for STEP’s Coiled Tubing and Hydraulic Fracturing and Nitrogen business lines.
  Actively call on and establish, maintain, and develop business, social and networking relations with Upstream Oil and Gas Operators.
  Analyze client needs and interests and determine how STEP’s products and services can best meet their needs.
  Sell STEP’s products and services and negotiate pricing and contract terms.
  Gather intelligence on competitor activities and opportunities and follow up with contacts for future work.
  Recommend solutions to product-related problems and support marketing of new technologies and applications.
  Facilitate the resolution of client issues, problems, or complaints.
  Develop the reputation of STEP as the most reliable, innovative, and cost-effective provider in the market segment.
  Participate in relevant trade shows, industry associations, and client events.
  Provide and follow up on qualified leads to the Sales team to consistently improve their ability to break down barriers with prospective clients.
  Assist in the preparation of annual sales forecast, as required.
  Build and maintain collaborative partnerships with various project teams and departments internally.
  Remain current with new technology and completion techniques in the energy industry.
  Provide input into strategic recommendations for STEP’s overall sales activities.
  Demonstrate a high level of leadership by utilizing the Company’s cultural values in every facet of work, both internally and externally
 
 
  Prepare and present technical presentations on STEP’s products and services.
  Remain current with new technology and completion techniques in the energy industry.
 
 
  Support and provide clear communication while negotiating contracts and MSA with clients
 

 
  WE OFFER:
 Benefits: Robust benefits package that includes:
 
  Medical
  Dental
  Vision
  Company-paid short-term disability
  Company-paid Life and AD&D.
  Voluntary life/AD&D
  Long Term disability
  Accident coverage
  Critical illness
  401k with company match
  Vacation and paid sick time
 

 
  QUALIFICATIONS:
 
  A minimum of 5+ years sales experience.
  A minimum of 8 years experience working within the Oil and Gas Upstream space.
  Bachelor’s degree preferred or equivalent work experience required.
  Must possess a valid driver’s license.
 
 KEY COMPETENCIES:
 
  In-depth understanding of current oil and gas market conditions.
  Strong technical understanding of Coiled Tubing and Hydraulic Fracturing
  A demonstrated network of contacts within STEP’s target client list
  Strong communication and interpersonal skills, exceptional listening, good oral (formal and informal) and well-developed written communication skills.
  Excellent facilitation, conflict resolution, and negotiation skills.
  Must be Self-motivated and a team player.
  Must be computer proficient
 

 
  Safety Focus: Safety is one of our core values and is our first priority, both in and out of the field. Our primary goal is to successfully deliver results without compromising the safety of our professionals.
 
 Equal Opportunity Employer
 This employer is required to notify all applicants of their rights pursuant to federal employment laws. For further information, please review the Know Your Rights notice from the Department of Labor.

title: Catering Sales Manager
description:
Position Title: Catering Sales Manager
 Status: Exempt/Hourly
 Compensation: $65,000 - $75,000 – includes base salary and commission on catering food and beverage sales
 
 Position Summary:
 The Catering Sales Manager is responsible for driving catering revenue through strategic outreach, client development, and exceptional service, while collaborating with the operations team to ensure successful event execution. The candidate works directly with clients to understand their needs, proficiently detail event menus and logistics, and meet deadlines while working towards common goals of the business. Obtain events outside of building spaces through networking, outreach, and expansion into different sales markets.
 This position requires anticipation of project needs, discerning work priorities, and willingness to work some nights and weekends.
 Responsibilities: 
 Sales and Business Development 
 
  Drive catering revenue through proactive sales outreach, client relationship management, and a strong presence in the local market
  Identify and pursue new business opportunities both on and off campus, including corporate events, university departments, and community partnerships
  Build and maintain a strong client base through consistent follow-up, exceptional service, and attention to detail
  Represent Steenbock’s on Orchard at networking events, industry functions, and community gatherings to expand brand presence and generate leads
  Create and execute strategic sales initiatives to grow repeat business and maximize revenue potential
  Track sales activity and provide regular updates and projections to management
 
 Event Planning and Production 
 
  Assist with negotiations for on-site and off-site space contracts, coordinate food and beverage, and manage vendor services such as rentals or AV
  Propose new ideas to improve the event planning and implementation process
  Leverage knowledge and experience in banquet management, decision-making, problem solving, and customer service to ensure successful events and deliver a high level of client satisfaction
  Act as the primary point of contact for clients throughout the planning process and during key moments of the event.
  Communicate all event details, updates, and changes clearly with FOH and BOH teams to ensure smooth execution.
  Close out, invoice, and follow up on outstanding payments in accordance with policy.
  Demonstrate professionalism and enthusiasm while representing the restaurant and Food Fight during client interactions.
  Provide on-site support for select events—particularly with high-profile clients—to ensure expectations are met, and the guest experience is seamless.
 
 Event Administration: 
 
  Prepare proposals for service and event orders, in a timely precise manner
  Assist with preparing budgets and provide periodic progress & sales projection reports to management
  Coordinate appointments and tours of on-site & off-site spaces, tastings, and scheduling of events with remainder of execution team & clients as necessary
 
 
 Apply Today:
 If our culture and team sound like something you’d like to be a part of, apply today.
 
 Steenbocks1
  Job Requirements:
 
  Excellent communication and organizational skills
  Ability to manage multiple projects at one time
  Excellent interpersonal skills both in person and by phone, with high professionalism
  Ability to accomplish projects with little to no supervision
  Fantastic customer service ethic and high expectations for quality
  Demonstrated success in sales or client development, ideally in hospitality, catering, or events
  Experience using event management software
  Minimum of 2 years of catering event planning experience required
 
 Additional Responsibilities: 
 
  Perform other duties, as assigned, to meet business needs.

title: Tableau Developer
description:
Job description:
Position is Onsite - 50% onsite at Lawrenceville, NJ
Please submit local candidates. EM will not consider candidates looking to relocate.

 SAP Business Objects – Must have advanced experience. Strong experience in creating reports using SAP BO.

The Pharmacovigilance (PV) Analytics and Reporting Specialist, PV Analytics Center of Excellence is responsible for successful execution, and close-out of activities aligned with the overall vision, strategy, and objectives of the Global Biostatistics & Data Sciences Function. The PV Analytics and Reporting Specialist, PV Analytics Center of Excellence contributes to the ongoing development, implementation, and successful execution of the scientific, operational, and regulatory reporting efforts in line with the overall PS needs. The PV Analytics and Reporting Specialist reports to the Senior Manager, PV Analytics Center of Excellence, within Global Biostatistics & Data Sciences. The PV Analytics and Reporting Specialist, PV Analytics Center of Excellence applies a combination of life sciences strategy, leadership, and reporting/visualization experience to drive successful servicing of information needs across PS.
Responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:
Data Analytics and Reporting

 Build and continuously improve data analytics through supporting models that provide insights into efficiency, quality, stakeholder feedback, and key performance indicators to drive timely and informed decision making
 Maintain and develop reporting databases and analytics applications in environments such as Excel, Tableau, Power BI, SAP Business Objects and/or other clients environments
 Leverage internal data systems and tools to efficiently maintain data and reporting processes to minimize manual data retrieving
 Liaison with validation team to create validation test script, validation plan, validation summary report and test scripts.
 Utilize data analysis tools to aggregate and analyze data to make actional recommendations and answer key business questions
 Run and maintain reports regarding activities, outcomes, and be prepared to deliver presentations to management team on a regular and ad-hoc basis

 Analyze key stakeholder complaints, address rapidly, and discuss with applicable functional leads to collaborate and propose impactful and realistic solutions

 Support program and project team activities required to implement innovation initiatives.
 Contribute to the management and prioritization of process improvement and innovation initiatives
 Define and provide metric reporting and data analysis for GBDS/PS initiatives including relevant insights to facilitate decision-making process

Skills/Knowledge Required:
•Bachelor’s Degree
•Advanced experience with creating reports in SAP Business Objects
•Advanced Tableau or Power BI experience in creating interactive dashboards
•Advanced SQL experience for data querying
•Ability to organize/curate data and see big picture from scattered pieces of information
•Knowledge of taxonomies, ontologies, and other knoledge management constructs
•Analytical and strategic thinking skills required

 Strong PowerPoint, Word, and Excel Skills
 Knowledge of Validation processes and associated documentation.
 Excellent verbal, writing, presentation, and project management skills
 Strong strategic orientation with ability to translate into operational priorities and plans
 Ability to promote cooperation and commitment within a team to achieve goals and deliverables.
 Ability to resolve complex problems and manage difficult stakeholder situations
 Ability to lead the development of critical path analyses and support scenario planning
 Promotes and practices effective pro-active decision-making, ensuring timely coordination and dissemination of information
 Demonstrated ability to work on multiple projects
 Strong willingness to collaborate with cross-functional partners
 Flexible, team member with positive attitude, friendly demeanor, ability to prioritize projects and balance competing priorities
 Confidentiality and integrity are required

description:

We are seeking a C# .NET Developer with good SQL Server development skills to join a mid-sized team of developers working on new development of Web Applications, Windows Applications and supporting maintenance on existing applications when needed.
The ideal candidate should have experience working in an Agile environment and interacting/coordinating with all members of the team (Product, QA, Implementations) in order to deliver high quality and efficient solutions.
The candidate will be a primary contributor in designing, coding, testing, debugging, documenting and supporting all types of applications consistent with established specifications and business requirements to deliver business value.
Daily activities will include analysis, coding, design, and collaboration with QA on testing. Interaction with the team is highly collaborative and cooperative.
Primary Responsibilities:
● Analyze and provide solutions for complex tasks and projects, providing design documentation as required
● Work with team lead and product owner to understand business requirements
● Actively collaborate with team members, QA, and product owners in an Agile environment on projects in
order to deliver high quality and efficient solution

● Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to mitigate and address these issues
● Help maintain code quality & organization
● Provide accurate and timely estimates for project tasks
● Exhibit solid organizational skills and focus on accuracy and attention to detail
● Exhibit excellent analytical, problem solving and troubleshooting abilities
● Be self-motivated with the ability to work both independently and in a team environment
To be considered for this job, candidates may be required to have the following skills and experience:
● Bachelor degree or above; degrees in Computer Science preferred; can be substituted with relevant
experience
● Strong knowledge of .NET Framework, .NET Core, & object-oriented programming

● 2-4 years’ experience with C# .NET programming (ASP.NET, ADO.NET)
● 2-4 years’ experience with SQL Server 2016 or higher (creating SQL, table design, views, stored
procedures, triggers, etc.)
● 2-4 years’ experience with REST, SOAP, and related Web Service oriented architectures

● 2-4 years’ experience with Source control; Git is preferred
● 2-4 years’ experience with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, JSON, AJAX

title: Email Campaign Developer
description:
Software Resources has an immediate, contract job opportunity for an Email Campaign Developer with a major corporation in Orlando, FL.
  
 Position is Remote, but must work EST hours.
 
 Important to Have:
 1. Extensive HTML knowledge, HTML coder with emphasis on email, experience with salesforce marketing cloud with ESP
 2. Focused on email side of salesforce marketing cloud (MUST HAVE)
 3. Any other ESP, adobe campaign, Marketa experience would be a nice to have but have to have Salesforce Marketing Cloud Scrum team experience would be a nice to have

 JOB SUMMARY: 
 Responsible for end-to-end technical html coding for email campaigns within Salesforce Marketing Cloud (inclusive building, editing, testing, and deployment), ensuring consistency with Orlando Resort brand elements and delivering flexible email creative frameworks to enable dynamic content.
 
 ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
 
  Designing and coding responsive HTML templates that enable dynamic content customization & personalization of the email working with Salesforce Marketing Cloud.
  Thoroughly test emails for compatibility including responsive layouts across all email providers on multiple computer platforms (pc & mobile) including most commonly used web browser-based email clients. Troubleshoot and resolve coding issues in a timely manner.
  Restructuring and/or hand-coding (raw coding) HTML templates to meet design standards. Work with pre-existing HTML templates and provide design and image editing.
 
 
  Serves as a subject matter expert, on production, and deployment best practices. Ensure email programs meet with regulatory compliance (CAN SPAM, CASL, and GDPR) and privacy/permission policy best practices. Stays informed of industry trends, technology and design/coding changes as related to email marketing.
 
 
  Understand and actively participate in Environmental, Health & Safety responsibilities by following established policy, procedures, training, and team member involvement activities.
 
 QUALIFICATIONS: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or abilities (KSAs) required. 
 
  Must have experience in Salesforce Marketing Cloud, including Email Studio, Mobile Studio and Journey Builder inclusive of creating automations and journeys
  Experience in other ESP's like Adobe AJO nice to have
  Advanced technical skills and expertise with HTML and CSS optimized for email deployment with an understanding of the difference between coding for the web and coding for email. Ability to code HMTL by hand
  Must be able to code responsive emails
  Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with constantly changing objectives and timelines
  Strong project manager and innovative problem solver who is intensely detail-oriented, result-focused, and able to successfully execute multiple projects accurately and on time.
  Proven expertise with Adobe Photoshop, Dreamweaver, and animated gifs
  Advanced experience with email testing software (render testing), working with email deployment platform and troubleshooting creative deployment issues
  Passion for learning new skills, expanding experience
  Ability to work in a highly collaborative environment, multi-task, and participate in a team-based planning process
  Customer Service Oriented with a "can-do attitude even when faced with complex requests
 
 Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
 
 Consistent attendance is a job requirement.
 
 EDUCATION: Bachelor's degree from a four-year college or university in Fine Arts, Graphic Design, Marketing, Business Communications, etc.
 
 EXPERIENCE: 3-5 years preferred; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
 
 About Software Resources
 Software Resources, founded more than 3 decades ago, is a trusted staffing partner specializing in Technology (IT, Creative, & Marketing), Finance, & Accounting placements. We work with companies nationwide that need skilled professionals and connect them with candidates like you looking for the right opportunity.
 
 We are always looking for professionals at all experience levels and in various specialties to meet our clients' hiring needs. As a member of our team, you will have access to benefits including medical, dental, and vision coverage, a 401(k) with company match, short-term disability, life insurance with AD&D.
 
 If this position fits interests you, we encourage you to apply. You can view all our job openings at Software Resources Careers.

title: Content Developer
description:
Job Title: Trainer/Content Developer
Location: Atlanta, GA
Duration: 6+Months (Contract)
Hybrid || Either Web Cam or In Person
Need Locals
Job Description:
Adheres to the priorities, procedures, objectives, and guidance of their GDOT Team Leader and IT management.
Keeps Team Lead fully informed of work schedule, technical issues/risks, or any travel or accommodation concerns. Proactively communicates and takes steps with Team Leader and IT management to mitigate any issues/risks.
Learns and maintains knowledge of GDOT IT applications to a level sufficient to effectively teach and guide learners in its use and operation.
Maintains, coordinates, and communicates training schedules/course offerings with end users and stakeholders.
Ensures training environments and data are ready prior to training classes.

Completes enrollments, course attendance/completions, and assigns appropriate scoring/grades within the LMS. Sends out surveys.
Ensures correct recordkeeping within the LMS, timekeeping/work activity reporting, and performance indicator reporting.
Ensures travel expenses, taxes, and forms are correct on billing statements, etc. Submits expense reports through appropriate systems and within expected timeframes. Complies with travel policies and reimbursement procedures.
Reviews and updates training materials and documentation.
Produces effective training content suitable to course audience. Publishes course materials as needed.
Participates in IT projects. Provides user training support with IT product user acceptance testing, initial rollouts, and ongoing production operation.

Microsoft Office and Office 365 applications
BA/BS in in communications, teaching, IT or similar field; or Associate Degree w/2 yr of IT experience; or IT Certifications w/4 yr IT experience

Excellent verbal and written English language communication, presentation, and teaching skills

title: Reports Developer
description:
Reports Developer
  Job Category: Information Technology
  Time Type: Full time
  Minimum Clearance Required to Start: Top Secret
  Employee Type: Regular
  Percentage of Travel Required: Up to 10%
  Type of Travel: Local
  * * *
 
 Are you a passionate, experienced Reports Developer who likes working under minimal direction? Do you have expertise in both the extraction of data and presenting it to meet customer needs? Join our team as a Reports Developer! You will get to use your systems knowledge to improve our Financial and Acquisitions System that supports our DoD Customer execute their vital mission. How does the opportunity to help improve the visibility of data for a key Government system sound to you?
 We have been supporting our customer for over 20 years with the implementation of a Commercial-Off-the-Shelf (COTS) Financial and Acquisitions System, Momentum. We continue to develop and implement exciting and complex solutions to support the evolving needs of our customers.
 We are looking for a Reports Developer with the desire to be a critical member of our team updating existing reports and designing new capabilities for our customer. This includes both standardized BIRT reports as well as developing reports in Business Objects. You will work as a member of the Technical Development Team, developing custom reports relating to Finance and Acquisitions data.
 
 
  The Technical Development Team will work closely with functional resources, solution developers, infrastructure resources, and configuration change management resources to perform analysis, design, development, testing, and deployment of reports. This includes developing technical design documents, developing reports, and following configuration management processes to deliver results to the customer.
 You will have strong technical and problem-solving skills and the ability to properly prioritize, multi-task and work collaboratively with our project team. This is a great opportunity for an experienced developer who enjoys interacting with people and has a desire to expand their knowledge and take on greater responsibility. Your contributions will directly impact the success of the customers' mission, our team, and ultimately CACI! In return, CACI will provide you with a company that fosters a culture based on integrity, strong ethics, quality work, and professionalism, while supporting your career growth aspirations.
 
 What You’ll Get to Do:
 
 Contribute to the development and documentation of reporting through:

  
   Collecting and documenting reporting requirements from customer work sessions.
   Identification of custom or ad hoc reports to include detailed technical requirements.
   Translating business requirements into specifications that will be used to implement the required reports.
   Design, development and testing of custom BIRT reports to meet business requirements.
   Design, development and testing of underlying universe or framework to support ad hoc reporting.
   Defining, documenting, and executing unit test cases to confirm requirements are met.
   Support system and user acceptance testing activities, including issue resolution.
   Supporting the functional and technical activities for the customer’s financial management and contract writing system reporting tool.
   Provide subject matter expertise in support of reports technical activities.
   Continuously increases knowledge of Business Intelligence applications/tools.
   Work independently with minimal guidance from more senior software developers.
  
 You’ll Bring these Qualifications:

  
   Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Information Systems or other technically relevant degree.
   5 years of technical experience in system design, development and production support of large applications/systems.
   Strong knowledge of Oracle SQL and PL/SQL, including stored procedures.
   Ability to obtain Security+ Certification.
   Willingness to work onsite in a secure facility.
   Active Top Secret or TS/SCI clearance.
  
 These Qualifications Would be Nice to Have:

  
   Design and development experience with Business Intelligence and Reporting Tools (BIRT), including
  
 
 
  Design and development experience creating dashboards through Business Objects, Pentaho, Cognos, etc.
  Experience with Financial Management or Business Applications.
  Technical experience with CGI Momentum Financials software.
  Possess prior experience supporting large scale organizations with successful ERP implementation(s).
  Security+ Certification.
 
 
 
  ________________________________________________________________________________________
 
  What You Can Expect:
 
 
 A culture of integrity.
 At CACI, we place character and innovation at the center of everything we do. As a valued team member, you’ll be part of a high-performing group dedicated to our customer’s missions and driven by a higher purpose – to ensure the safety of our nation.
 
 
 An environment of trust.
 CACI values the unique contributions that every employee brings to our company and our customers - every day. You’ll have the autonomy to take the time you need through a unique flexible time off benefit and have access to robust learning resources to make your ambitions a reality.
 
  A focus on continuous growth.
 Together, we will advance our nation's most critical missions, build on our lengthy track record of business success, and find opportunities to break new ground — in your career and in our legacy.
 
 
 Your potential is limitless. So is ours.
 
 Learn more about CACI here.
 
  ________________________________________________________________________________________
 
  Pay Range: There are a host of factors that can influence final salary including, but not limited to, geographic location, Federal Government contract labor categories and contract wage rates, relevant prior work experience, specific skills and competencies, education, and certifications. Our employees value the flexibility at CACI that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives. We offer competitive compensation, benefits and learning and development opportunities. Our broad and competitive mix of benefits options is designed to support and protect employees and their families. At CACI, you will receive comprehensive benefits such as; healthcare, wellness, financial, retirement, family support, continuing education, and time off benefits. Learn more here.

title: Program Developer
description:

title: Computer Engineer
description:
At Lendmark Financial Services, we believe the success of our company is specifically attributable to the quality of our employees and their commitment to our customers. We value each customer and understand that people want to do business with people who care. That’s one way we differ from our competitors. We are proud of what we as a team have accomplished. We will always strive for improvement, our motto since day one has been “Success is the only option.”
Lendmark Financial Services offers a comprehensive benefits package for employees and dependents that includes medical, dental, vision benefits, paid time off, paid holidays, 401(k), life insurance, long-term disability, tuition assistance and an employee assistance program. We also offer optional benefits such as critical care, auto, home and pet insurance as well as other ancillary insurance options.
Please note: This position will be located at the Lawrenceville GA Corporate office. This is not a remote position. 
SUMMARY:
The Computer Engineer is primarily responsible for Architectural Design, Engineering Computer Solutions to Business and technical problems, provide leadership to team responsible for collaborating on Desktop, Laptop, Tablet, and specialized computer platforms, deployment infrastructure connected with managing enterprise computer platforms, automation of deployment, break-fix, and lifecycle of enterprise computer platforms, lead deployment of remediation and new computer platforms, and provide final level of support escalation from the Help Desk. This position will also recommend, define, standardize, document, test and implement new software and hardware based on requirements from the business. The Computer Engineer will also document, monitor, and report on computer systems issues and lead appropriate IT staff to reproduce and resolve computer related problems.
MAJOR DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES:

 Recommend, Define, and Document Standard System components that support the business systems.
 Meet with vendors and IT management / Architects in reviewing new computer platform technology providing Advanced technical insight in theory, and Baseline Infrastructure.
 Provide Advanced Understanding of the entire Infrastructure Architecture supporting the implementation, deployment, and everyday operations of the compute stack.
 Documents, monitors, reports, and manages resolution as part of problem management.
 Provides Advanced technical support to end users when cases are escalated from peer engineers and technical support professionals.
 Performs Advanced technical engineering for Current and past Windows Computer Operating Systems, Active Directory, Anti-Virus and Lendmark Core Business and Productivity software stack.
 Integrates computer solutions into core computer services (e.g., DNS, DHCP, Active Directory, Security Solutions).
 Reviews and Defines Installations, configurations, and updates to computer platforms.
 Actively participates in the identification of new user needs or program enhancements.
 Writes, reviews and/or maintains technical documentation.
 Accountable for changes to the Windows Operating System to improve performance and reliability
 Manages 3rd party vendors to complete projects or troubleshoot issues
 Reports weekly status on projects
 Attends weekly staff meetings
 Manages Company risk relative to position

BASIC REQUIREMENTS:

 Bachelor’s Degree or comparable education/training (additional Four years’ experience in lieu of degree). Where education is substituted for experience, HS Diploma or GED from accredited institution, required.
 Ability to demonstrate strong Communication and Presentation skills
 5+ years of experience with windows operating systems, deployment tools and architectures, computer platforms, computer vendor management, Active Directory support, DNS, DHCP and print services; creating, managing, and deploying Active Directory Group Policy Objects (GPOs) and associated custom GPO templates for the virtual environment and Roaming profiles, virtualization, power shell, and other scripting tools.
 OS Deployment tools and architecture (e.g., Acronis, MS System Center, Flexera, MDT, HPDM)
 Advanced Adaptability to fast changing environment.
 Independent Analytical Thinking. Breaking down large complex problems into smaller components and addressing each component as a method to resolution to the larger problem.
 Approaches technology architecture and engineering by collecting and analyzing data from technical trends an best practices.
 Advanced experience in installing, testing, evaluating and integrating various applications and 3rd party solutions into the virtual architecture
 Extensive experience resolving computer system issues
 Ability to lead a team on specific engineering projects and tasks.
 Must be able to reach across groups in spirit of teamwork to gain cooperation in delivery of engineering projects and tasks.
 Advanced Attention to detail. Must be able to organize tasks, define responsibilities, and assign priorities to insure a timely technical delivery.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

 Experience in Financial/Banking industry
 Knowledge of enterprise single sign-on solution
 Knowledge of virtualization platforms.
 Experience in Office 365 roll-out and support
 Windows 10/11 Professional and Enterprise
 MDM (Mobile Device Management) solution
 Manage Engine End Point Central patching solution
 HP Device Manager(HPDM)
 LANSWEEPER Asset Management Tool

COMPENSATION:

 The salary range for this position is $105,000 - $120,000 annually, based on the specific Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and/or Experience of the selected candidate.
 This position is eligible for Semi Annual Incentive compensation based on individual and company performance guidelines.

WORKING CONDITIONS:

 Normal office environment

 Travel frequency up to 10%

title: Software Technician
description:
WGNSTAR is a dynamic and growing company with a global footprint. Primarily focused on the semiconductor industry, we provide a platform for you to expand your career with knowledge gained on-the-job training, and tailored development. We know we need talented people like you who hold similar values, which is why we do not put limits on learning, development, industry, and personal growth. Start your path to a WGNSTAR career today!
 WGNSTAR is hiring software technicians who will be part of the site project management team and will support the development, testing, and maintenance of software systems that interact with semiconductor devices and manufacturing equipment.
 
 Schedule: Day Shift M-F 7:30 am - 4 pm
 Pay Rate: $25-$28/hr. DOE
 Location: De Soto, KS
 Benefits: This position is eligible for WGNSTAR’s full benefits package, including Medical, Dental, Vision, and 401(k). Additional benefits are listed at the end of this posting.
 
 Principal Duties & Responsibilities: Other duties may be assigned.
 
  Follow all corporate safety protocols and report unsafe conditions.
  Develop and maintain software tools/equipment used in semiconductor testing and production.
  Write scripts or applications for data collection, analysis, and automation.
  Assist on-the-job training to the internal technician in routine operation, installation, and troubleshooting of assigned products.
  Effectively troubleshoot issues for both hardware and software.
  Interface software with semiconductor manufacturing equipment (e.g., testers, handlers, wafer probers). Ensure smooth communication between hardware and software systems.
  Analyze test data to identify trends, anomalies, or failures. Generate reports for engineering and quality assurance teams.
  Professionally interact with multi-national and multi-language teams.
  Prepare and submit all necessary paperwork and accurate status reports with supervision. Maintain technical documentation for software tools, procedures, and test setups.
  Input data to QA / QC check sheet, report creation, and submission to Installation Site Manager.
  Attend daily field start-up meetings. Work with minimum supervision, as needed.
 
  Qualifications:
 
  Associate's degree (AS) in Electrical/Mechanical/Software Engineering or equivalent combination of education and experience in the industry or Military Certification is preferred.
  1 -2 years of knowledge or proficiency in IT, automation, robotics, or computer systems.
  Familiarity with semiconductor testing platforms and protocols. Understanding of electronics and semiconductor device fundamentals.
  Experience with data analysis tools and version control systems.
  Ability to read electrical schematics, blueprints/layouts, and diagnose/troubleshoot electromechanical devices.
  Ability to analyze, diagnose, troubleshoot, and solve practical problems.
  Must have basic PC skills, including MS Office, Excel, Windows, etc.
  Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations.
  Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals.
  Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public.
  Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.
  Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables.
 
  Work Environment:
 
  The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job.
  While performing the duties of this position, the employee frequently works near live equipment moving parts, requiring situation awareness at all times.
  The employee is occasionally exposed to toxic or caustic chemicals and the risk of electrical shock.
  The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.
 
  Physical Effort/Activities:
 May be required to walk up to 5+miles per day, able to be on feet for 8-10 hrs at a time, able to bend, twist, push/pull, crouch, kneel in confined spaces, may work at heights, on a ladder, and lift up to 50 pounds. The physical demands described above are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Additional Benefits: Paid Vacation, Select Holidays, Overtime Opportunities, On-site Facilities & Career Development Opportunities.
 
 This job description is intended to convey information essential to understanding the scope of the job and the general nature and level of work performed by job holders within this job. But this job description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of qualifications, skills, efforts, duties, responsibilities, or working conditions associated with the position.
 
 The people who thrive most on our teams are those individuals who perform well in a team environment, enjoy interacting and engaging with several different stakeholders, adapt quickly to changing environments, and leverage their skills, quality, and knowledge to drive themselves and their teams towards continuous improvement and success.
 #LP
 
 This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship.
  
 Equal opportunities and Social Governance
 WGNSTAR is an Equal Opportunity Employer, drug free workplace, and complies with ADA regulations as applicable.
 WGNSTAR places an immense emphasis on equal employment, encourages diversity in the workplace, and applies an open-door policy for inclusion of all employees. Our diversity program encourages people from any gender, background, ethnicity, culture, education, and experience to join the company and more importantly build a career through employee development.
 Through our Global wellness programs, WGNSTAR ensures our employees and families have access to a full range of wellness services through our Employee Assistance Program (EAP). In the communities that surround our business operations, we support individual and group sponsorships for local sports and those that are vulnerable in society.

title: Job Developer Level 1
description:
Job Developer
 Cincinnati, OH
  In-Person
  Anticipated deadline to submit application: Aug 1, 5pm ET. Position may close early if application limit is met. Apply promptly for full consideration.
  The Opportunity
 CEO is currently seeking to hire a Job Developer for our local office, a role that's crucial to CEO's work to help individuals coming out of incarceration regain the skills and confidence needed for a successful transition to stable and productive lives.
 Job Developers increase the range of employment opportunities available to our participants using participant interests, experiences, and their ambitions as foundation for participant job placements, and more broadly, for the identification and cultivation of potential employers for prospect portfolios.
 The most rewarding part of being an Job Developer is the joy you feel upon making the "right fit" match between participant and employer. Your expertise and insight lead not only to successful matches in the now, but to participant longevity in the workforce which often drastically reduces the rate of recidivism.
 As part of our mission, we strongly encourage individuals who have lived experience of incarceration or involvement in the justice system to apply for this role.
  Who We Are
 The Center for Employment Opportunities (CEO) provides employment services to people recently released from incarceration. Across the United States, 8,000-9,000 people participate in CEO each year, transitioning to employment that supports themselves, their families, and their communities.
 What began as a demonstration project of the Vera Institute of Justice in the 1970s to address employment barriers facing the formerly incarcerated following release in New York City has grown into the leading reentry employment organization in the country, where over 30,000 formerly incarcerated individuals have secured full-time employment since 1996.
  Who You Are
 
  You're deeply dedicated to social justice and perhaps are already working in the re-entry space
  You come to CEO with experience in workforce development, recruitment, or sales/account management, a role in which you needed to meet performance goals on a regular basis
  You're passionate about making an impact in people's lives and interested in guiding them to achieve their career goals through a balance of accountability and empathy
  You enjoy networking and cultivating lasting relationships with people and businesses, helping them understand how our work can help them achieve their business strategy and goals
  You have excellent interpersonal and written communication skills with the ability to adjust to particular personalities and interaction styles on the spot
  You're resilient and never give up, anticipating and addressing challenges along the way while keeping your eye on the end goal
  You're comfortable working under pressure and meeting deadlines despite opposition or setbacks
  You're able to look at a set of data or market research and use it to guide your practice and decision-making
 
 Responsibilities
 Key responsibilities of the Job Developer include but are not limited to:
  Business Strategy and Analysis
 
  Envision, develop, and implement a strategic plan for placement services that ensures CEO meets its participant placement metrics
  Conduct reviews of existing CEO business partnerships regularly, evaluate employer demand and usage of CEO services, and determine improvements and ways to leverage relationships with employers
  Achieve weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual placement goals in accordance with CEO's contractual obligations
 
 Relationship Cultivation and Maintenance
 
  Research, conduct outreach to, and build relationships with prospective employers willing to hire CEO participants and who have hiring needs that match the skills, experience, and interests of our overall participant cohort
  Maintain relationships with existing employer partners
  Schedule and conduct daily prospecting, cold calls, and face-to-face meetings
  Serve as the liaison among employers, participants, and our criminal justice partners
 
 Job Placement
 
  You are expected to produce up to 5 direct placements a month
  Screen and match program participants with employment opportunities, taking into consideration each participant's skills, work experience, interests, and goals and aspirations
  Customize participants' resumes to fit identified opportunities
  Manage a caseload of participants, support and coach them around applying for jobs, navigating the hiring process, and finding and securing right fit employment
 
 Administrative Support
 
  Document all participant and employer contact, activities, and outcomes in our case management system (Salesforce)
  Perform other job-related duties and responsibilities assigned from time to time
 
 Compensation and Benefits
 The salary for this position is $47,250. In an effort to be both equitable and transparent, CEO's compensation philosophy considers a variety of factors, including, but not limited to, experience, internal equity, and home office location in making a final determination on our salary offer.
 We recognize that salary is a part of the overall compensation package and also provide a comprehensive benefits package, including medical and dental coverage, as well as professional development opportunities and training, including regular training opportunities in Motivational Interviewing (MI). MI is one evidence-based skill that reentry and human service professionals can utilize when supporting participants to achieve their goals.
 We also offer paid parental leave, participation in a retirement plan, sick and vacation leave, paid holidays and more. We are a workplace that promotes continual learning and teamwork, offering lunch and learns, team outings, holiday gatherings and more for our staff.
  More About Us
 Center for Employment Opportunities believes that everyone deserves the chance to shape a stronger future for themselves, their families, and their communities. People who are justice involved are highly encouraged to apply for vacant positions at all levels. CEO is committed to the CROWN Act, and creating an open space where our employees can present as their true authentic selves.
 All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without unlawful discrimination based on race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, gender, gender identity, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, military status, prior record of arrest or conviction, citizenship status, current employment status, caregiver status, or any other category protected by federal, state, or local law. We value diverse experiences, including with regard to educational background and justice system contact.
  Please note that due to the volume of resumes received, we are unable to contact each applicant regarding the status of each position or reply to candidates' inquiries via phone or email.
 IND 1

title: Web and Software Integration Specialist
description:
Business Technologist
 Marion County, FL
 $25.58
 8 a.m.-5 p.m. Monday-Friday
 Temp-to-hire
 
 
 ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS
 Assists the County’s IT department to determine the feasibility of implementing new computer applications or upgrades and obtains detailed specifications from users to ascertain specific output information requirements.
 Serves as a technical liaison on software design requirements, application and system installation and implementation and system scope and design objectives.
 Reviews, analyzes, and evaluates business systems and user needs. Documents requirements and defines scope and objectives. Confers with departmental officials for preliminary determination of program feasibility; reviews existing procedures and business process and defines problem and machine capability.Prepares cost benefit/ROI analysis.
 Supports the overall business / project plan by contributing to the research and analysis of assigned project deliverables and detailed specifications from which vendor systems will be programmed and/or configured.Provides process and workflow analysis.Monitors project deliverables.
 Responsible for coordinating technical aspects of the process, including the establishment of business standards, interpreting and disseminating technical information.Assists in implementation, maintenance, and provides support for business system software.
 Makes recommendations and assists in selecting new and modified systems and programs to ensure software information systems meet client specifications and needs, standards and guidelines and efficiency requirements. Facilitates the planning, testing and documenting of software systems.
 Develops data verification methods and establishes business standards for preparation of operating instructions.Develops and coordinates computer system report requirements and outline system needs.
 Responsible for the coordination and monitoring of hardware and software upgrades.
 Ability and knowledge of creating reports with Crystal Reports and SQL reporting services with data from database software.
 Develop and coordinate financial and data driven dashboards for various components generated from multiple applications.
 Responsible for administering a wide range of policies, rules and regulations as they apply to business processes and coordinate system issues with IT.Schedules workflow and develops report techniques.
 Plans, directs and supervises the development and preparation of business process applications and the design of flow charts and related matter.
 Prepares written reports and documentation of efforts for use by Director and to be shared with IT, County Administration and/or County Commissioners.
 Provides excellent customer service to members of the general public and other County employees. Personal contact occurs with other employees of the unit, employees of other departments in the County, citizens, and customers of the department. Service is provided in person or by phone contact.
 
 
 QUALIFICATIONS
 
 
 Education and Experience:
 
  Associate Degree (Bachelor Degree preferred) with major course work in information technology, management of information systems, business administration or engineering; one year of experience required, three years of experience preferred in analysis, programming, or computer systems; with one year of lead worker or supervisory experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
  Experience using SQL and Crystal reporting preferred.
  Formal training in current billing systems and databases preferred.
 
 
 
 Licenses or Certifications:
 
  Possession of a valid, State of Florida driver’s license to operate a motor vehicle.
  Must successfully pass a Criminal Justice Information Services (CJIS) background check and maintain a current CJIS Level 4 Security Awareness Certification. These requirements exist at the time of hire and as a condition of continued employment.
  May be required to complete National Incident Management System (NIMS) courses 100, 200, 700, 701,800 within one year of employment.

title: Automation and Tooling Engineer
description:
Job Overview
PTR Baler and Compactor (PTR), a division of Komar Industries, is a world leader in the waste equipment industry. The company manufactures and services balers, compactors, and provides parts and resources to customers.
PTR is seeking a hands-on, Automation and Tooling Engineer to lead the design, integration, and optimization of robotic and automation systems within our manufacturing operations. This role requires a strong understanding of automation technologies (e.g., welding and paint robots) and a solid foundation in designing tooling and fixtures used in robotic applications. The ideal candidate will bridge the gap between process design, tooling development, and shop floor implementation. This position will report to the Weld Engineering Process Manager
Responsibilities:

 Lead programming, commissioning, and troubleshooting of robotic systems, including Welding robots and Paint robots.
 Experience with robotic simulation software
 integrate robot-controller-to-PLC communication protocols.
 Utilize SolidWorks or AutoCAD for 3D modeling and design of tooling components.
 Design custom fixtures, jigs, clamps, and End of Arm Tooling-EOAT for welding or robotic applications.
 Implement lean manufacturing principles to optimize tooling usage and reduce waste.
 Provide training and support for operators on the proper use of tooling equipment.
 Lead small- to mid-size projects from concept through implementation, including vendor coordination, budgeting, and risk management.
 Read and interpret schematics and blueprints to ensure accurate fabrication of tools.
 Conduct testing and validation of new tooling designs to ensure reliability and performance.

Qualifications:

 Minimum 3 years of experience working with industrial automation systems in a manufacturing environment.
 7 years engineering, or industrial engineering experience (including tooling), preferred.
 Deep understanding of welding processes (MIG, TIG, spot welding), part tolerancing, heat-affected zones, and weld sequencing.
 Ability to read blueprints, schematics, and engineering drawings.
 Knowledge of GD&T (Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing) and its application in fixture alignment and precision tooling
 Proficient in 3D CAD software: SolidWorks, Autodesk and or Inventor
 Experience with hydraulics/pneumatics, welding/fabrication.
 Proven track record in programming, commissioning, and troubleshooting robotic systems.
 Familiarity with industrial painting processes, including robotic spray pattern programming, masking, and coating thickness requirements.
 Knowledge of Lean Manufacturing, 5S, Poka-Yoke, and process FMEA.
 Strong organizational skills to manage BOMs, 2D/3D drawing sets, tooling lists, and standard work documents.
 Skilled in conducting design reviews and root cause analysis (RCA).

Physical Requirements:

 Must be able to lift 35 pounds at a time.
 Physically capable of kneeling, reaching, stooping, standing, pulling, or pushing.
 Work environment is in open warehouse/garage where temperatures vary with the weather.

Benefits:

 Medical, Vision and Prescription Insurance
 401K with company match.
 Group Life Insurance paid for by the company.
 Short Term Disability paid for by the company.
 Long Term insurance paid for by the company.
 Dental Insurance.

title: SAP Integration Developer, Kuiper
description:
Project Kuiper is Amazon’s low Earth orbit satellite broadband network. Its mission is to deliver fast, reliable internet to customers and communities around the world, and we’ve designed the system with the capacity, flexibility, and performance to serve a wide range of customers, from individual households to schools, hospitals, businesses, government agencies, and other organizations operating in locations without reliable connectivity.
 
 Export Control Requirement:
 Due to applicable export control laws and regulations, candidates must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (i.e., current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.
 
 To be successful you need to be a talented Integration Developer willing to learn how to build solutions with new software applications such as SAP and MES (Manufacturing Execution Systems). You need to be highly motivated and detail oriented while collaborating with other functional owners, customers and team members to develop dynamic and flexible systems to meet the emerging demands of manufacturing systems.
 
 Key job responsibilities

 
  Design and review integration architecture for SAP ERP applications
  Develop complex integrations with internal systems and external (non Amazon) systems working with external technical teams
  Lead and implement integration best practices, procedures, and policies for integration patterns
  Production support for integration failures and triage needs
  Design and configure strong integration error handling and alert mechanisms
  Work with Kuiper security, Kuiper infrastructure and other teams to get integration architecture reviewed
  Review deliverables and provide final approvals for architecture design and production deployments
  Interface with functional, technical teams to finalize field mapping, integration tests and user acceptance
  Stay current with new ERP / SAP / AWS integration technology developments and techniques, research new software and tools, proactively recommend improvements
 
 A day in the life
 Integration developers typically start their day with team communication and planning through stand-up meetings, followed by core development work. Their work involves code reviews, testing, deployments, and team meetings, while actively utilizing tools like SAP BTP Cockpit, Git repositories, and SAP Integration Suite. Throughout the day, they focus on designing and implementing integration scenarios between different systems, developing cloud applications, debugging integration flows, monitoring interfaces, and collaborating with team members to deliver robust business solutions.

  BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
 
  Completed Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience
  - 6+ years of SAP experience with 4 or more years of middleware software systems - SAP CPI, SAP PO

 
  Experience integrating multiple Cloud systems
  ABAP Proxies, Alert Monitoring, ALE Configuration, RFC, Idoc, AIF, JMS adapters, SOAP, REST, Web Services, Odata Services
  - 2+ years of SAP ABAP development experience - CDS views , RESTful ABAP Programming (RAP), Basics of Cloud application programming (CAP)

  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
 
  Experience with EDI integrations for Supply Chain
  Experience with external (Supplier, Vendor, Broker) systems, with experience interacting with technical teams, coming up with finalized architecture, architecture security review
  Awareness of Integration concepts and work on AWS integration options
  Experience with SAP BTP based integrations
 
 Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of protected veteran status, disability, or other legally protected status.
 
 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
 
 Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $116,300/year in our lowest geographic market up to $201,200/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.
