title: Frontend Web Developer
description:
FRONTEND WEB DEVELOPER
Join a high-flying team! Jet OUT – Wisconsin’s #1 light jet operator – is a fast-growing private aviation company that emphasizes innovation, flexibility, and personalized service. We’ve recently expanded our fleet and operations, establishing the newest and largest fleet of Citation CJ4 Gen2 light jets in the U.S. As we continue to grow beyond the Midwest with new bases in South Florida and Scottsdale/Phoenix, and a 22,000 sq. ft. private terminal underway in Wisconsin, we’re building out our tech team to elevate our digital experience. If you’re a creative Frontend Web Developer with a passion for UI/UX design, we want you to help us craft engaging web experiences that match the excitement of flying private!
ABOUT Jet OUT
Jet OUT is a Milwaukee-based private aviation company pioneering a unique co ownership model for private jets. Our mission is to personalize private jet travel in ways no traditional operator can. By marrying cutting-edge technology with a customer-first mindset, we deliver flexible, VIP experiences at a fraction of the usual cost. In 5+ years, Jet OUT has grown to become Wisconsin’s leading light jet operator, now serving clients in markets across the country. We pride ourselves on a friendly yet professional culture where team member’s ideas can take flight. At Jet OUT, innovation isn’t just a buzzword – it’s how we stay ahead, whether investing in modern aircraft or new technology. We value grit, collaboration, creativity, and an entrepreneurial spirit, all in a fun, close-knit team that’s as passionate about great user experiences as we are about aviation.
ROLE OVERVIEW: Frontend Web Developer (UI/UX Design Focus)
We’re looking for a Frontend Web Developer who lives at the intersection of design and code. In this full-time, on-site role in the Milwaukee area, you’ll take the lead in crafting intuitive user interfaces and delightful web user experiences for Jet OUT’s digital platforms. This role leans heavily toward UI/UX design – you’ll create wireframes, visual mocks, and prototypes – but also involves bringing those designs to life with front-end development (HTML, CSS, JavaScript/TypeScript). You’ll work closely with our marketing and product teams to ensure our website and web apps are not only beautiful, but also fast, accessible, and easy to use. If you have an eye for clean design, a knack for smooth interactions, and the coding chops to implement them, this is the perfect opportunity to shape the digital face of a disruptive aviation startup.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Design engaging UIs: Create and refine wireframes, mockups, and interactive prototypes that align with Jet OUT’s brand and mission. Ensure a user-centered design approach that delivers simplicity and elegance.
Develop front-end features: Translate design prototypes into responsive, cross browser compatible front-end code using HTML5, CSS3, and modern JavaScript/TypeScript. Implement UI interactions and animations for seamless, intuitive user experiences.
Enhance UX and usability: Continuously improve the look and feel of our web presence. Conduct UI/UX testing, gather user feedback, and iterate on designs to optimize the customer journey (from landing pages to marketing emails to online booking flows).
Collaborate with cross-functional teams: Work closely with marketing and back-end developers to implement new website sections, microsites, or landing pages. Ensure design consistency and uphold best practices in web design across all pages.
Maintain and optimize web content: Update and manage content on our website (built on HubSpot CMS). Optimize pages for performance, SEO, and accessibility. Troubleshoot and debug front-end issues to maintain a smooth online experience.
Stay innovative: Keep up with industry trends in web design, UI frameworks, and digital user experience. Bring fresh ideas to the table and experiment with modern design concepts to keep Jet OUT’s digital experience cutting-edge.
QUALIFICATIONS
Must-Haves:
UI/UX design experience: Proven experience (2+ years) in web or mobile UI/UX design. Portfolio showcasing clean, modern designs and user-friendly interfaces. Proficiency with design tools like Figma to create wireframes and prototypes.
Front-end development skills: Solid knowledge of HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript (ES6+). Experience with TypeScript and front-end build tools is preferred. Able to implement designs pixel-perfectly in code and make responsive layouts that work across devices.
Framework/CMS familiarity: Experience with CSS frameworks or component libraries (e.g. Bootstrap, Tailwind) and understanding of front-end frameworks (e.g. the basics of React, Vue, or similar) for potential future use. Comfortable working within a CMS – HubSpot CMS experience is a big plus.
Eye for detail & UX principles: Strong understanding of typography, color, and layout. Familiarity with usability principles and accessibility standards (WCAG). You strive to make interfaces intuitive for end-users.
Problem-solving & learning mindset: Ability to debug HTML/CSS/JS issues and optimize user interactions. Quick learner willing to dive into Jet OUT’s preferred tech stack and adapt to new tools or workflows.
Team player: Excellent communication and collaboration skills. Ability to work on site with cross-functional teams, take feedback constructively, and contribute to a positive team culture. Self-motivated and able to manage time to meet deadlines in a fast-paced, startup environment.
Nice-to-Haves: 
HubSpot CMS or similar: Hands-on experience building templates or pages in HubSpot COS/HubL, or other marketing CMS platforms. Understanding of inbound marketing concepts is a bonus.
Graphic design skills: Ability to create or edit graphics, icons, or basic videos to support content (Adobe Creative Suite or similar).
SEO/Analytics knowledge: Familiarity with SEO best practices and using analytics tools to inform design improvements.
Passion for aviation/travel: An interest in the private aviation or travel industry. While no aviation experience is required, curiosity for our domain helps in crafting a more engaging user story.
WHY JOIN Jet OUT? (Benefits & Perks)
Impact & Growth: Join a rapidly growing company at the forefront of private aviation innovation. Your work will directly shape a brand that is transforming an industry – every pixel you perfect will be seen by an upscale, global clientele. We provide opportunities for you to grow your skills, lead initiatives, and advance your career as our tech team expands.
Startup Culture: Experience the best of startup life – a friendly, flexible work atmosphere with a close-knit team that values creativity and collaboration. We celebrate new ideas and empower you to take ownership of projects. No corporate bureaucracy here – just a passionate team driving toward a common goal.
Competitive Compensation: We offer a competitive salary in the range of $80,000–$100,000 (depending on experience). You’ll also receive performance reviews with the opportunity for merit-based increases.
Comprehensive Benefits: Jet OUT provides medical, dental, and vision insurance, so you can take care of yourself and your family. We offer a 401(k) retirement plan with company match and profit sharing, plus paid time off (vacation, holidays, and sick days) to maintain a healthy work-life balance.
Additional Perks: Enjoy travel industry perks like empty-leg flight opportunities (when available) – a unique benefit in private aviation.
HOW TO APPLY
Ready to launch your career with Jet OUT? We’d love to hear from you! Please send your resume, a link to your portfolio (or samples of your UI/UX design work), and a brief cover letter to careers@jetout.com. In your cover letter, tell us why you’re excited about combining design and development at an aviation startup like Jet OUT
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: From $80,000.00 per year
Benefits:

 401(k) matching
 Dental insurance
 Health insurance
 Health savings account
 Life insurance
 Paid time off
 Vision insurance

Schedule:

 Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Software Analyst
description:
A Software Analyst job in Cincinnati, OH is currently available at Belcan. This is a full-time direct position with benefits. To be considered, you will need a high school diploma and 2+ years of experience in a technical support environment and/or customer service. 

 Responsibilities and Daily Activities 


 Serve as SME and escalation for internal/external customer for incidents, requests and inquiries for all Business Products and applications
 Work with the Service Delivery team and internal/external customers to maintain business application uptime
 Serve as primary for internal/external customers for incidents, requests, and inquiries related to all business applications
 Log and document detailed ticket activity until resolution is complete and ticket is closed with customer
 Collaborate with other analysts and customer support groups to determine resolutions for customer incidents and requests
 Create knowledge base entries for solutions that may be repeatable so that others can leverage against future incidents/requests
 Make outbound calls to internal/external customers as part of the Incident Management lifecycle
 Other duties as assigned
 Skills and Requirements 


 Exceptional customer service skills
 Detail oriented and highly organized in all activities
 Python, PowerShell, and Bash scripting experience
 Working knowledge of Windows Server and Linux operating systems
 Familiarity with network infrastructure (Firewall, Routers, addressing, IP protocols, DNS)
 Familiarity with Windows / Linux Administration and LDAP (Active Directory)
 Solid understanding of virtualization concepts and architecture
 Solid understanding of Information Technology and computing systems, including service design
 Technical troubleshooting skills
 Ability to support and manage business services in a large-scale and diverse environment while following incident/escalation procedures
 Experience with managing 3rd parties and 3rd party delivered services
 A security focused mindset
 Ability to demonstrate flexibility including limited after-hours support
 Ability to manage sensitive and confidential information
 Due to the nature of the work performed, U.S. Citizenship is a requirement!
 Candidate must be eligible to obtain security clearance
 Desired Skills 


 Knowledge of license services, primarily FlexLM, LMX, and DSLS (both client and server-side configuration)
 Experience with Service Management
 Experience with SCCM software packaging and SCCM software deployment
 Familiarity with ServiceNow Incident Management System
 Familiarity with OpenLM
 Environment 
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit for long periods of time, wear a telephone headset. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. During periods of inactivity needs to be proactive in updating scripts and reviewing standards. 

 Working Conditions:
 The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet. Business casual dress is preferred. 

 Qualifications 
High School diploma required, ITIL Foundations Certification Desired, Vocational/Technical/Business School (6-8 Months specialized training) preferred Net+, CCENT preferred, CCNA desired. 2+ years in technical support environment and/or customer service 

 Belcan provides a competitive pay and benefits package. Benefits offered MAY include health, dental, vision, and life insurance; 401(k); education assistance; paid time off including PTO, holidays, and paid leave required by law. Salary guidelines for similar roles at Belcan are $74,880-$84,970. Guidelines vary based on many factors including but not limited to education, qualifications, experience, discipline, geographic location, market, and business considerations. 

 Belcan is an equal opportunity employer. Your application and candidacy will not be considered based on race, color, sex, religion, creed, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. 

 Build a challenging and rewarding career with an industry leader!

description:

ConEquip Parts, a growing construction equipment parts supplier, is seeking a Software Developer to join our internal development team. This is an in-office role that will focus primarily on maintaining and extending our Magento-based e-commerce platform, while also contributing to Python-based tools and integrations, including our ERP system (Odoo).
We are looking for a versatile and experienced developer who enjoys problem-solving, has a strong foundation in backend and full-stack development, and can collaborate across business and technical teams to bring ideas to life. The Software Developer is responsible for the scripting of websites and updating existing web applications using scripting languages. As a Software Developer, you will be responsible for coding, testing, design adjustments, and client reviews.

title: Frontend Web Developer
description:
FRONTEND WEB DEVELOPER
Join a high-flying team! Jet OUT – Wisconsin’s #1 light jet operator – is a fast-growing private aviation company that emphasizes innovation, flexibility, and personalized service. We’ve recently expanded our fleet and operations, establishing the newest and largest fleet of Citation CJ4 Gen2 light jets in the U.S. As we continue to grow beyond the Midwest with new bases in South Florida and Scottsdale/Phoenix, and a 22,000 sq. ft. private terminal underway in Wisconsin, we’re building out our tech team to elevate our digital experience. If you’re a creative Frontend Web Developer with a passion for UI/UX design, we want you to help us craft engaging web experiences that match the excitement of flying private!
ABOUT Jet OUT
Jet OUT is a Milwaukee-based private aviation company pioneering a unique co ownership model for private jets. Our mission is to personalize private jet travel in ways no traditional operator can. By marrying cutting-edge technology with a customer-first mindset, we deliver flexible, VIP experiences at a fraction of the usual cost. In 5+ years, Jet OUT has grown to become Wisconsin’s leading light jet operator, now serving clients in markets across the country. We pride ourselves on a friendly yet professional culture where team member’s ideas can take flight. At Jet OUT, innovation isn’t just a buzzword – it’s how we stay ahead, whether investing in modern aircraft or new technology. We value grit, collaboration, creativity, and an entrepreneurial spirit, all in a fun, close-knit team that’s as passionate about great user experiences as we are about aviation.
ROLE OVERVIEW: Frontend Web Developer (UI/UX Design Focus)
We’re looking for a Frontend Web Developer who lives at the intersection of design and code. In this full-time, on-site role in the Milwaukee area, you’ll take the lead in crafting intuitive user interfaces and delightful web user experiences for Jet OUT’s digital platforms. This role leans heavily toward UI/UX design – you’ll create wireframes, visual mocks, and prototypes – but also involves bringing those designs to life with front-end development (HTML, CSS, JavaScript/TypeScript). You’ll work closely with our marketing and product teams to ensure our website and web apps are not only beautiful, but also fast, accessible, and easy to use. If you have an eye for clean design, a knack for smooth interactions, and the coding chops to implement them, this is the perfect opportunity to shape the digital face of a disruptive aviation startup.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Design engaging UIs: Create and refine wireframes, mockups, and interactive prototypes that align with Jet OUT’s brand and mission. Ensure a user-centered design approach that delivers simplicity and elegance.
Develop front-end features: Translate design prototypes into responsive, cross browser compatible front-end code using HTML5, CSS3, and modern JavaScript/TypeScript. Implement UI interactions and animations for seamless, intuitive user experiences.
Enhance UX and usability: Continuously improve the look and feel of our web presence. Conduct UI/UX testing, gather user feedback, and iterate on designs to optimize the customer journey (from landing pages to marketing emails to online booking flows).
Collaborate with cross-functional teams: Work closely with marketing and back-end developers to implement new website sections, microsites, or landing pages. Ensure design consistency and uphold best practices in web design across all pages.
Maintain and optimize web content: Update and manage content on our website (built on HubSpot CMS). Optimize pages for performance, SEO, and accessibility. Troubleshoot and debug front-end issues to maintain a smooth online experience.
Stay innovative: Keep up with industry trends in web design, UI frameworks, and digital user experience. Bring fresh ideas to the table and experiment with modern design concepts to keep Jet OUT’s digital experience cutting-edge.
QUALIFICATIONS
Must-Haves:
UI/UX design experience: Proven experience (2+ years) in web or mobile UI/UX design. Portfolio showcasing clean, modern designs and user-friendly interfaces. Proficiency with design tools like Figma to create wireframes and prototypes.
Front-end development skills: Solid knowledge of HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript (ES6+). Experience with TypeScript and front-end build tools is preferred. Able to implement designs pixel-perfectly in code and make responsive layouts that work across devices.
Framework/CMS familiarity: Experience with CSS frameworks or component libraries (e.g. Bootstrap, Tailwind) and understanding of front-end frameworks (e.g. the basics of React, Vue, or similar) for potential future use. Comfortable working within a CMS – HubSpot CMS experience is a big plus.
Eye for detail & UX principles: Strong understanding of typography, color, and layout. Familiarity with usability principles and accessibility standards (WCAG). You strive to make interfaces intuitive for end-users.
Problem-solving & learning mindset: Ability to debug HTML/CSS/JS issues and optimize user interactions. Quick learner willing to dive into Jet OUT’s preferred tech stack and adapt to new tools or workflows.
Team player: Excellent communication and collaboration skills. Ability to work on site with cross-functional teams, take feedback constructively, and contribute to a positive team culture. Self-motivated and able to manage time to meet deadlines in a fast-paced, startup environment.
Nice-to-Haves: 
HubSpot CMS or similar: Hands-on experience building templates or pages in HubSpot COS/HubL, or other marketing CMS platforms. Understanding of inbound marketing concepts is a bonus.
Graphic design skills: Ability to create or edit graphics, icons, or basic videos to support content (Adobe Creative Suite or similar).
SEO/Analytics knowledge: Familiarity with SEO best practices and using analytics tools to inform design improvements.
Passion for aviation/travel: An interest in the private aviation or travel industry. While no aviation experience is required, curiosity for our domain helps in crafting a more engaging user story.
WHY JOIN Jet OUT? (Benefits & Perks)
Impact & Growth: Join a rapidly growing company at the forefront of private aviation innovation. Your work will directly shape a brand that is transforming an industry – every pixel you perfect will be seen by an upscale, global clientele. We provide opportunities for you to grow your skills, lead initiatives, and advance your career as our tech team expands.
Startup Culture: Experience the best of startup life – a friendly, flexible work atmosphere with a close-knit team that values creativity and collaboration. We celebrate new ideas and empower you to take ownership of projects. No corporate bureaucracy here – just a passionate team driving toward a common goal.
Competitive Compensation: We offer a competitive salary in the range of $80,000–$100,000 (depending on experience). You’ll also receive performance reviews with the opportunity for merit-based increases.
Comprehensive Benefits: Jet OUT provides medical, dental, and vision insurance, so you can take care of yourself and your family. We offer a 401(k) retirement plan with company match and profit sharing, plus paid time off (vacation, holidays, and sick days) to maintain a healthy work-life balance.
Additional Perks: Enjoy travel industry perks like empty-leg flight opportunities (when available) – a unique benefit in private aviation.
HOW TO APPLY
Ready to launch your career with Jet OUT? We’d love to hear from you! Please send your resume, a link to your portfolio (or samples of your UI/UX design work), and a brief cover letter to careers@jetout.com. In your cover letter, tell us why you’re excited about combining design and development at an aviation startup like Jet OUT
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: From $80,000.00 per year

 Paid time off
 Vision insurance

 Monday to Friday

title: Shopify Developer
description:
Description: 
  Position Overview
 The Johnson Health Tech North America E-commerce team is an expanding team of fitness professionals building the e-commerce experience for the Bowflex, Horizon Fitness, Schwinn Fitness, and JRNY brands. We’re looking for a skilled Shopify developer to join our fast-paced and collaborative environment. You’ll be responsible for developing and maintaining Shopify Plus themes, translating designs into responsive pages, managing third-party app integrations, and supporting store operations with tools and optimizations. Beyond technical implementation, you’ll collaborate closely with design, marketing, and operations teams to ensure a frictionless user experience. The ideal candidate has deep expertise in Liquid, JavaScript, HTML/CSS, and Shopify’s ecosystem, along with a strong eye for performance, UX, and detail.
  Responsibilities
  Shopify Plus Development
 o Develop and maintain Shopify Plus themes using Liquid, JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3/SASS.
 o Build and customize templates and features, including PDPs, PLPs, cart flows, and checkout enhancements.
 o Integrate third-party apps and APIs; manage custom app development when needed.
 o Optimize site speed, SEO, and mobile performance using best practices.
  Front-End Development
 o Translate Figma or design mockups into fully responsive pages.
 o Collaborate with design, marketing, and content teams to execute brand-aligned visuals and interactive features.
 o Ensure cross-browser compatibility and accessibility compliance.
  Shopify Store Management
 o Support merchandising and operations teams by building tools and processes to streamline store management.
 o Monitor and improve store performance metrics using tools like Google Analytics, Shopify Reports, and third-party apps.
 o Manage app installations, updates, and configurations to extend store functionality.
 o Coordinate with customer service and fulfillment teams to resolve technical or operational issues.
  Technical Leadership & Collaboration
 o Provide QA testing and troubleshooting for technical issues across the storefront.
 o Maintain Git-based workflows and deployment best practices.
 o Stay informed on Shopify Plus features, roadmap updates, and e-commerce trends.
 o Offer technical insights and contribute to e-commerce growth strategy. Requirements: 
  Education:
 Bachelor’s degree in computer science, web development, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
  Experience:
  Required
 o 3+ years of experience with Shopify Plus development.
 o Proficient in Liquid, JavaScript (ES6+), HTML, and CSS/SASS.
 o Strong understanding of Shopify architecture, APIs (Storefront, Admin), and theme structure.
 o Hands-on experience managing Shopify store settings, products, collections, and configurations.
 o Familiar with version control (Git) and deployment workflows.
 o Expertise in performance optimization and SEO best practices for e-commerce platforms, with a demonstrated ability to implement strategies that improve site speed, search engine rankings, and conversion rates.
 o Experience with third-party integrations, apps, and analytics platforms.
  Preferred
 o Familiarity with headless commerce and frameworks like Next.js, Hydrogen, or Remix.
 o Experience with content and product automation tools (e.g. Matrixify).
 o Understanding of digital marketing principles (email flows, CRO, UTM tracking).
 o Experience in a DTC (direct-to-consumer) e-commerce business.
 o Experience with international/multi-currency Shopify setups.
 o Shopify or e-commerce certifications.
 o Familiarity with analytics dashboards or BI tools.
  Benefits:

title: Database Developer/Technical Support Specialist
description:

The Database Developer / Technical Support Specialist is responsible for developing, maintaining, and supporting custom database systems used across the organization to enhance operational efficiency, data accuracy, and compliance with internal and external standards. This position involves database programming, user support, software backup management, and document handling for explosives certification processes, cloud storage transition, and non-ordnance shipping operations.Duties and Responsibilities:
1. Database Development & Maintenance
· Design, write, test, and maintain code using programming languages such as VBA, SQL, Power Fx, and JavaScript.
· Develop branch-specific databases and applications to support mission-critical processes.
· Debug, troubleshoot, and modify code to improve system performance or meet evolving requirements.
· Lead deployment and provide end-user training for internally developed databases.
2. Explosives Certification Database Management
· Develop and manage the explosives certification database.
· Ensure all training, certifications, task codes, and demonstration records are accurate and compliant with SOP/SD guidelines.
· Support certification/recertification processes by verifying data, preparing documentation, and coordinating with authorized personnel.
3. User Account & Permission Systems
· Manage a centralized user account database
· Ensure integration of account data with other branch databases and workflows.
4. Cloud Migration Support
· Develop and implement tools to support migration from hard drive storage to a secure cloud environment.
· Automate file mapping, duplication detection, and reporting functions.
5. Software Library & Backup Management
· Perform monthly backups of database systems
· Maintain backup libraries per security guidelines.
· Manage the software library and log system used on test consoles.
6. Shipping Documentation Support
· Prepare DD1149 forms and shipping manifests for non-ordnance shipments in compliance with logistics protocols.
Required Qualifications:
· Proficiency in VBA, SQL, JavaScript, and Power Fx.
· Experience with Microsoft Access and other database tools.
· Strong attention to detail, especially in managing regulated data and documentation.
· Ability to train and support end-users in database applications.
· Familiarity with Department of Defense data handling and certification requirements preferred.
· Secret level security clearance or ability to obtain one.
Work Conditions:
· Ability to sit and work at a computer for extended periods.
· Occasional lifting of documentation materials and discs as needed.
EEO Statement:
Paragon Force, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws.

title: First Officer
description:
Every day at Disney Cruise Line we take pride in bringing the magic of Disney to life. We find joy in creating cherished memories and form genuine connections with our guests. We hold each other to the highest degree and always act responsibly while ensuring the safety of fellow crew and guests. United by our Disney values, we work toward excellence in all we do. As a part of our team, you can live and work in a diverse and inclusive environment amidst a professional and supportive community. If you are ready to create unforgettable experiences and grow as a person and as a professional, apply today.
 
 As First Officer you will be the Senior Watch Keeper and during the watch the Master's representative on the Bridge, leading the Quartermasters on Bridge duty, safety work and fire patrol whilst also providing professional and social guidance to team members.
 
 You will report to the Staff Captain (except reporting to the Master for navigation)
 
 Level: 2.5 stripes Officer
 
 Responsibilities : 
 Be the Navigation Watch leader on a dual watch with a Junior Deck Officer
 
  Purchase and maintain all publications and charts
  Oversee cruise planning and itineraries, working directly with the Master regarding all navigational matters
  Oversee mooring stations during arrivals and departures
  Manage the daily routines of all navigational instruments; report any deficiency to the Staff Captain and Master
  Oversee all the emergency/pyrotechnic equipment on the Bridge and reporting this on the preventive maintenance system
  Maintain the on board PC ship-handling simulator
  Assist the Chief Officer Safety with Crew safety training, maintenance of LSA and FFE
  Uphold the general safety management responsibilities in areas and operations under your control
 
  Basic Qualifications : 

 
  Chief Mate unlimited license or higher
  2+ years' experience as Senior Watch Keeper on medium to large cruise vessels preferred
  Fluent written and spoken English
  Enthusiasm about guiding other team members
 
  Additional Information : 
 This is a SHIPBOARD role.
 
 Benefits offered year-round, on contract and off-contract, as long as return contract is signed, including Major Medical Coverage, Short & Long Term Disability, Life Insurance and Retirement Savings Plan Option.
 
 You must:
 
  Be genuinely interested in a career at sea and willing to live and work onboard a Disney Cruise Line vessel
  Be willing to follow and perform safety role, emergency responsibilities and associated responsibilities as specified in the ship Assembly Plan
  Be willing to uphold the general safety management responsibilities as specified in the Safety Management System in areas and operations under their control
  Be appreciative of working and living in a multicultural environment that has strict rules and regulations
  Your Responsibilities:
 
  Have a valid passport and C1/D Seaman's visa (DCL will provide you with documents to obtain this)
  Complete a pre-employment medical
  Obtain a criminal background check
  Bring approved work shoes
  **Disney Cruise Line is a drug-free workplace. All new hires are required to undergo drug/alcohol testing within the first week onboard and throughout their contracts. Failure to pass the drug/alcohol testing will result in immediate termination.
 
 #DCLMTO

title: Recepitonist
description:

title: Staff Chief Engineer
description:

title: Cocktail Server (Flexible AM & PM)
location: 180 Christopher Columbus Drive, Cape Canaveral, FL 32920
description:
Cocktail Server-Full or Part Time
 
 GENERAL JOB DESCRIPTION
 
 
  Servers stock at assigned bar with cups, straws and napkins, including to set up coffee station (stock cups, creamers, sweeteners, and straws). Break person sets up coffee stations in Club V and the old VIP room. All servers are to report to greeting line approximately five (5) minutes before guest boarding. Upon arrival of guests, greet customers with a SMILE. Make sure to clap and welcome our guests. Servers must ring all drinks before the bartender can make them.
  Ensure all beverages are garnished properly, unless at customer request, and ensure all beverages are properly marked with the appropriate straw.
  Servers may only serve one drink at a time to each guest.
  Continually ‘sweep’ section for discarded drinks, trash and debris. As you are serving a guest, take the empties in the area away. KEEP ASHTRAYS CLEAN AT ALL TIMES.
  If a guest appears intoxicated, inform an F&B Supervisor or Manager immediately. No Staff, Bartender or other position, is authorized to “cut a customer off”. Let management address the guest and take action they deem necessary.
  Cocktail Servers are vital to the success of Victory Casino Cruises. Aim for friendliness, politeness and cleanliness to ensure satisfaction. Each guest should leave feeling like a winner regardless of their gambling success.
 
 
  DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
 
 
  Servers set up trays with beverage napkins and straws.
  Stock the Servers side of assigned bar with cups, straws and napkins. Set up coffee station (stock cups, creamers, sweeteners, and straws). Break person sets up coffee stations in Club V and the old VIP room.
  One Server must report to Bar 1 prior to guest boarding.
  All Servers are to report to greeting line approximately five (5) minutes before guest boarding. Upon arrival of guests, greet guests with a SMILE. Make sure to clap and welcome our guests.
  Report to assigned station upon Captain making the five (5) minute announcement for gaming to begin. During gaming, guests are entitled to complimentary beverages while they are gambling. Guests MUST actually be gambling to receive complimentary beverages. Ensure proper POS procedures are used for ringing drinks and use proper category for comping items, i.e., table, slot and/or premium-promo comps. Any comped premium beverages or bottled beers MUST be approved by Casino Managers. Keep all tickets to turn in at end of shift.
  Servers must ring all drinks before the Bartender can make them.
  Ensure all beverages are garnished properly, unless at customer request, and ensure all beverages are properly marked with the appropriate straw.
  Each drink is served with a beverage napkin.
  Servers may only serve one drink at a time to each guest.
  “Shots” are NOT permitted.
  Continually ‘sweep’ section for discarded drinks, trash and debris. As you are serving a guest, take the empties in the area away. KEEP ASHTRAYS CLEAN AT ALL TIMES.
  Servers are responsible for their own area; HOWEVER, guest satisfaction is our first priority. All Servers must work as a team, and if a guest from another section requests a drink, please taker order and location and pass information onto the proper server promptly. If necessary, serve beverage to guest and provide tip received to server assigned to the section. DO NOT TURN AWAY A GUEST ORDER BECAUSE IT IS NOT YOUR ASSIGNED SECTION.
  If a guest appears intoxicated, inform an F&B Supervisor or Manager immediately. No Staff, Bartender or other position, is authorized to “cut a customer off”. Let management address the guest and take action they deem necessary.
  Immediately notify Security, an F&B Manager or Supervisor of any emergency.
  Follow all health department safe food handling procedures.
  Upon conclusion of gaming, run financial report and provide to Manager or Supervisor, along with any cash received and tickets.
  All servers are to remove trash and debris from section. Clean areas with sanitation cloth, if needed and pick up all ashtrays, including in the casino pits and in between slot machines.
  Empty and clean all ashtrays. Clean all straws, fruit and any other debris from the “dump” sink. Clean and sanitize sink.
  Servers must clean their serving tray at the end of the shift.
  Wipe down coffee machine, walls on server side of bar (to ensure no spills and splashes), counters and any other surface needed.
  Management may assign a server to perform a final sweep to ensure all side work has been completed properly.
  Servers tip out 20% of their gratuities to their bartender at the end of their shift.
  All Servers must meet on the Main Deck for F&B Manager or Supervisor before clocking out.
  Performs other related duties as requested by the Supervisors or Food & Beverage Manager.
  The use of personal items including, but not limited to, books, any form of electronic device and/or cell phone is prohibited. These items are permitted to be used in the employee area during the employees allotted break time. Some exceptions may apply. See Manager or Supervisor for approval.
 
 
  SKILLS & ABILITIES
 
 
  Must have minimum of six (6) months cocktailing experience to apply
  Must be 21 years of age or older
  Must have a high school diploma or equivalent
  Knowledge of basic bar terminology
  Must have good personal hygiene
  Must respect all fellow employees and guests
  Guest awareness- the ability to handle intoxicated guests
  Knowledge of laws for required identification for serving guest
  Ability to lift, balance and carry cocktail trays
  Ability to organize and prioritize under pressure, maintaining a calm demeanor
  Basic skill of arithmetic and monetary mathematics
  Ability to communicate to Managers/Supervisors, guests, Bartenders, Bar Backs and other Cocktail Servers
  Personality – outgoing and confident demeanor, friendly and welcoming smile
  Must have good listening skills
  Multitasking with several guests at a time
  Must be able to stand for several hours at a time
  Must be able to lift up to 15 lbs.
 
 
  
   Work Environment/Physical Requirements
  
  
   Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
  
  
  
   
    Hours/Shifts
   
   
    Due to the type of business, you must be able to work nights, weekends, special occasions, and holidays.
   
   
   
    Other
   
  
  
   Victory Casino Cruises has a no visible tattoo policy. For this position you must be clear of all visible tattoos.
   Must be able to successfully pass a drug test, physical, background screening, and credit check.
   You will be required to obtain a TWIC and MMC. Acceptable documents to obtain badging are Passport OR Government issued photo ID and certified copy of Birth Certificate. Supporting documents would be needed for a name change.

title: Shore Excursion Staff - San Francisco
description:
Join the Intercruises Shoreside & Port Services team as a Shore Excursion staff member where you will be the main point of contact for the Cruise Line for Shore Excursions.. You will be part of the team responsible for the preparation of the operation and the staff involved ensuring high standard quality of services in order to achieve development of the business and client satisfaction.
 
 
 
  About the Job:
 
 
  Responsible for the smooth operation from start to end
  Be at the port for the arrival of the cruise ship passengers.
  Ensure that all buses are ready, lined up and in the correct place and arrange all signage according and corresponding to the dispatch sheet.
  Brief all drivers/guides to ensure that they are adequately prepared for the tour .
  Prepare the office space, complete vouchers and prepare any additional forms that the drivers must take when they depart.
  Inform all drivers of their headcounts and help to welcome guests to the city while guiding them to the buses.
  Assist to load the buses, count tickets and ensure a smooth and efficient dispatch.
  Once the buses have dispatched, complete all necessary paperwork and record the passenger counts.
  Once the busses depart pick up all the signage and store accordingly
  Settle and agree on the tour participation with the ship
  Prepare for the tours to return and greet each bus upon their arrival back at the pier.
  Communicate with the ship staff on the status of the tours as they return.
  When all busses have returned advise the Cruise designated person that all passengers have returned and close up the office.
 
 
 
  What we provide:
 
 
  $20.00 hourly pay
  Cruise benefits
  Referral bonus
  Paid training
  Weekly pay
  401K retirement plan
  Savings & special offers on travel and entertainment.
 
 
  About You:
 
 
  Able to multitask and work a flexible schedule including weekends and Holidays
  Ideally, have knowledge and understanding of daily planning and Operation in a holiday destination/cruise business.
  You are able to meet daily deadlines, efficiently and precisely.
  Work well under especially under pressure and able to make decisions to benefit the company and passengers. .
  Excellent communication skills in English including verbal and written, Additional language a plus
  You have a pro-active guest service mind-set with a clear focus on quality and efficiency.
  Driver’s license is a plus
 
 
 
  Intercruises Shoreside & Port Services is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and does not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, disability, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Crew Member
description:
Crew Member
                   
                   
                   
                    American Cruise Lines, the largest U.S. cruise company, offers unique experiences exploring America’s rivers and coasts. We’re hiring Crew Members for the 2025 season. You’ll work in our shipboard hotel and restaurant providing outstanding hospitality and serving as a proud representative of our brand. This is a temporary position where we challenge you to work onboard for 28 weeks.
                   
                   
                   
                    Our company’s values are Optimism, Commitment, Patriotism, and Merit. We live these values every day and we look for people who share them as we Share America’s Story on the Finest American Ships.
                   
                   
                   
                    Food Service Crew Member Responsibilities:
                   
                   
                    Provide a personalized, high-quality dining service.
                    Set up and break down meals and events.
                    Greet guests by name, offer menu/wine suggestions, and answer questions.
                    Relay orders and serve with attention to detail.
                   
                   
                    Hospitality Crew Member Responsibilities:
                   
                   
                    Maintain safe and welcoming guest areas, including staterooms and common spaces.
                    Greet guests by name and respond to housekeeping requests.
                    Clean rooms, stock supplies, and organize inventory.
                    Support special events like embarkation, tea service, and cocktail parties.
                   
                   
                    Highlights:
                   
                   
                    Pay – Wages range from $1,000 to $1,400 per week with additional bonuses. With all major living expenses covered aboard, you have an extraordinary chance to save your earnings.
                    Hospitality Experience – This is an introductory position to the cruise industry and a strong foundation for a career in hospitality.
                    Covered Expenses – American Cruise Lines provides travel to and from your assigned vessel, room and board, uniforms, and paid training.
                    Travel the Country – We have over 50 itineraries, spanning over 35 states in America.
                    Crew Connections – Create lifelong memories and relationships with fellow crew members and guests from all over the country.
                   
                   
                    Qualifications:
                   
                   
                    You must be at least eighteen (18) years of age and an American citizen or Green Card holder. You must be willing and able to work a minimum of 12 hours per day, for 7 days a week, for up to 28 weeks. Employees must be able to meet moderate physical demands including lifting, bending, climbing, and extended periods of standing or walking.
                   
                   
                   
                    Under Federal Law and the Department of Transportation, we are required to pre-employment drug test all shipboard employees which includes testing for Marijuana and other controlled substances. To provide safe and conscientious service to our guests, the consumption of alcohol is strictly prohibited. All shipboard employees also have emergency and safety functions essential to the safe operation of the ship that are included in your training.
                   
                   
                   
                    American Cruise Lines has grooming standards that include limitations on visible tattoos and piercings. This is a temporary employment position not to extend beyond 28 weeks of shipboard work. We encourage you to utilize the skills you develop to apply for management positions within American Cruise Lines, but such positions cannot be expected and are not guaranteed.
                   
                   
                   
                    American Cruise Lines is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, disability, or genetic information. Successful individuals work well under pressure, keep composure and have a positive attitude. The talent and dedication of American Cruise Lines’ employees have made us America's Leading Small Ship Cruise Line.
                   
                   
                   
                    Job sites across the nation.

title: Deckhand
description:
Deckhand
 
 American Cruise Lines is the largest domestic cruise line with a growing fleet of riverboats and cruise ships that travel to the most amazing destinations across the United States. Through our modern ships and our dedicated crew, we are able to provide our guests with an exceptional cruise experience. We are currently looking for Deckhands to join us for our 2025 season, with an anticipated training date starting in Spring 2025.
 
 Deckhands are entry-level marine crewmembers trusted with the opportunity to assist in vessel operations standing helm, gangway, and security watches. You are the front line of the American Cruise Lines brand responsible for delivering exceptional guest service.
 
 As a Deckhand you will work onboard for a temporary 28-week period. Successful candidates possess the following traits: hardworking, natural leader, ambitious, goal-oriented, and a team player.
 
 Responsibilities:
       
       
        Handling lines, gangways, anchors, and marine equipment under the guidance of Captains and Mates.
        Responsible for daily exterior cleaning, line handling, and logistic support tasks. Standing helm watches assisting the Captain and Mate in steering the vessel.
        Standing gangway and deck watches including security, maintenance, and passenger assistance duties.
        Loading and unloading guest luggage, ship stores, garbage, and daily logistics tasks.
        Cleaning all exterior decks, verandas, windows, furniture, and marine spaces.
        Washing, drying, and folding all ship laundry.
        Maintain continual professional grooming and uniform appearance.
        Continual availability to assist guests and crew.
        Rotate through day-night watch and task schedules averaging 12-hrs daily.
       
       
        Highlights:
       
       
        Pay – Wages range from $1,000 to $1,400 per week with additional bonuses. With all major living expenses covered during your time onboard, you have an extraordinary chance to save your earnings.
        Hospitality Experience – This is a strong foundation for a career in the hospitality industry and a fantastic way to build your resume.
        Covered Expenses – American Cruise Lines provides travel to and from your assigned vessel, room and board, uniforms, and paid hospitality training from industry experts.
        Travel the Country – We have over 35 itineraries, spanning over 35 states in America.
        Crew Connections – Create lifelong memories and relationships with fellow crew members and guests from all over the country.
       
       
        Qualifications:
 
 For shipboard employment, you must be at least eighteen (18) years of age and an American citizen or Green Card holder. You must be willing and able to work a minimum of 12 hours per day, for 7 days a week, for up to 28 weeks. Employees must able to meet moderate physical demands including lifting, bending, climbing, and extended periods of standing or walking.
 
 Under Federal Law and the Department of Transportation, we are required to pre-employment drug test all shipboard employees which includes testing for Marijuana and other controlled substances. To provide safe and conscientious service to our guests, the consumption of alcohol is strictly prohibited. All shipboard employees also have emergency and safety functions essential to the safe operation of the ship that are included in your training.
 
 American Cruise Lines has grooming standards that include limitations on visible tattoos and piercings. This a temporary employment position not to extend beyond 28 weeks of shipboard work. We encourage you to utilize the skills you develop to apply for management positions within American Cruise Lines, but such positions cannot be expected and are not guaranteed.
 
 American Cruise Lines is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, disability, or genetic information.
 
 Successful individuals work well under pressure, keep composure and a positive attitude. The talent and dedication of the American Cruise Lines employees have made us America's Leading Small Ship Cruise Line.

title: Pier Agent - Holland America and Princess Cruises
description:
HIRING FOR 2025 CRUISE SEASON!
 
 
  
 Interview will begin late March/April.
 
 
 
  
 Benefits Provided:
 
 
  Part Time, Seasonal position
  2 shifts per weekend
  Weekend Schedules Mandatory
  Pay rate of $25.00 per hour
  Cruise season is late April to late October
 
 
 
  
 BASIC PURPOSE:
 
 
  This is a fast paced, high energy position requiring an enthusiastic, efficient and professional image. Agents working for SMS International Shore Operations US, Inc., direct and assist cruise guests in all aspects of shore-side operations as assigned. This position may include, but is not limited to meeting and greeting guests, computerized pier check-in along with assisting airport and hotel guest with transfers to and from the port.
 
 
   Job Duties & Responsibilities:

  
   Meet and greet guests cordially, responding to their inquiries in a knowledgeable and pleasant manner as well as assisting and directing debarkation and embarkation of guest.
   Monitors the flow of traffic in the luggage area, including U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) areas.
   Guides the flow of traffic throughout the terminal, including: secure areas, walkways, check–in areas, gangways and elevators/escalators and direct guests accordingly.
   Answers general questions in an accurate and pleasant manner and provides pertinent information regarding boarding and sailing; takes the initiative to assist guests.
   Escorts guests requiring wheelchair assistance throughout the terminal during embarkation and debarkation.
   Escorts and monitors guests pending boarding status or requiring additional documentation.
   Gathers data for various embarkation processes to include registration flow and timetables; reports findings to management, as established.
   Assists guests with locating luggage and completing lost luggage forms, when necessary.
   Reviews and verifies validity of all travel documents presented by guests for check-in.
   Inputs guest travel information using the registration system and checks in each guest upon arrival. Ensures required information is accurately processed and/or paperwork is completed.
   Provides guests with stateroom keys and pertinent boarding information, according to department manual and training.
   Prepares the terminal and check-in area by organizing required furniture, equipment, manifests and other related materials. Clears and organizes workstations and/or areas daily and submits relevant paperwork to appropriate personnel.
   Performs other job related duties as assigned.
  
 
 
 
  
 Education:

  
   High School Diploma or equivalent.
  
 
 
  
 Experience:

  
   Minimum of one-year experience in a customer service/logistics environment, preferably in the travel industry.
  
 
 
  
 Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:

  
   Demonstrated ability to communicate in English, sufficient to provide information and answer general questions.
   Knowledge of, or ability to learn practical computer skills to accurately register guests and navigate screens to perform computer based functions.
   Good organizational and customer service skills.
   Ability to work effectively in a multi-tasked, fast-paced environment in front of large groups.
   Required to be available on weekends, after hours, and on short notice, as requested by management.
  
 
 
 
  
 Work conditions/ Physical Demands & Travel:

  
   Position includes frequent standing, walking, lifting, pushing and pulling for up to 6 hour increments on average.
   Ability to safely maneuver wheelchairs; includes pushing and pulling guests on wheelchairs through all terminal areas and up and down ramps.
   Ability to physically transfer or assist passengers in/out of wheelchair, whose weight is approximately 100-300 lbs.
   Ability to stoop, kneel, bend, crouch, lift or carry.
   Position is exposed to indoor/outdoor work environment at piers and terminal locations under varying weather conditions.
   Flexibility to work hours ranging from 5:00am – 4:00pm or until ships departures; includes weekdays, weekends and holidays in various ports as assigned.
   Must have the ability to perform the essential functions of the job with or without reasonable accommodation.

title: Translation Services Staff
description:
Job Description:
  
  
   Key Responsibilities:  Provide translation and interpretation services for guests and crew members in multiple languages, including but not limited to English, Spanish, French, German, Italian, Mandarin, and Japanese.  Assist guests with language-related inquiries, requests, and concerns, including translating announcements, documents, and menus, and providing directions and recommendations in their preferred language.  Facilitate communication between guests and crew members during onboard activities, events, and excursions, ensuring that all participants can fully participate and understand the content.  Serve as a cultural ambassador for guests, providing insights into local customs, traditions, and etiquette in various regions and destinations visited during the cruise.  Collaborate with other onboard departments, including guest services, entertainment, and dining, to ensure that language-related needs and preferences are addressed and accommodated.  Maintain confidentiality and professionalism in all interactions with guests and crew members, respecting their privacy and cultural sensitivities.  Stay informed about shipboard activities, entertainment options, and port excursions, and be prepared to provide accurate and up-to-date information to guests in multiple languages.  Assist with administrative tasks, such as document translation, language proficiency testing, and record-keeping, to support the efficient operation of the Translation Services department.  Qualifications:  Fluency in English and proficiency in at least one other language commonly spoken by our guests, such as Spanish, French, German, Italian, Mandarin, Japanese, or others.  Additional language proficiency is a plus, particularly languages spoken in regions visited during our cruise itineraries.  Previous experience in translation, interpretation, or language services is preferred but not required; training will be provided for qualified candidates.  Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact effectively with guests and crew members of diverse linguistic and cultural backgrounds.  Excellent listening and comprehension skills, with the ability to accurately convey meaning and intent in both spoken and written communication.  Flexibility to work varied shifts, including evenings, weekends, and holidays, as required in a 24/7 operation onboard a cruise ship.  Attention to detail and accuracy in language usage, grammar, and vocabulary, with a commitment to delivering high-quality translation and interpretation services.  Professionalism, discretion, and sensitivity to cultural differences and nuances in language and communication styles.
  
  
   Working Place:
  
  
   Miami, FL, United States

title: Server
description:
We are seeking part-time, experienced servers. Successful candidates will have excellent communication and customer service skills. Must be self- motivated, friendly and a team player.
 Weekend and Holiday availability and a flexible schedule are a must. You must be committed to superior customer service in a fast-paced, high energy and fun environment. Must be professional, reliable, enthusiastic and friendly. Minimum 6 months experience with a catering or restaurant background. Seasonal employment with days, evenings and holiday shifts available.
 Other job requirements include:
 
  Ability to work at a fast pace while maintaining poise and grace.
  Maintain a very clean and well-run section.
  Serve patrons food & beverage orders quickly, in proper portion with courtesy.
  Ability to check I.D on any customer ordering alcohol who looks under 30 years old.
  Ability to reach, bend, stoop, wipe, push, pull and lift items up to 50 pounds.
  Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced operation.
  Set up and tear down before and after shift can be expected.
  A great attitude about life and the pleasure of serving our guests in a fun and relaxed environment.
  Takes pride in personal grooming and how you present yourself to others.
  This position requires pre and random drug testing as mandated by the U.S. Coast Guard.
 
 To apply for this position, please submit your resume.

title: Room Service Attendant
description:
Job Description:
  
  
   
    
     Provide prompt and courteous room service to guests, taking orders and delivering food and beverages to their rooms
    
    
     
 Ensure all orders are accurate and delivered in a timely manner, following company standards and procedures
     
    
     Maintain cleanliness and organization of the room service area, including the pantry and storage areas
     
    
     Stock and replenish items in the room service menu, ensuring availability of all items at all times
     
    
     Handle guest inquiries and complaints in a professional and timely manner, escalating to management when necessary
     
    
     Follow all safety and sanitation procedures, including proper handling and storage of food and beverages
     
    
     Collaborate with the culinary team to ensure menu items are prepared and presented according to company standards
     
    
     Assist with other duties as assigned by management, including assisting with in-room dining events and special requests
      Qualifications: 
    
     High school diploma or equivalent
     
    
     Previous experience in a similar role, preferably in a hotel or cruise ship setting
     
    
     Excellent customer service skills and a friendly, positive attitude
     
    
     Strong communication and interpersonal skills
     
    
     Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and handle multiple tasks simultaneously
     
    
     Knowledge of food and beverage service standards and procedures
     
    
     Basic understanding of food safety and sanitation guidelines
     
    
     Willingness to work flexible hours, including evenings, weekends, and holidays
     
    
     Must be able to pass a pre-employment background check and drug test
     
    
     Must be able to obtain a valid passport and travel internationally
    
  
  
   Working Place:
  
  
   Miami, FL, United States

title: Bellboy/Girl
description:
Job Description:
  
  
   To deliver all Guest and Business mail, preliminary and final statements, gratuity cards, newspapers, faxes, and newsletters to Guest suites and respective Offices in an efficient and timely manner.  To assist Guests during suite changes and to carry their luggage.  To deliver late and misplaced luggage to the suites.  To deliver luggage for embarking Guests and guide them to their suites in way ports.  To provide packing services for Guests.  To assist disabled Guests to their onboard destinations during the cruise (mostly wheelchair Guests).  To place signs around the ship when we have tender service.  To set up and prepare tables onboard for banks, post offices and tourist bureaus, and Customs and Immigration inspections when applicable.  To prepare and fill all travel document folders with color coded luggage tags and to deliver it to Guest suites.  To prepare elevators for luggage handling.  To assist with luggage collection on the last evening of the cruise.  To submit work orders when deficiencies are noted or when maintenance is required and to follow up on the work orders in a timely manner.  Maintains, at all times, a friendly and approachable demeanor, even under pressure, by applying the principles of Crystal Basics.  Always conducts oneself in a professional and courteous manner when dealing with guests, and fellow team members alike.  Performs any other operational duties as required.  This position description in no way implies that the job responsibilities listed in this document are the only duties to be performed by the employee holding this position.
  
  
   Working Place:
  
  
   Miami, FL, United States

title: Assistant Maitre'D
description:
Job Description:
  
  
   Position Overview: As an Assistant Maitre'D on a cruise ship, you will play a vital role in ensuring smooth and efficient restaurant operations. You will support the Maitre'D in overseeing the dining room, managing the restaurant staff, and providing exceptional guest service. Your leadership, organizational skills, and attention to detail will contribute to a memorable dining experience for guests onboard.  Responsibilities: 
    
      Restaurant Operations:
      
        Assist the Maitre'D in coordinating and supervising all aspects of the dining room operations.
        Ensure that the dining room is set up correctly, including table settings, decorations, and overall ambiance.
        Oversee table assignments, seating arrangements, and reservation management.
        Monitor the flow of guests and ensure efficient seating and service.
      
      Guest Service:
      
        Provide personalized and attentive service to guests, addressing their needs and preferences.
        Greet guests, escort them to their tables, and assist with seating arrangements.
        Handle guest inquiries, requests, and complaints in a professional and timely manner.
        Collaborate with the Maitre'D to resolve any guest issues or concerns.
      
      Staff Management:
      
        Assist the Maitre'D in managing the restaurant staff, including waiters, busboys, and hosts/hostesses.
        Train and mentor new staff members, ensuring they understand service standards and protocols.
        Monitor staff performance, provide feedback, and address any performance or behavior issues.
        Assist in creating staff schedules, ensuring adequate coverage during meal times.
      
      Quality Control:
      
        Ensure that all service standards and procedures are followed, maintaining consistency and quality.
        Monitor and maintain cleanliness and hygiene standards in the dining room and service areas.
        Conduct regular inspections of tables, chairs, linens, and table settings to ensure they meet the required standards.
        Collaborate with the culinary team to ensure prompt and accurate delivery of food orders.
      
      Special Events and VIP Service:
      
        Assist in organizing and executing special events, theme nights, and other dining experiences.
        Coordinate with the Maitre'D and culinary team to accommodate special dietary requests and preferences.
        Provide VIP service to high-profile guests, ensuring their needs are met and exceeded.
        Assist in organizing and managing private dining arrangements and functions.
      
      Administrative Duties:
      
        Assist in maintaining accurate records, including reservation logs, guest preferences, and special requests.
        Collaborate with the Maitre'D and restaurant management team in menu planning and menu changes.
        Prepare reports and analysis related to dining room operations, guest satisfaction, and staff performance.
        Assist in inventory management, including monitoring and replenishing restaurant supplies.
      
      Qualifications: 
    
      Previous experience in a supervisory role, preferably as a Head Waiter, Assistant Maitre'D, or similar position in a fine dining establishment.
      Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
      Strong leadership and team management abilities.
      Customer-focused mindset with a passion for delivering exceptional service.
      Ability to multitask and work well under pressure in a fast-paced environment.
      Attention to detail and strong organizational skills.
      Flexibility to work long hours, including evenings, weekends, and holidays, as required on a cruise ship.
      Proficiency in multiple languages is a plus.
      Knowledge of wine and beverage service is beneficial.
    
  
  
   Working Place:
  
  
   Miami, FL, United States

title: Destinations Staff

      Excellent appearance

title: Expedition Staff
description:
Job Description:
  
  
   As an Expedition Staff member onboard the cruise ship, you will play a vital role in creating an exceptional experience for our guests. You will work closely with the Expedition Leader and other team members to ensure the smooth operation of our expeditions.
 Key Responsibilities: 
    
     Assist the Expedition Leader in planning and executing expedition activities
     
    
     Lead and participate in shore excursions, hikes, and other activities
     
    
     Conduct presentations and lectures on various topics related to the expedition
     
    
     Provide exceptional customer service to guests, ensuring their safety and comfort at all times
     
    
     Maintain a clean and organized ship, including guest cabins and common areas
     
    
     Assist with meal service and other onboard duties as needed
     
    
     Monitor and report on wildlife sightings and other notable events during expeditions
     
    
     Participate in emergency drills and procedures as required
     
    
     Act as a liaison between guests and the ship's crew, ensuring clear communication and addressing any concerns or issues that may arise
     
    
     Continuously strive to enhance the guest experience and provide feedback to improve operations
    
 Requirements: 
    
     Minimum of 2 years of experience in a similar role, preferably in the cruise or hospitality industry
     
    
     Strong knowledge and passion for the destinations and activities offered on our expeditions
     
    
     Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
     
    
     Ability to work well in a team environment and adapt to changing situations
     
    
     First Aid and CPR certification is preferred
     
    
     Fluent in English, both written and verbal. Additional language skills are a plus
     
    
     Must be able to pass a background check and obtain necessary travel documents
     
    
     Physically fit and able to work in a fast-paced, outdoor environment
     
    
     Flexibility to work long hours and irregular schedules, including weekends and holidays
    
  
  
   Working Place:
  
  
   Miami, FL, United States

title: Crew Rotation Specialist
description:
Overview (Text Only):
 Awarded World’s Best Small Ship Cruise line, Windstar Cruises is known for intimate yacht style experience and unique voyages to the world’s best small ports and hidden harbors. Its three sailing yachts and three all-suite yachts carry just 148 to 342 guests and cruise around the world. 

 Our Mission: We imagine and deliver personalized and immersive experiences 180 degrees from ordinary 
Our Vision: Enriching people’s perspective through inspired travel 
Our Values: Welcoming, Innovative, Now, Discipline, Serve, Teamwork, Authentic, Responsible 

 Windstar Cruises, recognized as the World’s Best Small Ship Cruise line, is seeking a Crew Rotation Specialistto work under the supervision of the Manager of Fleet Planning & Scheduling to execute all aspects associated with onboard crew staffing and crew rotation. 

 Responsibilities (Text Only):


 Responsible for maintaining rotation schedules and communicating to vessels, manning agents and traveling/corporate managers regarding crew scheduling.
 Assist in forecasting of scheduling and planning.
 Review fleet occupancy and adjust planning as needed.
 Ensures the ships are consistently staffed in all positions.
 Analyze current crew rotations and staffing needs and ensure vacancies are communicated to appropriate manning agencies for recruitment.
 Monitor and communicate with the Manager of Fleet Planning & Scheduling regarding all unscheduled crew moves and crew rotation issues.
 Submit requests for crew travel.
 Act as the liaison between the Vessels and Manning Agencies with regards to crew air, hotels, visa processing, training certification, etc.
 Maintain open dialogue with the Purser teams, onboard teams, and Corporate Managers to address all crew member requests and /or issues in timely manner.
 Assist with special projects as requested.
 Update Adonis with scheduling, filing of documentation and other items as needed.
 Maintain confidentiality with respect to all Human Resources matters.
 Perform other duties as assigned.
 Qualifications (Text Only):


 Self-directed strategic thinker with initiative, analytical and problem-solving skills.
 Minimum of 3-5 years of scheduling and crew rotation planning. Experience in the cruise industry or airline industry.
 Demonstrated professional verbal and written communication skills.
 Strong customer service skills and ability to work well in a team environment.
 Strong Excel skills.
 Experience with the Adonis HR system is preferred
 Ability to maintain a high level of confidentiality.
 Ability to remain calm, composed and effective during fast-paced, stressful situations.
 High School Diploma or equivalent required, College degree preferred
 EEO: Windstar is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. We are an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, pregnancy, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other legally protected status.

title: Youth Staff on cruise ships
description:
Job Type:
Full-time Contract (7-month onboard assignment)
Join the MSC Cruises Entertainment Team!
Are you energetic, creative, and passionate about working with children and teens? Join our international team aboard MSC Cruises and help create unforgettable vacation experiences for families from around the world.
Responsibilities:

 Organize and lead age-appropriate activities for children and teens (from 3 to 17 years old).
 Ensure a fun, safe, and welcoming environment at all times.
 Engage with children through games, crafts, sports, and themed events.
 Support themed parties and family events onboard.
 Collaborate with international team members under the supervision of the Youth Program Manager.
 Assist in handling any child-related concerns in a professional and caring manner.
 Follow company safety and hygiene protocols.

Requirements:

 Experience working with children or teens (e.g. summer camps, after-school programs, teaching, childcare).
 Fluency in English AND German at minimum A2 level.
 A positive, outgoing personality with strong communication and interpersonal skills.
 Ability to work in a multicultural, fast-paced environment.
 Willingness to live and work onboard a cruise ship for 7 months.
 Availability for flexible hours, including weekends and holidays.
 Must meet maritime medical requirements (company will guide you through the process).
 Previous cruise or travel experience is a plus, but not required.

What We Offer:

 Exciting international work environment.
 Free accommodation (shared cabin), meals, and laundry onboard.
 Competitive tax-free salary paid monthly.
 Opportunity to travel the world while doing what you love.
 Professional development and career growth within MSC Cruises.

Apply now and start your adventure at sea!
We are currently hiring for our upcoming cruise season – limited positions available.
Note: This is an onboard position, not remote. Applicants must be able to travel internationally and be available for a 7-month contract.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: From $1,423.00 per month

 Youth Staff: 1 year (Required)

 English (Required)

title: Cruise Operations Associate A
description:
Hourly Rate: $18.02
 
 
 Job Summary:
 This position is the individual on staff of the Canaveral Port Authority who assists in the execution of paid parking lot activities. This position reports to the Cruise Operations Supervisor. The Canaveral Port Authority is a 24/7 operation: 365 days a year.
 
 
 Essential Functions:
 
  Strong customer service approach when interacting with guests, cruise line customers, ground transportation operators, and Port Canaveral visitors.
  Collect and safeguard parking fees collected from users of Canaveral Port Authority parking lots in accordance with CPA procedures.
  Safely facilitate the movement of vehicular and pedestrian traffic in areas surrounding the assigned cruise terminals. Direct charter buses, passenger shuttles, and taxis to designated drop-off and loading areas. Direct parking lot users to designated parking areas, i.e., employees, passengers, visitors, vendors, and crewmembers.
  Enforce parking restrictions and assist in identifying unlicensed taxis and shuttles. Assist in providing safety and security for users of parking lots and other outside facilities. Guard against abuse of CPA parking facilities. Lock and secure gates as directed at the close of business.
  Cooperate with departments as assigned to support events, functions, or other accommodations.
  During emergency conditions, all CPA employees are automatically considered essential employees and may be subject to recall. These events may include, but are not limited to, natural, man-made, or public health emergencies. Employees may be expected to perform emergency and/or recovery operations outside of their normal assigned responsibilities and routine working hours.
  Perform other duties as assigned.
 
 
 
 Minimum Qualifications:
 
  High School Diploma or GED equivalent
  Bilingual is preferred
  Must be willing to work a variety of shifts including weekends and holidays
  Must be able to follow verbal and written instructions and communicate information effectively
  Must have ability to perform basic computer skills
  Must be 18 years old
 
 
 
 Licenses / Certification Required:
 
  Must possess a valid Florida Driver’s License or have the ability to obtain one within 30 days
  Must be able to secure a Transportation Worker Identification Credential (TWIC)
 
 
 
 Physical Requirement:
 
  Must be able to work in all types of weather
  Must be physically able to stand for long periods of time
  Tasks involve the intermittent performance of physically demanding work, typically involving some combination of reaching, bending, stooping, kneeling, or crouching, and that may involve the lifting, carrying, pushing, and/or pulling of moderately heavy objects and materials (20-50 pounds).
