title: Server
description:
Pay Rate $16.90/hr
  City Experiences is seeking a Server for our City Cruises operation in Chicago, IL.
  About You:
 This person will be adaptable, dynamic, and embody City Experiences’ RESPECT Service System.
  About the Opportunity:
 The successful Server is technically competent in serving food and beverages, is hospitable and cordial to guests and coworkers, acts safely and responsibly, and is knowledgeable about the vessel and the skyline.
  Essential Duties & Responsibilities:
 
  Provide exceptional hospitality to guests and coworkers as prescribed in our RESPECT service system.
  Greet guests and serve food and beverages in a timely fashion.
  Accurately take orders and enter them into the point-of-sale system (Toast)
  Maintain the cleanliness and safety of all common areas and service stations.
  Participate in the celebration and entertainment experience of the guest.
  Set up and break down dining room and service stations as prescribed; this requires movement of dining cabin furniture.
  Accurately collect payment from guests for on-board purchases
  Provide information to guests including menu descriptions, order of service, entertainment options, cruise route and points of interest.
  Be prepared to begin work at the scheduled time.
  Maintain uniform and personal grooming in compliance with appearance standards.
  Assist with the warm and efficient greeting and seating of guests when they arrive.
  Additional job duties as assigned
 
 Requirements & Qualifications:
 
  High school diploma or equivalent required
  One (1) year experience in high volume restaurant preferred.
  Energetic and enthusiastic personality essential
  Must be able to effectively understand and convey written and verbal information to guests and coworkers.
  Must possess a service orientation – actively looking for ways to help others.
  Basic computer skills are required.
  Will work for extended periods without sitting.
  Required to lift furniture and other heavy items such as dishes up and down stairs.
  Will be required to be available for work on all major holidays.
  Must meet minimum state age requirements.
 
 About Us:
 City Experiences’ passion is to provide amazing experiences on land and water. Our 40-year success through organic growth and acquisitions has resulted in a portfolio of over 25+ brands that welcome upwards of 30 million guests/riders annually. If you’re an enthusiastic team player who thrives in an environment where communication, creativity, and cooperation are encouraged, this may just be the opportunity for you.
  The RESPECT Service System embodies City Experiences’ mission, vision, values and operating principles. By creating a company culture that puts RESPECT at its core, we believe it will drive us to achieve our goal of becoming a Global Experiences and Transportation Leader.
 The Company is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We prohibit discrimination and harassment against any applicants or employees based upon their race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, mental or physical disability, status as a protected veteran, or other characteristics prohibited by applicable law.
 Additionally, we encourage all qualified applicants including those with past arrest or conviction records to apply. The Company participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations.
 We encourage qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records to apply.
 
 Equal Opportunity Employer
 This employer is required to notify all applicants of their rights pursuant to federal employment laws. For further information, please review the Know Your Rights notice from the Department of Labor.

title: Dock Attendant - Statue Cruises
description:
Salary $23/HR
  Hornblower is seeking a Dock Attendant for our Statue City Cruises operation in Jersey City, New Jersey.
  About You:
 This person will be adaptable, dynamic, and embody Hornblower's RESPECT Service System.
  About the Opportunity:
 The Dock Attendant works under the supervision of the Dock Supervisor. Dock Attendant works in coordination with the marine crew to ensure the safety of passengers boarding/de-boarding at the dock. Dock Attendant provide passengers with safe, secure, and hospitable guest service at all times.
  Essential Duties & Responsibilities:
 
  Assists guests and answers questions in regards to Ferry Schedule, The Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island or other local attractions.
  Handling lines thrown from the vessels to the dock.
  Assisting Vessel Crew with pulling the gangway on and off each vessel.
  Assisting guests on and off the vessel.
  Properly inform guests how to safely board and disembark the gangway/vessel .
  Follow instructions from the vessel crew and dock supervisors.
  Fill out Island passenger log sheets, when applicable.
  Additional job duties as assigned.
 
 Requirements & Qualifications:
 
  Preference given to those who have maritime and customer service experience.
  Outstanding guest service personality is a must.
  Ability to interact with individuals at all levels in a pleasant and professional manner.
  Ability to work well under pressure and handle emergency response
  We are a quality hospitality organization that serves the public year round. Working weekends and holidays may be required.
  Regular attendance in conformance with the standards, which may be established by Statue Cruises from time to time, is essential to the successful performance of this position. Crewmembers with irregular attendance will be subject to disciplinary action, up to and including termination of employment.
 
 
 About Us:
 Hornblower’s passion is to provide amazing experiences on land and water. Our 40-year success through organic growth and acquisitions has resulted in a portfolio of over 25+ brands that welcome upwards of 30 million guests/riders annually. If you’re an enthusiastic team player who thrives in an environment where communication, creativity, and cooperation are encouraged, this may just be the opportunity for you.
  The RESPECT Service System embodies Hornblower’s mission, vision, values and operating principles. By creating a company culture that puts RESPECT at its core, we believe it will drive us to achieve our goal of becoming a Global Experiences and Transportation Leader.
 The Company is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We prohibit discrimination and harassment against any applicants or employees based upon their race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, mental or physical disability, status as a protected veteran, or other characteristics prohibited by applicable law.
 The Company participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations.
 
 
 Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

title: Tour Staff
description:
Tour Staff for Key West.
Global Cruises LLC a Miami-based company that provides shore excursions for cruise lines worldwide is seeking an experienced and enthusiastic Staff to join our team in Key West. As a Staff, you will accompany English-speaking groups of tourists through the city's most fascinating landmarks and attractions, and provide them with a memorable experience.
Responsibilities:

 Accompany the guide throughout the tour, ensuring smooth operations.
 Maintain full attention to passenger safety and security.
 Ensure no passenger strays from the group or gets confused with another group.
 Address any questions or concerns that may arise during the tour.
 Assist passengers with purchases or currency exchange as needed.
 Help the group cross streets safely and navigate crowded areas.
 Support administrative tasks such as distributing and collecting waivers, pens, and other materials.

Requirements:

 Fluency and proficiency in English are required.
 Knowledge of Key West's history, culture, and tourist attractions.
 Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
 A passion for travel, culture, and people.

Please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your experience and qualifications to this email:
training.specialist@globalcruisesllc.com
Job Type: Seasonal
Work Location: In person

title: Administrative Assistant - Payroll/Accounting
description:
Company: Personnel World, Inc. 
Position: Administrative Assistant - Payroll/Accounting 
Employment Type: Full-time 

 Position Overview 

 Personnel World, Inc. is seeking a detail-oriented Administrative Assistant with specialized expertise in payroll processing and accounting functions. This position combines traditional administrative support with critical financial operations, including payroll administration, accounts payable, and accounts receivable management. The ideal candidate will demonstrate strong numerical accuracy, confidentiality, and the ability to manage sensitive financial information. 

 Key Responsibilities 

 Payroll Administration 



 Process weekly payroll for all employees
 Calculate wages, overtime, bonuses, and deductions
 Maintain accurate payroll records and employee information
 Prepare and distribute payroll reports to management
 Process payroll tax deposits and quarterly tax filings
 Handle payroll inquiries and resolve discrepancies
 Ensure compliance with federal, state, and local payroll regulations
 Maintain confidentiality of all payroll and employee compensation data
 Accounts Payable 



 Process vendor invoices and expense reports
 Verify accuracy of invoices against purchase orders and receipts
 Prepare and process check runs and electronic payments
 Maintain vendor files and payment records
 Reconcile vendor statements and resolve payment discrepancies
 Track and manage payment schedules to optimize cash flow
 Coordinate with vendors regarding payment terms and issues
 Accounts Receivable 



 Generate and send customer invoices
 Monitor accounts receivable aging reports
 Follow up on past due accounts and coordinate collection efforts
 Process customer payments and deposits
 Maintain customer account records and credit information
 Prepare monthly AR reports and analysis
 Handle customer billing inquiries and disputes
 General Administrative Support 



 Provide administrative support to management team
 Maintain filing systems and document organization
 Prepare correspondence and reports
 Schedule meetings and appointments
 Handle phone calls and general office duties
 Assist with special projects as assigned
 Required Qualifications 



 Associate's degree in Accounting, Business Administration, or related field preferred
 Minimum 2-3 years experience in payroll processing
 Demonstrated experience with accounts payable and receivable functions
 Proficiency with payroll software systems (ADP, Paychex, QuickBooks, etc.)
 Strong knowledge of accounting principles and practices
 Experience with accounting software (QuickBooks, Sage, etc.)
 Advanced Excel skills and proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite
 Knowledge of federal and state payroll tax regulations
 Strong attention to detail and numerical accuracy
 Excellent organizational and time management skills
 Desired Skills 



 Experience with Payroll processing
 Knowledge of employment law and wage-hour regulations
 Familiarity with banking procedures and electronic payments
 Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities
 Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
 Ability to maintain strict confidentiality
 Working Conditions 



 Office environment with regular computer use
 Standard business hours with month-end/year-end flexibility required
 Interaction with employees, vendors, and customers
 Handling of confidential financial information
 What We Offer 



 Competitive salary based on experience and qualifications
 Retirement plan with company contribution
 Paid time off and holidays
 Professional development and training opportunities
 Stable work environment with growth potential
 Personnel World, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. 

 #IND1

title: Payroll Tax Analyst
description:
Job Summary
We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Payroll Analyst to join our finance team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing payroll processes, ensuring compliance with relevant laws and regulations, and providing insights through financial analysis. This role requires a strong understanding of accounting principles, payroll systems, and financial reporting to support the overall financial health of the organization.
Responsibilities

 Process payroll accurately and timely, ensuring compliance with federal, state, and local regulations.
 Perform general ledger reconciliation related to payroll entries and adjustments.
 Analyze payroll data to identify trends, discrepancies, and opportunities for improvement.
 Collaborate with HR to ensure accurate employee records and benefits administration.
 Assist in budgeting processes by providing payroll-related forecasts and reports.
 Maintain knowledge of securities law as it pertains to employee compensation and benefits.
 Support accounts payable functions by ensuring accurate allocation of payroll expenses.
 Prepare reports on payroll metrics for management review, including debits and credits related to payroll transactions.
 Stay updated on changes in laws affecting payroll processing and compliance.

Qualifications

 At least 1 year of experience in Tax experience filings and compliance issues
 Strong accounting skills, detail oriented, proficient in Excel and the full suite of Microsoft products (Word, Outlook, etc.)
 Proficient with Mastertax Software
 Must be able to create reconciliations that clearly communicate results
 Experience reconciling and preparing W-2 forms
 Must be able to communicate effectively and in a constructive manner with management, co-workers, and clients

title: Payroll Specialist
description:
Powercon Corp is a leading switchgear manufacturing company dedicated to providing high-quality electrical solutions.
Overview
We are seeking a detail-oriented and organized Payroll Specialist to join our team. The ideal candidate will play a crucial role in the payroll processes, ensuring accurate and timely compensation for employees. This position requires a strong understanding of financial concepts, accounting practices, and familiarity with payroll systems. The Payroll Specialist will collaborate with various departments to ensure compliance with regulations and internal policies. Employment is contingent upon successfully passing a background check, physical examination, and drug test.
Responsibilities: 

 Process payroll for all employees accurately and on time, utilizing accounting software and PAYCOM systems.
 Maintain employee records, including data entry of new hires, terminations, and changes in employment status.
 Prepare and review journal entries related to payroll transactions and ensure proper general ledger accounting practices are followed.
 Assists benefits programs by managing enrollments, changes, and terminations in accordance with company policies.
 Ensure compliance with governmental accounting regulations and reporting requirements.
 Assist in the preparation of payroll reports for management review and audits.
 Respond to employee inquiries regarding payroll issues, benefits administration, and financial concepts.
 Collaborate with HR and finance teams to streamline payroll processes and improve efficiency.

Qualifications:

 Requires passing a Background Check 
 Proven experience as a Payroll Specialist or in a similar role with a strong understanding of double-entry bookkeeping principles.
 A proven track record of long-term commitment and professional growth in previous positions.
 Strong references that highlight your tenure and performance over the years.
 Proficiency in accounting software and familiarity with PAYCOM are highly desirable (or familiarity with other payroll software e.g., PAYCHEX and PAYLOCITY are acceptable).
 Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word, and other office software.
 Prior experience working with a payroll system to process payroll for 400 or more employees is a plus.
 Knowledge of benefits administration processes and accounting regulations.
 Strong attention to detail with exceptional data entry skills to ensure accuracy in payroll processing.
 Ability to analyze financial data and prepare reports for management review.
 Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks effectively under tight deadlines.
 Strong communication skills to interact professionally with employees at all levels of the organization.

Salary: Based upon education and prior work experience.
Please Note: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employees may perform other related duties as negotiated to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.
This is a full-time opportunity, and we are only considering direct applicants. Submissions from temporary agencies or staffing firms will not be accepted.
If you are passionate about payroll management and possess the necessary skills, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity to contribute to our team as a Payroll Specialist.

title: Bookkeeper/Administrative Assistant
description:
About Us
We are proud to be a licensed cannabis retailer committed to quality, compliance, and community. We believe in creating a welcoming and educational experience for our customers while maintaining the highest operational and regulatory standards. We’re currently seeking a Bookkeeper / Administrative Assistant to support our growing business with strong financial oversight and administrative efficiency.
Position Summary
The Bookkeeper / Administrative Assistant plays a key role in maintaining accurate financial records and supporting the daily administrative operations of our cannabis retail business. This individual must be highly organized, detail-oriented, and comfortable working in a regulated environment. The ideal candidate will have experience in bookkeeping, knowledge of AGCO compliance, and the ability to multitask effectively in a fast-paced setting.
Key Responsibilities
Bookkeeping Duties
- Manage full-cycle bookkeeping using accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, Sage, or Xero)
- Reconcile daily POS transactions with banking and merchant accounts
- Prepare monthly financial reports, balance sheets, and income statements
- Process accounts payable and receivable; manage vendor records and payments
- Assist with payroll processing and remittance (hourly, salary, and commission-based staff)
- Track and reconcile cannabis inventory costs for financial reporting
- Support year-end financial audits and compliance audits
Administrative Duties
- Maintain accurate internal records and filing systems (digital and paper)
- Schedule and coordinate internal meetings, training sessions, and compliance reviews
- Assist with onboarding of new employees and updating employee documentation
- Order office supplies, track expenses, and support store-level logistics
- Monitor and respond to general inquiries through email and phone
- Collaborate with management to maintain operational checklists and compliance documentation
Qualifications
- 2–4 years of bookkeeping and/or administrative experience (cannabis industry preferred)
- Post-secondary education in accounting, business administration, or related field
- Proficiency in accounting software (QuickBooks, Sage, or Xero)
- Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office (especially Excel) and Google Workspace
- Familiarity with cannabis POS systems
- Excellent organizational, communication, and time management skills
- High level of discretion and confidentiality

title: Payroll Specialist
description:
Fluent Corp. is a vertically integrated cultivator, processor, formulator, and retailer of Premium Cannabis Products currently operating in Florida, Pennsylvania, New York and Texas as FLUENT Cannabis. Our purpose is to compassionately provide patients access to the highest level of medical cannabis in an unrivaled, professional healthcare environment with outstanding customer service. Patient care always comes first at FLUENT, and our standards, practices, and performance are unmatched.

 
 We are looking for leaders who want to work alongside great talent and create a positive work experience for their team. We are focused on continuous improvements, which create developmental opportunities, engage feedback, and increase contributions towards our goals as a leader in the medical cannabis industry.

 
 Find out more at www.getfluent.com. Follow us on LinkedIn.

 
  ROLE SUMMARY

 
 We are seeking a detail-oriented and reliable Payroll Specialist to process the company’s payroll and support the finance and accounts payable team. This role requires a strong understanding of payroll practices, excellent numerical skills, and a collaborative approach to assist with various finance functions.

 
 The ideal candidate will have 2-3 years of payroll experience, with accounting experience being a plus.

 
 KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

 
 
  Process weekly and bi-weekly payroll for employees, ensuring accuracy and timeliness.
 
 
  Verify and enter payroll data, including time worked, overtime, deductions, and benefits.
 
 
  Maintain and update employee payroll records in the payroll system.
 
 
  Address and resolve payroll-related inquiries and issues from employees.
 
 
  Ensure compliance with federal, state, and local payroll, wage, and hour laws and best practices.
 
 
  Assist with payroll and finance audits and implement corrective actions as needed.
 
 
  Collaborate with HR to ensure seamless payroll processing.
 
 
  Participate in developing and implementing payroll procedures and policies to improve efficiency and effectiveness.
 
 
  Stay updated on changes in payroll laws and regulations to ensure compliance.
 
 
  Review and process expense reimbursements
 
 
  Support finance and accounts payable with day-to-day functions, including, but not limited to, invoice processing, reconciliations, and month-end processing.
 
 
  Perform other duties as assigned.
 

 
  QUALIFICATIONS
 
  A bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance, or a related field is preferred.
 
 
  2-3 years of experience in payroll processing preferred.
 
 
  Proficiency with payroll software (e.g., Paypro, ADP, Paycom, or similar).
 
 
  Strong understanding of payroll laws and regulations.
 

 
 Preferred Qualifications:
 
  CPP (Certified Payroll Professional) certification.
 
 
  Experience with multi-state payroll processing, especially in FL, PA, TX & NY.
 

 
  SKILLS

 
 
  Ability to handle confidential information with discretion.
 
 
  Strong numeracy and analytical skills.
 
 
  Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
 
 
  Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills.
 
 
  Excellent organizational skills
 
 
  Excellent attention to detail and accuracy.
 
 
  Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines.
 
 
  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
 
 
  Ability to prioritize tasks and to delegate them when appropriate.
 
 
  Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Excel.
 

 
  REQUIRED EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE

 
 
  A bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance, or a related field is preferred.
 
 
  2-3 years of experience in payroll processing.
 
 
  Proficiency with payroll software (e.g., ADP, Paycom, or similar).
 
 
  Strong understanding of payroll laws and regulations.
 

 
  ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS

 
 
  Per state law, must be at least 21 years of age.
 
 
  Must complete a comprehensive background check.
 

 
  WORK ENVIRONMENT

 
 This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets, and fax machines.

 
 The company will ask you to help out in other departments depending on company needs. This means that you may not always work in the department where you were hired. Teamwork and getting products out to patients are the goals, and helping where you are needed is crucial to your and the company’s success.

 
  PHYSICAL DEMANDS

 
 The physical demands described here represent those that must be met by an employee to perform the essential functions of this job successfully. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be able to speak and hear. An employee needs to be able to sit at a workstation for extended periods; use hand(s) to handle or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms and ability to work on desktop or laptop computer for extended periods of time reading, reviewing/analyzing information, and providing recommendations, summaries and/or reports in written format. Must be able to effectively communicate with others verbally and in writing. Employee may be required to occasionally lift and/or move moderate amounts of weight, typically less than 20 pounds. Regular and predictable attendance is essential.

 
  POSITION TYPE / EXPECTED HOURS OF WORK

 
 This position will sometimes require long hours and weekend work/holidays.

 
  TRAVEL

 
 Travel is primarily local during the business day, although some out-of-area and overnight travel may be expected from time to time. For example, payroll checks may need to be delivered to local facilities.

 
 OTHER DUTIES

 
 Please note that this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of the activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time, with or without notice.

 
  AAP/EEO Statement

 
 FLUENT is an equal opportunity employer, and we welcome applications from all backgrounds regardless of race, color, religion, sex, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or any other classification protected by law.

 
  COMPANY BENEFITS

 
 FLUENT provides comprehensive benefits offerings to all full-time employees. Our benefits include medical, dental, and vision, supplemental insurance, a paid time-off program, and a non-matching 401 (k) plan.
 FLUENT participates in E-Verify to ensure a legal workforce. All applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States and will be required to submit proof of such eligibility.

 
  Please note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Full-Time Bookkeeper
description:
Overview
DS Thorpe Landscapes is seeking a professional, experienced Bookkeeper to serve as the face of our corporate office. This position is ideal for someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment, enjoys a variety of tasks, and wants to grow with a dynamic company.
As our full-time Bookkeeper, you will handle critical aspects of our office operations including bookkeeping data entry, payroll timesheets, phones, customer service, and client communication. You will work directly with our Controller and alongside the company owners to manage multiple LLCs and coordinate scheduling.
We manage a team of 60-70 employees across the state of North Carolina, with branch locations in Wilmington and Asheville. This role requires strong communication and organizational skills, as you'll collaborate closely with branch managers to ensure accurate tracking of receipts, timesheets, and job-related expenses.
Key Responsibilities:

 Oversee and support two (2) bookkeeping/front desk office assistants
 Maintain accurate and up-to-date bookkeeping records and general ledger in accordance with GAAP
 Manage accounts payable and receivable processes to ensure timely payments and collections
 Process payroll and update employee timesheets using ADP
 Ensure all receipts are collected, recorded, and verified across multiple locations
 Monitor purchase orders and extra purchase order systems with builders to ensure timely payments
 Perform general ledger accounting, including posting debits and credits, reconciling accounts, and preparing financial statements
 Conduct regular account and general ledger reconciliations to ensure financial accuracy in reporting
 Manage tax payments and ensure timely filing of all required state and federal employment and business documents
 Track, organize, and assist with documentation for company loans and financing
 Utilize QuickBooks, Quicken, and other financial software for budgeting, tracking expenses, and generating reports
 Collaborate with management to prepare budgets and forecasts, providing insights based on financial data
 Prepare monthly closing entries and assist with internal and external audits
 Ensure compliance with relevant governmental accounting regulations and assist with any related filings

Qualifications:

 3-5 years of proven experience as a Full Time Bookkeeper or in a similar accounting role
 Strong understanding of accounts payable, general ledger accounting, and financial software applications (QuickBooks, Quicken, ADP preferred)
 Familiarity with GAAP principles and governmental accounting practices
 Proficient in managing debits and credits accurately within a general ledger system
 Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
 Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks and deadlines effectively
 Strong analytical skills and the ability to interpret financial data to provide actionable insights
 Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite
 Professional demeanor with excellent communication skills

Schedule:

 Monday to Friday
 8-hour daytime shifts

Benefits:

Home Care Contractors LLC is a growing residential construction and remodeling company seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Accountant/Bookkeeper. title: Payroll Administrator
description:
Position - Payroll Administrator
 
  Pay Rate: $25.50 - $34.50
  Location: Edmonds, WA
 
 
 
 Raise is currently hiring a permanent, full-time team member on behalf of our client. They’re expanding their team to meet growing needs, making this a unique opportunity to work with an industry leader.
 
 
 JOB DESCRIPTION

 

 Payroll Administrator
 
 

 JOB RESPONSIBILITIES 
 Performs all activities necessary to process weekly payroll 
 Ensures compliance with all federal, state and local regulations 
 Analyzes, prepares, troubleshoots timekeeping errors, and inputs payroll data to produce accurate and timely payroll 
 Updates, imports, approves and maintains payroll information such as progression rates, deductions, title/department changes, etc. 
 Works with People Support Services to enter new hires and process separations in a timely manner 
 Generates post-Payroll weekly reports for Payroll & Accounts Payable Manager review/approval 
 Imports and posts payroll entries to the General Ledger 
 Maintains the GL balance of payroll accounts 
 Handles stale Payroll checks and unclaimed wages 
 Imports union-dues-deduction file, transmits payment files and sends status changes to union 
 Processes 401(k) deduction changes, enrollments, withdrawals and hardships while managing the employee relationship during this process 
 Provides employment wage verification for Market Support employees 
 Records, maintains and updates payroll procedures 
 Creates special reports for management as requested 
 Processes employee expense reports 
 Processes all garnishments, child support, and tax levies 
 Assists the Payroll & Accounts Payable Manager as needed 
 Maintains department in a neat, clean, and orderly manner 
 Provides excellent customer service 
 Stays current with industry trends, standards and changes 
 Stays current with all training including online training and professional development opportunities 
 Supports and follows all company and department policies 
 Supports and follows sustainability programs 
 Supports and follows all safety and security policies 
 Demonstrates attitude of service to co-workers and guests 
 Operates within the Company’s Core Values, Company Brand, and Business Principles

 

 POSITION REQUIREMENTS 
 Prefer 3-5 years of experience in payroll or accounting 
 Certified Payroll Professional certification preferred 
 Experience processing union contract provisions and step progression 
 Solid understanding of payroll processes and regulations 
 Excellent customer service skills 
 Must have intermediate or higher computer skills including MS Office; prefer knowledge of UKG WFM, ADP Lyric, and/or GP Dynamics 
 Ability to maintain a high-level of confidentiality 
 Must be a team player, a leader, and a positive role model 
 Must be accurate and very detail-oriented with excellent math skills 
 Highly organized, effective, and skilled at prioritizing daily/weekly responsibilities 
 Ability to work independently, as well as with a diverse group of guests, employees, and leadership 
 Ability to take direction and carry out department tasks and assignments 
 Ability to adjust to constant interruptions 
 Commitment to personal and professional development 
 Displays excellent work ethic 
 Must possess an attitude of service to others 
 Demonstrates self-discipline and accountability 
 Excellent listening, verbal, and written communication skills (including spelling, grammar and industry language) 
 Flexibility to work mornings, afternoons, evenings, weekends, and holidays as needed 
 Flexibility to work additional hours as needed 
 Ability to lift and carry 25 lbs. occasionally, and have excellent manual dexterity 
 Possesses full body mobility (bending, stooping, twisting and reaching) 
 Ability to work in a constant state of alertness and safe manner 
 18 years or older
 

 

 
 Looking for meaningful work? We can help
 
 
 Raise is an established hiring firm with over 65 years of experience. We believe strongly in making the world a better place through work, which is why we’re a certified B Corporation and donate 10% of our profits to charity.
 
 
 We strive to build teams that reflect the diversity of the communities we work in. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply, including people from traditionally underrepresented groups such as women, visible minorities, Indigenous peoples, people identifying as LGBTQ2SI, veterans, and people with visible/nonvisible disabilities.
 
 
 We have a dedicated webpage for accommodations where you can learn more about what we offer, and request accommodation: https://raise.jobs/accommodations/
 
 
 In order to submit candidates for roles, our clients will sometimes require personal information to confirm the identity of applicants and their legal status to work. Raise will never ask you for personal or banking information unless you have been selected for a job. If you are ever unsure about the legitimacy of this or another job posting by Raise (or have any other questions), please contact us at +1 800-567-9675 or hello@raiserecruiting.com

title: Payroll Systems Analyst
description:
You may not know our name, but you know our products. What we make is part the places where we live, work and play – all day, everyday.
 
 Zekelman is a family of companies — 100% domestic manufacturers — with a legacy dating back to 1877. We’re proud to be the largest independent steel pipe and tube manufacturer in North America and the leading innovator in multi-family housing development.
 
  We believe in what we build and what we build, builds the world around us. Hospitals, hotels, schools, bridges, airports and more.
 
  Come build a career you believe in.
 
  About the Role
 
 As a Payroll Technical Specialist at Zekelman Industries, you will play a key role in ensuring the efficient, accurate, and compliant operation of our UKG and Workday payroll systems across U.S. and Canadian locations. This position requires deep technical payroll expertise, strong analytical thinking, and cross-functional collaboration, and offers the opportunity to directly impact payroll accuracy, compliance, and union agreement adherence.
 You will collaborate with HR, Finance, IT, and plant leadership, ensuring seamless payroll processing and continuous system optimization. This is a [insert hybrid or remote, include in-person days] role located in [insert location].
 This role is perfect for someone who thrives in a fast-paced, detail-oriented environment, enjoys solving complex system and compliance challenges, and brings strong technical skills to support payroll operations in union and non-union settings.
 
 What You’ll Do
 
  Administers and supports UKG and Workday payroll systems for U.S. and Canadian operations
  Maintains accurate payroll records and ensures compliance with federal, state/provincial, and local laws, as well as union agreements
  Collaborates with HR, Finance, IT, and plant management to implement system changes and payroll process improvements
  Troubleshoots technical payroll issues and coordinates with software vendors and internal stakeholders
  Configures, tests, and deploys payroll system enhancements, upgrades, and integrations
  Generates and analyzes payroll reports for compliance, audits, and management insights
  Conducts payroll audits and reconciliations, including time and attendance data validation
  Applies union contract provisions to payroll processing, including overtime, benefits, and grievance settlements
  Develops and maintains payroll documentation and training for HR/payroll teams and plant users
  Supports year-end processing, tax filings, and regulatory submissions for U.S. and Canada
  Monitors changes in payroll regulations and system upgrades to ensure best practices
 
 
 Who You Are
 
  3+ years of payroll experience in a multi-location manufacturing environment
  Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Information Systems, or equivalent experience
  Hands-on experience with UKG (Ultimate Kronos Group) and Workday Payroll
  Knowledge of U.S. and Canadian payroll regulations and union payroll administration
  Proficient in payroll system configuration, reporting, and integrations
  Strong problem-solving skills with attention to accuracy and detail
  Skilled in interpreting and applying union contract payroll provisions
  Advanced Excel skills, including data analysis and reconciliations
  Excellent communication and collaboration skills across technical and non-technical audiences
  Ability to manage multiple deadlines in a dynamic, fast-paced environment
  Professional certifications (e.g., CPP, Workday Pro, UKG Pro) highly desirable
 
 
 What You’ll Get
 Zekelman Industries offers competitive compensation and excellent benefits, including low-cost, high-quality medical and dental benefits. In addition, we have an amazing tuition assistance program, a bonus plan, a 401(k) plan with a generous company match, loyalty awards, and much more:
 
  Competitive Compensation
  Bonus Plan & Profit-Sharing Opportunities
  401(k) with Company Match
  Comprehensive Health, Dental & Vision Insurance
  Tuition Assistance Program
  Paid Vacation & Holidays
  Employee Loyalty Awards
 
 
 Compensation & Benefits
 Below is the expected base salary range for this position. This is a good-faith estimate, and offers will be determined based on experience, education, skill set, and interview performance.
 
 Base Salary Range: [$120,000-$125,000 USD]
 Additional compensation may include:
 ✔ Performance-based yearly merit-increase
 ✔ Profit-sharing bonus opportunities
 
 Zekelman Industries offers competitive compensation and excellent benefits, including low-cost, high-quality medical and dental benefits. In addition, we have an amazing tuition assistance program, a bonus plan, a 401(k) plan with a generous company match, immediate vesting, and much more.
 
 M/F/D/V
 
 We are Zekelman Industries.
 
 We manufacture superior quality tubular and related products, and provide outstanding service for our valued customers.
 
 We seek to continuously advance the skills and opportunities of our employees, utilizing the latest technology and management tools available to consistently increase profitability and the enterprise value of Zekelman Industries and of our customers.

title: NetSuite Bookkeeper
description:
NetSuite Bookkeeper 
Well established, highly reputable mechanical parts contractor has an opportunity for you contribute to the strategic development of this organization. We have experienced unprecedented growth as we continue to service the area. Our reputation is built on quality, personalized service, and attention to detail.
Reporting to the Controller, the bookkeeper will be responsible for handling full-cycle AP and AR processes using NetSuite. You will play a critical role in ensuring the accuracy and efficiency of our financial transactions, maintaining up-to-date records, and supporting the overall accounting and financial department.
Essential Job Responsibilities 
Take charge and manage all books, being fully accountable and up to date on accuracy.
Drive the company’s accounting system and prepare the financial planning.
Perform risk management by analyzing the organization’s liabilities and investments.
Control and evaluate the organization capital structure.
Ensure cash flow is appropriate for the organization’s operations.
Prepare reliable forecasting reports based upon input from the Management Team, perform cost-benefit analysis, and oversee the individual job costing process to be reviewed by the management team.
Set up and oversee the company’s finance/accounting IT system.
Ensure compliance with the law and company’s policies, oversee all taxation issues for the company, and provide timely and accurate communications with the business’s CPA firm.
Review and confirm estimates and change orders are accurately entered into the system.
Perform and manage weekly company payroll, ensuring timely and accurate processing with appropriate job costing.
Contribute and have significant input into the company's investments, capital structure, and how the company manages its income and expenses.
Manage invoicing, A/R and A/P processes to maximize company cash position.
Track all corporate initiatives and their financial impact on cash flow.
Work with other senior managers and play a key role in a company's overall success, especially in the long run.
Full Charge Bookkeeper will focus on compliance and quality control for the business, provide significant insight into planning, and drive written process improvements.
Responsible for developing the company’s budget and reporting variances to the plan.
Engage with the company’s banking and insurance partners.
Essential Qualifications
Must be proficient in NetSuite and have a minimum of 3+ years of bookkeeping and accounting experience.
Excellent knowledge of data analysis and forecasting methods.
Proficiency in the use of MS Office Products (Word and Excel) is required.
Degree in accounting, finance, or related field is preferred.
Highly organized, ability to strategize and solve problems.
Confidentiality, strong leadership and organizational skills.
Excellent communication and people skills.

title: Payroll Administrator
description:
Summary:
 
 
  The Payroll Administrator plays a critical role in supporting accurate and timely payroll operations across the organization. This position ensures compliance with all local, state, and federal regulations, while maintaining high standards for data accuracy and confidentiality. This role is detail-oriented, collaborative, and requires a strong understanding of payroll systems and processes. The Payroll Administrator works closely with employees, managers, and cross-functional teams to resolve payroll inquiries, manage documentation, and contribute to the department’s goals for operational excellence and employee satisfaction. This position is ideal for someone who is organized, solutions-focused, and committed to continuous improvement in payroll practices and systems. The mission of this role is to support a seamless and compliant payroll process that upholds the organization’s values and promotes trust with employees.
 

 
 
   Essential Duties:
 

 
   Payroll Processing & Compliance
 
 
  Assist with the preparation of biweekly and weekly payroll, following procedures and timelines defined by the Director of Payroll.
  Process off-cycle payrolls, including PTO cash-outs, ensuring accuracy and timeliness.
  Review time and attendance records, including manager approvals and pending PTO reports, for completeness and accuracy.
  Review and resolve payroll tax notices and update changes to payroll tax rates as required.
  Maintain compliance with local, state, and federal payroll laws, including sick leave policies and wage garnishments.
 

 
 
   Employee Support & Inquiry Resolution
 
 
  Research, analyze, and resolve payroll-related issues or questions from employees and internal teams in coordination with the payroll team.
  Maintain a positive and professional relationship with employees by delivering high-quality payroll support and timely responses.
 

 
 
   Documentation & Reporting
 
 
  Maintain accurate payroll records including employee files (active and terminated), wage attachment documentation, and payroll vendor files.
  Assist in the transition to electronic payroll filing systems to increase efficiency and data security.
  Generate standard and custom payroll reports using Dayforce and other tools.
  Track and update wage attachments and garnishments each payroll cycle using electronic systems.
 

 
 
   Additional Duties: Tasks or duties not outlined in this job description may be required to contribute to the organization's success and efficiency.
 

 
 
   Qualifications: 
 
 
  Reasonable accommodation may be arranged to facilitate individuals with disabilities in fulfilling the essential duties of this role.
 

 
 
   Education and/or Experience:
 
 
  Minimum 2 years of related payroll experience.
  Bachelor’s degree a plus.
  Strong knowledge of local, state, and federal payroll regulations and sick leave policies.
  Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as percentages, interest, commissions, and proportions accurately.
  Proficient in Microsoft Office, particularly Excel and Word, with the ability to create and manage spreadsheets and payroll documents.
  Strong working knowledge of HRIS or payrolls systems required.
  Certified Payroll Professional (CPP) preferred but not required.
 

 
 
  
   
    The “Benefits” of Employment
    
     Employee referral payment program
     Educational Enhancement Program
     Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits
     Life/ AD&D Insurance
     Paid Parental Leave
     Long and short term disability
     Retirement Plan - 401(k) Plan
     Discount on an apartment at any one of our properties
     Brand new amenity space that includes a full gym/fitness center and golf simulator
    
    Salary range: $65,000-70,000
 
 If you are hired at Morgan Properties, your overall compensation package will also be determined based on factors such as geographic location, skills, education, and/or experience which may result in total compensation outside of this range.
    
     
  Get To Know Us:
    
    
     
 Established in 1985 by Mitchell Morgan, Morgan Properties is a national real estate investment and management company headquartered in Conshohocken, Pennsylvania. Jonathan and Jason Morgan represent the next-generation leaders growing the platform and overseeing the business operations.
 
 Morgan Properties and its affiliates currently own and manage a multifamily portfolio comprised of more than 360 apartment communities and over 100,000 units located in 22 states. The Company is among the three largest multifamily owners in the nation and the largest in Pennsylvania, Maryland, and New York. With over 2,500 employees, Morgan Properties prides itself on its quick decision-making capabilities, strong capital relationships, and proven operational expertise.
    

    
    
     #AC8999

title: Payroll Specialist
description:
Company Description
 
 Fortune Brands Innovations, Inc. is an industry-leading innovation company focused on creating smarter, safer and more beautiful homes and improving lives. Our driving purpose is that we elevate every life by transforming spaces into havens. We believe our work and our brands can have incredibly positive impacts for not just our business and shareholders, but for people and the planet, too.
 When you join Fortune Brands, you become part of a high-performing team who are empowered to think big, learn fast and make bold decisions. We support an inclusive and diverse culture where everyone is encouraged and empowered to be their authentic selves, and where our differences and unique perspectives are a key strength.
 Explore life at Fortune Brands here.
 Job Description
 
 We are seeking a meticulous and detail-oriented Workday Payroll Specialist to join our payroll team. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of payroll processes, accounting principles, and tax regulations. This role will be responsible for supporting processing of payrolls, general ledger postings, and reconciliation of payroll payments. This role requires a combination of payroll expertise in the Workday platform, deep understanding of payroll processes and financial implications, and strong reconciliation skills.
  Location: This position is eligible for a hybrid schedule based out of Deerfield, IL. Effective mid-2025, Fortune Brands will transition to a new world-class campus in Deerfield, bringing together associates from across our U.S. offices, brands, and functions. The campus will offer vibrant workspaces for collaboration, along with amenities for dining, onsite daycare, fitness, and recreation.
  What you will be doing:
 
  Processing payroll input and payments for weekly or bi-weekly payrolls
  Reconcile and resolve Payroll tax submission though ADP Smart Compliance.
  Reconcile and process weekly integrations with funding to third parties accounting for all differences for net pay, taxes, garnishments, etc.
  Process payments for highly compensated employees including Stock, Non-Qualified, and other Perquisites/Programs with an understanding of state and federal tax implications to ensure compliance.
  Conduct financial analysis of payroll-related expenses, including labor costs, benefits, taxes, and other payroll-related liabilities, to identify trends, variances, and opportunities for improvement.
  Identify opportunities for process improvement to enhance payroll efficiency, accuracy, and compliance.
  Serve on cross departmental teams and provide payroll accounting support for project teams including acquisitions.
  Support new procedures/projects and improvements due to business changes, operational requirements, strategic initiatives, and legal requirements.
 
  Qualifications
 
 A successful Payroll Specialist will have: 
 
  Three or more years of experience processing multi-state payroll. (Workday)
  Experience with time and attendance systems (UKG Workforce Management preferred)
  Working experience of payroll taxes at the federal, state, and local levels
  Proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel (V-lookup and pivot tables)
  Acute attention to detail and accuracy.
  Effective organizational and time management skills
  Effective communication skills both written and oral
 
 
 Additional Information
 
 Fortune Brands believes in fair and equitable pay. A reasonable estimate of the base salary range for this role is Hiring Pay Range: $50,000 USD - $60,000 USD. Please note that actual salaries may vary within the range, or be above or below the range, based on factors including, but not limited to, education, training, experience, professional achievement, business need, and location. In addition to base salary, employees will participate in either an annual bonus plan based on company and individual performance, or a role-based sales incentive plan.
 At Fortune Brands, we support the overall health and wellness of our associates by offering comprehensive, competitive benefits that prioritize all aspects of wellbeing and provide flexibility for our teammates’ unique needs. This includes robust health plans, a market-leading 401(k) program with a company contribution, product discounts, flexible time off benefits (including half-day summer Fridays per policy), inclusive fertility / adoption benefits, and more. We offer numerous Employee Resource Groups to support inclusivity and our associates’ feeling of belonging at work.
 Fortune Brands is a brand, innovation and channel leader focused on exciting, supercharged categories in the home products, security and commercial building markets. Our portfolio of brands includes Moen, House of Rohl, Aqualisa, SpringWell, Therma-Tru, Larson, Fiberon, Master Lock, SentrySafe and Yale residential.
 Fortune Brands is headquartered in Deerfield, Illinois and trades on the NYSE as FBIN
  Equal Employment Opportunity:
 FBIN is an equal employment opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any applicant based on race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, marital status, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, genetic history or information, or any other legally protected characteristic.
 We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace and encourage applicants from all backgrounds to apply. To support our efforts, we invite you to voluntarily share your gender, ethnicity, and veteran status. This information is confidential and helps us ensure an inclusive hiring process and improve our diversity initiatives.
  Reasonable Accommodations:
 FBIN is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or interview process, please contact us at fbinleave.fbhs@fbin.com and let us know the nature of your request along with your contact information. Resumes submitted to this email address will not be responded to.

title: Staff Accountant – No Payroll
description:
Company Overview
We Are Blood is a vital non-profit organization dedicated to ensuring the safety and availability of the blood supply in Central Texas. With over 200 employees across multiple locations, we serve more than 40 hospitals and medical facilities, making a significant impact on our community's health and well-being.
Summary
This position is responsible for maintaining financial records among all AMOs including performing general ledger entries and maintenance, bank reconciliations, loan payment application, and reconciliation.
Responsibilities:
Banking
· Reconcile all bank accounts including bank entries for any unrecorded items in a timely manner.
· Review outstanding transactions to ensure they are relatively current and research/ask questions for items older than 90 days.
· Record loan payments and reconcile work sheets.
· Retrieve funds from donor services for deposit.
Record credit card activity from donor services
Routine Accounting Duties
· Prepare and audit all benefit insurance invoices for payment and reconcile new hires and terminations against invoices to ensure appropriate billing.
· Validate UMR claims invoices weekly and follow terminations to ensure appropriate billing. Record UMR claims invoices in system.
· Validate and record HSA invoices with each pay period. Work with HR on any discrepancies for resolution.
· Validate and record P&A invoices weekly.
· Record payroll transactions in accounting software.
· Perform general bookkeeping and organize financial forms, documents and receipts.
· Ensure all financial transactions within the company are accounted for and follow legal standards.
· Assist Accounting team for preparation of documents for external auditors.
· Recommend ways to reduce costs, enhance revenue, and improve efficiencies.
· Assure compliance with internal control policies and procedures as well as external compliance with IRS rules and other agencies.
· Serve as backup for AR clerk in processing billing and payment application as necessary and perform Tissue Distribution billing biweekly
· Coordinate with AP clerk for routine transactions, and Accounting Manager for month end procedures.
· Code and input Divvy employee transactions into system.
· Perform preliminary COGS analysis.
· Process pension and post into system.
Finance
· Support CFO with output of data analytics to include forecasting, budgeting, and statistics.
· Aide in preparation and presentation of reports.
Extra
· Meet and exceed employee program expectations of AMO CommYOUnity!
standards: Rewards & Recognition, Communication, Individuality, Integrity, Respect, and Pursuit of Excellence.
· Perform other duties as assigned.
Skills, Education & Experience:
· Bachelors Degree in Accounting is preferred; Associates Accounting Degree with 1-2 years experience or no degree with extensive (more than 5 years) experience is required.
· Knowledge of accounting processes and advanced mathematical skills.
· Must be PC proficient, especially spreadsheets, word processing and accounting software.
· Detail-oriented with excellent organization skills, the ability to handle multiple projects.
